jobText: TXT/50539463.txt	§Document Formatting Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Document Formatting Specialists§§Advertiser: §Document Direct§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§DOCUMENT FORMATTING SPECIALISTS§Document Direct is growing very fast, and we are looking to expand our team.  We are undergoing a busy recruitment drive, and invite excellent Document Production/Formatting Specialists to join our existing team.§Our document formatting specialists are self-employed and work from home using their own computer and broadband connection and are required to have a fully operating foot pedal and headset. §As a Document Formatting Specialist you will work as part of a team and will utilise your advanced skills to support fast and accurate creation and formatting of documents, spreadsheets and presentations, adhering to specific firms house styles.§The rate of pay for the work will be discussed upon application. §ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES REQUIRED FOR THE ROLE:§Applicants should be able to create, format and update Word documents, using advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word functions such as:§Word styles (creating, editing and troubleshooting);§Multi-Level Numbered lists & linking to heading styles;§Cross referencing;§Bookmarks; and§Tables of Contents.§Ability to learn and adhere to various client’s house styles, utilising the appropriate templates to ensure efficiency, accuracy and consistency.§A good working knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint to be able to create and edit spreadsheets and presentations. §Previous experience of converting PDF’s to Word/Excel is advantageous.§Be able to troubleshoot and health check document formatting.§Accurately interpret complex fee earner instructions and produce documents within the required timescales, seeking clarification when necessary.§Be able to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.§Proofread and quality check all work to ensure that completed documents are delivered accurately and to an appropriately high standard. §Adhere to Document Direct’s working practices.§EXPERIENCE:§Ideal applicants should have recent experience of working within a Document Production unit in a law firm or similar professional services organisations.§Experience of case management systems.§Be familiar with Outlook.§Personal Attributes:§Applicants should be professional with a flexible approach and work closely as part of the Document Production Team. They should also take pride in their work and be willing to learn. §Document Direct is a 100% remote worker company.  We have systems and processes in place to assist our workers to deliver the best service possible to our clients.  You are required to work from home, independently, and make good use of online resources and knowledge base.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in corporate & commercial law?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50539824.txt	§Senior Litigation Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Litigation Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§About the Company§ § We have partnered up exclusively with a well-established law firm in Blenheim. They offer a wide range of services with strong teams in place to join and learn from. These teams operate in fields such as dispute resolution, employment, property, trusts wills and estates and more. The firm is now entering a phase where they are preparing to lose a significant team member, part of the litigation team and they are looking to bring someone in who can take over and continue the success of this team. This is an opportunity to get into a well-established firm with a great team structure and excellent reputation. A pathway to partnership is available for the successful candidate who proves themselves worthy of this position.§ § §The Role & The Candidate§ § The role would involve all aspects of litigation however emphasis is placed on Relationship Property and Resource Management. Work in other areas of civil litigation, employment, relationships, and estate litigation will also be required at times.§ § A successful candidate will likely be able to:§ §confidently meet with clients and extract essential information§prepare affidavits and briefs of evidence§do court applications and other documentation§competently prepare submissions and attend to the hearing§give clients confidence that their matter is being well-handled§advocate the client’s position at all stages of the Court process.§Be in around the 5+ PQE range§Benefits§ § Our client believes the salary will reflect the successful candidate’s production rate and ability to satisfy clients’ and Partners’ requirements, therefore they have chosen not to put a set figure on this role. To give you an idea, a salary between a third to half of the candidate’s production can be expected. So, if you are prepared to take on the challenge you can really determine your own salary in this role.§ § §How to apply§ If you are interested to learn more give me a call for a chat, or alternatively click the apply button to submit your CV. All enquiries are strictly confidential.§ § § §Emeka Ilogu§ § § §Consultant - FLUID Legal§ § §03 467 7228§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50544053.txt	§Commercial Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§If you have been thinking it is time to make a move to a new role - why not consider Cambridge! A great opportunity has arisen for a 2-4 year PQE Commercial Property lawyer to join a fantastic, supportive team.  You will enjoy a wide range of commercial and property work including advising on sales and acquisitions of businesses, sub-divisions, preparing and negotiating contracts and commercial leases.  There is plenty of work in this firm and with excellent mentoring and supervision available from two partners you will quickly develop and expand your commercial expertise.   §The firm has an excellent culture with long-standing staff.  If you seek a rewarding role and want to be a part of a highly successful firm, you need to apply now!  §An excellent salary is on offer together with work/life balance within a great team.  Call Paula Watts 027 2221696 for more details or send your CV to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§§§§§

We serve over 80 markets globally, supported by an operation which includes twelve processing plants throughout New Zealand. We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced lawyer to join our executive leadership team to provide sound advice and guidance across the full spectrum of in-house legal matters. The role is based five minutes north of Hamilton at our head office in Horotiu.§This opportunity will suit a commercially astute lawyer who is skilled at delivering practical, solutions-focused legal advice. The brief is diverse and challenging across employment, corporate, commercial, investment, markets, dispute and governance matters.You will need to be confident coaching and managing a junior solicitor and dealing with a range of specialist advisors - including at times driving matters with external counsel.This will be an exceptionally rewarding role; you will have full responsibility and ownership of the delivery of legal advice, guidance and support to the business.§Key responsibilities include:§overseeing the full portfolio of legal matters for the company, delegating to in-house or external counsel as appropriate§drafting, reviewing and negotiating a wide variety of documents including but not limited to employment agreements, client service agreements, supplier contracts, court documents, letters, correspondence and advice notes§appearing before the Employment Relations Authority, the Court and any specialist bodies or institutions as required§liaison with and reporting to management, internal staff and external individuals and organisations on a wide range of legal, dispute and compliance matters§keeping abreast of relevant regulatory and legislative requirements affecting the business.§The ideal candidate will have:§a tertiary qualification at law (LLB)§a current practising certificate issued by the New Zealand Law Society§prior commercial and generalist law experience, and the ability to understand how changes in legislation will impact the company§a high level of work ethic and excellent time management§outstanding written and verbal communication skills§a high level of accuracy, attention to detail, and organisational skills.§If you believe that you are the right person to take on this challenging, varied and rewarding role then please apply today!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50544402.txt	§Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago)§§Advertiser: §Human Connections Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago) §      §        §Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours)§        §Human Connections Group has partnered exclusively with Otago Southland Employers Association (OSEA) for the appointment of a Lawyer/Human Resources professional to join their existing team, based anywhere in the Otago/Southland Region.§        § §        §The Company:§        §The Otago Southland Employers’ Association (OSEA) is a membership-based organisation, to support employers to be sustainable, skilled, through advocacy and leadership in best practice. OSEA provides tailored and specialist support and training around Employment Law, Health and Safety and Professional Development to organisations in Otago, Southland and The Lakes district.  §        §The objective of the organisation is to give members easy access to quality, reliable and accurate support in their daily business, assisting them to make good business decisions, develop and manage their staff and improve their systems and processes ensuring that they are compliant across all areas.§        § §        §The Role:§        §We are open to expressions of interest from suitable candidates who are seeking either full-time or part-time work looking for a contract or permanent opportunity.§        §This role will suit a seasoned lawyer or Human Resources professional with a keen interest in employment relations.§        §You will be responsible for the delivery of all the OSEA legal services including training for clients both in group settings and one on one.§        §This role is to complement the existing legal team at the organisation to support members as more businesses need legal assistance and advice in their daily operations in the current post COVID economy.§        §Daily requirements of the role will include providing advice and direct support to employers where there is an employment dispute, disciplinary, mediation, Authority Investigations, performance management and/or compliance needs for members to remain up to date with current legislation and best practice.§        §A further small percentage of the role involves facilitation of training around legislation and employee management best practice. The position would suit someone from a variety of legal or HR backgrounds with sound practical employment law experience.§        §We are open to considering applicants on a part time or full-time basis located either in Otago or Southland the geographical coverage of the membership base. The ability to travel at short notice is an integral part of the role.§        § §        §The Person:§        §You will have a collaborative approach and extensive experience in dealing with Collective Bargaining, Employment Relations Authority, Employment Law Issues, and confidence delivering seminars and training sessions. You will have at least five years’ experience in law or Human Resources.§        §A self-starter, with a strong and resilient nature, able to manage client relations both face to face and remotely. Someone with exceptional organisational skills, who is thorough in their approach and has extremely good attention to detail. This person will be professional and calm, with a warm and friendly nature and active listening skills. OSEA provides tailored and specialist support and training around Employment Law, Health and Safety and Professional Development to organisations in Otago, Southland and The Lakes district.  § §The objective of the organisation is to give members easy access to quality, reliable and accurate support in their daily business, assisting them to make good business decisions, develop and manage their staff and improve their systems and processes ensuring that they are compliant across all areas.§ § § §The Role:§ §We are open to expressions of interest from suitable candidates who are seeking either full-time or part-time work looking for a contract or permanent opportunity.§ §This role will suit a seasoned lawyer or Human Resources professional with a keen interest in employment relations.§ §You will be responsible for the delivery of all the OSEA legal services including training for clients both in group settings and one on one.§ §This role is to complement the existing legal team at the organisation to support members as more businesses need legal assistance and advice in their daily operations in the current post COVID economy.§ §Daily requirements of the role will include providing advice and direct support to employers where there is an employment dispute, disciplinary, mediation, Authority Investigations, performance management and/or compliance needs for members to remain up to date with current legislation and best practice.§ §A further small percentage of the role involves facilitation of training around legislation and employee management best practice. The position would suit someone from a variety of legal or HR backgrounds with sound practical employment law experience.§ §We are open to considering applicants on a part time or full-time basis located either in Otago or Southland the geographical coverage of the membership base. The ability to travel at short notice is an integral part of the role.§ § § §The Person:§ §You will have a collaborative approach and extensive experience in dealing with Collective Bargaining, Employment Relations Authority, Employment Law Issues, and confidence delivering seminars and training sessions. You will have at least five years’ experience in law or Human Resources.§ §A self-starter, with a strong and resilient nature, able to manage client relations both face to face and remotely. Someone with exceptional organisational skills, who is thorough in their approach and has extremely good attention to detail. This person will be professional and calm, with a warm and friendly nature and active listening skills. As an emotionally intelligent individual you will support clients through often challenging situations offering a firm hand to hold every step of the way, this approach will come naturally to you.§ §Members range from all walks of life, so this person needs to be able to relate to people from diverse backgrounds and have the ability to ‘speak their language’ making each member that they work with feel they truly are understood and can have complete faith and trust in the process at hand, whatever it may be.§ §To apply please send your resume and covering letter outlining your experience in the above attributes to Emily Richards via email to §jobs@humanconnectionsgroup.com§ or call in confidence on 027 9596847§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50547115.txt	§Trusts &  Private Client Lawyer | Senior§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trusts &  Private Client Lawyer | Senior§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§This is an opportunity to join a thriving practice on the North Shore that represents a multi-generational client base including high net worth individuals and investors. This is a role where you can work with a good level of autonomy with private clients and assist them in their personal affairs as it relates to trusts, wills, estates, wealth and succession planning, family charters, powers of attorney, inheritance planning, asset structuring and relationship property matters (contracting out agreements etc). The team works flexibly and there is an expert partner that is there for mentorship. If you'd like to join a practice that does quality work and operates without office politics, then enquire now. § § §Part of this role involves dealing with the changes to the Trusts Act and so having some familarity with these changes is key. § § §To be successful in this role, you will ideally have:§5-6+ years' solid legal experience with a decent amount of trusts and private client experience;§An ability to communicate well and build rapport with a range of private clients from different backgrounds and ages;§Sound drafting skills and the ability to provide advice in a clear and concise manner; and§Some private practice experience is needed. § §This is a unique opportunity to work in a very client facing role in a supportive team - get in touch with us to find out more. § §To discuss further, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186 or email your CV and academic transcript to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ or click APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Reporting to the Head of Legal, you will deliver sound, timely and commercially focused legal advice across all areas of the business to ensure that legal issues and risks are well managed. The scope of legal work is diverse, high quality and interesting and includes; strategic and commercial agreements, corporate transaction support, litigation and disputes, consumer law, competition law, health and safety, intellectual property, resource management and property law issues. In addition, you will contribute to key strategic projects, keep the business updated on legal and regulatory change, deliver training on critical issues and manage external legal advisors when required.§  §The ideal candidate we seek will have the following:§ § §Qualified lawyer with NZ practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§ §Experience in commercial and corporate law with 'generalist' knowledge in other broader legal areas§ §Some previous in-house or secondment experience preferred but not essential§ §Commercial awareness with the ability to provide pragmatic, solutions-focused advice§ §Strong drafting and analytical skills§ §The ability to relate well at all levels and become a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders§ §Flexibility, adaptability and a positive, team focused attitude§ §This is a great opportunity to join a supportive, fun and collaborative legal team and contribute to business success. jobText: TXT/50550298.txt	§Commercial Property Senior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Senior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Hays Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§Highly Attractive Salary Package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Commercial Property Senior Solicitor §        §Top Leading Hamilton Firm §        §          §Leading Mid Tier Hamilton Firm §          §Varied, Interesting & Complex Technical Property Matters §          §Career Development, Collegial Team + Benefits §        §        §          §Senior Solicitor Commercial Property, Hamilton, Mid Tier Firm, Interesting & complex matters, Great Team § §Your new company§ § This leading mid-tier firm based in Hamilton has an outstanding reputation for providing excellence in legal advice and customer service to leading commercial/corporate and private clients both locally, nationally and overseas. A rare opportunity has arisen to join their highly talented Property Team where your property expertise will be contributing to their outstanding performance.§ § §Your new role§ § Working alongside their Property Partner, you'll be providing legal advice to corporate entities, local authorities, Institutions and high net worth private clients on a variety of large and complex commercial property matters including:§          § §          §            §Commercial property agreements, §            §Commercial leasing, §            §Commercial property acquisition including due diligence, §            §Large Property development projects,§            §Subdivisions §            §Public works involving technical land issues. §          §          § You'll need to be utilising all your legal technical property knowledge and expertise, client relationships skills and will be undertaking ongoing development in your career working alongside talented legal professionals.§          § §What you'll need to succeed§ § Pivotal to this role is being an experienced technical property solicitor (with ideally 3-8 YRS PQE) that has proven ability within a broad range of commercial property matters with an emphasis on sub-divisions and local government matters (Unit title and public works experience is a bonus). You'll be comfortable with managing files, liaising with clients, working well in a team environment and reviewing work undertaken by more junior solicitors. jobText: TXT/50556206.txt	§Legal Hub Secretary, Commercial§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Hub Secretary, Commercial§§Advertiser: §Morrison Kent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Leading mid-tier law firm Morrison Kent is growing its Commercial Secretarial Hub and is searching for a legal secretary who can be relied upon to deliver high quality work to a variety of lawyers across the business.  The applicant will have a professional services background and be looking for their next career challenge. §  §Reporting to the Hub Manager and Office Manager, you will be exposed to the full range of administrative and secretarial functions within these busy and varied practices to include: § § §Typing and processing of documentation;§ §Monthly billing;§ §File management;§ §Diary management;§ §Client management; § §Presentations; § §General administration requirements; and§ §In addition, the legal administrators will regularly contribute ideas and initiatives to continue to improve the efficiencies of their Hubs.   § §Essential to the role is your ability to turn work around quickly and accurately.  You must have attention to detail, excellent comprehension and grammar. Knowledge and experience of Microsoft Office is highly desirable and familiarity with legal forms is an advantage.  The Hub is busy and requires team players with high initiative who can work autonomously and efficiently and will do whatever is required to get the job done.   §  §The opportunity exists to prove yourself as a highly competent and safe pair of hands that can be relied upon to deliver excellent work and build your reputation for being a highly sought-after legal administrator.  For those who are keen to build their career in administration, there is certainly scope to grow, master new skills and be challenged within the role.§  §Morrison Kent offers a vibrant and supportive culture with a generous spirit that regularly gives back to their community. §  §To apply, please send a cover letter and your CV to Catherine at §catherine@morrisonkent.com§  §Applications close on Monday, 5 October 2020 unless position is filled prior.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Solicitor - Litigation Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50567378.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Litigation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Litigation§§Advertiser: §Tyler Wren§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§This is as broad a Litigation role as you will see available in Central Auckland. Working in a mid-tier firm, reporting to 2 Partners you will enjoy a full variation of work across Litigation and Immigration matters in both the Criminal and Civil Courts. Plenty of time will be spent in Court whether that is in the field of Criminal Prosecution, Civil or Private Litigation matters.§ § §A truly diverse role which requires an autonomous lawyer who relishes attending court as well as a varied and challenging workload. To be able to adapt your experience and skills to this role the firm needs you to have at least 6 years' experience of Litigation including Immigration, Legal Aid and Criminal work.§ § §You will be able to take on a large number of files, manage your clients, draft effective arguments from Day One and require little support from your managers. You will be comfortable delegating to less experienced staff as well as mentor and train.§ § §The firm offers a competitive salary, the chance to develop to Partnership/Special Counsel (whichever route you choose) in time, a realistic understanding of the peaks and troughs of workflows for Litigators - so manage your own time approach, a stable, strong wider team.§ § §If you are interested in talking further about this challenging role then please contact §lgray@tylerwren.co.nz§.§§§§

There is a bit of clutter in the market currently, but this is one not to be missed. Should go quickly.§About the Firm§Our client is a mid-sized firm with both CDB and suburban presence in Canterbury. It has some properly heavy hitting commercial clients on the books amongst a diverse range of SME and private clients. It’s a nice size whereby you will get some interesting work on your desk, but it is also compact enough for you to make a genuine difference.§This particular team is very social and tight knit, enjoying Friday drinks and other social and sporting events together. Culture wise it is the type of office that will discuss the weekend's sporting results over a cup of tea on Monday morning and find common interests to engage with as a team. There was chat of a table tennis set up, but I cannot actually confirm that! There are also a number of altruistic and charitable initiatives that the team get behind each year.§The partner is known to have brought through a number of top young solicitors and takes a very supportive approach to nurturing talent within the firm.§About this role§We have been instructed directly by a well-regarded partner to source a candidate with genuine client facing potential. The ability to take a client-centric approach and build quality relationships is key. Experience in commercial law, property and private client work e.g. trusts wills and estates will be useful.§A ladder climbing role with the opportunity to work collaboratively with senior members of the team, rather than below them. Whilst it will suit an ambitious candidate with a strong work-ethic, no one in the firm is interested in seeing you slave away for 70 hours per week...§Skills and Experience§Likely 2-5 years relevant practice experience. Can be local or relocating.§Ambitious, energetic and keen to learn§Enjoys a social and team-orientated culture§Commercial acumen and maturity key to be successful§Benefits§Generous salary negotiable depending on experience§+ a range of extra benefits and wellness initiatives§Structured mentoring system in place including individual development plans§Top firm to place on your CV and a modern, non-hierarchical culture§How to Apply§If you would like to know more about this vacancy, please give me a call on 021 044 3607 for a confidential and no-obligation discussion.§Or else, flick through your CV via the APPLY button and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§Manager - Fluid Legal§021 044 3607§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50572639.txt	§Solicitor | Dispute Resolution | Intermediate - Senior§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor | Dispute Resolution | Intermediate - Senior§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$60k - $100k p.a.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Above market salary negotiable + carpark + other benefits§Social team environment; Friday drinks, progressive partners§Rare career opportunity to climb the tree and get some proper exposure§The Firm§My client is a household name in the Christchurch legal practice market. Recent change has opened up opportunities in the intermediate to senior bracket for an ambitious litigator to step up into pathway role rarely seen in town.§A well-versed partner and up and coming senior associate drive the team, which is fairly well balanced with the exception of an additional solicitor who may have had a good grounding in dispute resolution, but is wanting an opportunity to get more involved. §You can be a part of social sports teams, firm quiz nights and dinners, and a range of charitable initiatives that help to build firm togetherness. Turnover is very low once people are established at the firm for that reason. Not the type of firm to run its solicitors into the ground with huge hours, which is a hallmark policy of management.§The Role§We want to see someone with some enthusiasm and energy. A drive to learn more, get more time and court and in mediation, and take the chance to lead files more independently. You will be well supported and a individual development plan will be in place from day one and regularly reviewed to make sure you are hitting your own personal goals with the firm.§Skills and Experience§Several skillsets could be adapted to this team so if you have general disputes experience it would be worth making an inquiry. Specifically experience in commercial/civil cases, relationship property, insurance, employment, construction, property, contractual, insolvency, estates or similar would all be useful as the workload is diverse.§A decent amount of time on your feet and an ability to display previous caseload will be ideal, and likely to be sitting in that 2-5year PQE range.§Benefits§Above market salary negotiable + carpark + other benefits§Social team environment; Friday drinks, progressive partners§Rare career opportunity to climb the tree and get some proper exposure§How to Apply§Please use the APPLY button to submit your CV directly to my inbox, otherwise give me a call if you are slightly tentative and after some more information. All discussions are confidential and non-obligatory.§Eden Brown§Manager - Legal - Fluid Recruitment§021 044 3607§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment Ltd. jobText: TXT/50572685.txt	§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative §      §      §      §        §          §Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§          §Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§          §Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§        §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§        §We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§        §To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§        §To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§        §Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §        §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§        §The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§        §This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 11th October 2020.§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §How to Apply§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 11th October 2020.§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50573013.txt	§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§Advertiser: §Bell Gully§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction §      §Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§        §          §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§          §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§          §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§          §Excellent written skills.§          §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§        § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§        §          §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§          §community support programmes;§          §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§          §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§        § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§ § §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§ §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§ §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§ §Excellent written skills.§ §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§ § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§ § §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§ §community support programmes;§ §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§ §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§ § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50573273.txt	§Experienced Commercial Practitioner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Commercial Practitioner§§Advertiser: §C & F Legal Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Are you looking for an opportunity to join a progressive, client focused, very busy law firm in one of the fastest growing regions in New Zealand, whose operation is based on a team approach where all share in the successes of the firm? … Are you interested in being part of a professional legal team that prides itself on excellence and achieving the result? … Are you interested in joining a law firm that stands out from the crowd, prides itself on providing the highest quality legal services, where there is no ceiling on the level of your financial return, where salaries are competitive with the Auckland market and where you are paid based on the efforts you make and the results you achieve and where there is every opportunity for equity participation? … If you are prepared to put in the hard yards and reap the rewards, then read on for the opportunities that exist in this equal opportunity law firm where respect for one’s colleagues and getting the job done are paramount.  § § § §We have a position available for an experienced commercial practitioner within our firm in Nelson.§ §This is an opportunity for an ambitious, hardworking, capable lawyer with no less than five years post admission experience in commercial and property law in New Zealand.  § §Initially you will be working closely with one of our very experienced commercial lawyers servicing clients throughout New Zealand and in some cases overseas§ §The subject matter of your work will be most varied, interesting and rewarding.§ §The position§ § §We are offering a very competitive remuneration package that will reflect the successful applicant’s ability, experience, commitment and results.§ §The work will be interesting, varied and wide ranging, generated from a significant, loyal and ever expanding client base.§ §You will be working with a team of hard working and competent legal practitioners and support professionals.§ §You will have the utility of up-to-date IT support and databases and will work in very pleasant, modern surroundings, situated in the sunshine capital of New Zealand.§ §Our philosophies of practice include:§ §Providing a pleasant, positive and fun working environment focusing on excellence and client satisfaction where our clients are very much advocates for the service we provide;§ §We want to work with people who enjoy each other and share our values;§ §A culture of caring for each other, our team and our clients;§ §Providing an atmosphere for challenge and job satisfaction with opportunities for progression; and§ §Sharing in our financial successes to ensure that the whole team is properly rewarded and individual’s performance is recognised.§ § § §If you wish to make any enquiries about the position, please do not hesitate to telephone Rick Farr on 021 777 443 or §03 545 8080§ §Applications together with resume and testimonials should be provided to C & F Legal Ltd:§ §C & F Legal Ltd§Solicitors§PO Box 1049§Nelson 7040§ § §diana@cflegal.co.nz§ § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Legal Adviser or Associate - Customer Success Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50577759.txt	§Legal Adviser or Associate - Customer Success§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Adviser or Associate - Customer Success§§Advertiser: §ComplyWith NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§About ComplyWith§ §ComplyWith helps businesses and people who want to do things right. People need clarity so that they can do things right.§  §In our mission to create clarity for people we blend our legal expertise and experience with our innovative technology to break down the barriers of complexity and confusion.§  §Our growing legal technology business works with over 130 New Zealand businesses, including many of the regulators.§  §The working environment at ComplyWith encourages creative thinking and suits 'heavy lifters' — those who love to contribute to get stuff done, who embrace challenges, and who are constantly coming up with new ways of doing things better.§  §We value work-life balance. All members of our team have the opportunity to manage client relationships and projects. § §  §What you'll be doing§ §The role is part of our growing Customer Success Team at ComplyWith.  This is the client-facing arm of ComplyWith, and our goal is to drive success and add value for all new and existing customers using ComplyWith.§  §Our work is diverse and covers all stages of the customer journey — from proposals, to implementation, through to ongoing management, we're there every step of the way to support our customers. We also have a big project working with customers to convert them to our New Admin platform which you are likely to be working on in the first year.§  §We are looking for a team member with the skills to comfortably provide a range of advisory services to our legal compliance customers, and who is flexible enough to wear a range of different hats in their role while we're growing our business.§  §While you will work with businesses from a range of sectors, a focus for this role will be our existing and new local government customers.§  §Your primary work will be helping project manage the implementation of new customers and converting existing customers to ComplyWith's New Admin. This work involves mapping our wide breadth of legal content across their business, tailoring a legal compliance survey to the business's activities, and helping organisations to assess legal risk.§  §You will need to drill down into the detail of the customer's business to understand their unique operations, so attention to detail is a must.§  §Once you're up to speed with the legal content and our processes, this role allows for more autonomy and client contact than traditional roles for legally qualified people early in their careers. You will have mentoring and support from senior team members (reviewing your work) and you will be expected to build and maintain strong customer relationships yourself.§  §You will also work closely with ComplyWith's Content Team — our senior experts responsible for drafting and maintaining our legal compliance content. §  §Depending on your areas of interest and strength, you will be encouraged to contribute to the development of the ComplyWith NZ business. The Customer Success team contributes to the software-development roadmap by channeling feedback from customers and your own experience using the tool.§  §What you'll bring§ §Requirements§  §The ideal candidate will demonstrate the following:§ § §2 to 4 years' legal profession experience § §A strong academic record and proven technical legal analysis skills§ §Driven to learn and take on new challenges in a collaborative and practical way§ §An ability to work independently within a close-knit team, and also 'pull together' as a team when the pressure is on§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §A values-driven personality § §Intellectual agility§  §You will need a keen intellect and confident legal analysis skills, which you will deploy in a pragmatic and time-efficient way. You will have an agile mind, with the ability to quickly apply yourself to a diverse range of legal areas whilst moving seamlessly between detailed legal work and 'big-picture' strategic and solution-focused thinking.§  §Excellent communication skills§  §You will need excellent communication skills (and sometimes patience) supported by common sense and the ability to empathise with how non-lawyers see the world and struggle to understand the law's requirements. ComplyWith believes the vast majority of people and businesses want to do the right thing, but they often struggle to get a clear view of what the law requires.§  §Great process management skills§  §We will have multiple projects underway at the same time, and a key challenge you will face is keeping each on track within the timeframes we have promised. You need to be a fan of good process and drive things forward proactively.§  §A values-driven personality§  §We are searching for someone who will be the 'right fit' in our close-knit team.§  §We are building ComplyWith to be a 'most-trusted' brand, with integrity and trust standing at the core of what ComplyWith does. You will have an internal commitment to these principles, and to building our tribe of loyal supporters.§  §ComplyWith employees are 'doers' to the core: they thrive on achieving far more than some might believe possible.§  §Apply§ §Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§  §If you would like to apply for this role, send your CV, academic transcript and a covering letter to §katemac@complywith.com§  §If you're interested in this role, don't delay in applying. We will be reviewing applications as they come in and, if a suitable candidate applies, we won't wait for the closing date to invite them to meet with us.§  §For more information about ComplyWith, visit our website: www.complywith.com.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

this is a fantastic opportunity to join a firm with a team-spirited culture where you will be valued.  Salary is commensurate with experience in the range of $80-95,000 p/a.  §Call Paula Watts on §09 3772248§ or send your CV to §Paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - jobText: TXT/50580293.txt	§Commercial Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Solicitor§§Advertiser: §James People Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§Negotiable based on Experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Overview§My client is a progressive Tauranga law firm, assisting clients throughout the wider Bay of Plenty.§ They provide quality legal advice on all matters from high level business transactions, complex relationship, trust and estate issues, to personal or family disputes.§  § The opportunity has arisen for a Commercial Solicitor to join their team. This is an amazing chance to join a growing and well known business in one of the most beautiful parts of New Zealand.§  § §Company Values§§We ask the right questions§To best serve their clients they are committed to asking the right questions to fully understand the different needs of every situation.§We suggest what's best§Working as a team is huge, it's by collaborating on solutions that my client can ensure their customers get the very best advice and solutions.§We think long term§It's essential that good solutions last the test of time. It's this knowledge that guides my clients work from the beginning.§ § §If these values resonate with you, if it's how you work, you might just be the person we're looking for!§ §Up Front§ While the core need in this case is for a Commercial Solicitor if you are an experienced Litigation Solicitor or Property or General, let us know, there may be an opportunity for the right person.§  § On a day to day basis as a Commercial Solicitor you will be involved with:§ § §Starting a new business§ §Compliance and governance§ §Succession planning§ §Planning, management and governance§ §Securities and financing§ §Mergers and acquisitions§ §Residential conveyancing§ §Commercial conveyancing§ §Commercial leases§ §Farm conveyancing§ §Horticultural leases§ §Subdivisions§ §Resolution of title issues§ § This role works across the spectrum of commercial law in the Bay of Plenty.§ § §You'll need at 2 years PQE or more, but let us know if you think we should consider less. jobText: TXT/50580403.txt	§Patent Attorney§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Attorney§§Advertiser: §AJ Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Intellectual Property Law§§§§§§PATENT ATTORNEY§LEADING IP FIRM§AUCKLAND§ §Join the brilliant minds protecting the world's brightest ideas.§ §If you're inspired by brilliant thinking, come and work with our team of IP experts at one of Australasia's leading IP firms and help protect, build and grow some of the world's most exciting engineering ideas and innovations.§ §AJ Park is recognised as having one of the top specialist teams of IP experts in the world. Our clients range from start-ups and small to medium enterprises, to publicly-listed multinationals, government, and research institutes across 130 countries.§ §Right now, we're on the lookout for patent professionals with a relevant degree and preferably three to eight years' post-qualification work experience, specialising in physics or mechanical, aeronautical or process engineering through to mechatronics, electrical and electronic engineering. Alternatively, you may be an engineer with some experience, but have decided engineering is not for you and are looking for a change in career and interested in pursuing IP.§ §You'll join an acclaimed firm awarded 'Specialist IP Firm of the Year' in the New Zealand Law Awards from 2013 to 2017, working alongside people who have received numerous accolades for their work.§ §You'll do interesting work, and learn a great deal as you go, for a wide range of New Zealand and Australian clients across a broad spectrum of technologies and sectors. Many are export-focused. They look to us for assistance in protecting and commercialising their IP in diverse jurisdictions around the globe.§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural Employer of Choice report listing the 25 top-ranking legal organisations in New Zealand in terms of overall employee experience. This report celebrates employers who go beyond industry standards to provide their people with a safe and engaging working environment and showcases firms leading the way with policies and initiatives that engage their staff. We were also a finalist in the 'Employer of Choice' category of the New Zealand Law Awards 2019.§ §If you'd like to work in a supportive environment that places a strong emphasis on work/life balance, career development and professional growth, take this opportunity to join our award-winning team of IP specialists.§ §Please send your CV, covering letter and academic transcript to Sue Quinnell, Chief Human Resources Officer, at §careers@ajpark.com§ §Visit §www.ajpark.com/careers§ for more information.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50582654.txt	§Junior Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About us:§  §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§  §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. WRMK was also recently named a finalist in three categories at the NZ Law Awards, to be announced in November. In 2019, the firm won both the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the  NZ Law Awards (and was a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§  §The role:§  §We’re looking for a motivated junior lawyer to join our team. As part of our Trusts and Asset Planning team, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients while being guided and mentored by your Team Leader.§  §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Learning to take a big picture view for your clients, you’ll advise on a range of matters relating to trusts and asset planning, including setting up, reviewing and winding up family trusts, as well as some conveyancing and wills.§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal and business clients.§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Bachelor of Laws § §Comfortable with technology and learning new systems§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work as part of a team but also show initiative § §What you'll get in return:§  §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by our staff and external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy our many social events, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§  §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§  §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50588283.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Vend§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋 §  §Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!§  §We are looking for a Senior Legal Counsel to join our team in Newmarket and to support Vend with its rocket-ship growth as it continues its mission as a global SaaS leader transforming the retail ecosystem.§  §Who we are and what we do:§  §Vend is an award-winning SaaS company winning on a global scale. We have over 250 talented people across 5 major markets (US, CA, UK, NZ, AU) working to delight approximately 25,000 awesome retailers worldwide.§  §💚 Our mission: help our retailers build thriving businesses, live more fulfilling lives and create experiences that people love.§  §What you’ll be doing:§ § §Drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and managing a wide range of legal agreements, including technology agreements, partnership agreements, vendor contracts, and customer terms;§ §Keeping across relevant changes to law globally (including data protection, fiscal regulation, open source licensing, and payments);§ §Scoping and leading projects required to implement new legislative developments;§ §Maintaining Vend’s existing global data protection, risk, and compliance programmes;§ §Advising Vend’s international offices on marketing and competition issues, leasing, and assisting with RFPs and enterprise negotiations.§ §And a little bit of.... § § §Continuing to build the legal function at Vend;§ §Implementing new policies, processes, and procedures;§ §Developing and delivering training and education programmes to Venders on relevant areas of law;§ §Providing thought-partnership, as a trusted advisor, to the executive team and other leaders in the business. § §What you need to bring:§ § §Strong commercial/contract experience, from working in private practice and in-house (preferably in a tech/SaaS setting); and§ §Ideally some global experience, particularly across US, UK, Canada, and/or Australia.§ §Why do you want to work at Vend?§ § §You will be offered a competitive salary§ §This role can be full time or part time and we offer flexible working hours§ §We will provide you with opportunities to develop your career§ §You can help build an amazing product in a company big enough for growth but lean enough to make a genuine impact§ §Plus, we have a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:§ § §Secure, full-time carpark§ §Dog-friendly environment§ §Free fresh fruits, snacks and drinks (and cake for your birthday!)§ §Paid leave and assistance for new parents§ §Travel insurance for you and your family§ §Vend Share Options scheme§ §Four weeks annual leave + extra day over the Christmas holidays§ §Where to from here?§  §Obviously, we’re looking to ensure it’s a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world, feel free to check out our Instagram.§  §Vend is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity.§§§§

jobTitle: Junior Lawyer (PAL1) Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50591640.txt	§Junior Lawyer (PAL1)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Lawyer (PAL1)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer §§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a junior lawyer with a speciality in criminal advocacy, holding a duty lawyer listing would be optimal but is not essential, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment. §You will find challenge and satisfaction with a varied caseload, including trials and appearances. You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand.  You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required. §You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people.  This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §Applications close on 11 October 2020 and the salary range for this role is §$60,092 - $70,6998§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

A Canterbury network is an advantage but not essential.§ §About the Firm§This firm is led by experienced partners who have developed an excellent company culture. Touring the office, it is easy to see why they have maintained such low staff turnover. Staff are happy, morale is high, and the firm is busy. There are large breakout common areas which speaks to the social nature of the team and partners are proud of the work/life balance maintained by their staff.§The bulk of the work is in property, private client and commercial, which naturally generates a workflow of litigation work. There is an existing team, although it requires leadership and senior level expertise after the seat was vacated earlier in the year.§About the Role§This role has a mentoring and management part to it, as well as a strategic remit, which includes growing the practice, keeping up to date with legal tech and advising partners on growth areas within the litigation practice and for the wider firm.§The work that is generated will be fairly general and diverse, covering things like contractual disputes, debt recovery, insolvency, estates as well as a range of property and commercial disputes.§About You§You will be an experienced litigation lawyer keen on a challenge that sits outside of your typical role. You will work mostly in conveyancing, but undertake general work with wills, trusts, estates, commercial work. As we are not a large firm, we are a tight knit group of self starters who show initiative, flexibility, high work ethics and knowledge to guide and assist our clients. The right person needs to have the breadth and depth of  conveyancing and estate experience in New Zealand law firms to be able to run conveyancing matters on their own from day one with minimal supervision; be unflappable under pressure, have an eye for the details, be meticulous with paperwork and organisation, meet deadlines, have some basic accounting skills, love a challenge and be very client and results focused.  This is a "client facing" role, meaning you will have self confidence and up to date knowledge to represent the firm at all times and meet with our clients to put them at ease immediately.  §  §About the Role§  §Your main responsibilities will include:§ § §Working closely with the firm's lawyers and other staff on a variety of matters including conveyancing, estates, commercial and general practice files.§ §Landoline searches & edealings.§ §Preparing documents in Webforms.§ §Preparing all types of legal documents including drafting trusts, wills, EPAs, estate documents and general correspondence including settlement statements and invoices within our trust accounting system.§ §Assisting the AML compliance officer with client due diligence requirements.§ §Assisting with trust accounting entries and client ledgers.§ §Helping with general administration tasks including reception & telephones, photocopying, filing and managing our deeds register.§ §Benefits and Perks§ § §Flexible work hours and a supportive team environment in new and modern offices.§ §Access to ongoing professional development.§ §Free parking.§ §Skills and Experience§ § §minimum of one to three years legal executive experience working in a New Zealand law firm.§ §Be highly motivated, self managing,with an ability to cope with sometimes stressful situations. § §A willingness to learn new things.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Work efficiently and effectively with high levels of accuracy and attention to detail.§ §Have excellent communication and multi-tasking skills.§ §Show initiative, confidence and maturity.§ §A demonstrated ability to juggle priorities as they change throughout the day/week to achieve deadlines and client demands.§ §A willingness to always go the extra mile and be flexible in a demanding environment.§ §Be able to handle people from all walks of life especially in difficult situations.§ §Professional, ethical and courteous on the phone and face to face. § §To apply, please forward a full covering letter outlining why you think you are the right person for us and an up to date CV with verbal references for two people including a current employer.  You can also read more about us at www.ginajansen.co.nz.  §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§
