Most solicitors in the firm have an area of focus but are encouraged to stay relatively general and contribute across at least a few areas.§The focus is less on experience and more on getting the right people for the future of the firm. Client facers, self-starters, keen learners are all welcomed. This is a family friendly and community minded firm. It is a social environment with Friday drinks, social events and a range of community level sponsorships.§About You§You will be looking for a supportive environment to continue building your legal career. You will likely be 2-5 year + in PQE, wanting a firm that can provide a quality long term opportunity for progression. Ideally you will have runs on the board, but you may be feeling stuck or undervalued in your current situation.§Benefits§Work with experienced and well renowned partners across disciplines§Excellent salary banding with achievable targets in place§Personalised development plans in a firm with room to progress§Excellent company culture. Low turnover. Social and non- bureaucratic§How to Apply§Please call Eden on §+64210443607§ for a fully confidential discussion, or else use the APPLY button to directly submit your CV.§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. As the only legal recruiter with on the ground experience in Dunedin I am always happy to provide general commentary, so please do ensure you call me before making any moves.§ §Eden Brown§Manager - Legal - FLUID Recruitment§§0210443607§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

This is a new role due to an increase in workflows and a growing team.§        §Ideally, you will have 3 - 5 years' experience and interest and background in property, subdivisions, conveyancing, commercial leases and the general needs of individuals and private clients. In this role, you will be working alongside our clients advising in small business, commercial and property transactions. This is a new role due to an increase in workflows and a growing team.§  §Ideally, you will have 3 - 5 years' experience and interest and background in property, subdivisions, conveyancing, commercial leases and the general needs of individuals and private clients. In this role, you will be working alongside our clients advising in small business, commercial and property transactions. We're looking for someone who can pick up a file and run it confidentially and autonomously but collaborate with the team where necessary on the more complicated matters.§  §You'll be a team player, but keen to fulfil your own potential. The team at K3 are multicultural, multi disciplinary and have a strong focus on diversity§ §K3 Legal are the recent recipients of the 2020 legal Employer of Choice Award, demonstrating our commitment to culture and a supportive and fun workplace for all employees.§ §Applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand.§ §To apply please email your CV and cover letter to §kanisya@K3.co.nz§.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50617437.txt	§Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Are you currently working in a top tier or reputable law firm and seeking an in-house commercial role that will provide variety and exposure to a range of legal and regulatory matters?  This opportunity will see you working collaboratively with the business from day one in order to drive change and deliver pragmatic solutions.§ §Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, with over 30,000 employees globally.  The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.§ §In New Zealand, Chubb continues to grow and evolve in an environment of regulatory change.  We are at the exciting stage of building a legal and compliance team that is at the forefront of driving change.  You will have a unique opportunity to work across all areas of the business, working with various stakeholders to mitigate risk and provide optimum customer solutions.§ §MAIN PURPOSE§ §This newly-created role will report to the Head of Legal and Regulatory NZ and is a key hire for the business.  You will provide legal oversight across all business lines, manage contractual agreements and respond to regulatory change.  This is an exciting opportunity in a fast-paced environment where you will have the ability to influence business decisions and provide input into the Company’s strategy and direction.§ §THE OPPORTUNITY§ §This position sits within the Chubb NZ legal and compliance team and could see you:§ § §Working with stakeholders across the business to review, negotiate and draft documents including contractual agreements and insurance policy documents relevant to the Company’s operations (such as distribution, broker, procurement, service and confidentiality agreements).§ §Analysing and providing legal and regulatory advice in connection with all aspects of the Company’s operations including business initiatives and transactions relating to insurance products, distribution methods and corporate agency arrangements, customer interface issues such as claims, complaints and disputes and internal advice to the company’s financial, actuarial, audit, human resources and risk departments.§ §Monitoring changes and developments in the legal and regulatory landscape impacting Chubb and assisting in the development of appropriate strategies to meet these developments, including appropriate communications and training for the business and liaising with industry and regulatory bodies.§ §Driving and/or managing projects within the business to respond to and implement regulatory and contractual change.§ §Assisting in the development and awareness of legal and compliance policies at a local level, including privacy related policy documentation and procedures, ensuring alignment with regional and global legal and compliance policies where applicable.§ §Assisting in the development and maintenance of legal templates/precedent documents, legal policies and procedures.§ §Assisting in the selection, retainer and effective management of external counsel.§ §Assisting with company secretarial tasks including drafting Board and Committee reports and documents.§ §Working on other legal, regulatory and compliance matters as they arise from time to time.§ §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Solid legal experience in a leading law firm and/or in-house environment.  Exposure to the financial services industry and knowledge of relevant laws would be beneficial.§ §A willingness to learn, a positive attitude and high integrity. § §Strong oral and written communication, analytical, presentation and influencing skills.§ §Ability to take initiative, manage competing priorities and adhere to deadlines.§ §In return, we offer you the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic and agile environment, with a competitive benefits package, where continuous development is encouraged throughout your career (both professionally and academically).§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

You will be responsible for running matters from end to end, representing clients at mediation and appear in the Employment Relations Authority where required.§  § You will be mentored, guided and coached by our supportive and knowledgeable Senior Employment Claims Adviser and Employment Claims Team Leader.§ § You will be part of a close knit, supportive and high performance team with access to practical in-house and external training. Our environment is fast-paced and your ability to manage clients' expectations through difficult times is critical. Your organisation and prioritisation skills are a must for the successful delivery of the high quality service that we offer.§   § §Key accountabilities.§ § §All aspects of case preparation and representation of clients§ §Provision of advice and strategic assistance to clients and internal and external stakeholders§ §Drafting responses to claims and representation of clients at mediation§ §Negotiating settlements and drafting appropriate terms of settlement§ § § § § §The right person will have:§ § §qualifications in law§ §litigation/workplace relations experience highly regarded§ §experience in dealing with employment-related claims, drafting documentation and representing clients at mediation§ §excellent time management skills and ability to prioritise § §ability to work effectively under pressure and be a self-starter§ § § § § § § §Why join Employsure?§ § Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity.§ § The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.§ § With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.§ § §Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50621242.txt	§20/374 Manager, Policy & Regulatory§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/374 Manager, Policy & Regulatory§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§Type:§ Permanent§Hours:§ Full time§Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Legal Services §Branch:§ Organational Strategy and Performance §Salary:§ $131,321 - $177,670§§                    §If you thrive on diversity, like a challenge and want to know that what you do makes a difference to the lives of New Zealanders, this is the opportunity is for you.   §Our Legal Services team has recently been reconfigured into two teams to enable us to maximise the value that our in-house legal team brings to Te Tari Taiwhenua – DIA.  That value arises out of the privileged position that we hold as trusted advisors within DIA, the perspective that this gives us and our commitment to making the most of our position and perspective to support DIA to achieve its strategic outcomes.§  §We are looking for a Manager to lead our Policy & Regulatory team in delivering legal advice across a broad range of regulatory systems and practice areas.  The team provides legal advice on legislative design, licensing and other statutory decisions, regulatory investigations, prosecutions and other enforcement action.  This is a new position, responsible for people and practice management for a team of 6 lawyers and part of a leadership team that works collaboratively to provide advice and assurance on legal risk.§  §Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor, you will be part of the Legal Services team in the Organisational Strategy and Performance (Te Urungi) branch.  You will be working in a collegial environment where experience and knowledge is shared and support, peer review and constructive feedback are encouraged.§  §We are looking for a lawyer with extensive experience in working in government and a good understanding of public law, legislative design and operation of regulatory systems.  You will to demonstrate an ability to lead and mentor a team and to think strategically about the delivery of legal services and management of legal risk.§  §We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§ §To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Monday 19 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Andrea Speir at §andrea.speir@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621910.txt	§Inspectorate Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inspectorate Manager§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Law Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Inspectorate Manager§  §New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Tu§re o Aotearoa, Auckland§  §About the Law Society§The New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa is the professional body for barristers and solicitors in New Zealand. The Law Society regulates all lawyers practising in New Zealand and is the membership organisation for practising lawyers. With 13 branch offices throughout the country, the Law Society is the Kaitiaki (guardian) of the practise of law in Aotearoa New Zealand and the consumers of legal services.§  §About the role§We are seeking an outstanding candidate to join our Regulatory department, to provide leadership, direction, and support to the Law Society’s Inspectorate team. Based in Wellington, this position will assume responsibility for the programme to inspect law firms’ trust accounts and carry out the functions as set out in the Lawyers and Conveyancers Act.§  §The work is challenging, varied and fast-paced, and requires a high level of judgment and political nous.§  §What’s in it for you?§  §The opportunity to add incremental value to our organisation, to work as part of a competent & collaborative Inspectorate team, and the opportunity to develop your career with a progressive organisation.§  §This position is a permanent, full-time (37.5 hours per week) role. It is important that the Law Society can attract, support, and retain quality staff and one of the ways we can achieve this is by offering employees the flexibility to manage their work/life balance. At the Law Society we offer our staff the flexibility to work both from home and in the office and give staff more freedom to make decisions suited to them.§  §What are we looking for?§ § §Preferably a tertiary qualification in Law or other relevant tertiary qualification§ §Chartered accountancy desirable§ §Previous audit and risk-based experience in a large accounting firm § §Proven experience leading staff § §Professionalism and the ability to quickly establish rapport with stakeholders § §A high standard of written and oral communication skills. Written skills must include the ability to produce concise, structured, and accurate material § §The ability to produce evidence before the Disciplinary Tribunal and the courts § §Ability to work as part of a team or independently in the field § §Good judgement and discretion § §Willingness to travel (drivers license required)§ §A high level of discretion and confidentiality. § § §  §This is an exciting career prospect for a commercially astute, motivated individual who thrives on creating customer value.§  §The Law Society is committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion and is keen to ensure that appointments reflect New Zealand’s multicultural society. Applications from a diverse range of backgrounds are encouraged.§ §  §For a confidential discussion or additional information please contact Stu Woollett, Acting General Manager Professional Standards (Regulatory) (§stu.woollett@lawsociety.org.nz§).§ §  §Please follow this link for a copy of the position description and application form - https://www.lawsociety.org.nz/professional-practice/legal-jobs/inspectorate-manager-auckland/§  § §  §If you would like to apply, please complete the §application form§ (found on link above) and submit this together with your §cover letter§ and §CV§ to §recruitment@lawsociety.org.nz§.§  § §  §Applications close 5pm, 7 October 2020.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50623872.txt	§Property/Commercial Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property/Commercial Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Timpany Walton Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Timpany Walton Lawyers is a well-established, progressive law firm in South Canterbury undertaking a wide range of legal work.§ §We are looking for a graduate or a junior lawyer (up to 2-3 years PQE) to join our busy practice in early 2021. § §As a lawyer at our firm, you’ll work with and be mentored by some of the brightest legal minds in Timaru, advise some of Timaru’s leading organisations and be involved in remarkable work. § §You’ll have a large amount of client contact, and an ability to grow your own client base and be responsible for your own files as your competency grows. You will have exposure to a variety of general commercial/corporate transactions, residential conveyancing, business acquisitions and disposals, negotiating and drafting contracts, licensing and corporate compliance.§ §If you have the following attributes;§ §·         Strong academics§ §·         A flexible attitude§ §·         Excellent written and analytical skills§ §·         A desire to learn in a practical environment§ §·         The ambition to develop a career§ §·         Motivation to deliver high quality legal services to our clients§ §Please apply by emailing your cover letter, CV and academic transcript to Kate Holden §kate@timpanywalton.co.nz§If you want to know more about living in Timaru check out welovetimaru.nz§ §Applications close Friday 23 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Legal Secretary - Property Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50625194.txt	§Legal Secretary - Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary - Property§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§In this role you are responsible for providing support to your team as required. This will involve providing general administrative and secretarial support and ensuring the efficient operation of the team you are assisting. In this role you need to effectively manage the workload of the team, utilising the appropriate resources.§ §Key Accountabilities: § §Client/Team Relations§Develop and maintain a professional and friendly relationship with clients and Brookfields’ staff. Give clients top priority.§Assist team and Brookfields’ staff members to ensure that a high level of customer service is provided to clients at all times.§General Administration§Answer/screen telephone calls and forward messages to authors in a timely and professional manner. Receive messages for other team members when absent.§Advise receptionist of required response to clients in relation to authors' whereabouts.§Organise appointments with clients and provide support for meetings including arranging venue and refreshments if required.§Ensure timely and accurate completion of billing process.§Secretarial Duties:§Assist authors with document management, letter writing, including Dictaphone and copy typing, preparation for settlements, reporting to clients and other matters as required.§Manage authors' diaries, ensuring appointments and commitments are recorded accurately and maintained. Ensure Author is informed and updated of these commitments.§Handle incoming and outgoing mail and facsimiles as required. Photocopy and file outgoing mail (including enclosures)§Set up and maintain effective filing systems, ensuring files are up-to-date, and in a tidy and chronological order. This includes opening and closing files.§Maintain client files, precedents, and research folders.§In consultation with other secretaries in the team and the Office Manager, ensure that efficient cover of solicitors is always maintained.§Continue to increase legal and market knowledge.§Person Specifications:§ §Work Experience/Knowledge§A solid background in property law – being able to run a conveyancing file from start to finish is imperative.§Experience with banking and finance documentation including loan agreements and securities is desirable.§Landonline, Webforms, KiwiSaver forms and Sales Direct experience.§Ideally Companies Office, PPSR, IPONZ experience.§A basic understanding of Anti-Money Laundering and related client due diligence.§Demonstrated competency in word processing and other programs and operation of office equipment (i.e. facsimile, photocopier, scanner).§Excellent typing speed and accuracy.§Skills & Abilities:§Ability to learn new things and retain information.§A quick learner and enjoy getting to grips with new computer software.§A good communicator.§Ability to delegate work and utilise appropriate resources.§Ability to effectively prioritise and organise workload.§Ability to work effectively under pressure.§Well-developed relationship and customer service skills.§Attention to detail.§§§§

jobTitle: 20/379 Solicitor / Senior Solicitor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50625321.txt	§20/379 Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/379 Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§Type:§ 2 x Permanent & 1 x Fixed Term - 12 months§Hours:§ Full time or Part time §Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Legal Services§Branch:§ Organisational Strategy and Performance§Salary:§ Solicitor $66,312 - $89,715 Senior Solicitor $92,316 - $124,897§§If you thrive on cutting-edge projects, like a challenge and to know what you do, you do for the good of New Zealand, this is the opportunity is for you. §§Te Tari Taiwhenua - DIA Legal Services Team recently reconfigured into two teams, to enable us to maximise our value, which comes from our privileged position as trusted advisors and the perspective that gives us. §To help us deliver on our commitment to support DIA to achieve its strategic outcomes, we’re now looking to fill three Senior Solicitor/Solicitor positions in our new Commercial & Corporate Law team – two are Permanent roles and one is a 12 months fixed term contract (parental leave) position starting around mid-January 2021. § §Working in the CCL team will particularly appeal to lawyers who have a strong interest in, and the skill and experience to provide, high quality strategic legal advice on commercial and technology related legal work across DIA’s diverse and innovative operations, including:§commercial and contract law advice, contract review, drafting and negotiation§working on complex projects, procurement processes and cross-government initiatives§property/construction  §ICT/technology and intellectual property§general corporate law issues.§§We’re happy to receive applications for these roles if you’re looking for full-time, part-time, secondment or other flexible working arrangements.§You’ll be working in a collegial environment where experience and knowledge is shared and support, peer review and constructive feedback are encouraged. §There is more information about this role, and what we’re looking for from you, in the Job Description. More information about DIA, and what the Department does, can be found at www.dia.govt.nz§Better New Zealand§§Working at the Department of Internal Affairs, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. §Organisational Strategy and Performance (Te Urungi)§§We’re a small branch with a big job. We provide direction, oversight and leadership across the Department around risk assurance, project governance, legal services and strategic planning.  §§Role Information§See Job Description. §If you want a job where the work you do matters to New Zealand, we would like to hear from you.§We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§§Please indicate whether you are applying for the Solicitor or Senior Solicitor role in your application.§§To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Sunday 11 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Tim Whiteley at §tim.whiteley@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here for Solicitor and click here for Senior Solicitor. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50629083.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor (Dunedin-based)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor (Dunedin-based)§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We currently have two exciting opportunities available with our clients based in Dunedin. These are well-established law firms with credible brands in the market that work with a diverse range of private clients and businesses. Workflows are consistent and the firms are in growth mode, so you can be sure to get solid experience while working with well-regarded partners in the industry. Our clients are looking to hire at the Solicitor or Senior Solicitor level but are interested in ​considering more senior candidates as well.§ §Litigation Opportunity§ §General practice law firm with modern offices in a convenient CBD location, approachable partners and a pragmatic approach to their work.§3+ years PQE from a general practice, or specialist law firm, in one or more of these areas: relationship property, family law and employment law. Some criminal law experience would also fit well in this role.§Experience appearing in court and mediation hearings would be highly-regarded.§The role will include a mix of matters relating to complex relationship property matters (drafting Section 21 contracts), family law disputes, employment law matters e.g. advising restraints and dismissals, drafting employment agreements, personal grievances claims and health and safety matters.§This is a varied role at a law firm that values people and promotes career development within the firm. On the cards is partnership for the right candidate.§ §Property & Commercial Opportunity§ §General practice law firm with a strong commercial team that advises individual and business clients across various property and commercial transactions.§2+ years PQE in property and commercial law from a general practice or commercial property firm is needed.§The property side of this role includes involvement with commercial property ​transactions, developments, subdivisions, commercial leasing, financing and property sharing arrangements.§The commercial side will include drafting of various agreements, sale & purchase of businesses, corporate law (ownership structures, shares).§Working with two highly respected partners at a firm with a long-standing heritage, this is the perfect opportunity for you if you have a background in these areas and want to work on more complex transactions to further develop your commercial law skills.§ §If you're looking for that outdoor lifestyle and work/life balance role, this is a good time to make the move. You may be a NZ qualified lawyer looking to return to NZ ​or to relocate to the Dunedin region and seeking an opportunity that will enable you to advance your career in an attractive part of New Zealand.§ § §If you are interested in these roles, please “APPLY” by sending your CV and academic transcript. For more information call Harrison on 027 2745 926. § §Thinking of relocating? Cobalt Recruitment has opportunities all across New Zealand, so if you are looking to move to another region or return from overseas, Cobalt is perfectly positioned to help you with your transition. Get in touch with our any of our legal recruitment specialists.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50631577.txt	§Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Are you an outstanding multiskilled Legal Executive ready to immerse yourself in a law firm that will foster and grow your skills?§Our client, Nicholsons Lawyers, is the oldest law firm in Taranaki servicing third generation families and offering a wide range of legal services. Their success is attributed to the firms strong core value which is “their people are the most valuable asset.” It’s this philosophy that ensures that all the team work hard to build trust and maintain strong relationships with their clients.§Is this the opportunity you have been looking for?§This position is a very satisfying job that will not only allow you to use your breadth of knowledge in your area of expertise as a legal executive but also support you to grow your skills over time into more high profile and complex work. You will be working alongside a Commercial Partner providing essential support in legal tasks across a broad range of matters relating to residential and commercial transactions and trust, estate management. jobTitle: Corporate Lawyer  Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638287.txt	§Corporate Lawyer §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Lawyer §§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§The role§ §Our client has a growing Corporate team and has a position for an intermediate level lawyer in its Wellington team two work with two partners who are specialists in this area. The partners do top quality M&A work, advise on joint venture arrangements, regulatory matters and provide general commercial advice to it's clients (e.g. in the fintech and IT sector) as well as work on infrastructure projects. There will be work with a varied client base including large corporates, public sector institutions, those in the energy, mining, oil and gas sector as well as growing NZ businesses. The firm itself has a structured professional development and training system in place so that you can truly grow your skills. § §Your skills / experience§ §3+ years solid experience in a well-regarded corporate/commercial law team (recent private practice experience is preferred but those with public sector or in-house experience may be of interest also).§Good academics - at least a B average.§Passionate about further developing a career in the corporate/commercial law field and learning from experts. § § §This is a chance to be involved in some of the best corporate and commercial legal work in the country. § § § §If you're a NZ qualified lawyer looking at returning from overseas, positions like this are rare in the Wellington market at present - make an enquiry today to find out if this an opportunity for you. § § § §To apply or for further information, email your CV and academic record by clicking 'APPLY' now or call Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50638462.txt	§Litigation & Employment  | Intermediate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Litigation & Employment  | Intermediate§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§ About the role§ §Working under the mentorship of two approachable partners, in a team setting, you will be involved in a range of employment law matters including personal grievance claims, employment law advice, restructuring matters and the like as well as civil litigation (property disputes, contractual disputes etc). The role will be relatively equally split between civil litigation and employment law with the ability to have a bit of exposure to criminal law work too. § § §This firm has a flat structure and reputable brand in the market - the work will be hands on and you'll have the ability to attend mediations and deal with clients directly, with a good level of involvement in the files. You will work in a practice that has modern practices and offices. § § §About you: §You will have: §· 2 or more years’ as a litigation lawyer. Ideally you would have had some exposure to employment law / employment relations work and in private practice. If you have gained relevant experience in-house or in the public sector you may be of interest too provided you have good academics;§· sound research, drafting and advocacy skills; and§· the ability to work with a reasonable level of autonomy in file management.§ § §This role could suit someone that is doing either civil litigation or employment law work and wants a greater mix and variety of work. § § §NZ qualified lawyers looking to return from the UK or Australia are of interest too. § § §For more information or a confidential discussion, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186 or email your CV and academic record to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ or click APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Solicitor  Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50638758.txt	§Solicitor §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Enjoy interesting, varied and challenging work!§Collaborative and supportive team culture§Want to work with an engaged and forward-thinking team?§Do you want to be at an agency at the forefront of New Zealand’s response to the global pandemic? Are you interested in being part of a team which is at the centre of legislative reform affecting the everyday lives of all New Zealanders?  If you are a skilled solicitor looking to join a highly-skilled and close-knit team then we want to hear from you!§The Ministry of Transport is taking on a new direction – it’s not just about roads and rail. Transport affects every area of our society and we need to think in broad terms.  We are interested in great thinking, bold ideas and new approaches.§As the principal transport adviser to the government, the Ministry of Transport provides policy advice and support to Ministers to improve the performance of New Zealand’s transport system and related Crown entities such as the Civil Aviation Authority, Transport Accident Investigation Commission, Maritime New Zealand, and the New Zealand Transport Agency. The Ministry also manages the government’s investment into transport, develops legislation and represents New Zealand’s international interest in maritime and aviation affairs. §The role§In the role you’ll not only be part of the a team creating forward-thinking legislative reform at a system level, you will also work across the Ministry to support the Ministry on ensuring good practice in relation to matters such as privacy and procurement.§As a solicitor at the Ministry you will sit within the Legal Team, which provides strategic, high quality, cost effective and efficient legal advice to the Ministry of Transport and Ministers, concentrating on activities which require Ministry-specific skills, or which are regarded as core activities of the Ministry. §About you§Coming from a public-sector background, you will possess strong legal instincts as well as great initiative. You will have a minimum of 12 months experience and the ability to hold a practising certificate. §Along with your tertiary qualification in Law, you will have strong knowledge and understanding of public law and different legislative frameworks. You will have great attention to detail, strong analytical and communication skills that allow you to know what partnership really means, and strive to be part of the bigger picture.§Whilst not essential, it would be great if you have some government experience, but if not, you’ll be a person who easily picks things up along the way!§What we offer§It’s an exciting time to join the Ministry and the variety of interesting issues we lead, shape, and influence may surprise you. As a small, flexible and responsive ministry, we deliver great results by working collaboratively across the sector.§This is an exciting opportunity to grow your skill set and make a real contribution to New Zealand's transport system, during unique and challenging times - if this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you. §Salary band - $78,103 - $110,264. The successful candidate will be appointed at a salary which reflects individual skills and experience.§To learn more about the role and working at the Ministry of Transport, download our position description and for a confidential discussion about the role, contact Brendan Booth, Chief Legal Adviser on 027 574 4391.§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for these roles at the Ministry of Transport.§Please submit your application online including a cover letter and CV by Monday 12 October 2020.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Corporate Affairs Officer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639625.txt	§Corporate Affairs Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Affairs Officer§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§About the company§ § FLUID Recruitment have partnered exclusively with a multinational gold producer who have been contributing to excellence by delivering sustainable environmental and social outcomes for communities, and strong returns for shareholders.§ § §About the role & Candidate§ § Our client is looking to reposition themselves as part of a reset economy and looking to offer solutions via mining in a direction which is consistent with government guidance, and have therefore created a new 12-month fix-term role to assist in achieving this goal. However, even though it is a fix-term role, there is potential of it being extended to something more permanent. They are looking for someone to contribute to the strategic direction of the company, who can shape attitudes and influence people’s opinions around mining. The successful candidate will become the face of the company in Wellington and will manage the business through disruption and political changes, aiding in a cultural transition which will be shifting due to imminent policy changes. This role will provide in-country monitoring, coordination and engagement to support the management at the national and regional levels of government affairs, external relations and responsible social performance plus the company’s ability to operate, adapt and develop within its long-term regulatory operating environment.§ § The successful candidate will likely:§ §Have a minimum of 4 years PQE.§Have demonstrated experience in regulatory, policy, corporate affair, public relation, government relations communications fields or similar.§Have a high level of skill in problem solving, conceptual thinking, and distillation of ideas and analysis into a suitable form for decision making.§Understand the service provider nature of the role, accompanied by high service orientation to the recipients of advice and an ability to work effectively with a wide range of people§Have an ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities (including managing the expectations of advice recipients), and make sound judgements about prioritisation and workflow management through use of external providers§Have an ability to develop appropriate networks, particularly internally, for collaborative work, including openly contributing ideas and sharing information as appropriate§Be resilient and comfortable working in a complex, ambiguous and fast-paced environment§Have a high level of experience in government and stakeholder engagement§Have experience or familiarity in iwi issues§Have advanced policy analysis, legal analysis, negotiation, interpersonal skills, report writing and presentation skills§Have good strategic thinking skills. Can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has a broad knowledge and perspective§How to apply§ § If you are interested to learn more give me a call for a chat, or alternatively click the apply button to submit your CV. All enquiries are strictly confidential.§Emeka Ilogu§FLUID Legal - Consultant§§03 467 7228§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

They will advance, with support, in taking greater responsibility in the management of cases and appearing for clients, including conducting hearings independently. The successful application can expect to be involved in cases of the highest level, often topical and with profile. § §Applicants currently completing their professional legal studies or a Junior Lawyer with existing experience, though not necessarily in criminal, is preferred. The successful Applicant will need to harbour strong motivation to pursue a career in criminal law or litigation generally, whether they have such experience to date or not. The Legal team partners with the business units within Airways to drive the company's strategy and manage its risk. As a state-owned enterprise, Airways operates within a public sector framework, as well as the highly regulated Aviation sector.  The legal function is key to delivering Airway's strategy of safe skies today and tomorrow within this complex setting. § § § §About the role: § §In this role you will work directly with stakeholders across the business providing advice, contract support and training. You will work collaboratively with colleagues in the legal team, and be key in driving the legal team strategy to deliver its objectives.  You will have the opportunity to work independently, but also to benefit from the support and experience of the more senior solicitors in the team.  This is an exciting opportunity to develop your generalist knowledge through exposure to a broad range of in-house, corporate legal challenges.  § § § §To be successful in this role:§ §You will have a Bachelor of Laws, with admission to the High Court of New Zealand. In addition, you will have a minimum of 1 – 2 years post qualified experience. jobTitle: Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50645711.txt	§Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Victoria Fletcher Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Pidgeon Law is a highly regarded boutique law firm specialising in property, unit title and body corporate law, commercial, trust and asset planning law based in Auckland’s CBD. § §Pidgeon Law is led by two female partners.  Joanna Pidgeon is a recognised property law expert - asked to speak at conferences, be an expert witness on property matters in Court and advise other practitioners as well as her clients.  Her commitment to the profession is evidenced by her past presidency of the ADLS and she continues her long-term involvement in both NZLS and ADLS committees.  Outside of the legal industry, she is the Acting Chair of Auckland City Mission.  Her career began in several of New Zealand’s large law firms.  Motivated to offer a more personal, pragmatic and efficient specialist legal service to her clients, she founded Pidgeon Law in 2008.  Since then she has built a team of 9 lawyers, plus law students supporting the administration of the firm in part-time law clerk roles. § §The firm’s other partner, Liza Fry-Irvine, is a body corporate and unit title expert.  She too is frequently asked to speak at seminars and conferences on unit titles and issues facing multi-dwelling sites in New Zealand and Australia, has drafted the model ADLS Body Corporate Rules and is Deputy President of the Strata Community Association (New Zealand Chapter).  She is also committed to the development of the profession by her current involvement in the ADLS.§ § § §Joanna and Liza have an excellent opportunity for a lawyer with 18 months’ - 5 years’ quality legal experience directly relevant to the firm’s practice, to join their team and make their mark as a trusted property, business and personal lawyer.§  § § § §Pidgeon Law’s clients include the full range of people and businesses involved in property from developers, investors, financiers, surveyors and property managers to property owners.  The team’s lawyers advise on all aspects of property including land acquisition, construction contracts, financing including overseas investment, development and subdivision, leasing, property management, unit title, body corporate, incorporated society and cross lease matters.  Acting for this range of clients on this range of work, naturally leads the team to providing business and personal advice from business structuring, business sales and purchases, commercial contract negotiation and drafting, to personal asset structuring and protection, relationship property agreements, and trust formation and ongoing management. § §Joanna and Liza have created an empowering, liberating and flexible-working environment where you can rely on their leadership and mentoring as well as collaboration with their team of excellent lawyers.  You will work with interesting clients on transactional work covering the broadest spectrum of property, commercial and personal work, tailored to your level of experience and intended to quickly accelerate your development. § §With your strong self and work management skills, you will be motivated, organised, efficient and outcome focused.  Your interpersonal skills will enable you to easily inspire confidence and build relationships with clients and team.  Your clients will expect you to be articulate both verbally and in your writing, with the common sense, pragmatism and commercial instincts to help them meet their needs.  Ideally you will have a solid academic record.§ § § §Feel free to enquire confidentially by telephoning Victoria Fletcher on 021 300 982.  Otherwise, for your application to be considered, you must be able to legally work in New Zealand and must submit your academic transcript, along with your cover letter and CV to Victoria via Seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50646041.txt	§Prosecutor 1§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Prosecutor 1§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Prosecutor 1 §      §        §Police Prosecution Service, it starts with you! §        §          §Nelson§          §Office of Constable/Police Employee§          §Permanent Fulltime§          §Salary range: $77.862,00-by negotiation §        §        § §        §About the role§        §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor within their Nelson PPS team. §        § §        §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§        § §        §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§        § §        §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§        § §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Communication - Having the skills to effectively communicate with our people, partners and community. §          §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions and responses under pressure in a face to face setting§          §Law and Policy - Having a sound understanding of prosecution and court processes, and the ability to analyze complex information accurately. §          §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development. §          §Clear - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver. §          §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience §        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§        § §        §Special Requirements:§        §          §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§          §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made §          §Successful applicant must reside in the Nelson area. §          §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility.§          §If you are a Constabulary applicant, you must have a current Sergeants CPK and have applied to enter the Sergeants Career Progression Framework, or be a substantive Sergeant, or be fully qualified under a previous promotion scheme. You will also hold currency in PITT, PCT and First Aid certificates.§        §        § §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. §        § §        §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. §        § §        §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. §        § §        §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§        § §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser: §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/prosecutor.pdf§        § §        §About us§        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        § §        §Working Flexibly§        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        § §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §How to apply§        § §        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        § §        §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Lauren.Gennills@police.govt.nz§        § §        §Applications close 5pm, Friday 2nd October 2020§        § §        § §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Police Prosecution Service, it starts with you! § §Nelson§ §Office of Constable/Police Employee§ §Permanent Fulltime§ §Salary range: $77.862,00-by negotiation § § § §About the role§ §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor within their Nelson PPS team. § § § §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§ § § §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§ § § §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§ § § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Communication - Having the skills to effectively communicate with our people, partners and community. § §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions and responses under pressure in a face to face setting§ §Law and Policy - Having a sound understanding of prosecution and court processes, and the ability to analyze complex information accurately. § §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development. § §Clear - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver. § §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience § § § §What you’ll bring§ §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§ § § §Special Requirements:§ §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§ §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made § §Successful applicant must reside in the Nelson area. § §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility.§ §If you are a Constabulary applicant, you must have a current Sergeants CPK and have applied to enter the Sergeants Career Progression Framework, or be a substantive Sergeant, or be fully qualified under a previous promotion scheme. You will also hold currency in PITT, PCT and First Aid certificates.§ § § §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§ §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. § § § §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. § § § §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. § § § §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§ § § §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser: §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/prosecutor.pdf§ § § §About us§ §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. § § § §Working Flexibly§ §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. § § § §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ §How to apply§ § § §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. §Corporate and Commercial Solicitor§ §Due to our continued growth Young Hunter Lawyers is looking to hire a junior-mid level commercial solicitor, preferably with 0-4 years PQE. § §Your role will be varied, giving you a wealth of exposure to clients and transactions.    § §You will be the solicitor working in a high performing team supporting a partner, three consultants, two associates and a team of legal executives.  § §Your growth and development will be fully supported by a firm with a culture of integrity, courage, innovation, excellence, and building relationships. § §Role overview§ §The role will be varied and encompass:§ § §General corporate law (company borrowing / restructuring / company structuring and constitutions / general company transactions);§ §Estate planning (drafting wills / contracting out agreements / enduring powers of attorney)§ §Trusts (new trust formations / variations / restructuring / wind ups and distributions).§ §Commercial leasing (drafting and advising on leases).§ §Business sales / purchases & share sale and purchase agreements.§ §Research and opinion work – on matters such as property matters, estates, relationship property issues.§ PPSR, IPONZ, Landonline;§ § § § § §Benefits include§ § §Excellent remuneration package;§ §Long-term career opportunities;§ §Experienced partners and mentors who are invested in your development;§ jobTitle: Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50650525.txt	§Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Legal Personnel§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§The Restaurant Association of New Zealand is a Not for Profit Organisation serving the hospitality industry. There are over 2,500 members nationwide. The Association prides itself on being the 'bridge' between good food and good business. The purpose is to help our members' cafes or restaurants be successful and great, and to navigate the challenges presented by Covid-19 by providing essential and practical support. In keeping with the industry it serves, the Association is a vibrant, interesting and fun environment to work in.§   § The role has a strong Employment law focus and includes:§ § §advising on a wide range of Employment Law issues, mainly by phone to members, including disciplinary matters, the Holidays Act, and redundancy, restructuring and performance management;§ §responding to personal grievances and representing employers at mediation;§ §negotiating settlement agreements;§ §dealing with matters in the Employment Relations Authority;§ §advising on liquor licencing, leasing and immigration matters.  § § There is also a library of Employment Law and Health and Safety manuals and resources to maintain and the opportunity to write articles and make submissions regarding changes to relevant legislation.§ § Ideally, you will a minimum of 2+ years PQE or relevant experience as a solicitor or human resources professional working with employment law and related areas. You will naturally be outgoing, flexible and open, and easy to interact with. Being a great communicator, especially on the telephone, you will have the ability to build strong relationships with the people who make up this vibrant organisation.§ § The offices are ideally situated on the city fringe with a carpark and the hours will facilitate a great work life balance, with the opportunity to partially work from home.§   § The organisation is open to where you might be coming from.  It might be that you are:§ § §in private practice and looking for a different direction;§ §looking to leave the city and work closer to home;§ §looking to re-enter the workforce after a period out; or§ §you may be in a similar in-house role but looking for a change.§ §   § Whatever your reason for looking to make a move, you won’t be disappointed in what you find here. This is a diverse, interesting and hands on role covering a range of very current employment issues. You have the opportunity to make a real difference and to help a very vibrant sector positioning for the future.  § § If this role sounds like you and the type of opportunity you are looking for then please click on the button to apply, or contact §ally.ashton@legalpersonnel.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657404.txt	§Senior Lawyer | Trusts & Estates§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Lawyer | Trusts & Estates§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§The Opportunity:§ §This role will suit an experienced Solicitor with detailed knowledge around Trusts, Wills and Estates, in particularly having the confidence and capability around the creation of, structuring and reviewing of Trusts. You will need to have strong communication and relationship management skills and the ability to work with a diverse range of Private Clients. §Working for a highly successful and long established firm with a great reputation in the Hamilton & wider Waikato market, you will be working alongside one of their Partners and taking on a variety of challenging and interesting matters requiring in-depth research, interpretation and technical advice. Our client is offering a highly competitive and attractive salary package for this position and understands both the unique skillset this role requires as well as what will be the continued and growing demand within the current market moving forwards - for example, having an understanding of the changes to the Trusts Act would be very advantageous.§You will be joining an established team within the firm itself and coming into an environment that is both supportive and driven. Surrounded by incredible talent this firm manages to maintain the right balance in terms of a positive culture and work/life balance that is welcoming and inclusive whilst still able to demand and deliver to the highest quality.§If such a role is of interest to you, please get in touch for a more detailed discussion around the position itself and the longer term opportunities that would be available within the firm.§ §How to Apply§ §Please call Peter on 021 278 8653 for a fully confidential discussion, or feel free to email § §OR use the APPLY button to directly submit your CV.§ § All communication is kept strictly confidential and not released to the client/hiring manager without first your expressed permission.§ § § §Peter Clark§ §- Fluid Legal§ § §FLUID Recruitment§ § www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657552.txt	§Solicitor 4 - 6 years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor 4 - 6 years PQE§§Advertiser: §Treadwell Gordon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§TREADWELL GORDON § We’re looking for a Solicitor with 4 – 6 years PQE general practice/property experience to join our team based in the Manawatu/Rangitikei.§We believe it’s our people who drive our success through their enthusiasm, capability and passion for great client service. §So, if you’re a lawyer with the required experience and are up for making great things happen, we’d love to hear from you. §Treadwell Gordon (established in 1869) is one of the longest running law firms in New Zealand.  We operate from offices throughout the Central North Island and service a wide variety of clients.  We pride ourselves on being a well-regarded, progressive, full service law firm, who actively embraces new technologies. Our use of technology allows us to offer a flexible working environment. §Working for us you will §§Be surrounded by§ top class lawyers and mentors§Grow §as you are exposed to a variety of legal challenges§Make a difference§ to your clients’ businesses and personal lives§Have use of the §latest legal technology tools§ (including paperless office, voice recognition, software generated workflows, and more)§Get recognised§ for your initiative and drive§Have access to §regular training programmes§Be part of §a fun and supportive team §who enjoy flexible hours and firm-wide social events (on a regular basis) §Enjoy §a great work/life balance §We want to hear from you§Great jobs in law are hard to come by.  If you would like to know more about what we have on offer:§ §Please contact: Kirsten Harper§kirsten@treadgord.co.nz§027 244 6553§ §Treadwell Gordon – people first§ §§§§

You will be responsible for running matters from end to end, representing clients at mediation and appear in the Employment Relations Authority where required.§  § You will be mentored, guided and coached by our supportive and knowledgeable Senior Employment Claims Adviser and Employment Claims Team Leader.§ § You will be part of a close knit, supportive and high performance team with access to practical in-house and external training. Our environment is fast-paced and your ability to manage clients' expectations through difficult times is critical. Your organisation and prioritisation skills are a must for the successful delivery of the high quality service that we offer.§   § §Key accountabilities.§ § §All aspects of case preparation and representation of clients§ §Provision of advice and strategic assistance to clients and internal and external stakeholders§ §Drafting responses to claims and representation of clients at mediation§ §Negotiating settlements and drafting appropriate terms of settlement§ § § § § §The right person will have:§ § §qualifications in law§ §litigation/workplace relations experience highly regarded§ §experience in dealing with employment-related claims, drafting documentation and representing clients at mediation§ §excellent time management skills and ability to prioritise § §ability to work effectively under pressure and be a self-starter§ § § § § § § §Why join Employsure?§ § Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity.§ § The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.§ § With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.§ § §Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661781.txt	§Experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Lawyer to join our Warkworth team in our brand new modern offices. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Wills – drafting and executing/witnessing wills§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal, business and rural clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661942.txt	§Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Hays Talent Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lawyer §      §        §Are you ready to make the move in-house?  Want to join a leading in-house legal team supporting a large and diverse business?  An exciting opportunity has become available for a generalist lawyer in our Legal team based in Auckland. Reporting directly to the Head of Legal, your role will see you supporting all areas of the New Zealand Suncorp Group, which includes the Vero Insurance and Asteron Life brands, as well as our partnerships AA Insurance and AA Money. We are part of Suncorp Group, a Top 20 ASX-listed financial services company with $96 billion in assets, employing over 13,500 people.§We offer a range of benefits such as:§§Competitive salary and discretionary annual bonus§Up to four days of flexible leave in addition to annual leave§Positive, inclusive team environment where we welcome individuality and celebrate diversity§Flexible work arrangements embracing a healthy work/life balance§Discounted medical insurance through Southern Cross§$250 annually towards wellness activities§Ongoing learning and development opportunities, etc.§§This is an exciting time to join a significant player in the changing financial services sector in New Zealand, as we continue to strive for brilliant customer outcomes.  If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply today.§ § § § § § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You will be part of a close-knit team. § §  § §  § §  §Position –Legal and Accounting Executive§  §You will:§  § § § §Assist Teresa in legal transactions including research, preparing documents, and correspondence.§  § §Manage client files and be responsible for meeting deadlines.§  § §Deal with clients from time to time. §  § §Attend to administrative and clerical responsibilities as required.§ § §  § §  §Attributes and Skills Required.§  § § § §Essential: previous experience as a legal secretary or executive. In one or more of the following areas: Conveyancing, Trusts, Wills, Leases, Estates.§ § § § §Good communication skills. Must be able to write succinctly in plain English.§ § § § §Good analytical skills – must be a logical thinker.§ § § § §Must be a team player.§ § § § §Must take initiative and responsibility in self-learning.§ § § § §Must be able to prioritise and meet deadlines. § § § § §Typing and office skills are essential- ability to use Outlook, Word, EXCEL.§ § § § §Reasonable numeracy skills are required. § § § § §Willing to take on challenges. § § § § §References required. Police check will be required. § § §  §Hours of Work§ § §Part time-  3 days a week, with ability to do further hours from time to time.§ §Desirable: willing to deal with client enquiries after hours on a paid basis from time to time.§ §Competitive Pay Rate, depends on experience and qualifications. Any required raining will be provided. §  § §  §Applications close on §22 October 2020§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§
