jobText: TXT/50663280.txt	§Legal Executive/Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Executive/Administrator§§Advertiser: §Innes Dean Tararua Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We have a Fantastic Opportunity for You §to join an established and successful Manawatu law firm.§We are seeking an experienced Legal Executive/Administrator for a full time role within our firm, based in our Pahiatua office.  You will be a positive and friendly person that is well organised and self-motivated. Your existing legal and office skills will be valued and your ongoing development will be encouraged.  While working closely with a Director, you will be part of a friendly, productive, dedicated and hard-working team with a large and varied client base. §This is a busy, full time permanent, position that will require the successful applicant to undertake legal executive work to a high standard and deal directly with our valued clients.  To succeed in this role you must have high personal standards, strong organisational skills and a good work ethic as this is a trusted position.§The role will include Estate and Trust administration, as well as Property, Conveyancing and Commercial/Business work so if you are looking for an interesting, diverse and stimulating position we would love to hear from you.§This position will involve§:§Upholding and displaying the values of the firm at all times;§Adhering to our current document management system;§Assisting with preparation of necessary documents and correspondence for the assigned Director/s;§Assisting in all areas of Property Law;§Assisting with Family Trust creation and administration;§Assisting with collecting client information;§Drafting Wills and Enduring Powers of Attorney;§Assisting with drafting leases and other legal documentation as required;§Completing Landonline transactions including obtaining searches and creating e-dealing transactions;§Managing communications and correspondence ensuring all actions are forwarded to the appropriate individual; §Meeting, developing and managing good relationships with clients; and§Maintaining good relationships within our team.§For this position you will need:§Proven experience as a Legal Executive/Legal Administrator; §Very capable of working on Estates and Trusts autonomously;§Landonline and ADLS experience preferred;§Possess a can-do attitude with a willingness to grow the role;§Attention to detail will be ingrained; §Outstanding client service and the ability to constantly deliver;§Professionalism and integrity;§Strong written and verbal communication skills;§Excellent self-management with the ability to solve problems and achieve deadlines;§Skills to lead and manage others;§The ability to be a constructive and approachable team member;§The ability to build strong and enduring client relationships;§To be able to deal with multiple files efficiently, with excellent attention to detail;§Have excellent time management and prioritisational skills and the ability to delegate;§To have a working knowledge of trust law, estate law, retirement villages law and conveyancing and property law or a willingness to develop knowledge in those areas of law;§To be a motivated self-starter with a positive attitude; and§The ability to be flexible.§How to apply:§If you fulfill the above requirements, we would love to hear from you.  Please submit your CV via the email to §sharyn@innesdean.co.nz§.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. §Our General Manager, Sharyn Royds, will be in contact with you should we be interested in progressing your application.§  §Applications close 23rd October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following legal practice management software do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664451.txt	§Senior Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Hays Talent Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Lawyer §      §        §The Role§        §A recently created role is on offer for a senior corporate lawyer and thought leader to join our sought-after corporate legal team.  We are looking for an experienced corporate lawyer to provide strategic legal advice to all our entities and partnerships on all aspects of corporate law, including M&A (and divestment) activity, corporate advisory, investments, technology and other procurement and partnering. You will be a key advisor and influence on some of our core strategic projects, working with senior business leaders.§        §This exciting role will report directly to the Head of Legal and will involve providing leadership with respect to team initiatives and support operations. A part of the role will also include mentoring other members of the team.§        §Key Responsibilities §        §          §Be a single point of contact for core legal support on large projects and initiatives.§          §Provide legal advice to relevant functional areas to protect the interests of the business that is aligned to the Group strategy.§          §Deliver commercially focussed legal strategies and solutions.§          §Partner with the business to simplify complex legal problems into concepts that can be easily understood.§          §Manage and influence stakeholders to drive excellent business and customer outcomes.§          §Be a mentor for others in the legal team and actively promote a ‘one team’ approach across the Suncorp legal community and lead by example.§          §Champion a continuous improvement mindset.§          §Actively identify areas to improve the operational efficiencies of the Legal team through innovation.§          §Appropriately manage (and minimise) external legal spend.§        §        §Skills & Experience§        §          §Bachelor of Law and current practising certificate is essential§          §Admission as a Solicitor or Barrister in New Zealand§          §8+ years previous relevant corporate legal experience in either a law firm or in-house legal practice§          §Broad corporate advisory experience is highly desirable§          §High level of proficiency in applying the relevant areas of law within the financial service industry is desirable, but not essential§          §Demonstrated commercial acumen and an ability to work autonomously, including with Senior Leaders§          §A strategic and continuous improvement mindset§        §        §Our Benefits§        §          §Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§          §Discounted insurance through Vero, Asteron Life and Southern Cross§          §Flexible working environment and arrangements; jobText: TXT/50665421.txt	§General Practice Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Practice Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Innes Dean Tararua Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We have a Fantastic Opportunity for You §to join an established and successful law firm in the Manawatu.§We are one of the oldest, continuous law firms in the Manawatu, offering legal services in various areas of law, including commercial, property, trusts and estates, relationship property, employment, rural and elder law.  We are looking for a passionate Solicitor to join our Pahiatua team and be part of our future. We offer a friendly and collaborative environment and promote career advancement and work-life balance. §We are looking for an energetic and experienced generalist lawyer with experience across the following areas of law: Family law (PPPR applications, Division of Relationship Property, etc.), Employment Law, Elder Law issues (EPOA’s, Estate & Succession Planning & Will drafting), Trusts, Conveyancing, and Commercial matters.§The ideal candidate will be someone who:§Has an excellent academic record;§Has at least two years’ post-qualification experience (we would consider applications from Graduates who have been admitted to the Bar, and have an exceptional transcript);§Has thorough procedural knowledge and has handled files as part of a team and individually across many areas;§Will demonstrate a pro-active work ethic, a high professional standard, clear communication, and is looking for a practice of equally motivated, client-focused colleagues;§Is willing to relocate to Palmerston North or surrounds;§Is willing to commute between branch offices to deliver legal services;§Is interested in contributing to our local community;§Is a self-starter with proven initiative, common sense and enthusiasm;§Is able to keep calm under pressure and has a strong work ethic;§Is a team player; and§Is very, very organised, with excellent time management skills.§What’s in it for you?§As a practice we are committed to growing and investing in our teams. You will be given ample opportunity to demonstrate your expertise, develop your skills, and learn from the Directors. A progression program that reflects your achievements will ensure you are given room to grow, and you will be supported in developing your client base and personal reputation as a capable, trusted and reliable Solicitor.§How to apply:§If you fulfill the above requirements, and are looking for a great opportunity in the Manawatu region we would love to hear from you.  Please submit your CV via the email to §sharyn@innesdean.co.nz§.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. §Our General Manager, Sharyn Royds, will be in contact with you should we be interested in progressing your application.§Applications close 23rd October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§Which of the following legal practice management software do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50666164.txt	§Senior Trustee - Highbrook location §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Trustee - Highbrook location §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§At Public Trust, caring for people is the lifeblood of our organisation and at the centre of everything we do. Over the last 145 years we've supported thousands of New Zealand families and businesses to look after what is important to them.§We couldn't do this without our awesome customer centre teams, who connect with our customers to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions. If you are empathetic, can build relationships with a wide range of people and are commercially savvy, then you could be the perfect fit for our well-established Highbrook customer centre team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not join us at Public Trust?§About the role§We are seeking a Senior Trustee to join our conveniently located customer centre in Highbrook.§Our Senior Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Associate and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future.§In this varied role, you will support the support the Principal Trustee on more complex files, while coaching and mentoring our Associate Trustees on less complex work. You will work with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide training, however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are integral to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§Several years' experience in a role that has involved providing exceptional customer care in emotionally challenging situations§Experience coaching, mentoring and collaborating with a wider team§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Senior Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them.§By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including; legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection.§We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Sunday 30th August 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

One role will have an initial regulatory focus on supporting the immigration system with its purpose of managing immigration in a way that balances the national interest as determined by Government and the rights of individuals.  The more senior role will have an initial regulatory focus on supporting those working within the Building & Construction system including occupational regulation.§ jobTitle: Pasifika Law Research Fellow Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673834.txt	§Pasifika Law Research Fellow§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pasifika Law Research Fellow§§Advertiser: §Victoria University of Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §Pasifika Law Research Fellow §    §      §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is a global-civic university with our marae at our heart. This iho draws off our heritage and is further defined by our tūrangawaewae, in particular Wellington, Aotearoa, and the Asia-Pacific, all of which are expressed in our position as Aotearoa New Zealand's globally ranked capital city university. §        § Our core ethical values are respect, responsibility, fairness, integrity, and empathy. These core ethical values are demonstrated in our commitment to sustainability, wellbeing, inclusivity, equity, diversity, collegiality, and openness. With, and as, tangata whenua, we value Te Tiriti o Waitangi, rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, kaitiakitanga, whai mātauranga, whanaungatanga, and akoranga.§      §      §        §Faculty of Law§Pipitea§        §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is currently recruiting a Pasifika Law Research Fellow to lead an exciting research project to identify the barriers and interventions for supporting Pacific people to succeed in law school and to take up a career in the legal profession.§        §To identify those interventions, the research project seeks to address the following questions:§        §          §What are the barriers and challenges to entering law school, completing law school, entering the law profession, and achieving and leading within the law profession?§          §What interventions would address the barriers and challenges?§          §What interventions have been trialled and what were the outcomes from these interventions? (Considering interventions specific to equity in legal education and Pasifika in education, as well as more broadly looking at equity interventions in education and internationally).§          §What interventions are recommended and how should these be implemented and tested?§        §        §The Pasifika Law Research Fellow will establish a collaborative research hub as the platform to conduct the first phase of this research.§        §The hub will engage law academics and others interested in Pasifika and the Law to take an interdisciplinary approach to:§        §          §Developing and implementing interventions§          §Evaluating interventions, and§          §Fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§        §        §Whilst based within the Law Faculty at Victoria University of Wellington, the Pasifika Law Research Fellow will establish coordinated action across Aotearoa New Zealand Universities to bring students and practising lawyers together with academics and policymakers to identify barriers, evaluate and implement interventions.§        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §To conduct a literature review of research on the experience of Pacific peoples at law school and in the legal profession§          §To establish an online collaboration hub§          §To build engagement across various stakeholder groups and facilitate multi-disciplinary 'talanoa' (conversations) amongst leaders including policymakers, educators, researchers, students, legal professionals and community groups with an interest in Pasifika from across Aotearoa New Zealand.§          §To draw together the various strands of the talanoa-based research over the 20-month project into a report.§          §Lead and support the Pasifika Law Research Assistant to achieve the aims of the project§          §Managing the budget and workload of the Pasifika Law Research Assistant§        §        §Key requirements:§        §          §A proven track record of building and engaging Pasifika community networks§          §Demonstrated understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)§          §Demonstrate quantitative skills and robustness around research and evaluation methodologies, approaches and outcomes§          §A law degree§          §Ability to build strong working relationships with a variety of stakeholders§          §Capability to work as part of a team as well as having individual responsibilities§        §        §Role Description§        §Contact Details for Vacancy:§ If you have any questions regarding this role please get in touch with Hon Luamanuvao Dame Winnie Laban (§winnie.laban@vuw.ac.nz§). §But applicants should follow all steps listed below.§        §About us§        §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is New Zealand's globally ranked capital city university, focused on engaging with Wellington, New Zealand, and the Asia-Pacific region and connecting with the world. The University values the expertise of its professional staff in supporting and enabling teaching, research and engagement activities.§        §Victoria University of Wellington is an EEO employer and actively seeks to meet its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi. We care about your privacy and personal information. You can review the University's privacy notice or alternatively find out more about working at the University using the links at the top of the current vacancies page.§        §Important - Application steps§        §Download and complete the §University Application Form.§        §Click the Apply Now Button at the base of the advert, follow the process to enter your contact details and add your CV in the online form.§        §Email completed application form to §erecruit@vuw.ac.nz§ along with any further supporting documents stating the reference number and position title from the advert in the subject line.§        § Applications close Saturday, 31 October 2020.§        §Reference 30140.§      §      §Our shared purpose at Wellington's university is research, teaching, and engagement that transforms lives. To find out more about working here and other opportunities, visit §https://www.wgtn.ac.nz/about/careers§ §    §    §  §§§Faculty of Law§Pipitea§Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is currently recruiting a Pasifika Law Research Fellow to lead an exciting research project to identify the barriers and interventions for supporting Pacific people to succeed in law school and to take up a career in the legal profession.§To identify those interventions, the research project seeks to address the following questions:§What are the barriers and challenges to entering law school, completing law school, entering the law profession, and achieving and leading within the law profession?§What interventions would address the barriers and challenges?§What interventions have been trialled and what were the outcomes from these interventions? (Considering interventions specific to equity in legal education and Pasifika in education, as well as more broadly looking at equity interventions in education and internationally).§What interventions are recommended and how should these be implemented and tested?§The Pasifika Law Research Fellow will establish a collaborative research hub as the platform to conduct the first phase of this research.§The hub will engage law academics and others interested in Pasifika and the Law to take an interdisciplinary approach to:§Developing and implementing interventions§Evaluating interventions, and§Fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§Whilst based within the Law Faculty at Victoria University of Wellington, the Pasifika Law Research Fellow will establish coordinated action across Aotearoa New Zealand Universities to bring students and practising lawyers together with academics and policymakers to identify barriers, evaluate and implement interventions.§Key responsibilities:§To conduct a literature review of research on the experience of Pacific peoples at law school and in the legal profession§To establish an online collaboration hub§To build engagement across various stakeholder groups and facilitate multi-disciplinary 'talanoa' (conversations) amongst leaders including policymakers, educators, researchers, students, legal professionals and community groups with an interest in Pasifika from across Aotearoa New Zealand.§To draw together the various strands of the talanoa-based research over the 20-month project into a report.§Lead and support the Pasifika Law Research Assistant to achieve the aims of the project§Managing the budget and workload of the Pasifika Law Research Assistant§Key requirements:§A proven track record of building and engaging Pasifika community networks§Demonstrated understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)§Demonstrate quantitative skills and robustness around research and evaluation methodologies, approaches and outcomes§A law degree§Ability to build strong working relationships with a variety of stakeholders§Capability to work as part of a team as well as having individual responsibilities§Role Description§Contact Details for Vacancy:§ If you have any questions regarding this role please get in touch with Hon Luamanuvao Dame Winnie Laban (§winnie.laban@vuw.ac.nz§). §But applicants should follow all steps listed below.§About us§Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is New Zealand's globally ranked capital city university, focused on engaging with Wellington, New Zealand, and the Asia-Pacific region and connecting with the world. The University values the expertise of its professional staff in supporting and enabling teaching, research and engagement activities.§Victoria University of Wellington is an EEO employer and actively seeks to meet its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi. We care about your privacy and personal information. You can review the University's privacy notice or alternatively find out more about working at the University using the links at the top of the current vacancies page.§Important - Application steps§Download and complete the §University Application Form.§Click the Apply Now Button at the base of the advert, follow the process to enter your contact details and add your CV in the online form.§Email completed application form to §erecruit@vuw.ac.nz§ along with any further supporting documents stating the reference number and position title from the advert in the subject line.§ Applications close Saturday, 31 October 2020.§Reference 30140.§§§§

This includes, but is not limited to, working with Group Managers and their teams to ensure timely and qualitative delivery of information, organising, attending and minuting board meetings, and day to day support to the board of directors.§   § Your other key responsibility will be to design and oversee a programme of work for the implementation of recommendations from the Board, as well as developing a reporting and performance framework for use by internal and external stakeholders, and other strategic projects as they arise.§ §Your responsibilities will be a blend of compliance, Continuous Improvement and project management. Your keen eye for detail and ability to understand complex information will position you to effectively manage compliance and governance. Meanwhile, you will have ample opportunity to showcase your impressive communication, relationship management, organisational and project management skills.§What you need§Some previous experience in governance/law/Board Secretariat is preferred. However, more importantly, are your drive, energy and the following skills and attributes:§ § §Bachelor of Laws or similar qualification, or relevant vocational training§ §Excellent written and oral communication standards, with a clear understanding of managing sensitive and confidential information§ §Impeccable internal and external customer service with a high standard of service delivery§ §High standard of time management skills and an ability to work under pressure§ §High standard of effective relationship building§ § §What's in it for you§You will be working with the Movers and Shakers of the organisation and be privileged to work at a Strategic level. It goes without saying that this is a pivotal and highly visible role, giving you the opportunity to demonstrate your worth and capability and to build relationships across the organisation. This opportunity represents an exceptional platform for you to launch your career in a number of potential areas.§If this opportunity is of interest, please submit your CV by following the link below. If you’d like to find out more and for a confidential discussion please call §Wayne Fry §on 021 656 502 or email waynef@huntercampbell.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50680656.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §Gaze Burt§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§This is a rare opportunity to join a progressive law firm with a reputation for its close-knit team environment.§ §We are looking for a special someone to fill an essential role supporting three of our busy lawyers. This is a busy role with a high level of client contact. You will be managing the workflow of one director, encompassing diary, email, and client management, as well as providing general secretarial support to two other senior practitioners. Our busy solicitors need efficiency, competence, flexibility, and most of all a great attitude from their new secretary.§ §Previous legal administrative experience is desirable, but may not be necessary for an otherwise exceptional candidate. The primary area you are supporting is general practice, encompassing property, wills, estates, and trusts, so familiarity with these areas is an advantage - although again, we welcome new graduates/entry level candidates to apply if they are certain they are capable of stepping into such a busy role.§ §You'll need to be an organisational superstar, as our directors will depend on you to keep everything under control. We need you to diligently work to present our firm in the best way possible.  Taking pride in the service provided is essential, along with having excellent communication skills and ability to relate well to people. You'll need to be quick to pick up new IT systems and already know your way around platforms frequently used in the office environment. The role is full time, Mon-Fri, 8.30-5pm.§ §In return we offer the chance to work in a firm with a supportive environment and a well established culture of valuing staff. Our North Shore office is conveniently located in Albany. The solicitors you will be working for are supportive and truly value the contribution you will bring.§ §If this sounds like the role for you, please apply with your CV and a cover letter explaining how you can bring what we need to this position. Entry level candidates should also submit an academic transcript.§ §You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this position.§§§§

jobTitle: Pasifika Law Research Assistant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681248.txt	§Pasifika Law Research Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pasifika Law Research Assistant§§Advertiser: §Victoria University of Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §Pasifika Law Research Assistant §    §      §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is a global-civic university with our marae at our heart. This iho draws off our heritage and is further defined by our tūrangawaewae, in particular Wellington, Aotearoa, and the Asia-Pacific, all of which are expressed in our position as Aotearoa New Zealand's globally ranked capital city university. §        § Our core ethical values are respect, responsibility, fairness, integrity, and empathy. These core ethical values are demonstrated in our commitment to sustainability, wellbeing, inclusivity, equity, diversity, collegiality, and openness. With, and as, tangata whenua, we value Te Tiriti o Waitangi, rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, kaitiakitanga, whai mātauranga, whanaungatanga, and akoranga.§      §      §        §Faculty of Law§Pipetia §        §          §Fixed-term (0.5FTE, until April 2022)§          §Do you have a demonstrable understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)?§          §Are you a team player who is able to take on and deliver on individual responsibilities?§        §        §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is currently recruiting a Pasifika Law Research Assistant to support an exciting research project to identify the barriers and interventions for supporting Pacific people to succeed in law school and to take up a career in the legal profession.§        §To identify those interventions, the research project seeks to address the following questions:§        §          §What are the barriers and challenges to entering law school, completing law school, entering the law profession, and achieving and leading within the law profession?§          §What interventions would address the barriers and challenges?§          §What interventions have been trialled and what were the outcomes from these interventions? (Considering interventions specific to equity in legal education and Pasifika in education, as well as more broadly looking at equity interventions in education and internationally).§          §What interventions are recommended and how should these be implemented and tested?§        §        §The Pasifika Law Research Assistant will support the establishment of a collaborative research hub as the platform to conduct the first phase of this research. The hub will engage law academics and others interested in Pasifika and the Law to take an interdisciplinary approach to:§        §          §developing and implementing interventions§          §evaluating interventions§          §fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§        §        §Whilst based within the Law Faculty at Victoria University of Wellington, the Pasifika Law Research Assistant will establish coordinated action across Aotearoa New Zealand Universities to bring students and practising lawyers together with academics and policymakers to identify barriers, evaluate and implement interventions.§        §Key responsibilities:§        §          §To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow in conducting a literature review of research on the experience of Pacific peoples at law school and in the legal profession§          §To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow to establish an online collaboration hub§          §To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow in building engagement across various stakeholder groups and facilitate multi-disciplinary 'talanoa' (conversations) amongst leaders including policymakers, educators, researchers, students, legal professionals and community groups with an interest in Pasifika from across Aotearoa New Zealand§          §To provide support to the Pasifika Law Research Fellow as necessary in producing and delivering a report summarising findings of the 20-month project§        §        §Key requirements:§        §          §A proven track record of building and engaging Pasifika community networks§          §Demonstrated understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)§          §A law degree§          §Capability to work as part of a team as well as having individual responsibilities§        §        §Role Description§        §Contact Details for Vacancy:§ If you have any questions regarding this role please get in touch with Hon Luamanuvao Dame Winnie Laban (§Winnie.laban@vuw.ac.nz§)§ but applicants should follow all steps listed below.§        §About us§        §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is New Zealand’s globally ranked capital city university, focused on engaging with Wellington, New Zealand, and the Asia-Pacific region and connecting with the world. The University values the expertise of its professional staff in supporting and enabling teaching, research and engagement activities.§        §Victoria University of Wellington is an EEO employer and actively seeks to meet its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi. We care about your privacy and personal information. You can review the University's privacy notice or alternatively find out more about working at the University using the links at the top of the current vacancies page.§        §Important - Application steps and information§        §Download and complete the §University Application Form.§        §Click apply now button at the base of the advert, follow the process to enter your contact details and add your CV in the online form.§        §Email completed application form to §erecruit@vuw.ac.nz§ along with any further supporting documents stating the reference number and position title from the advert in the subject line.§        § Applications close Saturday, 31 October 2020.§        §Reference 30141.§        § §      §      §Our shared purpose at Wellington's university is research, teaching, and engagement that transforms lives. To find out more about working here and other opportunities, visit §https://www.wgtn.ac.nz/about/careers§ §    §    §  §§§Faculty of Law§Pipetia §Fixed-term (0.5FTE, until April 2022)§Do you have a demonstrable understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)?§Are you a team player who is able to take on and deliver on individual responsibilities?§Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is currently recruiting a Pasifika Law Research Assistant to support an exciting research project to identify the barriers and interventions for supporting Pacific people to succeed in law school and to take up a career in the legal profession.§To identify those interventions, the research project seeks to address the following questions:§What are the barriers and challenges to entering law school, completing law school, entering the law profession, and achieving and leading within the law profession?§What interventions would address the barriers and challenges?§What interventions have been trialled and what were the outcomes from these interventions? (Considering interventions specific to equity in legal education and Pasifika in education, as well as more broadly looking at equity interventions in education and internationally).§What interventions are recommended and how should these be implemented and tested?§The Pasifika Law Research Assistant will support the establishment of a collaborative research hub as the platform to conduct the first phase of this research. The hub will engage law academics and others interested in Pasifika and the Law to take an interdisciplinary approach to:§developing and implementing interventions§evaluating interventions§fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§Whilst based within the Law Faculty at Victoria University of Wellington, the Pasifika Law Research Assistant will establish coordinated action across Aotearoa New Zealand Universities to bring students and practising lawyers together with academics and policymakers to identify barriers, evaluate and implement interventions.§Key responsibilities:§To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow in conducting a literature review of research on the experience of Pacific peoples at law school and in the legal profession§To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow to establish an online collaboration hub§To support the Pasifika Law Research Fellow in building engagement across various stakeholder groups and facilitate multi-disciplinary 'talanoa' (conversations) amongst leaders including policymakers, educators, researchers, students, legal professionals and community groups with an interest in Pasifika from across Aotearoa New Zealand§To provide support to the Pasifika Law Research Fellow as necessary in producing and delivering a report summarising findings of the 20-month project§Key requirements:§A proven track record of building and engaging Pasifika community networks§Demonstrated understanding of Pasifika language(s) and culture(s)§A law degree§Capability to work as part of a team as well as having individual responsibilities§Role Description§Contact Details for Vacancy:§ If you have any questions regarding this role please get in touch with Hon Luamanuvao Dame Winnie Laban (§Winnie.laban@vuw.ac.nz§)§ but applicants should follow all steps listed below.§About us§Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is New Zealand’s globally ranked capital city university, focused on engaging with Wellington, New Zealand, and the Asia-Pacific region and connecting with the world. The University values the expertise of its professional staff in supporting and enabling teaching, research and engagement activities.§Victoria University of Wellington is an EEO employer and actively seeks to meet its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi. We care about your privacy and personal information. You can review the University's privacy notice or alternatively find out more about working at the University using the links at the top of the current vacancies page.§Important - Application steps and information§Download and complete the §University Application Form.§Click apply now button at the base of the advert, follow the process to enter your contact details and add your CV in the online form.§Email completed application form to §erecruit@vuw.ac.nz§ along with any further supporting documents stating the reference number and position title from the advert in the subject line.§ Applications close Saturday, 31 October 2020.§Reference 30141.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50682501.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§MinterEllisonRuddWatts has the largest construction specific team in New Zealand and is recognised internationally as a top ranked (Tier 1) construction practice in the Asia Pacific Legal 500 Directory, with six partners and over 20 staff. Our team covers back and front end construction law - this opportunity is in the back end construction disputes team.§This role offers you the opportunity to work on top notch, complex, high-end construction disputes and litigation, covering project disputes, arbitration, defective buildings and Construction Contracts Act matters, acting for an impressive client list. You will get plenty of client contact and will learn a lot, working alongside New Zealand's best.§We are seeking a bright, capable lawyer with around 2-4 years' experience, ideally in construction and/or property disputes, however general disputes and litigation experience would be considered. We are looking for someone with a solutions-focused, positive attitude, strong drive and interest in construction.  §The team is committed, energetic, and highly-capable. Not only do they achieve excellent results, but they also have a lot of fun along the way - this is a true 'team', in every sense of the word. Bring your sense of humour and collegial approach, and you will thrive in this team.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart. §We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kate Bishop, HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9815§ or §kate.bishop@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence. No applications from agencies please.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The team is responsible for providing guidance and operational advice in relation to housing legislation and the Ministry's corporate business, contracting, complex property and development transactions, privacy and development of policy and legislation.§        §Ideally you'll have some post-graduation work experience, in a legal or related field. This is a varied role that encompasses operational and public law advice, with the opportunity to work on property transactions and/or the development of legislation. You will be responsible for providing high-quality, timely, accurate and practical legal advice in a dynamic context and in a variety of forms, ranging from opinions to oral advice through to training clients.  You will take the lead on some complex assignments and projects while contributing to the team's overall programme of work.§        §About you | Mōu§        §          §Law graduate with previous work experience§          §Completed the Professional Legal Studies Course and holding or entitled to hold a practising certificate§          §Take a calm and considered approach to others and your work§          §Be a clear and concise communicator, both written and verbal§          §Be a team player and comfortable working with a broad range of stakeholders§          §Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§          §Interest in the political decision-making process, and the parliamentary legislative process§        §        § This is an ideal opportunity to build on your legal career and make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders'.§        §Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. The team is responsible for providing guidance and operational advice in relation to housing legislation and the Ministry's corporate business, contracting, complex property and development transactions, privacy and development of policy and legislation.§Ideally you'll have some post-graduation work experience, in a legal or related field. Apply now.§How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§§You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§Applications closes 20 October  2020.§ § §§§§

You will play a key role in coaching and mentoring team members to support overall capability development.  You will also maintain oversight of the branch's current work in the area of public law.§        §About you | Mōu§        §          §Principal level legal expertise in New Zealand public law, with a particular emphasis on legislative development§          §Proven ability to provide sound advice across all levels of the organisation§          §Well-developed written and verbal communication ability which will allow you to convey concise messages and ideas or simplify complex issues suitable to the audience§          §Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills§          §Proven ability to coach and mentor others§          §Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§          §Interest in the political decision-making process, and especially the Parliamentary legislative process.§        §        §This is a unique opportunity to make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders' and help create the expectations, culture and success for the legal team moving forward.§        §Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now!§        §Note; this is a permanent full time position . However flexible arrangements will also be considered.§        §How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§        §Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§        §Applications closes 20 October  2020.§      §    §    §      §      §    §  §§§About us | Mō mātou§We think all Kiwis should have somewhere warm and dry to live, and we want our cities to lead the world in living standards.  This is your opportunity to be part of building a brighter future for Aotearoa.§The Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is here to deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier.  We want to make housing more affordable for people to rent and buy and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.  §About the role | Mō te tūnga§Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor the §Principal Solicitor §will help lead the legal work on the Ministry's busy legislation programme, including implementation of new urban development legislation, residential tenancies reforms and new legislation from the incoming government.  You will also provide operational advice and support to the Ministry's business units.§This is a thought and team leadership role. Drawing on your expertise you will contribute to the management, strategy and business planning for the legal team. You will play a key role in coaching and mentoring team members to support overall capability development.  You will also maintain oversight of the branch's current work in the area of public law.§About you | Mōu§§Principal level legal expertise in New Zealand public law, with a particular emphasis on legislative development§Proven ability to provide sound advice across all levels of the organisation§Well-developed written and verbal communication ability which will allow you to convey concise messages and ideas or simplify complex issues suitable to the audience§Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills§Proven ability to coach and mentor others§Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§Interest in the political decision-making process, and especially the Parliamentary legislative process.§§This is a unique opportunity to make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders' and help create the expectations, culture and success for the legal team moving forward.§Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now!§Note; this is a permanent full time position . However flexible arrangements will also be considered.§How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§§You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§Applications closes 20 October  2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50685776.txt	§Experienced Legal Executive/Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Legal Executive/Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Property Lawyer to join our Kerikeri team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal and business clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2) Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687555.txt	§Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2) §      §        §Intermediate Criminal Defence Lawyer §        §Wellington§        § §        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §We are looking for a PAL 2 Intermediate lawyer, with a speciality in criminal advocacy, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. §        §You will find challenge and satisfaction with the varied caseload, including high profile cases and the opportunity for High Court and Court of Appeal trials and appearances.  You will have colleagues around you who you can learn from and who will support your development to the next level of your career, and a comprehensive professional development programme. The work comes to the PDS via Legal Aid and you will be supported by professional administrators.  §        §This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do. §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  In this role you are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§        § To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and:§        §          §have a PAL 2 approval level and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand§          §have confidence in your ability to develop credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community§          §enjoy sharing legal expertise, exchanging ideas and brainstorming§          §have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people§        §        § §        §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. §        §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is §$79,326 - $102,657§        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Intermediate Criminal Defence Lawyer §§Wellington§ § §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a PAL 2 Intermediate lawyer, with a speciality in criminal advocacy, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. §You will find challenge and satisfaction with the varied caseload, including high profile cases and the opportunity for High Court and Court of Appeal trials and appearances.  You will have colleagues around you who you can learn from and who will support your development to the next level of your career, and a comprehensive professional development programme. The work comes to the PDS via Legal Aid and you will be supported by professional administrators.  §This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do. § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  In this role you are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§ To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and:§§have a PAL 2 approval level and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand§have confidence in your ability to develop credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community§enjoy sharing legal expertise, exchanging ideas and brainstorming§have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is §$79,326 - $102,657§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50687857.txt	§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer §      §        §Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider§        §Wellington§        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §We are looking for a Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts.§        §You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.  §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§        §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and§ Experience§        §To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues.§        §You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.§        §You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people, this is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  §        § §        § §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §        §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is§ $51,849 - $67,098 §        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider§§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts.§You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.  § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and§ Experience§To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues.§You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.§You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people, this is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  § § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is§ $51,849 - $67,098 §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50692512.txt	§Commercial / Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial / Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Are you keen to work for a law firm that offers opportunities for career advancement and learn alongside accomplished business professionals?§ §Our client, Nicholsons Lawyers, is the oldest law firm in Taranaki servicing third generation families and offering a wide range of legal services all carried out with a high level of expertise. With such a long history and unsurpassed local knowledge, it’s fair to say they love the province and its people. Their success is atttributed to the strong core firm value that their people are the most valuable asset. It’s this philosophy that ensures that the whole team work hard to grow and maintain strong relationships with their clients.§ §Is this the opportunity you have been looking for?§ This position is incredibly diverse and interesting. You will be working alongside one of the partners across all aspects of property law managing a residential/commercial/property caseload for individuals and small to medium businesses, advising clients on a wide range of transactions. You will be mentored and trained in trust work involving family, trading and incorporated societies and trusts. In addition to this, you may be actively involved in marketing to clients and prospective clients, undertaking project work, and helping to develop new firm initiatives over time. § §To be seriously considered for this role, you will have:§§A Bachelor of Law and current Practising Certificate from the NZLS with up to date knowledge of NZ law and legislation§3 plus years’ experience as a Property/Commercial/Trust Lawyer§An ability to combine logical, analytical and a great deal of creative thinking skills to problem solving§An attitude of getting things done and recognising that client’s time and money matter§The ability to see the ‘big picture’, consider all implications and give practical common-sense advice that works for all circumstances§To demonstrate that you can work quickly and efficiently without compromising quality§A team philosophy that working together accomplishes so much§The skills to communicate in both written and oral with ease and a natural style§If working in an environment where delivering outstanding service is born from a culture that fosters a ‘one team’ approach appeals, then we would like to hear from you.§ §To obtain a copy of the position description email §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. To speak to the Baker Tilly Staples Rodway Recruitment Team about this role, call us on §06 757 3155§ for a confidential discussion. All applications will need to be submitted online with a copy of your CV and cover letter.§ § §Applications close 4 November 2020§§§§

At ARL we pride ourselves on ‘§making it happen’§ for our clients while providing a supportive and collaborative environment for our colleagues.§ §Our Personal Planning and Business Solutions team has a position available for an experienced lawyer who is looking to advance into the next stage of their career.§ §This is a senior role which requires a minimum of 5+ years of relevant PQE in the areas of trusts, estates, wills and powers of attorney.§ §In addition to the right know-how, you will be ready to take on a leadership role within this team and our organisation. We are looking for someone who will enthusiastically contribute to the culture and vision of ARL Lawyers.§ §You will work alongside an approachable, knowledgeable and supportive Partner within a well-established team.§ §Ideally you will:§ § §Demonstrate expertise across all practice areas of this team§ §Competently manage your own practice to meet competing demands§ §Develop and maintain strong relationships with both co-workers and clients§ §Balance the need to work autonomously while contributing to the smooth running of this team§ §Provide supervision and guidance to junior solicitors§ §We will provide you with:§ § §A modern, family-friendly working environment§ §Ongoing training and development§ §Competitive remuneration§ §A healthy work/life balance§ §Flexible working hours for the right person§ §Opportunities for progression§ §To apply please forward your CV and a covering letter to §bethany.parlane@arl-lawyers.co.nz§ by 26 October 2020. For a confidential chat, Bethany can be contacted on §04 576 1657§.§ §This role requires a current NZ Law Society Practicing Certificate and recent NZ experience.§ §No agencies please.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50692552.txt	§Litigation Project Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Litigation Project Services Manager§§Advertiser: §Simpson Grierson§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Litigation Project Services Manager §      §Simpson Grierson is one of New Zealand’s leading, large law firms. We have an exciting and unique opportunity in our Auckland office for an experienced lawyer, keen to take on a new and varied role. §   § We’re looking for a Litigation technology guru, natural project manager and team player, who’ll  ensure the litigation team is fully up-to-speed with the latest legal developments.  You’ll be motivated to leverage technology to its full capacity in order to provide the best possible legal services to our clients. The scope is unlimited – where could you take this role?§ Working closely with both the Head of Litigation and our Business Transformation and Innovation Director, this role will provide support to our people across the whole litigation department, including:  §        §          §Acting as a single point of contact and project manager for litigation technology across multiple cross-functional teams, communicating requirements and mobilising teams towards delivering effective and innovative solutions for our clients, in large litigation matters.§          §Leading and managing required resources for e-Discovery processes across all offices.§          §Creating and supporting best practices for e-Discovery to ensure consistency and efficiency.§          §Designing and delivering training to lawyers, paralegals and relevant support staff on litigation software applications, technology issues relating to court proceedings and legal issues relating to privilege and discovery.§          §Supporting Simpson Grierson’s growing business transformation and innovation initiatives.§        §   § You’ll be a practising lawyer with 5+ years’ experience in large litigation and/or legal project management. You’ll have a good working knowledge of e-Discovery systems and processes,   including hands-on experience with review tools such as EDT, Relativity and others, plus a strong interest in innovation and developing technologies around legal project management.  The ability to build effective relationships is vital in this role so you’ll be an excellent communicator who loves to work collaboratively and has a keen interest in building and leading a team.  You’ll have strong problem-solving skills, great judgment and a passion for learning.§   § We have an award-winning, inclusive, friendly culture, and  you’ll be well supported to grow with this role and make it your own.   If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.§      §      §Jackie Mulligan§09 977 5104§ §    §    §  §§§Simpson Grierson is one of New Zealand’s leading, large law firms. We have an exciting and unique opportunity in our Auckland office for an experienced lawyer, keen to take on a new and varied role. §   § We’re looking for a Litigation technology guru, natural project manager and team player, who’ll  ensure the litigation team is fully up-to-speed with the latest legal developments.  You’ll be motivated to leverage technology to its full capacity in order to provide the best possible legal services to our clients. The scope is unlimited – where could you take this role?§ Working closely with both the Head of Litigation and our Business Transformation and Innovation Director, this role will provide support to our people across the whole litigation department, including:  § § §Acting as a single point of contact and project manager for litigation technology across multiple cross-functional teams, communicating requirements and mobilising teams towards delivering effective and innovative solutions for our clients, in large litigation matters.§ §Leading and managing required resources for e-Discovery processes across all offices.§ §Creating and supporting best practices for e-Discovery to ensure consistency and efficiency.§ §Designing and delivering training to lawyers, paralegals and relevant support staff on litigation software applications, technology issues relating to court proceedings and legal issues relating to privilege and discovery.§ §Supporting Simpson Grierson’s growing business transformation and innovation initiatives.§ §   § You’ll be a practising lawyer with 5+ years’ experience in large litigation and/or legal project management. You’ll have a good working knowledge of e-Discovery systems and processes,   including hands-on experience with review tools such as EDT, Relativity and others, plus a strong interest in innovation and developing technologies around legal project management.  The ability to build effective relationships is vital in this role so you’ll be an excellent communicator who loves to work collaboratively and has a keen interest in building and leading a team.  You’ll have strong problem-solving skills, great judgment and a passion for learning.§   § We have an award-winning, inclusive, friendly culture, and  you’ll be well supported to grow with this role and make it your own.   If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
