jobText: TXT/50692699.txt	§Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Film Commission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Te Tumu Whakaata Taonga The New Zealand Film Commission (NZFC) is looking to recruit a lawyer with 5+years PQE and proven commercial law experience.  The role will be part-time (24-32 hours a week) but this is negotiable.  The position is based in Wellington.    The role will be fixed term to 23 December 2020 at this stage but could be extended into early 2021.   An immediate start is preferred.§  §What will you bring?§ § §A qualified lawyer with commercial law experience (either in a firm or as in-house counsel)§ §Minimum of 5+ years PQE§ §Must hold current practising certificate or be able to obtain one§ §Proven experience and credibility in engaging with internal and external stakeholders§ §Proven ability to work collaboratively and build strong relationships§ §Ability to work under pressure and prioritise competing demands§ §Desirable§ § §Understanding of and commitment to Tikanga and Kaupapa Māori§ §Experience with entertainment law, ideally film or television financing§ §Experience in the film/screen sector§ §Experience operating in the public sector§ §Te Tumu Whakaata Taonga The New Zealand Film Commission welcomes applications from all applicants who meet the relevant criteria.  We select staff to join our team based on merit and with disregard to any of: gender, race, colour, ethnic or national origins, religious or ethical beliefs, disability, marital or family status, age or sexual orientation. Special needs of applicants will be considered when arranging interviews.§  §How to Apply§  §To apply, please click "Apply Online."   §  §Applications close 5pm 16th October 2020.    However, we reserve the right to start the interview process prior to the application close date.§  §If you have any questions about this role or would like to see a job description please email:  §Virginia.Ng@nzfilm.co.nz§.§  §Applicants must have the right to live and work in New Zealand.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50692939.txt	§Employment Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§negotiable on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§The role:§My client is a commercially focused firm with a diverse range of SME's, start ups and corporates on the books. The partnership insists on providing a pragmatic client partnership model which is well differentiated in the Christchurch market. It is mid sized with a partnership covering more or less a full suite of disciplines. One of the key strengths is the integrity and poularity of its brand, well known both in Christchurch and the surrounding regions.§There is a requirement for someone with some high level employment experience to work alongside the entire partnership to provide specialist consultation to a range of clients. Current circumstances have created a lot of employment related work for all businesses which is forecast to remain bouyant, particularly with an upcoming election and substantial policy changes on the cards. Hence you will add significant value to the firm, which will be duly rewarded in the form of progression, opportunity, exposure and remuneration.§Make no mistake this is a pathway role and the ideal outcome is that you are someone wanting to build on a strong technical base to really take the next career step.§What you will bring:§Client facing skills and personability are a must have§Experience in complex employment matters, including litigation and alternative dispute resolution§A pragmatic approach and sharp commercial acumen§An ambitious, social team orientated outlook will be a good fit§Other skills outside of employment will also be useful - show me what you've done§Benefits:§Top remuneration, comensurate to experience§Genuine pathway opportunities to be discussed§A CV building firm with a great team, superb partners and reputable culture§If the description above piques your interest, please let me know. I would advise getting in touch as soon as you are able as this role is unique in the market currently and will attract interest. I will shortlist and present to the client on an ASAP basis.§To register your interest§Either;§Phone 021 044 3607§Use the APPLY button to send through your CV§ §Eden Brown§Manager FLUID LEGAL§021 044 3607§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50693581.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Bureau Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Senior Legal Counsel §        §          §This Senior Legal Counsel is a key leadership role, responsible as part of the team for ensuring optimum organisational performance and delivery of some exciting service offerings for its members.   Some excellent work has already been done, giving you a brilliant platform to take the organisation on the next step of its journey. §          §Reporting to the CEO, you will work as part of the senior leadership team to lead, plan, direct and co-ordinate the legal, advocacy, membership advisory and risk & compliance functions on behalf of the organisation. You’ll be able to engage external legal counsel for specialist matters when necessary.§          §This is no ordinary in-house legal role!  There is a great deal of variety to keep you interested and challenged. §          §Day to day this includes the usual drafting and reviewing of legal opinions, contracts, risk mitigation and the like. Arguably, the more interesting work will come in the form of preparing and delivering submissions to legal and government bodies in support of industry regulatory change, with submissions to the relevant government ministers and select committees a somewhat common aspect of the role (and with excellent success to date!)§          §You and your team will also provide some advocacy and support for members in the form of advisory services, training, presentations and the like, so your strong interpersonal skills will be well utilised.§          §To be successful in this role you will need:§          §            §Tertiary qualifications in New Zealand Law§            §A specialist understanding of Property Law and solid generalist understanding of Contractual Law and other legislation.§            §Well-developed commercial acumen, great interpersonal skills and the willingness to present to groups including government officials§            §Experience leading a legal function and mentoring others§            §Ideally experience in in-house general counsel roles as part of a senior leadership team§          §          §We are seeking interest from those with at least 8-10+ years general practice experience.  Given the industry sector, property law experience and a strong understanding of the buy/sell relationship is fundamental to your success. §          § In return, you get to work with a great bunch of passionate people, in an organisation that has a very clear strategy and an emphasis on providing product and service innovation. This role could potentially be managed in four days per week if that appeals.§          §Are you ready to make the move to a sector of the market that is still tracking really well post all the challenges that 2020 has thrown up?  Please call Donna Miller | Partner | Bureau | ph 021 680318 or §09 213 0845§ for more information or apply through Seek now.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§This Senior Legal Counsel is a key leadership role, responsible as part of the team for ensuring optimum organisational performance and delivery of some exciting service offerings for its members.   Some excellent work has already been done, giving you a brilliant platform to take the organisation on the next step of its journey. § §Reporting to the CEO, you will work as part of the senior leadership team to lead, plan, direct and co-ordinate the legal, advocacy, membership advisory and risk & compliance functions on behalf of the organisation. You’ll be able to engage external legal counsel for specialist matters when necessary.§ §This is no ordinary in-house legal role!  There is a great deal of variety to keep you interested and challenged. § §Day to day this includes the usual drafting and reviewing of legal opinions, contracts, risk mitigation and the like. Arguably, the more interesting work will come in the form of preparing and delivering submissions to legal and government bodies in support of industry regulatory change, with submissions to the relevant government ministers and select committees a somewhat common aspect of the role (and with excellent success to date!)§ §You and your team will also provide some advocacy and support for members in the form of advisory services, training, presentations and the like, so your strong interpersonal skills will be well utilised.§ §To be successful in this role you will need:§ § §Tertiary qualifications in New Zealand Law§ §A specialist understanding of Property Law and solid generalist understanding of Contractual Law and other legislation.§ §Well-developed commercial acumen, great interpersonal skills and the willingness to present to groups including government officials§ §Experience leading a legal function and mentoring others§ §Ideally experience in in-house general counsel roles as part of a senior leadership team§ §We are seeking interest from those with at least 8-10+ years general practice experience.  Given the industry sector, property law experience and a strong understanding of the buy/sell relationship is fundamental to your success. § § In return, you get to work with a great bunch of passionate people, in an organisation that has a very clear strategy and an emphasis on providing product and service innovation. This role could potentially be managed in four days per week if that appeals.§ §Are you ready to make the move to a sector of the market that is still tracking really well post all the challenges that 2020 has thrown up?  Please call Donna Miller | Partner | Bureau | ph 021 680318 or §09 213 0845§ for more information or apply through Seek now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal counsel?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50694507.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §Bramwell Bate Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Bramwell Bate Lawyers are looking for an experienced legal secretary to join our team of 25 based in Hastings, Hawke’s Bay. This is a great opportunity to be part of a highly regarded law firm with a busy regional practice. We have a diverse client base and act for clients not only in the Bay but throughout NZ and abroad. §  §We are looking for someone who sets high standards for themselves and thrives in a varied role. This full-time role will provide support to three criminal and family lawyers. §  §The right person to join our team will bring with them a background professional services, exceptional administrative skills along with the following:§ § §Positive attitude with a desire to contribute and a team-based approach;§ §Adept at juggling competing demands and priorities;§ §Able to quickly develop a rapport with both colleagues and clients;§ §Experience in preparing court documents, for example, submissions, affidavits, court bundles, applications for bail etc;§ §Competent in Microsoft Office suite with experience in document management systems; and§ §Familiarity with audio transcription.§ §In return, we offer a supportive work environment with the opportunity to develop in the role. Our office is centrally located in Hastings and only 25 minutes from Napier and 5 minutes from Havelock North. Hawke’s Bay has great local restaurants, world-renowned wineries, and an outstanding outdoor lifestyle.§  §If you have the professionalism and skills we are looking for we would love to hear from you. A position description is available on request. There will be opportunities to work within the broader dispute resolution team on a variety of other client matters and so experience outside of relationship property in general litigation would be a bonus.§        §While this role would suit a full-time lawyer, we will consider applications from those seeking more flexible working arrangements and have the technology in place to make this feasible. §        §We would love you to start as soon as possible, but we are realistic enough to accept that for the right person we may need to wait a bit.  We offer an attractive salary package commensurate with your experience. §        §Learn more about the firm here. jobText: TXT/50696491.txt	§Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor §      §        §PDS Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§        §Northern Region§        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §The PDS is looking for an outstanding senior lawyer to step into this new and exciting Senior role. You will have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy a genuine interest in coaching and mentoring and the ability  to  assist  with  the management  of  the  PDS  duty  lawyer  service. Reporting to the Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor you will support them in the achievement of PDS' operational and strategic goals.§        §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. There is flexibility as to where this position is based but must be based at one of the PDS's Northern branches in metropolitan Auckland, §Hamilton or Tauranga.§        §This is a senior position with a wide range of interesting and challenging opportunities to influence and shape an essential Court based service. If you thrive in a challenging environment, are passionate about criminal justice and delivering the best outcomes for our clients would like to make a positive contribution to the development of PDS and private bar criminal lawyers, and value the kind of support and collegiality which can only be offered by New Zealand's largest criminal law practice this could be the role for you! §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §The  Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping all people of New Zealand access justice,  the  PDS  promotes  the  values  of  respect,  integrity,  service  and  the  delivery  of  excellent  service  to  its clients. PDS lawyers are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system§. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated§ §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§        §To be successful in this role you need to be qualified to practise law in New Zealand have current duty lawyer approval, have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy. Have confidence in your ability to inspire, support and empower possess excellent relationship management skills and proven credibility with Judges peers and others in the legal community, have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people have flexibility to travel In return, the PDS offers access to a well designed and embedded national training programme, professional development opportunities and access to a professional supervision programme.§        § §        § §        §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter.§        §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020 and the salary range for the role is §$130,996 - $169,524§§        §If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§PDS Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§Northern Region§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§The PDS is looking for an outstanding senior lawyer to step into this new and exciting Senior role. You will have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy a genuine interest in coaching and mentoring and the ability  to  assist  with  the management  of  the  PDS  duty  lawyer  service. Reporting to the Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor you will support them in the achievement of PDS' operational and strategic goals.§The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. There is flexibility as to where this position is based but must be based at one of the PDS's Northern branches in metropolitan Auckland, §Hamilton or Tauranga.§This is a senior position with a wide range of interesting and challenging opportunities to influence and shape an essential Court based service. If you thrive in a challenging environment, are passionate about criminal justice and delivering the best outcomes for our clients would like to make a positive contribution to the development of PDS and private bar criminal lawyers, and value the kind of support and collegiality which can only be offered by New Zealand's largest criminal law practice this could be the role for you! § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§The  Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping all people of New Zealand access justice,  the  PDS  promotes  the  values  of  respect,  integrity,  service  and  the  delivery  of  excellent  service  to  its clients. PDS lawyers are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system§. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated§ § §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role you need to be qualified to practise law in New Zealand have current duty lawyer approval, have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy. Have confidence in your ability to inspire, support and empower possess excellent relationship management skills and proven credibility with Judges peers and others in the legal community, have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people have flexibility to travel In return, the PDS offers access to a well designed and embedded national training programme, professional development opportunities and access to a professional supervision programme.§ § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020 and the salary range for the role is §$130,996 - $169,524§§If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Senior lawyer – Construction (Transactional/Project Advisory) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696864.txt	§Senior lawyer – Construction (Transactional/Project Advisory)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior lawyer – Construction (Transactional/Project Advisory)§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§MinterEllisonRuddWatts was named the New Zealand Law Firm of the Year by Chambers and Partners again in 2020, and has a top ranked (Tier 1) construction practice. The construction team is also the largest specialised practice in New Zealand, with 6 partners and over 20 legal staff. Our team covers transactional and advisory work (front-end), and dispute and dispute advisory work (back-end), across all sectors in the industry. This opportunity is for a senior role in the front-end team.§The team is at the forefront, advising key industry participants on all aspects of the planning, procurement and tendering, and delivery of major projects and works programs. You will work closely with the partners and an impressive and growing client base including central and local government, listed companies, financial institutions and private business. This role offers you the opportunity to be involved in a lead role in significant transactions being undertaken by the team.§Advising in the private and public sector, you will be expected to lead projects by working directly with the client and its project team and providing expert advice to clients. As the ideal candidate, you will have a background of not less than 5 years' construction experience at a senior level.§The team is committed, energetic, and highly-capable. They work as a team and achieve excellent results. If you are this sort of person, we want to talk to you.§Please don't hesitate to call if you would like further details, or to discuss whether your experience could be the right fit.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart.§We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kiri Sullivan, Senior HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9991§ or §kiri.sullivan@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence.§§§§

Our clients range from start-ups and small to medium enterprises, to publicly-listed multinationals, government, and research institutes across 130 countries.§ §Right now, we're on the lookout for patent professionals with a relevant degree and preferably three to eight years' post-qualification work experience, specialising in physics or mechanical, aeronautical or process engineering through to mechatronics, electrical and electronic engineering. Alternatively, you may be an engineer with some experience, but have decided engineering is not for you and are looking for a change in career and interested in pursuing IP.§ §You'll join an acclaimed firm awarded 'Specialist IP Firm of the Year' in the New Zealand Law Awards, and work alongside people who have received numerous accolades for their work.§ §You'll do interesting work, and learn a great deal as you go, for a wide range of New Zealand and Australian clients across a broad spectrum of technologies and sectors. Many are export-focused. They look to us for assistance in protecting and commercialising their IP in diverse jurisdictions around the globe.§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural Employer of Choice report listing the 25 top-ranking legal organisations in New Zealand in terms of overall employee experience. This report celebrates employers who go beyond industry standards to provide their people with a safe and engaging working environment and showcases firms leading the way with policies and initiatives that engage their staff. We were also a finalist in the 'Employer of Choice' category of the New Zealand Law Awards 2019.§ §If you'd like to work in a supportive environment that places a strong emphasis on work/life balance, career development and professional growth, take this opportunity to join our award-winning team of IP specialists.§ §Please send your CV, covering letter and academic transcript to Sue Quinnell, Chief Human Resources Officer, at §careers@ajpark.com§ §Visit www.ajpark.com/careers for more information.§§§§

jobTitle: Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50699092.txt	§Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE§§Advertiser: §LegalVision ILP Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§Why LegalVision?§ §LegalVision is a market disruptor in the commercial legal services industry. Our innovative business model and custom-built technology allow our lawyers to provide a faster, better quality and more cost-effective client experience. LegalVision is a leader in delivering legal services in Australia and has assisted more than 150,000 businesses. We were recently named an Employer of Choice by Australasian Lawyer, Best NewLaw Firm at the Australian Law Awards in 2019 and fastest growing law firm in APAC by the Financial Times in 2018 and 2020.§ §After experiencing great success in the Australian market, we are excited to broaden our horizons and launch in New Zealand in 2021! If you’re excited to be a part of a growing business that offers challenging work, a start up environment and plenty of work life balance, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!§ §The Opportunity§ §We’re excited to offer the opportunity for an experienced New Zealand qualified Lawyer to join our successful Employment practice area. The team advises clients of all sizes, from startups to listed companies, to help employers anticipate, manage and resolve workplace issues. You will be responsible for assisting New Zealand based businesses with their employment law needs, and providing support to the broader Employment team based in Sydney.§ §This position is ideal for an experienced and enthusiastic employment lawyer who has assisted a broad range of clients. You are able to work autonomously, and require minimal supervision. You are diligent, efficient, and genuinely care about providing an amazing client experience. § §How You’ll Assist our Clients§ §Drafting and advising on employment contracts, contractor agreements and workplace policies.§ §Advising on restraints of trade and enforcement of restraints.§ §Advising on termination of employment entitlements and risk of claims.§ §Advising on and resolving employment disputes, including attendance and appearance in court.§ §Supporting our LVConnect subscription clients on their day to day employment law related needs.§ §The Ideal Candidate§ §Experienced: At least 4 years of experience in a reputable legal environment specialising in employment law (demonstrated experience in acting for employers is a must). Additional experience in corporate law, specifically business structuring, capital raising and M&A is highly valued.§ §Qualified: Holder of a current practising certificate in New Zealand; willing to become admitted in New South Wales, Australia.§ §Startup savvy: Interested in the NewLaw movement, startups and innovation; excited to disrupt BigLaw.§ §Commercial: Has business acumen; is practical, pragmatic and cares about growth.§ §Ambitious: Hungry to learn and grow; excited to build a practice and make their mark on the industry.§ §Attentive: Brilliant attention to detail; nothing ever slips through the cracks.§ §Autonomous: Likes help, but doesn’t need too much of it; owns their work and is capable of working independently; loves responsibility and working directly with clients.§ §Adaptable: Grasps new concepts quickly; goes with the flow; improves every day.§ §Efficient: Prioritises effectively; focuses on what matters; delivers on time.§ §The Perks§ §Fully remote working opportunity - work from anywhere in New Zealand or Australia!§ §No billable hours, and no suits!§ §Competitive salary.§ §Fast-paced startup environment with endless growth opportunities.§ §Annual budget to spend on external learning opportunities.§ §How to Apply§ §If this position sounds like your ideal next move, we’d love to hear from you! Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early to avoid missing out.§ §A note to recruiters: we’re all over this role, so there’s no need for you to get in touch. jobText: TXT/50699221.txt	§Corporate Lawyer - 5+ PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Lawyer - 5+ PQE§§Advertiser: §LegalVision ILP Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§About LegalVision§ §LegalVision is a market disruptor in the commercial legal services industry. Our innovative business model and custom-built technology allow our lawyers to provide a faster, better quality and more cost-effective client experience. LegalVision is a leader in delivering legal services in Australia and has assisted more than 150,000 businesses. We were recently named an Employer of Choice by Australasian Lawyer, Best NewLaw Firm at the Australian Law Awards in 2019 and fastest growing law firm in APAC by the Financial Times in 2018 and 2020.§ §After experiencing great success in the Australian market, we are excited to broaden our horizons and launch in New Zealand in 2021! If you’re excited to be a part of a growing business that offers challenging work, a start up environment and plenty of work life balance, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!§ §The Opportunity§ §We are looking for an experienced New Zealand qualified Corporate Lawyer to join our highly successful corporate practice. You will partner with New Zealand and Australia’s leading startups and venture capital funds on high value deals to meaningfully impact their growth, while simultaneously guiding that of our New Zealand practice. § §Our Australian startup capital raising team is recognised across the industry as one of the country’s leading practices. We advise on hundreds of transactions each year, ranging from Seed rounds to Series C and beyond. Our clients include early stage startups, later stage startups and a variety of investors, including venture capital funds. We are excited to replicate our success in Australia in the New Zealand startup market.§ §This position is ideal for an experienced (5+ PQE) lawyer with broad expertise in corporate law, ideally within a recognised firm or company. You should have experience in effectively managing matters from end to end in a fast paced environment. You are excited about the prospect of growing a practice from scratch, while having the support of your team members based in Australia.§ §The Ideal Candidate§ §Experienced: At least 5 years PQE in a reputable legal environment specialising in corporate law (demonstrated experience in capital raising and M&A is ideal). Additional experience in general commercial contracts and employment law will be highly regarded.§ §Qualified: Holder of a current practising certificate in New Zealand; willing to become admitted in New South Wales, Australia.§ §Startup savvy: Genuinely interested in NewLaw, startups and innovation; excited to disrupt BigLaw.§ §Commercial: Has business acumen; is practical, pragmatic and cares about growth.§ §Ambitious: Hungry to learn and grow; excited to build a practice and make their mark on the industry.§ §Attentive: Brilliant attention to detail; nothing ever slips through the cracks.§ §Autonomous: Likes help, but doesn’t need too much of it; owns their work and is capable of working independently; loves responsibility and working directly with clients.§ §Adaptable: Grasps new concepts quickly; goes with the flow; improves every day.§ §Efficient: Prioritises effectively; focuses on what matters; delivers on time.§ §The Perks§ §Fully remote working opportunity - work from anywhere in New Zealand or Australia!§ §No billable hours, and no suits!§ §Competitive salary.§ §Fast-paced startup environment with endless growth opportunities.§ §Annual budget to spend on external learning opportunities.§ §How to Apply§ §If this opportunity sounds like your ideal next move, we’d love to hear from you! Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early to avoid missing out.§ §A note to recruiters: we’re all over this role, so there’s no need for you to get in touch. LegalVision does not accept unsolicited CVs or responsibility for any fees related to unsolicited CVs. Thanks!§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50700945.txt	§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki (Hawke's Bay)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki (Hawke's Bay)§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki§Permanent, full-time§Hawke's Bay Region§About the role§A legal team supports Oranga Tamariki to achieve the goal of all tamariki being in loving whānau and communities where Oranga Tamariki can be realised. The team is a central part of the business providing strategic advice across all work areas.§We are seeking an experienced Solicitor to join our Legal Services team based in Hawke's Bay. Hawke's Bay offers a relaxed lifestyle with warm and sunny weather, extensive vineyards with internationally recognised local wines, and the unique Art Deco stylings of Napier. The region is home to some of the country's leading secondary schools, and offers an array of gorgeous scenery and vibrant culture, such as the Annual Art Deco Weekend.§You will be involved in providing high quality, solution focused legal advice and advocacy services on the range of operational issues facing Oranga Tamariki. The Solicitor Litigation is responsible for the provision of legal advice and assistance to Oranga Tamariki staff in the Hawke's Bay region, will be accountable for the conduct of litigation in the Family Court and at times in the Youth Court or other Tribunals, and will provide support in the management of legal issues and risk.§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, is the Ministry that supports children and young people in New Zealand. Oranga Tamariki works to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people.§In everything we do, the wellbeing and best interests of children are paramount. The voices of children and young people underpin the design and operation of our services.§What we offer§We offer a dedicated and supportive team, flexible work options and the opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki. Permanent employees of Oranga Tamariki can take advantage of discounted services from Westpac, Southern Cross Health, and vision care.§Skills and experience§To be successful you will have the following:§Been admitted as a Barrister and Solicitor in New Zealand and have (or be eligible for) a practising certificate§Practical experience of ideally two-five years providing advice to clients and in conducting litigation before Courts and Tribunals§A good knowledge of family law and ideally in the care or protection area§Solid understanding of the justice system§Outstanding relationship management skills with the ability to promote the legal services team§Full driver's licence is essential as travel may be required as part of this role​​​​​​​§How to apply§Please apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal.§If you have any questions about role, please contact §Monique.Ciochetto@OT.govt.nz§Applications close on Wednesday, 21 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50709690.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021)§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Customs Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021) §      §        §Do you want to make a positive difference to the protection of New Zealand's border from serious threats including COVID-19, the facilitation of legitimate trade and travel, and the collection of customs and excise revenue on behalf of the Crown? The successful applicant will also be required to pass an initial drug test. The Customs Legal team provides legal advice on policy and legislative development in the border sector, procurement and commercial contracts, OIA and privacy law, information sharing, international arrangements with a focus on trade and travel, litigation and a wide range of operational issues arising under the Customs and Excise Act 2018 and other Acts we enforce at the border.§Working as part of a supportive and engaged legal team that is committed to encouraging career development, you will work to achieve excellent results and enjoy using your initiative, judgement and experience. You will enjoy engaging with the business to deliver results and, where appropriate, mentor less experienced colleagues to support their development in role.§To be successful as Senior Legal Counsel you will:§Be a qualified lawyer with at least 5 years relevant post qualification experience§Have experience working in a government or relevant commercial environment§Lead the provision of high quality legal advice§Achieve results both within a team and independently, showing a high level of initiative and judgement, flexibility and a sense of responsibility§Communicate with influence.§Apply now§To join Customs in any role you must be a §New Zealand citizen or NZ permanent resident§*.§(*) §A New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided continuously in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application;§OR a New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application, but may have been absent from New Zealand for periods of six or more months within the past five years, preferably in one or more of the following countries: either Australia, Canada, UK or the USA. You will be required to provide overseas police certificates for these periods spent outside of New Zealand.§Applicants must have §New Zealand Citizenship§ or have §NZ Permanent Residency§ and be able to obtain and maintain an organisational security clearance. This is a Fixed-term opportunity for 6 months and has flexibility to work from home for a portion of the week if required.§ §We are looking for an efficient and enthusiastic team player who enjoys working to deadlines and being busy – we are a small but lively corporate team with a great work ethic and strong customer focus!§ §Key areas of responsibility include:§Support the Legal Director in providing an customer focussed, in-house legal service to the Laser business in New Zealand§Assist the Laser business in New Zealand to be fully compliant with its franchise obligations and negotiating contracts with its franchisee Members§Review and update lapsed contracts and those needing renewal§Provide legal oversight on Procurement contracts§Assist with negotiations on clauses and build lists for standard acceptable variations§ §We are seeking someone with a genuine Customer Service focus, who has the ability to build valuable interpersonal relationships and resolve conflict smoothly and in a positive manner for all.§ §Preferred skills and experience include:§3-4 years experience in contract law – preferably within a franchise organisation§Excellent drafting skills and problem solving skills§Ability to exercise independent judgment and provide diplomatic challenge§Effective communication skills which are clear, fluent, concise and appropriate and encourages feedback as appropriate§Ability to identify alternative solutions, recognise the impact of those alternatives, and determine solutions, which result in the best outcome§Proficient computer skills – Microsoft Office§ §Applications are open now with the option to begin within short notice – if you are solutions focused, outcome driven, and can demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills, we are looking forward to hearing from you.§§Please apply via the link, or contact Alex for a confidential conversation and more information: §recruitment@lasergroup.co.nz§§§§

We have the largest global reach of any firm in the New Zealand market with unparalleled access not only to lawyers but also support teams. This means the opportunities are endless for our people!§        §Our internationally recognised Tier 1 construction team is involved in most of New Zealand’s largest construction and infrastructure projects, including major transport, building and energy projects, PPPs, and commercial and residential developments.§        §In this role, you will be part of our busy national construction team working with a wide range of clients including construction companies, principals, local authorities and Government agencies, advising clients at every stage of the project from the early procurement stage through to dispute resolution and litigation.§        §If you have:§        §          §4-8 years’ of experience in construction disputes and back-end work§          §developed skills in opinion writing and drafting of pleadings, evidence and submissions (some front-end experience would be an advantage too)§          §deep knowledge of common standard form construction contracts, including NZS3910§          §a working familiarity with the Construction Contracts Act, the adjudication process and arbitration and court processes§          §experience advising on issues involving delay, disruption and prevention§          §work experience which demonstrates your initiative, commitment and drive for excellence§          §a desire to work closely with clients as one of their trusted advisors§          §the ability to contribute within a strong and collaborative team environment§          §an aspiration to consolidate your career as a recognised expert in construction law§        §        §then we are keen to hear from you!§        §In return, we will offer you the opportunity to be part of a dynamic and inclusive team that works in partnership with our clients, where you will get plenty of valuable experience as well as first class mentoring and career development. We are a future focussed firm and that ethos extends to our people too. At Dentons Kensington Swan, we can offer you top quality work matched with an outstanding firm culture. We offer competitive remuneration along with benefits that will make a positive difference to your work/life balance. We welcome applications for this position from candidates seeking flexible working arrangements.§        §To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter. For a confidential discussion about the role, or a copy of the position description, please contact Katy Lloyd on 021 730 632.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms and, following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We are a future focussed firm and that ethos extends to our people too. At Dentons Kensington Swan, we can offer you top quality work matched with an outstanding firm culture. We offer competitive remuneration along with benefits that will make a positive difference to your work/life balance. We welcome applications for this position from candidates seeking flexible working arrangements.§To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter. For a confidential discussion about the role, or a copy of the position description, please contact Katy Lloyd on 021 730 632.§§§§

environments§          §Ability to contribute to advancing the objectives of the Employment Relations Act§          §Accreditation with a professional association such as Resolution Institute or AMINZ Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Lawyer to join our Dargaville team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Wills – drafting and executing/witnessing wills§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal, business and rural clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

      §Good written and oral communication skills with people at all levels within an organisation§          §Confidence to manage mediation processes with employees and employers§          §Ability to earn the confidence and respect of employers, employees, unions, practitioners and other stakeholders§          §Ability to work confidentially and professionally, often in emotionally-charged environments§          §Ability to contribute to advancing the objectives of the Employment Relations Act§          §Accreditation with a professional association such as Resolution Institute or AMINZ is desirable§        §        § §        §Please note this role will require you to travel sometimes quite frequently within New Zealand. § To find out more or apply:§        §Click on the "Apply Now" button to read and download the position description.  Please apply directly online, complete the application form and submit your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§        §Email Monica Chow at §Monica.Chow@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting reference MBIE/1488341 if you have any further questions.§        § §        §Applications close at Sunday 18 October at 8pm§      §    §    §  §§§§Are you an expert in employment relations, with experience or an interest in dispute resolution? §§Do you enjoy helping people resolve their issues, no matter who they are or where they come from? §§Are you unflappable, self-motivated, positive and good with people?§§Do you have experience working with Maori, Pasifika and other cultures?§§Wellington, §Permanent full-time position and/or 6-8 month fixed term position§§ §We're looking for a bright, capable person with significant interest in employment relations to join our high-performing team of mediators on a permanent or fixed term basis§You'll need to be open-minded, engaging and, above all, able to work effectively with people across a range of different cultures and backgrounds. You'll know exactly how to put your great attitude, excellent communication skills and professional know-how to good use to bring about positive results, plus you'll be passionate about working to serve the best interests of clients.§As part of your role you may be required to make recommendations or decisions at the request of parties, and will be dealing with matters ranging from an issue between two work colleagues, contractual disputes, personal grievances, assisting parties with collective bargaining and sometimes quite sensitive matters. It's an important, interesting, varied and challenging job, and no two days will be the same.§Mediators play a critical role under the provisions of the Employment Relations Act, and they're involved in a wide range of employment relations activities - from assisting in the development of good employment relationships in the workplace to prevent disputes arising to helping people resolve employment relationship problems and disputes.§Mediators need to have a flexible attitude as to how the service is delivered, be adept with the use of technology, and have life experience which prepares them well for dealing with people in conflict.§ §Do you have what it takes?§§Experience and understanding of workplaces and employment relations§Experience and understanding of dispute resolution processes§A sound knowledge of New Zealand employment law§Experience working with Maori, Pacific people and other cultures§Good written and oral communication skills with people at all levels within an organisation§Confidence to manage mediation processes with employees and employers§Ability to earn the confidence and respect of employers, employees, unions, practitioners and other stakeholders§Ability to work confidentially and professionally, often in emotionally-charged environments§Ability to contribute to advancing the objectives of the Employment Relations Act§Accreditation with a professional association such as Resolution Institute or AMINZ is desirable§§ §Please note this role will require you to travel sometimes quite frequently within New Zealand. § To find out more or apply:§Click on the "Apply Now" button to read and download the position description.  Please apply directly online, complete the application form and submit your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§Email Monica Chow at §Monica.Chow@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting reference MBIE/1488341 if you have any further questions.§ §Applications close at Sunday 18 October at 8pm§§§§

We are a signatory to the Gender Equality Charter, of the New Zealand Law Society and support a number of local charitable organisations.§About the Role§As part of the Conveyancing Team you will be responsible for:§Completion of residential conveyancing work and associated tasks.§Taking on and running existing client files.§Undertaking business development and networking to continue the Firm’s growth.§Providing exceptional customer service.§Working alongside other team members and providing assistance as required.§A bit about You§You will have proven skills and experience as follows:§A minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in residential conveyancing with a relevant Legal Executive qualification.§Excellent attention to detail.§Ability to prioritise, plan workloads and meet deadlines.§Excellent verbal and written communication skills.§Competency using Microsoft Office and Landonline.§You will be a confident and outgoing person who is proactive, resourceful and can build long lasting relationships within your team, clients and local estate agents and businesses.§If you can meet the requirements for this role and are someone who takes pride and ownership in your work, are flexible and adaptable, and want to be part of an exciting and vibrant team then send your CV and cover letter to §recruitment@crlaw.co.nz§ [link removed]. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50719738.txt	§Litigation Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Litigation Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §    §      §Litigation Solicitor §      §        §Our client§        §Is an established and successful business law firm located in Auckland CBD.  This firm has an excellent reputation for delivering innovative solutions to their established high profile client base.  They pride themselves on being dynamic and progressive whilst providing their employees with balance, flexibility and excellent mentoring.§        §Who you are§        §You are an innovative, confident and business-minded lawyer who strives to provide practical and commercial advice to clients.  You are a team player, but are also confident running your own files and advising clients directly. You have 3-6 years PQE in a reputable commercial law firm as a commercial litigator, and have relevant experience in the practice areas below. You are looking to boost your career, and be rewarded for your contribution. A solid academic transcript is absolutely essential.§        §The Position§        §The role will see you engaged in a broad range of high profile commercial disputes and advisory work, including business and contractual disputes, injunctions, shareholder and partnership disputes, construction disputes and advice, leasing and insolvency matters.§        §What's on offer§        §In return for your skills, you will be provided with a remuneration package which will be commensurate with your experience and contribution.  In addition, the successful applicant will enjoy the benefit of mentorship from a highly regarded commercial Partner and the opportunity for solid career progression and growth.  §        §If you have what it takes to be successful in this role please forward your resume in confidence to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ or call me for a confidential discussion §on §09 375 0145§ or click on 'Apply Now'. §        § §        §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§        § §      §      §Paula Watts§09 3772248§paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §    §  §§§Our client§Is an established and successful business law firm located in Auckland CBD.  This firm has an excellent reputation for delivering innovative solutions to their established high profile client base.  They pride themselves on being dynamic and progressive whilst providing their employees with balance, flexibility and excellent mentoring.§Who you are§You are an innovative, confident and business-minded lawyer who strives to provide practical and commercial advice to clients.  You are a team player, but are also confident running your own files and advising clients directly. You have 3-6 years PQE in a reputable commercial law firm as a commercial litigator, and have relevant experience in the practice areas below. You are looking to boost your career, and be rewarded for your contribution. A solid academic transcript is absolutely essential.§The Position§The role will see you engaged in a broad range of high profile commercial disputes and advisory work, including business and contractual disputes, injunctions, shareholder and partnership disputes, construction disputes and advice, leasing and insolvency matters.§What's on offer§In return for your skills, you will be provided with a remuneration package which will be commensurate with your experience and contribution.  In addition, the successful applicant will enjoy the benefit of mentorship from a highly regarded commercial Partner and the opportunity for solid career progression and growth.  §If you have what it takes to be successful in this role please forward your resume in confidence to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ or call me for a confidential discussion §on §09 375 0145§ or click on 'Apply Now'. § §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§ §§§§

A part of the role will see you acting as counsel for WorkSafe in respect of its litigation activities. In particular, this will involve appearances before the District Court nationwide, including prosecutions.§        §To be successful in this role you will bring:§        §          §litigation experience (ideally including criminal litigation) from within a similar complex regulatory environment§          §experience operating in an in-house legal environment§          §a passion to make a difference in health and safety§          §the ability to build strong internal and external relationships§          §a current practising certificate§          §a level 2 (or higher) Prosecutor's Classification Scheme classification (or the ability to obtain this)§        §        §This role will suit someone who is seeking an opportunity to join a friendly and professional team that supports WorkSafe in achieving its vision of ensuring that everyone who goes to work comes home healthy and safe.§        §Benefits at WorkSafe§        §WorkSafe offers a range of benefits including, discounts on health insurance and eye care, four weeks annual leave plus three days WorkSafe leave, and learning and professional development opportunities.§        §About our Legal Team§        §Our Legal Group has staff based in Auckland and Wellington.  We are a busy in-house team that works collegially, professionally, and to high standards.  This role will suit a lawyer who thrives on variety and challenge, and enjoys working collaboratively with staff across an organisation.§        §About WorkSafe§        §WorkSafe New Zealand, Mahi Haumaru Aotearoa, is the primary workplace health and safety regulator - our vision is that everyone who goes to work comes home healthy and safe.  Alongside other regulators we lead New Zealand to achieve healthy and safe workplaces through engagement, education and enforcement.§        §To apply§, click the link below, complete an application form and attach your CV and a cover letter.  For further information please contact §careers@worksafe.govt.nz§ with any queries.§        §To find out more about WorkSafe New Zealand go to www.worksafe.govt.nz.§        §Applications close on Tuesday 20 October 2020.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Work closely with our investigations team and network across the business§Provide high quality legal advice and act as counsel in litigation activities for WorkSafe§Fixed-term position (until mid-September 2021) - Based in Central Auckland§§Play a significant role in shaping an area of law that directly affects all New Zealanders.§We have an opportunity for a Senior Solicitor with experience in litigation to join our Auckland based Legal Group.§WorkSafe is a Crown Entity responsible for administering and enforcing the Health and Safety at Work Act and other health and safety legislation.  The Legal Group is responsible for providing effective legal services and advice to WorkSafe NZ, including the Chief Executive and the Board. §As Senior Solicitor you will be responsible for providing high quality, timely, accurate and practical legal advice (formal and informal) in a dynamic context. A part of the role will see you acting as counsel for WorkSafe in respect of its litigation activities. In particular, this will involve appearances before the District Court nationwide, including prosecutions.§To be successful in this role you will bring:§§litigation experience (ideally including criminal litigation) from within a similar complex regulatory environment§experience operating in an in-house legal environment§a passion to make a difference in health and safety§the ability to build strong internal and external relationships§a current practising certificate§a level 2 (or higher) Prosecutor's Classification Scheme classification (or the ability to obtain this)§§This role will suit someone who is seeking an opportunity to join a friendly and professional team that supports WorkSafe in achieving its vision of ensuring that everyone who goes to work comes home healthy and safe.§§Benefits at WorkSafe§§WorkSafe offers a range of benefits including, discounts on health insurance and eye care, four weeks annual leave plus three days WorkSafe leave, and learning and professional development opportunities.§§About our Legal Team§§Our Legal Group has staff based in Auckland and Wellington.  We are a busy in-house team that works collegially, professionally, and to high standards.  This role will suit a lawyer who thrives on variety and challenge, and enjoys working collaboratively with staff across an organisation.§About WorkSafe§WorkSafe New Zealand, Mahi Haumaru Aotearoa, is the primary workplace health and safety regulator - our vision is that everyone who goes to work comes home healthy and safe.  Alongside other regulators we lead New Zealand to achieve healthy and safe workplaces through engagement, education and enforcement.§To apply§, click the link below, complete an application form and attach your CV and a cover letter.  For further information please contact §careers@worksafe.govt.nz§ with any queries.§To find out more about WorkSafe New Zealand go to www.worksafe.govt.nz.§§Applications close on Tuesday 20 October 2020.§§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50713401.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor Dispute Resolution§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor Dispute Resolution§§Advertiser: §ARL Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§SOLICITOR / SENIOR SOLICITOR DISPUTE RESOLUTION§ §ARL Lawyers is a well-established firm known for providing excellent service to our Lower Hutt and greater Wellington client base. We are a strong team supported by an experienced Partnership, who are approachable, knowledgeable and thrive on training up great lawyers. We believe in the benefits of a healthy work/life balance. As far as we’re concerned, if our lawyers are regularly working nights and weekends then we haven’t done our job right.§ §We have a position available for a solicitor / senior solicitor in our Dispute Resolution team. Our ideal candidate will have 3+ years PQE in a relevant role. We are looking for someone who can take the lead on matters, but also knows when to seek out consultation. At ARL Lawyers we take a pragmatic, client-focused approach which has earned us our reputation for §“making it happen”§!§ §This role will support a Partner in the provision of civil litigation, mediation and employment services.§ §Ideally you will have:§ § §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Initiative and the ability to think on your feet§ §Strong research experience§ §The ability to confidently advise clients§ §Desire to broaden your existing  advocacy skills with a range of District and High Court matters§ §What we offer:§ § §A modern working environment with a healthy work/life balance§ §Fantastic colleagues who will welcome and support you§ §Ongoing mentorship from highly skilled & approachable senior practitioners§ §Opportunities for career progression§ §Flexible working hours for the right person§ §To apply please forward your CV and a covering letter to §bethany.parlane@arl-lawyers.co.nz§ by 26 October 2020. For a confidential chat please call Bethany on §04 576 1657§.§ §*This role requires a current NZ Law Society Practising Certificate and recent NZ experience.§ §*No recruiters please.§§§§

Then we want you!§ §ARL Lawyers is a well-established firm with a reputation for providing excellent service to our Lower Hutt and greater Wellington client base.§ §This role will support our Dispute Resolution and Family teams, who require a high level of sound and competent support.§ §The successful candidate will assist with a wide range of duties in the areas of civil litigation, employment and relationship property, including:§ § §Preparation of notices of proceeding, interlocutory applications and straight forward affidavits in support§ §Preparation of affidavits of service§ §Collating documentation for discovery§ §Preparation of records of settlement§ §Maintaining and updating civil litigation, employment and relationship property precedents§ §If you have high standards, initiative, excellent client liaison skills, the ability to meet deadlines and an outstanding work ethic, we want to hear from you.§ §What we can offer is a fun and thriving workplace full of supportive colleagues. We love to celebrate each other’s successes and always look for opportunities to acknowledge those who go above and beyond.§ §Ideally the candidate will have a Legal Executive qualification and recent experience in a relevant position, although we will consider applications from less qualified candidates.§ §Please submit your CV together with a cover letter to Bethany Parlane, Practice Manager, §bethany.parlane@arl-lawyers.co.nz§. In your cover letter please outline your experience relevant to this position and let us know why you think you’d be a great fit.§Applications close Monday 26 October 2020, or earlier if a suitable candidate is appointed.§ §*Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §*No recruiters please.§§§§

jobTitle: Litigation/Insolvency Lawyer (2 - 5 Years PQE) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50720397.txt	§Litigation/Insolvency Lawyer (2 - 5 Years PQE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Litigation/Insolvency Lawyer (2 - 5 Years PQE)§§Advertiser: §Norling Law Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Norling Law requires a Litigation and Dispute Resolution Lawyer (with 2 - 5 years PQE) to assist with increased demands in the practice.§Join an industry-leading firm to speed track your career in 2020. Norling Law has been recognised as a winner of Employer of Choice by NZ Lawyer and is a winner of Innovative Firm of the year for 2019 and 2020. More details of our awards and people is here: https://norlinglaw.co.nz/people §Norling Law has various accolades for its high quality of service. §Norling Law is based on the North Shore, Auckland.§Norling Law is a boutique law firm specialising in litigation and dispute resolution with a focus on commercial disputes, including a high volume of shareholder disputes, insolvency and restructuring, debt recovery and security enforcement.§Experience in litigation and/or insolvency would be advantageous. §Norling Law and Brent are routinely featured in the New Zealand Law Awards recognising the depth of experience and service provided by Norling Law.§You will be working directly with Brent Norling who established the practice and is an expert in his field. Brent authors works for both Thomson Reuters and LexisNexis and regularly appears various Courts in New Zealand but frequents the High Court and Court of Appeal. The successful applicant will work with Brent closely.§Very rarely do roles like this get listed. The successful applicant must be able to engage in a fast-growing, new practice and be on the forefront of assisting our clients to achieve a resolution. Norling Law’s fast-paced growth is based on the unrelenting results-focused approach deployed by its experts. The successful candidate must meet these client expectations.§Our clients have high expectations and we routinely meet those expectations.§The successful candidate will have direct client contact and will be motivated to achieve the results expected.§Depending on the successful candidate, they will have file autonomy coupled with expert mentorship.§To assist our clients, it is crucial that the successful candidate will:§Be a quick learner.§Have a very good work ethic.§Can work autonomously as well as within a team.§Be commercially confident to engage directly with clients and to confidently advocate at Court.§Have attention to detail.§Have strong investigative skills and be able to provide sound strategic advice.§Be able to strategically plan and achieve results for our clients.§Have leadership potential.§Have the ability to generate his or her own work from their existing network.§Job responsibilities will include:§Resolving commercial disputes.§Review of matters and provision of advice and representation.§Drafting Court documents at all stages.§Appearances at various Court’s.§Applicants should detail their notable achievements during their legal careers. Applications should also detail their notable lessons during their legal career.§Experience within the area we practice will be advantageous. However, we will consider candidates with reduced PQE/experience and/or the right attitude and ability to hit the ground running.§If this role sounds suitable please apply via Seek.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50737128.txt	§Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Harris Tate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Harris Tate is a boutique Tauranga law firm with a modern outlook and a reputation for providing quality legal services.§ §We have an opportunity for a full time Intermediate Solicitor who is interested in growing their skills and expertise in litigation generally, and Family Law in particular.§ §We can offer the successful applicant a broad range of challenging and interesting work.  You will receive support and mentoring in a busy, collegial and fun work environment where we pride ourselves on providing high quality service to our clients.§ §Based in the sunny Bay of Plenty, this could be a fabulous opportunity for a positive lifestyle change.  Sun, surf, sea and countless outdoor activities make Tauranga an awesome place to work, particularly in a firm that places great emphasis on work life balance. § §Our architecturally designed office is where the magic happens.  As part of a cohesive team you will ultimately enjoy the flexibility to work from home part time (if preferred) and many other incentives.  § §We hope to find someone with the following:§ § §Broad family law experience with 3-5 years PQE§ §Particular experience in care of children and family violence matters§ §Exceptional verbal and written communication skills§ §Proactive and a big-picture problem solver§ §A team player with strong interpersonal skills§ §Confident, driven, independent and passionate about family law§ §Understanding of te reo Māori/tikanga Māori a bonus (but not essential)§ §We welcome applicants from across NZ or those returning from overseas.  Please forward your letter of application and CV to carla@harristate.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50733309.txt	§Legal & Governance Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal & Governance Specialist§§Advertiser: §Nyriad Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Are you an experienced lawyer looking to scale down your hours for greater work/life balance - but still want a role that is stimulating?  Or perhaps you’ve taken some time off to start a family and now looking to rejoin the workforce on a part-time basis? Then this is the role you’ve been waiting for!§  §In this §part-time position, §you will take responsibility for Nyriad’s secretarial requirements, working with a§ well-respected board of directors§ and a §diverse shareholder base§. In particular, you will §coordinate and attend Board meetings, craft minutes, provide governance advice, and ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory requirements. §  §Additionally, you will p§rovide or procure legal advice across a number of areas in the business, including procurement, intellectual property and software licensing, employment, and customer contracts.§ Nyriad works with a number of specialist legal firms, who advise on intellectual property, shareholder matters, capital raising, and general commercial matters. §Working with the CFO, you will take ownership of these relationships to ensure independent legal services are procured when necessary and are fit for purpose.§  §WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL§ § § §Bachelor of Laws or Bachelor of Commerce / Bachelor of Laws Conjoint§  § § §Broad commercial legal experience, including commercial and employment contracts§  § § §A pragmatic and proactive approach to providing legal advice§  § § §Intermediate proficiency in MS Office, Google suite§  § § §Good understanding of legal practices and processes§  § § §Ability to deal with competing priorities§  § §WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU IDEAL§ § § §5+ years PQE§  § § §Admitted to practice in New Zealand§  § § §Experience in a mid-size to large legal practice§  § § §Exposure to company secretarial work§  § § §Interaction with C-Suite executives and board members§  § §The role will initially be for §20-30 hours per week but may require additional hours for board meetings or business requirements. §We can accommodate flexibility as to how that works for you. This will be a §fixed-term role for a minimum of 6 months§.§  §ABOUT NYRIAD§  §Based in Cambridge, New Zealand, we’re a software development company building the next generation data storage systems by unifying the CPU, GPU, NVDIMM & storage media (HDD or Flash), enabling new levels of throughput, data resilience, and security. §  §We offer §market-related packages§, a§ well-supported team§, and an §awesome workspace§. Other perks include §free breakfast daily §and§ access to the local gym!§  §If you have a §love of continuous learning and enjoy a fast-paced startup environment§. This is the place for you!§  §Next steps:§  §If this sounds like you the right challenge for you, apply now! §We'd love to hear from you. §  §At Nyriad we believe in equal opportunities for all. We celebrate and encourage diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.§  § §  § §§§§
