jobText: TXT/50733500.txt	§Associate Trustee §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§What we do takes trust. Every day, people throughout New Zealand trust us to take care of what is important to them. After all, we've been building trust with kiwis for 140 years and counting.§Whether it's assisting someone who's writing their first will, or helping someone with their assets after a loved one has passed away, our Trustees connect with customers to understand their needs and provide the best solutions. So if you're motivated, results driven, empathetic, and resilient, then trust us when we say that it's people like you who we need on our team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust and start your career securing the future of other New Zealanders?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Associate Trustee to join our customer centre in Whangarei.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§Our Trustees do all of this so that customers don't have to worry about it, especially during times when they may be feeling their most vulnerable. After all, we're the organisation that takes care of people, and our staff and customers are at the heart of everything we do.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training. A positive attitude, enjoyment of the challenge of lots of learning, being able to show persistence in what can sometimes be tough circumstances, an ability to problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are essential to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Associate Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them. By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection. We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 28th October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50738445.txt	§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§Advertiser: §Bell Gully§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction §      §Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§        §          §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§          §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§          §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§          §Excellent written skills.§          §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§        § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§        §          §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§          §community support programmes;§          §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§          §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§        § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§ § §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§ §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§ §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§ §Excellent written skills.§ §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§ § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§ § §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§ §community support programmes;§ §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§ §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§ § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. jobTitle: Senior Solicitor - Public and International Law Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: Please note that you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this role.
jobText: TXT/50736640.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Public and International Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Public and International Law§§Advertiser: §Maritime New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Maritime NZ is the national regulatory, compliance and response agency responsible for the safety, security and environmental protection of New Zealand’s seas, rivers, and lakes.§What we do touches the lives of many New Zealanders, as well as international visitors and sea-borne traffic, daily. This is true whether you are a recreational boatie, a commercial operator, a port authority, a seafarer, or a regional council responding to an oil spill. Our maritime environment is vital to New Zealand’s prosperity, security and social wellbeing - providing valuable employment, trade, tourism and recreational opportunities. Our mission is to lead and support the maritime community to take responsibility for ensuring our seas, rivers and lakes are safe, secure and clean, on behalf of all New Zealanders.§Our legal team manages a diverse range of commercial, enforcement, and public law (including international) matters, providing a broad range of legal services to assist MNZ in achieving safe, secure and clean seas including: public law advice on the exercise of statutory functions and powers, international law advice, legal drafting of maritime and marine protection rules, legal opinion work, contract, procurement and property law advice, and conducting and managing litigation.§We are currently looking for a permanent full-time Senior Solicitor to join our public and international law practice, working with closely both the in-house legal team and external legal providers.   Our small team provides specialist support and advice to decision makers within Maritime NZ on a wide range of issues relevant to those operating within Maritime NZ law framework and International conventions. §The role would ideally be based in Wellington, but we would consider applicants based in other locations where Maritime NZ has an office.§To be successful in this role, you will have:§  §A Bachelor of Laws or higher§  §Admission as Barrister and Solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand and a current practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§  §A minimum of 5 years post-admission experience§  §Experience in public administrative law, international law, interpreting legislation and applying common law principles in a public law context§  §Experience in maritime law or transport law would be an advantage§Please apply on-line directly through the §Maritime NZ website§ by going to §Careers with Us§. Here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process§For any other enquiries please contact Jo Attewell on §jo.attewell@maritimenz.govt.nz§. §Applications for this role close on §Tuesday 27th October§.§Please note that you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this role. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §MNZLegal-ServicesPosition-DescriptionSenior-SolicitorOctober-2020.pdf§§§§

jobTitle: Team Manager Legal Services Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50729231.txt	§Team Manager Legal Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Manager Legal Services§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §Team Manager Legal Services §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35006§        §MSD Legal (Wellington based)§        §          §Senior leadership role§          §Develop committed teams of professionals §          §Rewarding and challenging legal work§        §        §About us§        §MSD Legal is proud to be the in-house legal practice of the Ministry of Social Development where we strive to help New Zealanders be safe strong and independent. At MSD Legal we provide our people with the opportunity to thrive and build great careers while doing rewarding and interesting work. With the many practice opportunities we offer, MSD staff can continue to build their careers within MSD Legal however our alumni can be found working in many government departments as lawyers, chief legal advisors and senior leaders outside of legal practice. They can also be found in private practice, statutory appointments and in the judiciary. §        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with Māori, Hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §About the opportunities§        §MSD Legal is seeking to appoint two new Team Managers, one permanent and one fixed term (or secondment) opportunity until October 2021.§        §The Team Managers report directly to the Chief Legal Advisor. They will be responsible for leading the teams working on the legal aspects of the Ministry’s legislative and regulatory programme, its service initiatives, and the Ministry’s partnerships with other government agencies and service providers.§        §The successful candidates will have significant experience in advising senior leaders in public law matters, including the application of the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi. The allocation of specific responsibilities will depend on the successful candidates but a specialist background in legislative reform or government contracting would be advantageous.§        §Strong leadership capability will be required as MSD Legal prioritises the support and development of its staff. As well as leading individual teams the Team Managers will be part of MSD Legal’s leadership group who work together to develop and lead the practice’s strategic direction.§        §The Team Managers will be required to build effective networks with clients, colleagues, and stakeholders. Candidates will need to show evidence of the ability to build strong working relationships.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-organisational-assurance-and-communication/legal/team-manager-legal-services-sep20.docx§        §How to apply§        §If you would like to know more about this role, please send your question to the Executive Assistant to the Chief Legal Advisor, Felicity Wilton (§Felicity.Wilton001@msd.govt.nz§). If you would like a confidential conversation with the Chief Legal Advisor prior to applying Felicity can arrange that. §        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter, and complete the online application form.  Note: your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key accountabilities listed in the position description. All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §Applications close Friday 23 October.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35006§ §MSD Legal (Wellington based)§ § §Senior leadership role§ §Develop committed teams of professionals § §Rewarding and challenging legal work§ §About us§ §MSD Legal is proud to be the in-house legal practice of the Ministry of Social Development where we strive to help New Zealanders be safe strong and independent. At MSD Legal we provide our people with the opportunity to thrive and build great careers while doing rewarding and interesting work. With the many practice opportunities we offer, MSD staff can continue to build their careers within MSD Legal however our alumni can be found working in many government departments as lawyers, chief legal advisors and senior leaders outside of legal practice. They can also be found in private practice, statutory appointments and in the judiciary. § §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with Māori, Hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §About the opportunities§ §MSD Legal is seeking to appoint two new Team Managers, one permanent and one fixed term (or secondment) opportunity until October 2021.§ §The Team Managers report directly to the Chief Legal Advisor. They will be responsible for leading the teams working on the legal aspects of the Ministry’s legislative and regulatory programme, its service initiatives, and the Ministry’s partnerships with other government agencies and service providers.§ §The successful candidates will have significant experience in advising senior leaders in public law matters, including the application of the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi. The allocation of specific responsibilities will depend on the successful candidates but a specialist background in legislative reform or government contracting would be advantageous.§ §Strong leadership capability will be required as MSD Legal prioritises the support and development of its staff. As well as leading individual teams the Team Managers will be part of MSD Legal’s leadership group who work together to develop and lead the practice’s strategic direction.§ §The Team Managers will be required to build effective networks with clients, colleagues, and stakeholders. Candidates will need to show evidence of the ability to build strong working relationships.§ §Position Description§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-organisational-assurance-and-communication/legal/team-manager-legal-services-sep20.docx§ §How to apply§ §If you would like to know more about this role, please send your question to the Executive Assistant to the Chief Legal Advisor, Felicity Wilton (§Felicity.Wilton001@msd.govt.nz§). If you would like a confidential conversation with the Chief Legal Advisor prior to applying Felicity can arrange that. § §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter, and complete the online application form.  Note: your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key accountabilities listed in the position description. All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§ §Applications close Friday 23 October.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50727025.txt	§Labour Inspector (Whangarei)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Labour Inspector (Whangarei)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Labour Inspector (Whangarei) §      §      §      §        §          §Make a difference in the community§          §Ensure fair working conditions for all§          §Permanent opportunity, Whangarei based location§        §        § §        §The goal of MBIE is to create a strong and high performing economy for all New Zealanders. One way we can achieve this is by constantly working to ensure New Zealand employers provide fair and compliant workplaces. The Labour Inspectorate monitors and enforces our minimum employment standards. §        §In this challenging, but rewarding role in the Labour Inspectorate, you will work with a diverse range of people and cultures across a wide variety of industry sectors. You will have the authority and autonomy to make decisions and take actions which affect real changes in workplaces and the working lives of New Zealanders.§        §One day you could be investigating a minimum wage complaint, the next you could be in the field on a worker exploitation case alongside the Police and Immigration New Zealand, or in the office auditing a company as part of a targeted enforcement project. On your days in the office you could be working with your team to come up with new creative approaches. §        § §        §As Labour Inspector, you will be: §        §          §Raising the quality of employment standards and ensuring workplaces treat employees fairly§          §Challenging employer non-compliance§          §Managing your own cases through the Employment Relations Authority and Employment Court§        §        § §        §We are especially interested in hearing from those who have:§        §          §A strong interest in community wellbeing§          §Exceptional people skills with the ability to build relationships with a wide range of people and cultures§          §A strong interest, and/or study towards developing a career, in employment relations§          §Interpreted and applied legislation, completed investigations and written comprehensive reports.§          §A full current drivers licence§          §Great organisational skills and the ability to be self-managing in terms of workload§          §The ability and willingness to problem solve cases with and alongside your colleagues and managers§          §The ability to ask the right questions to quickly obtain the information required from employers and employees§          §Tertiary qualification (desirable) but sound academic record as a minimum§          §Well-developed written and verbal communications skills§          §Demonstrable ability to write reports and make verbal presentations to a high standard§          §Previous experience in an analytical, regulatory or compliance role§        §        § §        §Why work for us?§        §          §You'll have full on-the-job training as well as on-going mentoring opportunities, including being able to complete nationally recognised qualifications in regulatory compliance§          §We'll help you develop your career in this role and beyond§          §We'll give you a great work/life balance§          §You'll work with a strong, supportive and high achieving team§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §To apply for this role, click on the "Apply Now" button. Please apply directly online, complete the application form and submit your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role. §        §For further information on the role please refer to the attached Position Description. If you have any further questions please contact Monica Chow at §monica.chow2@mbie.govt.nz§ referencing MBIE/1485910.§        §Applications close at 5pm, Monday 26th October 2020.§      §    §    §  §§§Make a difference in the community§Ensure fair working conditions for all§Permanent opportunity, Whangarei based location§§ §The goal of MBIE is to create a strong and high performing economy for all New Zealanders. One way we can achieve this is by constantly working to ensure New Zealand employers provide fair and compliant workplaces. The Labour Inspectorate monitors and enforces our minimum employment standards. §In this challenging, but rewarding role in the Labour Inspectorate, you will work with a diverse range of people and cultures across a wide variety of industry sectors. You will have the authority and autonomy to make decisions and take actions which affect real changes in workplaces and the working lives of New Zealanders.§One day you could be investigating a minimum wage complaint, the next you could be in the field on a worker exploitation case alongside the Police and Immigration New Zealand, or in the office auditing a company as part of a targeted enforcement project. On your days in the office you could be working with your team to come up with new creative approaches. § §As Labour Inspector, you will be: §§Raising the quality of employment standards and ensuring workplaces treat employees fairly§Challenging employer non-compliance§Managing your own cases through the Employment Relations Authority and Employment Court§§ §We are especially interested in hearing from those who have:§§A strong interest in community wellbeing§Exceptional people skills with the ability to build relationships with a wide range of people and cultures§A strong interest, and/or study towards developing a career, in employment relations§Interpreted and applied legislation, completed investigations and written comprehensive reports.§A full current drivers licence§Great organisational skills and the ability to be self-managing in terms of workload§The ability and willingness to problem solve cases with and alongside your colleagues and managers§The ability to ask the right questions to quickly obtain the information required from employers and employees§Tertiary qualification (desirable) but sound academic record as a minimum§Well-developed written and verbal communications skills§Demonstrable ability to write reports and make verbal presentations to a high standard§Previous experience in an analytical, regulatory or compliance role§§ §Why work for us?§§You'll have full on-the-job training as well as on-going mentoring opportunities, including being able to complete nationally recognised qualifications in regulatory compliance§We'll help you develop your career in this role and beyond§We'll give you a great work/life balance§You'll work with a strong, supportive and high achieving team§§ §How to apply:§To apply for this role, click on the "Apply Now" button. jobTitle: Legal Secretary Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50738434.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §DLA Piper New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Role: §Legal Secretary§Team: §Secretarial Hub§Location: §Wellington, New Zealand§ § § §Looking for change? It’s already happening.§The whole legal industry is changing. The old establishment is gone, and there’s a new establishment in town. It’s an exciting and dynamic future, which we at DLA Piper are leading.§ §It’s a new business world, with new client needs. Clients want more than legal advice, they want strategic business advisers that cross borders and geographies. They want global insights with local savvy. And so do we.§ §DLA Piper is a firm built for this rapidly globalising world, and we’re looking for people to join us on this mission. We’re looking for people who see the world differently, who listen to clients, and solve their problems, not just give legal advice. Being well read is good, but being able to read the room is great. We’re looking for people to help make business better for our clients.§ § § §Why do you want to work with DLA Piper?§ §•       Access to a global network and resources§ §•       A supportive and collaborative environment§ §•       A diverse and inclusive culture§ § § §The opportunity§ §At DLA Piper, our success depends upon our most important asset - our people. We have an opportunity for a Legal Secretary to join our Wellington team. At DLA Piper we have a unique approach to our legal secretaries' function - the hub. This model allows you to join a team where you will collaboratively provide secretarial support to our fee earners. This means you will work with a wide range of people ensuring you are given interesting work, within a supportive environment.§ §You'll enjoy a busy, fast paced role with varied responsibilities including:§ § §providing general secretarial service to the Wellington office, and nationally as requested;§ §opening and managing new files including client onboarding and client due diligence;§ §preparing legal documents;§ §ensuring clear and concise record keeping and correct filing of tasks and supporting materials;§ §scheduling appointments and managing Partners' and fee earners' diaries and emails;§ §liaising with clients and professionals at all levels and assisting with billing;§ §assisting with organising, and assisting with client functions.§ §This role supports dynamic and progressive leaders in their respective fields. You will bring with you a similar mind-set and help keep things running smoothly, ensuring that we are delivering the best possible service for our clients.§ §Joining this team will provide you with the opportunity to get involved in a variety of high quality and interesting work in a supportive environment.§ § § §About you§ §You will be a skilled legal secretary with experience supporting a team of lawyers within a commercial law firm or have proven experience as a personal assistant within a professional services environment. You will have outstanding organisational skills, understand the inner workings of a professional services environment and enjoy multi-tasking. You will also be well versed using the Microsoft Office suite, practice management and billing systems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential to the success of this role. You will also be experienced in managing a number of different stakeholders, efficiently solve problems and be able to adapt to changing priorities.§ §You will also be a strong team player, proactive in sharing knowledge and encouraging efficiencies within the secretarial team. You will have the skills, knowledge and attributes to work flexibly and autonomously within our fast moving and changing environment. You'll thrive on delivering results to a diverse and challenging client group and be looking to build your career within a leading global law firm.§ §If this role appeals to you and you have a confident, calm and pragmatic approach to your work, then we would like to hear from you.§ § § §A career with DLA Piper§ §At DLA Piper we invest in our people. We offer an environment where personal leadership is strong, and encouragement is the norm. Our supportive and collaborative business support teams are solutions focused and determined to provide an outstanding service to the firm and partnership.§ §A career with DLA Piper New Zealand means being an integral part of this exciting team. We offer you the opportunity to work with quality clients, talented lawyers, and provide stimulating work.§ § § §Keen to find out more?§ §You can learn more about DLA Piper here: https://www.dlapiper.com/en/us/aboutus/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

to work in a beautiful climate.§ §Woodward Chrisp is a well-established firm of 35+ working in spacious offices, with modern technology and excellent support staff.  While we value hard work,  we also make sure all staff have time to enjoy the relaxed Gisborne lifestyle with its sun, surf and social life in the heart of our wine country.  The position and environment are ideally suited to a person who appreciates all that living in a small city has to offer.§ §To apply for this position you must have at least 3 years’ experience in all types of conveyancing, financing and subdivisions, trusts and wills, enduring powers of attorney, estate planning and administration, retirement villages agreements, business sales and purchases and commercial law.  You will be team leader for two junior solicitors (one graduate, one with some experience) and an experienced secretary.  § §What we expect from the ideal candidate§ § §A friendly enthusiastic attitude§ §Ability to get on with a wide range of people§ §Ability to work independently§ §A desire to develop skills in all aspects of law§ §A sense of humour§ §Preference will be given to those with previous legal experience§ §What we offer§ § §A team of friendly people§ §Emphasis on work life balance§ §Ongoing training§ §Great mentoring§ §Competitive salary based on experience§ §A variety of work§ §This is an ideal opportunity for someone looking to move to Gisborne to experience the lifestyle on offer.§ §Please forward your letter and cv to Amanda Matthews (§amanda.m@woodward-chrisp.co.nz§) by 30 October 2020.§ §Please refer to our website https://www.woodward-chrisp.co.nz/about-us/recruitment/ for further details.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Legal and Policy Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: McLaren Associates Ltd - Winner SEEK Small Recruitment Agency of the Year 2019
jobText: TXT/50731434.txt	§Legal and Policy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal and Policy Manager§§Advertiser: §McLaren Associates Ltd - Winner SEEK Small Recruitment Agency of the Year 2019§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Banking & Finance Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Legal and Policy Manager §      §        §The Financial Services Federation (“FSF”) is the industry body representing responsible and ethical finance and leasing providers in New Zealand. The FSF has more than sixty members and affiliates providing first-class financing, leasing, investment, banking and insurance products and services to over 1.5 million New Zealand consumers and businesses. The FSF’s affiliate members include internationally recognised legal and consulting partners.§        § §        §This is an exciting opportunity for a smart, enthusiastic and driven Law, Finance or Public Policy graduate who is seeking to develop and further their skills within in the financial services industry. You’ll be part of an amazing small and close-knit team that works collaboratively to provide quality submissions to government and quality events and communications to its members.  §        § §        §Reporting to the Executive Director, you’ll be responsible for providing analysis, legal and strategic advice and advocacy and will contribute to the development of public policy on issues affecting FSF members, which includes:§        § §        §          §Supporting the Executive Director to prepare submissions on behalf of members to Parliamentary Select Committees and government agencies on proposed legislative change§          §Advocating on behalf of the FSF membership to drive strong relationships and understanding between FSF and its stakeholders§          §Advising the Executive Director and members on relevant industry law changes and issues on a proactive basis§          §Maintaining strong relationships with government, influencers and member representatives§          §Providing regular regulatory updates to members§          §Assisting the wider team with conferences and events management and the development of internal FSF policies and communication plans as required§        §        § §        §To be considered for this role, you’ll have a general understanding of the policy development and legislative process. You’ll be in your element working in a broad and varied position within a small team and will be happy to roll up your sleeves when it's "all hands to the pump".§        § §        §The financial services sector is constantly evolving. Its importance to consumers and the economy generally means that it’s highly regulated, and that regulation is also constantly evolving, so the Legal and Policy Manager is a pivotal role to the FSF.§        § §        §Person Profile§:§        §          §A relevant tertiary qualification in law, banking and finance and/or public policy§          §Experience in or an interest in the financial sector is desirable§          §Outstanding written and oral communication skills§          §Effective relationship building capabilities, ability to relate to people at all levels§          §Strong research and analytical skills§          §A high level of maturity with the ability to problem solve, use initiative and work autonomously§          §Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)§          §Efficient, effective and highly organised§          §A good sense of humour and positive attitude§        §        § §        §Applications close:§ 5.00pm Tuesday 27 October 2020§Applications to:§ Kirsty McLaren via mclaren.co.nz§Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§        § §        §P:§ §04 499 1069§        §W:§ www.mclaren.co.nz§      §    §    §  §§§The Financial Services Federation (“FSF”) is the industry body representing responsible and ethical finance and leasing providers in New Zealand. The FSF has more than sixty members and affiliates providing first-class financing, leasing, investment, banking and insurance products and services to over 1.5 million New Zealand consumers and businesses. The FSF’s affiliate members include internationally recognised legal and consulting partners.§ § § §This is an exciting opportunity for a smart, enthusiastic and driven Law, Finance or Public Policy graduate who is seeking to develop and further their skills within in the financial services industry. You’ll be part of an amazing small and close-knit team that works collaboratively to provide quality submissions to government and quality events and communications to its members.  § § § §Reporting to the Executive Director, you’ll be responsible for providing analysis, legal and strategic advice and advocacy and will contribute to the development of public policy on issues affecting FSF members, which includes:§ § § § §Supporting the Executive Director to prepare submissions on behalf of members to Parliamentary Select Committees and government agencies on proposed legislative change§ §Advocating on behalf of the FSF membership to drive strong relationships and understanding between FSF and its stakeholders§ §Advising the Executive Director and members on relevant industry law changes and issues on a proactive basis§ §Maintaining strong relationships with government, influencers and member representatives§ §Providing regular regulatory updates to members§ §Assisting the wider team with conferences and events management and the development of internal FSF policies and communication plans as required§ § § §To be considered for this role, you’ll have a general understanding of the policy development and legislative process. You’ll be in your element working in a broad and varied position within a small team and will be happy to roll up your sleeves when it's "all hands to the pump".§ § § §The financial services sector is constantly evolving. Its importance to consumers and the economy generally means that it’s highly regulated, and that regulation is also constantly evolving, so the Legal and Policy Manager is a pivotal role to the FSF.§ § § §Person Profile§:§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification in law, banking and finance and/or public policy§ §Experience in or an interest in the financial sector is desirable§ §Outstanding written and oral communication skills§ §Effective relationship building capabilities, ability to relate to people at all levels§ §Strong research and analytical skills§ §A high level of maturity with the ability to problem solve, use initiative and work autonomously§ §Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)§ §Efficient, effective and highly organised§ §A good sense of humour and positive attitude§ § § §Applications close:§ 5.00pm Tuesday 27 October 2020§Applications to:§ Kirsty McLaren via mclaren.co.nz§Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§ § § §P:§ §04 499 1069§ §W:§ www.mclaren.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Solicitor - Enforcement and Compliance Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50730840.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Enforcement and Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Enforcement and Compliance§§Advertiser: §Maritime New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Maritime NZ is the national regulatory, compliance and response agency responsible for the safety, security and environmental protection of New Zealand’s seas, rivers, and lakes.§What we do touches the lives of many New Zealanders, as well as international visitors and sea-borne traffic, daily. This is true whether you are a recreational boatie, a commercial operator, a port authority, a seafarer, or a regional council responding to an oil spill. Our maritime environment is vital to New Zealand’s prosperity, security and social wellbeing - providing valuable employment, trade, tourism and recreational opportunities. Our mission is to lead and support the maritime community to take responsibility for ensuring our seas, rivers and lakes are safe, secure and clean, on behalf of all New Zealanders.§Our legal team manages a diverse range of commercial, enforcement, and public law (including international) matters, providing a broad range of legal services to assist Maritime NZ in achieving safe, secure and clean seas including: public law advice on the exercise of statutory functions and powers, international law advice, legal drafting of maritime and marine protection rules, legal opinion work, contract, procurement and property law advice, and conducting and managing litigation.§We are currently looking for a permanent full-time Senior Solicitor to join our enforcement and compliance practice, working closely with both the in-house legal team and Crown Solicitors to manage litigation and provide advice and support to the compliance teams.§The role would ideally be based in either Wellington, Nelson, Auckland or Christchurch, but we would consider applicants based in other locations where Maritime NZ has an office, please let us know your preference. §To be successful in this role, you will have:§  §A Bachelor of Laws or higher§  §Admission as Barrister and Solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand and a current practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§  §A minimum of 5 years plus post-admission experience§  §Experience in litigation or litigation management, particularly in the public law and/or      prosecution context§  §Experience in maritime law, transport law and health and safety law would be an advantage§Please apply on-line directly through the §Maritime NZ website§ by going to §Careers with Us§. Here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process. §Please indicate on your cover letter your location preference. §For any other enquiries please contact Jo Attewell on §jo.attewell@maritimenz.govt.nz§. §Applications for this role close on Tuesday 27th October.§Please note that you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this role. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §MNZLegal-ServicesPosition-DescriptionSenior-SolicitorOctober-2020.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50728789.txt	§Expressions of Interest: Māori Land Court Judge appointments§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Expressions of Interest: Māori Land Court Judge appointments§§Advertiser: §Te Puni Kokiri§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§On behalf of the Minister for Māori Development, Te Puni Kōkiri seeks expressions of interest for two positions of Judge of the Māori Land Court. The location of the two positions has not yet been decided and will be confirmed as part of this process.§ §Māori Land Court judges exercise the jurisdiction of the Māori Land Court and the Māori Appellate Court, principally under Te Ture Whenua Māori Act 1993. The Māori Land Court is the judicial forum for interaction with owners and interested people about the current and future use, ownership, occupation and management of Māori land. Under the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975, the Chair of the Waitangi Tribunal may also appoint judges to serve as presiding officers for Waitangi Tribunal inquiries.§ §Applicants must have held a practising certificate as a barrister or solicitor for at least seven years. Successful candidates will demonstrate legal excellence, as well as knowledge and understanding of te reo Māori, tikanga Māori and Te Tiriti o §Waitangi§.§ §A Position Description with relevant appointment criteria and an Expression of Interest form are available from Te Puni Kōkiri’s website at www.tpk.nz/mlcjudgeeoi§ §Applicants must submit the Expression of Interest form and a full curriculum vitae to the Chief Executive of Te Puni Kōkiri, PO Box 3943, Wellington 6140 or by emailing §CEoffice@tpk.govt.nz§  by Sunday 8 November.§ §For further information contact Evan Martin by emailing §marte@tpk.govt.nz§.§§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Property Lawyer Job in Wellington - SEEK
experience: Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years
jobText: TXT/50741304.txt	§Commercial Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Our client§Is a well established and highly successful law firm located in Hamilton.  This firm has an excellent reputation for delivering innovative solutions to their long established high profile client base and would rate as one of the best firms in the Waikato.  They pride themselves on being dynamic and progressive whilst providing their employees with flexibility, excellent mentoring and a true career path within the firm.§Who you are§You are an experienced, confident and business-minded lawyer who strives to provide practical commercial advice to clients.  You enjoy being part of a team, but are also confident running your own files and advising clients directly. You have 3-6 years PQE in a reputable commercial law firm as a commercial property solicitor with strong experience across subdivisions, RMA issues and local government matters.  You are looking to boost your career, and be rewarded for your contribution. §The Position§The role will see you engaged in a broad range of property matters including subdivisions, RMA issues, Local government and specialist advice work.  You will report to a dedicated property Director and be involved on a range of commercial work from the wider team.  This firm is a close-knit team that enjoys This firm is a close-knit team that enjoys giving back to the community and developing long-standing client relationships. §What's on offer§In return for your skills, you will be provided with a remuneration package which will be commensurate with your experience and contribution.  In addition, the successful applicant will enjoy the benefit of mentorship from a highly regarded commercial Director and the opportunity for solid career progression and growth.  §If you have what it takes to be successful in this role please forward your resume in confidence to §kerry.orourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ or call me for a confidential discussion §on §04 471 5875§ or click on 'Apply Now'. § §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50740346.txt	§Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate§§Advertiser: §McElroys New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Associate§  § §  §McElroys is looking to recruit a talented associate with 4+ years PQE in litigation to join our close-knit team.§  §About Us§  §McElroys are experts in insurance law, maritime litigation and legal representation helping the New Zealand business community navigate risk and resolve complex litigation.§  §We have been solving problems in insurance and maritime law for over 25 years. In that time we’ve been called upon by both global and national clients to help them navigate risk and resolve a broad range of litigation challenges from leaky buildings to employment and statutory prosecutions.§  §We are proud of our track record, but actually McElroys’ success lies in the values our founding partners established when the firm first opened its doors for business. Attention to detail, going beyond what is required, keeping astride of new approaches and setting new standards have all contributed to a purposeful culture that sets itself apart by consistently delivering results that count. §  §The Role§  §You will work closely with our partners in our civil litigation team, with an opportunity to develop client relationships and hone your advocacy skills.§  §You will be managing civil and insurance disputes, including claims against professionals and directors, and product and public liability claims.§  § §  §Attributes We Are Looking For§  § § § §Collaborative – the ability to work as part of a team and value the contributions of each other§ §Better – to continually strive to reach the highest standard and go beyond what is required§ §Expertise – to constantly challenge your understanding and deepen your knowledge§ §Straightforward – be clear, accurate and direct in ensuring the right course of action is taken§ § §  § §  §If you wish to apply for this position, please email §paul.sullivan@mcelroys.co.nz§  § §  §Applications should include a covering letter detailing relevant experience, CV and academic transcripts.§  § §  §Recruiters – please contact us to discuss terms before submitting CV’s.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

jobTitle: Kaitūhura Kaitohutohu Ture - Investigator - Legal Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
email: or email your up-dated CV and covering letter through to heather@manarecruitment.co.nz
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50727258.txt	§Kaitūhura Kaitohutohu Ture - Investigator - Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitūhura Kaitohutohu Ture - Investigator - Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Mana Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Kaitūhura Kaitohutohu Ture – Investigator/Legal Advisor§ §Join with an organisation that honors its bicultural partnership in all it does and regulates the nursing profession in the interests of public safety.§ § §A law degree and current practising certificate§ §Sound understanding of, or experience in, the New Zealand health sector.§ §Previous experience working in an investigations or complaints environment.§ §The Nursing Council regulates nurses in New Zealand and is governed by the Health Practitioners Competence Assurance Act 2003. Organisational work is varied and is focused on ensuring that New Zealand nurses are competent and fit to practise their profession and assuring the organisation strives to lead health professional regulations. Their values serve to guide and inform best practice in the way they work:§ §Whakahoatanga tikanga rua – §We honour our bicultural partnership§ §Mahi ngātahi ā mana – §We work collaboratively with integrity respecting each other§ §Whai haepapa whai – §We are accountable, effective and efficient§ §Arataki, ako, whakapai ake – §We lead learn and improve§ §Wairua tōkeke hauora – §We set standards to improve health equity§ §An exciting new position has come to market for an investigator/legal advisor to deliver legal advice on matters concerning the fitness to practise of nurses to the Council, Committees, and Nurse Advisors. The position manages a broad framework of responsibilities, with its cornerstone based around leading thorough and impartial investigations that have been referred to a Professional Conduct Committee (PCC) for investigation.  Your role will ensure the investigations of the complaints to the PCC are full, fair and timely and you will be interviewing complainants and witnesses.§ §Providing accurate and accessible information on the disciplinary process to complainants and nurses, it is an expectation that you will provide all supporting documentation relevant to the investigation to the nurse and to the complainant where appropriate.  Responsibilities of the position are broad, ranging from organising expert witnesses to assisting prosecutors, preparing cross-examination of witnesses to gathering evidence and managing all pre-hearing matters.§ §Providing legal advice to the PCC, you will demonstrate a level of comfort dealing with evidence objections and providing guidance on standard of proof, evidence and the decision-making process.  Ensuring decisions are considered, well-reasoned and proportionate in drafting the written determination, you will draw on your past knowledge and experience instructing and assisting prosecutors, keeping abreast of relevant court proceedings such as appeals and procedural changes, and providing ongoing reports, advice and context to the wider group.§ §Ensuring the Council’s legislative compliance by reviewing and overseeing risk management, you will ensure awareness of and compliance with relevant legislation.  Providing advice to the CE/Registrar and the Council on general legal matters affecting the Council, you will be tasked with ensuring compliance with all legal requirements.§ §Qualifications, experience and skills required are to include;§ § §A legal qualification and a current practising certificate.§ §A solid understanding of, or experience in, the New Zealand health and disability sector.§ §Significant understanding of an investigations or complaints environment.§ §Experience working in a legal advisory role with strong litigation exposure.§ §A sound understanding of the social, cultural and religious values of different cultural groups.§ §A working knowledge and understanding of Te Reo me ona tikanga Māori.§ §The prior demonstration of the application of Treaty of Waitangi within a legal/corporate environment.§ §With the self-confidence to represent the Council as required, you will have a level of comfort which will see you aptly informing the nursing community and public on issues and law relating to disciplinary and fitness to practise functions.  Actively engaging with the Nursing Council’s responsiveness to Māori work plan, you will set about developing long-term and meaningful relationships with Māori that provides honour and respect to those who engage with you.   Alongside your empathetic and culturally aligned approach, you will feel comfortable following tikanga and applying tika, pona, aroha in your interactions with whānau groups and key stakeholders.§ §Working collaboratively and remotely with a small but passionate group of people, to achieve project goals, you will offer a demonstrated flexibility and willingness to assist others, whilst staying on track and delivering to milestones.  There will be national travel required in this position so a full, clean driver’s licence is required.§ §This role is positioned for a dynamic legal professional who is seeking a broader challenge and working within a supportive, well informed team who share a passion to make a valued contribution.  Through your combined professional and cultural expertise; you will be adding significant value as you act as the conduit, supporting the majority of parties toward a shared and mutually agreed outcome.§ §To apply, or to enquire further in confidence call or email please contact Heather Walker for a confidential conversation now on §(09) 632 1108§ or email your up-dated CV and covering letter through to heather@manarecruitment.co.nz§ §Applications close: Monday the 2nd of November 2020 at 5.00pm. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50726494.txt	§Associate Trustee - Lower Hutt location §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee - Lower Hutt location §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§What we do takes trust. Every day, people throughout New Zealand trust us to take care of what is important to them. After all, we've been building trust with kiwis for 140 years and counting.§Whether it's assisting someone who's writing their first will, or helping someone with their assets after a loved one has passed away, our Trustees connect with customers to understand their needs and provide the best solutions. So if you're motivated, results driven, empathetic, and resilient, then trust us when we say that it's people like you who we need on our team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust and start your career securing the future of other New Zealanders?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Associate Trustee to join our customer centre located in Lower Hutt.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§Our Trustees do all of this so that customers don't have to worry about it, especially during times when they may be feeling their most vulnerable. After all, we're the organisation that takes care of people, and our staff and customers are at the heart of everything we do.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training. A positive attitude, enjoyment of the challenge of lots of learning, being able to show persistence in what can sometimes be tough circumstances, an ability to problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are essential to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience in a corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Associate Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them. By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection. We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Monday 26th October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Ideally you will have experience in commercial leasing and property development, and property refinancing.§ §We want someone who:§ § §is capable, but just as importantly, will be proactive§ §has a natural commercial awareness and aptitude§ §has excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §In return we can offer a number of opportunities to:§ § §work closely with our partners who work with an accessible, open door policy§ §receive multiple levels of support from peers, colleagues, partners and professionals§ §deal with interesting work and a wide range of different clients§ §access ongoing training and development§ §be immersed in our fantastic culture, something that we're very proud of§ §be exposed to great professional support networks§ §With stunning modern offices just a short walk from Hagley Park, working alongside a talented team of lawyers - this is the perfect opportunity to advance your career in a supportive environment.§ §To apply please email your CV, cover letter and academic transcript to §careers@duncancotterill.com§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50740755.txt	§Senior Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Lawyer§§Advertiser: §DG LAW LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Senior Lawyer – Trust / Property / Business Role§ §We are looking for a Senior Lawyer with a minimum of 5 years' PQE to join our team.  This role is to ease the workload of a Director who is moving towards retirement.§ §This is a great opportunity for an ambitious and dynamic person with a sound understanding of Trusts, Property and Business.  The ability to supervise Estate work undertaken by another team member would be beneficial.§ §Key attributes required for this role: § § §Have experience in dealing with clients and able to manage your own files with minimum supervision.§ §Relate well to clients and referrers.§ §Have good time management, interpersonal skills, attention to detail and operate in a collaborative team environment.§ §Be able to work in a Paperlite office and manage an electronic file using Infinity Software.§ §We offer: § § §An innovative firm with a great team environment. § §An opportunity to be part of one of the Eastern Suburbs' largest legal practices.§ §Market salary, team monthly and annual bonus schemes. § §Excellent established precedents, systems and technology. § §Free parking and iPhone.§ §The excellent training, conferences and benefits that are available to members of NZ LAW legal firms.§ §Please email your resume and covering letter to our Practice Manager, Brandon Tam brandont@dglaw.co.nz or Director, Kelly McCullough kellym@dglaw.co.nz.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

People are often surprised by the scale and complexity of the client base served by firms in this region. If you can get in with an established brand and importantly under the tope few partners in the region, it can be a genuine career move.§ § § §About the role§ § § §This is a genuine commercial role with a client facing focus rather than just compliance and transactional work. Within limits it can be tailored to your skillset and ambition. The partnership are definitely open to a mid-senior level solicitor coming in with a strong set of goals.§ §Upon inquiry I will need you to demonstrate your ability to service the full commercial scope of needs from property and S&P through to structuring and M&A etc.§ §The client base is mostly SME with a few larger nationals, internationals and high wealth individuals.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Salary is completely negotiable. It will depend on your expectations, skills, existing client base and experience.§ §Over and above the firm offers a full-suite benefits package including insurance, carparks and social/wellbeing perks.§ §Being a regional firm, work/life balance is a top priority and actively modelled throughout the ranks. No one is interested in slogging you for 70 hours a week. Get out there and enjoy the lifestyle location!§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §A desire to help to build the firm long term§Business S&P and structural agreements§Ability to supervise residential and commercial property transactions§Client facing commercial advisory track record§Some employment, relationship property and general practice experience ideal but not §Excellent references are a must have§ §Please either give me a call, send me an email or submit your application directly. Tentative inquiries to learn more are welcomed.§ §Eden Brown - Manager - Fluid Legal§eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§021 044 3607§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd.
