jobText: TXT/50736701.txt	§Commercial Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §    §      §Commercial Property Lawyer §      §        §Our client§        §Is a well established and highly successful law firm located in Hamilton.  This firm has an excellent reputation for delivering innovative solutions to their long established high profile client base and would rate as one of the best firms in the Waikato.  They pride themselves on being dynamic and progressive whilst providing their employees with flexibility, excellent mentoring and a true career path within the firm.§        §Who you are§        §You are an experienced, confident and business-minded lawyer who strives to provide practical commercial advice to clients.  You enjoy being part of a team, but are also confident running your own files and advising clients directly. You have 3-6 years PQE in a reputable commercial law firm as a commercial property solicitor with strong experience across subdivisions, RMA issues and local government matters.  You are looking to boost your career, and be rewarded for your contribution. §        §The Position§        §The role will see you engaged in a broad range of property matters including subdivisions, RMA issues, Local government and specialist advice work.  You will report to a dedicated property Director and be involved on a range of commercial work from the wider team.  This firm is a close-knit team that enjoys supporting the community and developing long-standing client relationships.§        §What's on offer§        §In return for your skills, you will be provided with a remuneration package which will be commensurate with your experience and contribution.  In addition, the successful applicant will enjoy the benefit of mentorship from a highly regarded commercial Director and the opportunity for solid career progression and growth.  §        §If you have what it takes to be successful in this role please forward your resume in confidence to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ or call me for a confidential discussion §on §09 375 0145§ or click on 'Apply Now'. §        § §        §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§      §      §Paula Watts§09 3772248§paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §    §  §§§Our client§Is a well established and highly successful law firm located in Hamilton.  This firm has an excellent reputation for delivering innovative solutions to their long established high profile client base and would rate as one of the best firms in the Waikato.  They pride themselves on being dynamic and progressive whilst providing their employees with flexibility, excellent mentoring and a true career path within the firm.§Who you are§You are an experienced, confident and business-minded lawyer who strives to provide practical commercial advice to clients.  You enjoy being part of a team, but are also confident running your own files and advising clients directly. You have 3-6 years PQE in a reputable commercial law firm as a commercial property solicitor with strong experience across subdivisions, RMA issues and local government matters.  You are looking to boost your career, and be rewarded for your contribution. §The Position§The role will see you engaged in a broad range of property matters including subdivisions, RMA issues, Local government and specialist advice work.  You will report to a dedicated property Director and be involved on a range of commercial work from the wider team.  This firm is a close-knit team that enjoys supporting the community and developing long-standing client relationships.§What's on offer§In return for your skills, you will be provided with a remuneration package which will be commensurate with your experience and contribution.  In addition, the successful applicant will enjoy the benefit of mentorship from a highly regarded commercial Director and the opportunity for solid career progression and growth.  §If you have what it takes to be successful in this role please forward your resume in confidence to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ or call me for a confidential discussion §on §09 375 0145§ or click on 'Apply Now'. § §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§§§§

They need someone to come in for at least six  months, with a good chance of that being extended or potentially made permanent. §        §The Role:§        §The company is looking for a senior corporate commercial lawyer, preferably with some prior in-house experience in insurance or financial services, to work across commercial contracts, procurement, corporate governance, regulatory, risk and compliance  Working as senior counsel in a small close knit team reporting to the General Counsel, in  this newly created role you will establish and build on key relationships with people across the business and will have proven communication and relationship skills allowing you to engage with and build strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.  §        §About You:§        §You'll need to:§        §          §Have at least six or more years’ post qualification experience in corporate commercial law,§          §Ideally a mix private practice and in-house experience in legal team in a corporate entity here or offshore.  §          §Have strong communication and relationship skills and a good sense of humour.§          §Be admitted in New Zealand.§          §Be a self-motivated senior lawyer who is able to work well, both individually and collaboratively  on key initiatives and projects.§        §        §Benefits:§        §In return you'll be well remunerated in terms of both a very competitive market rate base salary along with additional incentives and other benefits. Working closely with management team, you will be able to make a significant difference through helping to set the strategic direction of the business.§        §Next Steps:§        §If you would be interested in having a totally confidential no obligation chat about this role or your legal career more generally then call Mark on §(09) 300 6876§ quoting reference AA002723 §      §      §      §      §    §    §Convergence Partners is a highly experienced team offering Search & Selection for Permanent Appointments & Executive Contracting roles across the areas of: Finance, Legal & Risk; Technology, Transformation & Change; Sales & Marketing; Supply Chain, Operations & Procurement | §convergencepartners.co.nz§  §§§The Company:§ §This company is a leading New Zealand insurance company.  They are a well-regarded market leader in their industry sector and they have a reputation for being innovative and cutting edge in terms of the way they conduct business and the products they provide. They need someone to come in for at least six  months, with a good chance of that being extended or potentially made permanent. § §The Role:§ §The company is looking for a senior corporate commercial lawyer, preferably with some prior in-house experience in insurance or financial services, to work across commercial contracts, procurement, corporate governance, regulatory, risk and compliance  Working as senior counsel in a small close knit team reporting to the General Counsel, in  this newly created role you will establish and build on key relationships with people across the business and will have proven communication and relationship skills allowing you to engage with and build strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.  § §About You:§ §You'll need to:§ § §Have at least six or more years’ post qualification experience in corporate commercial law,§ §Ideally a mix private practice and in-house experience in legal team in a corporate entity here or offshore.  § §Have strong communication and relationship skills and a good sense of humour.§ §Be admitted in New Zealand.§ §Be a self-motivated senior lawyer who is able to work well, both individually and collaboratively  on key initiatives and projects.§ §Benefits:§ §In return you'll be well remunerated in terms of both a very competitive market rate base salary along with additional incentives and other benefits. Working closely with management team, you will be able to make a significant difference through helping to set the strategic direction of the business.§ §Next Steps:§ §If you would be interested in having a totally confidential no obligation chat about this role or your legal career more generally then call Mark on §(09) 300 6876§ quoting reference AA002723 §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal counsel?§§§

Remuneration will be negotiated as to experience.§  § §  §To apply for this position please email your CV and covering letter to Clare Campbell at §clare@huckerlaw.com§ or phone §09 368 1810§ for further information. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§§§

jobTitle: Governance Counsel Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50756984.txt	§Governance Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Governance Counsel§§Advertiser: §Southern Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Southern Cross is a group of businesses united by a not-for-profit ethos, which together give care and attention to over a million New Zealanders. Southern Cross was established in 1961, introducing health insurance to New Zealanders and laying the foundations for one of the nations most enduring, best known and trusted brands.§ §Sixty years later, Southern Cross helps more Kiwis than ever to look after their health and wellbeing. We support them and their families whether they’re at home in New Zealand or travelling abroad.§ §The Southern Cross group has evolved and this role will support our diverse range of health and financial services including Southern Cross Health Insurance, Southern Cross Hospitals, Southern Cross Rehabilitation, Southern Cross Health Trust, Southern Cross Travel Insurance and Southern Cross Pet Insurance.§ §This is a full time role working 40 hours per week in our corporate office, located in the CBD of Auckland.§ §What we’re searching for:§ § §Minimum of 5 years’ PQE§ §Corporate governance experience§ §Knowledge and experience in the health, health insurance or the financial services sectors (preferred)§ §Experience in managing a portfolio of concurrent projects, with an ability to respond to deadlines in a prioritised manner§ §Relevant tertiary qualification in law (or equivalent) and relevant company secretariat experience§ §Working knowledge of relevant government legislation§ §What we can offer you:§ § §Competitive remuneration packages§ §Subsidised health insurance§ §Situated in the CBD, close to Britomart and ferry transport hubs§ §If you would like to contribute to this evolution of services we offer, make the change you have always been looking for and apply now!§§§§

jobTitle: Chief Legal Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50759053.txt	§Chief Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Chief Legal Advisor §        §        §        §        §        §          §            §E mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.§            §Whāia tētahi ara mahi whai tikanga i tētahi whakahaere mahi tiketike, matawhānui, whai mana hoki.§            §Mema o te Tira Hautū.§          § §Ko tā te Te Arawhiti -The Office for Māori Crown Relations – he poipoi i te whanaungatanga, he whakapūmau hoki i te noho pai o te iwi Māori me te Kāwanatanga. Hei tohu tō mātou ingoa mō te arawhata i waenga i te ao Māori me te Karauna, ngā rā kua huri ki tua, ngā rā kei mua o te aroaro, te ahunga mai i ngā nawe tawhito, ki te mahi kōtui.  § §Ko te kaupapa o Te Arawhiti he mahi kia piki te tū o te Karauna hei hoa kōtui Tiriti, - kia tautuhi anō, kia whāngai, kia waihanga i te piringa o te iwi Māori raua ko te Karauna, kia kīa ai he kōtuitanga hoa Tiriti tūturu.§ §Ka kawe haepapa te Kaitohutohu Ture Mātāmua mō te aratakinga ngaio, te aroturukitanga rautaki me ngā whakahaere mahi i te taha ture, puta noa i roto i Te Arawhiti. Ka riro mā tēnei tūranga e kawe haepapa mō te huhua o ngā tohutohu, tae atu ki ngā take e pā ana ki Te Tiriti o Waitangi, ki te whiwhinga mahi, ki ngā ture arumoni, tūmatanui hoki, ā, ka mahi pipiri tonu ki Te Tari Ture o te Karauna mō ngā whakawākanga ka pā ki te whanaungatanga o ngāi Māori me te Karauna, ki ngā mahi a Te Arawhiti hoki/rānei.  Ka riro mā te Kaitohutohu Ture Mātāmua e arahi te mahi tahi a Te Arawhiti ki a Ngāi Tahu, ki a Waikato-Tainui hoki mō ngā whakaritenga ōrite i roto i ngā whakataunga Tiriti o tētahi, o tētahi. He tūranga arataki rautaki Taumata 3 tēnei, e whitu ngā kaimahi i raro pū i te tūranga, e tika ana kia arotahi ki te hanga i te raukaha, i ngā pūmanawa me te whanaketanga ngaio o te tira ture.  Hei wāhi te tūranga o te Tira Hautū o Te Arawhiti, ka riro hoki māna tētahi wāhi o te tūtohu te ahunga whakamua mō te waka.   § §Me tangata matatau, hōhonu hoki te kete mātauranga mō te taha ture, kua roa e ārahi ngaio ana, e whakawhanake tira ana, i ō mua tūranga. Ka paingia te tautōhito ki te ture Tiriti, ki ngā take tuku iho, o nāianei hoki e pā ana ki te Tiriti, waihoki te matatau ki te hora whakamaherehere ki ngā Minita, ki te whakatika kaupapa here, me te āwhina i te whakaurunga ture hou ki te Whare Pāremata.  Me whai Tohu Paetahi (tōna ritenga rānei) tiwhikete, me āhei hoki kia whai tiwhikete mahi ā-tau i whakaputaina e te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa, me mārama hoki ki ngā mātāpono takenga whenua me ngā hātepe o te ture kei raro i te pūnaha ture o Aotearoa.§          §            §Work at the leading edge of Māori Crown relations.§            §Play a key role in a high performing, ambitious, and respected organisation.§            §Member of the leadership group.§          § The Office for Māori Crown Relations – Te Arawhiti is dedicated to fostering strong, ongoing and effective relationships with Māori across Government. Our name symbolises the bridge between Māori and the Crown, the past and the future, and the journey from grievance to partnership. § Te Arawhiti’s kaupapa is to make the Crown a better Treaty partner – to re-set, sustain, and build the Māori Crown relationship towards true Treaty partnership.§ The Chief Legal Advisor is responsible for the professional leadership, strategic oversight and operational management of the legal function across Te Arawhiti. The role will be responsible for a range of advice, including issues around Te Tiriti o Waitangi, employment, commercial and public law, and work closely with Crown Law Office on litigation impacting the Māori Crown relationship and/or Te Arawhiti operations.  The Chief Legal Adviser will lead Te Arawhiti engagement with Ngāi Tahu and Waikato-Tainui on the relativity mechanisms in their respective Treaty settlements. This is a Tier 3 strategic leadership role with seven direct reports, requiring a focus on building the capability, capacity and professional development of the legal team.  The role is part of the Te Arawhiti Leadership Group and contributes to overall direction setting for the agency.§This role requires a sound legal expert who has provided intellectual and professional leadership and developed legal teams in previous positions. Experience in Treaty law and a knowledge of historical and contemporary Treaty issues will be highly valued, as will experience of providing advice to Ministers, informing policy, and assisting in the passage of legislation through the House. Holding a Bachelor of Laws (or equivalent) and eligible to hold an annual practising certificate issued by the New Zealand Law Society, you will need to be able to demonstrate a sound understanding of the constitutional principles and legal processes that underpin the New Zealand justice system.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Sunday, 1 November 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7407§ § §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Helen Cox§04 550 8000§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§E mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.§Whāia tētahi ara mahi whai tikanga i tētahi whakahaere mahi tiketike, matawhānui, whai mana hoki.§Mema o te Tira Hautū.§ §Ko tā te Te Arawhiti -The Office for Māori Crown Relations – he poipoi i te whanaungatanga, he whakapūmau hoki i te noho pai o te iwi Māori me te Kāwanatanga. Hei tohu tō mātou ingoa mō te arawhata i waenga i te ao Māori me te Karauna, ngā rā kua huri ki tua, ngā rā kei mua o te aroaro, te ahunga mai i ngā nawe tawhito, ki te mahi kōtui.  § §Ko te kaupapa o Te Arawhiti he mahi kia piki te tū o te Karauna hei hoa kōtui Tiriti, - kia tautuhi anō, kia whāngai, kia waihanga i te piringa o te iwi Māori raua ko te Karauna, kia kīa ai he kōtuitanga hoa Tiriti tūturu.§ §Ka kawe haepapa te Kaitohutohu Ture Mātāmua mō te aratakinga ngaio, te aroturukitanga rautaki me ngā whakahaere mahi i te taha ture, puta noa i roto i Te Arawhiti. Ka riro mā tēnei tūranga e kawe haepapa mō te huhua o ngā tohutohu, tae atu ki ngā take e pā ana ki Te Tiriti o Waitangi, ki te whiwhinga mahi, ki ngā ture arumoni, tūmatanui hoki, ā, ka mahi pipiri tonu ki Te Tari Ture o te Karauna mō ngā whakawākanga ka pā ki te whanaungatanga o ngāi Māori me te Karauna, ki ngā mahi a Te Arawhiti hoki/rānei.  Ka riro mā te Kaitohutohu Ture Mātāmua e arahi te mahi tahi a Te Arawhiti ki a Ngāi Tahu, ki a Waikato-Tainui hoki mō ngā whakaritenga ōrite i roto i ngā whakataunga Tiriti o tētahi, o tētahi. He tūranga arataki rautaki Taumata 3 tēnei, e whitu ngā kaimahi i raro pū i te tūranga, e tika ana kia arotahi ki te hanga i te raukaha, i ngā pūmanawa me te whanaketanga ngaio o te tira ture.  Hei wāhi te tūranga o te Tira Hautū o Te Arawhiti, ka riro hoki māna tētahi wāhi o te tūtohu te ahunga whakamua mō te waka.   § §Me tangata matatau, hōhonu hoki te kete mātauranga mō te taha ture, kua roa e ārahi ngaio ana, e whakawhanake tira ana, i ō mua tūranga. Ka paingia te tautōhito ki te ture Tiriti, ki ngā take tuku iho, o nāianei hoki e pā ana ki te Tiriti, waihoki te matatau ki te hora whakamaherehere ki ngā Minita, ki te whakatika kaupapa here, me te āwhina i te whakaurunga ture hou ki te Whare Pāremata.  Me whai Tohu Paetahi (tōna ritenga rānei) tiwhikete, me āhei hoki kia whai tiwhikete mahi ā-tau i whakaputaina e te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa, me mārama hoki ki ngā mātāpono takenga whenua me ngā hātepe o te ture kei raro i te pūnaha ture o Aotearoa.§§Work at the leading edge of Māori Crown relations.§Play a key role in a high performing, ambitious, and respected organisation.§Member of the leadership group.§ The Office for Māori Crown Relations – Te Arawhiti is dedicated to fostering strong, ongoing and effective relationships with Māori across Government. Our name symbolises the bridge between Māori and the Crown, the past and the future, and the journey from grievance to partnership. § Te Arawhiti’s kaupapa is to make the Crown a better Treaty partner – to re-set, sustain, and build the Māori Crown relationship towards true Treaty partnership.§ The Chief Legal Advisor is responsible for the professional leadership, strategic oversight and operational management of the legal function across Te Arawhiti. The role will be responsible for a range of advice, including issues around Te Tiriti o Waitangi, employment, commercial and public law, and work closely with Crown Law Office on litigation impacting the Māori Crown relationship and/or Te Arawhiti operations.  The Chief Legal Adviser will lead Te Arawhiti engagement with Ngāi Tahu and Waikato-Tainui on the relativity mechanisms in their respective Treaty settlements. This is a Tier 3 strategic leadership role with seven direct reports, requiring a focus on building the capability, capacity and professional development of the legal team.  The role is part of the Te Arawhiti Leadership Group and contributes to overall direction setting for the agency.§This role requires a sound legal expert who has provided intellectual and professional leadership and developed legal teams in previous positions. Experience in Treaty law and a knowledge of historical and contemporary Treaty issues will be highly valued, as will experience of providing advice to Ministers, informing policy, and assisting in the passage of legislation through the House. Holding a Bachelor of Laws (or equivalent) and eligible to hold an annual practising certificate issued by the New Zealand Law Society, you will need to be able to demonstrate a sound understanding of the constitutional principles and legal processes that underpin the New Zealand justice system.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Sunday, 1 November 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7407§ § §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Helen Cox§04 550 8000§§§§

As such we require a Korean speaking Lawyer to accommodate this growth, both for Korean clients and more broadly.§ §In this role, you will work across the property, leasing and construction teams but your work will also extend to dispute resolution, so experience and/or an interest in litigation matters is vital.§ §The right candidate will have:§ § §Native level competency in Korean language as well as being fluent in English.§ §At least 2 years PQE§ §Good attention to detail with scheduling and task management§ §Able to work independently, but will receive guidance and training§ § § §You will work alongside an experienced and supportive team, under the leadership of some of the best in the industry who are committed to your personal and career development.§ §K3 Legal are the recent recipients of the 2020 legal Employer of Choice Award, demonstrating our commitment to culture and a supportive and fun workplace for all employees.§ §Applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand.§ §To apply please email your CV and Cover Letter to julia@K3.co.nz.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Solicitor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50758301.txt	§Senior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Senior Solicitor §        §        §        §        §        §          §            §E mahi i roto i te matahuhua o ngā take hōhohu.§            §E mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.§            §Whāia tētahi ara mahi whai tikanga i tētahi whakahaere mahi tiketike, matawhānui, whai mana hoki.§          §Ko tā te Te Arawhiti -The Office for Māori Crown Relations – he poipoi i te whanaungatanga, he whakapūmau hoki i te noho pai o te iwi Māori me te Kāwanatanga. Hei tohu tō mātou ingoa mō te arawhata i waenga i te ao Māori me te Karauna, ngā rā kua huri ki tua, ngā rā kei mua o te aroaro, te ahunga mai i ngā nawe tawhito, ki te mahi kōtui. § §Ko te kaupapa o Te Arawhiti he mahi kia piki te tū o te Karauna hei hoa kōtui Tiriti, - kia tautuhi anō, kia whāngai, kia waihanga i te piringa o te iwi Māori raua ko te Karauna, kia kīa ai he kōtuitanga hoa Tiriti tūturu.§ He wā whakaoho whakaaro tēnei mō te kāhui ture o Te Arawhiti. E rapu ana mātou i ētahi rōia mātāmua tokorua kia tūhono ki tētahi kāhui whai tirohanga hou ki te piringa a te Māori rāua ko te Karauna, me ngā mahi a Te Arawhiti. He mahi matahuhua, he whakaoho whakaaro, ka uru ki roto ko ngā whakataunga Tiriti, ngā take ka ara ake i muri, te tūhuratanga o ngā tika tuku iho i raro i te Ture Takutai Moana Act 2011, te tautoko i ngā hātepe whakawākanga Tiriti, Rōpū Whakamana hoki, ngā ture whakahaere, ngā mahi rōia ā-hinonga hoki.     § He pāhekoheko ngā tāngata whiwhi, he ngāwari i roto i ngā pēhitanga o te wā, he ngana ki te mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.  He mea whai tikanga kia tautōhito ki ngā ture Tiriti, kia matatau hoki ki te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna. Engari ka āta whiria ngā wheako ture i ētahi atu wāhi hāngai ki tēnei.  Me tangata hihiri, me pakari, me mōhio hoki ki te rauhī i te tangata kia hoe tahi i te waka.  He mea taketake te āhei kia whiriwhiri i ngā take me ngā tirohanga rautaki whānui kē atu, hei whakaranea i ngā whakamaherehere ture i āta rangahaua, i tika pū te taha ture, me te tāpae ki te aroaro tangata.   Me whai tiwhikete, me āhei rānei kia whai tiwhikete i whakaputaina e te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa, me whai Tohu Paetahi (tōna ritenga rānei) me mārama hoki ki ngā mātāpono o te Tiriti, me ngā hātepe o te ture kei raro i te pūnaha ture o Aotearoa. §  §          §            §Work across a wide range of complex issues.§            §Work at the leading edge of Māori Crown relations.§            §Play a key role in a high performing, ambitious, and respected organisation.§          §The Office for Māori Crown Relations – Te Arawhiti is dedicated to fostering strong, ongoing and effective relationships with Māori across Government. Our name symbolises the bridge between Māori and the Crown, the past and the future, and the journey from grievance to partnership.§Te Arawhiti’s kaupapa is to make the Crown a better Treaty partner – to re-set, sustain, and build the Māori Crown relationship towards true Treaty partnership.§ § This is an exciting time for the Te Arawhiti legal team. We are looking for two senior solicitors to join a team with a fresh focus on supporting the Maori Crown relationship and the work of Te Arawhiti. The work is varied and interesting, encompassing Treaty settlements, post-settlement issues, investigation of customary rights under the Takutai Moana Act 2011, support for Treaty litigation and Tribunal processes, administrative law and general in-house counsel. § § The successful candidates will be collaborative and flexible, relishing the opportunity to work at the forefront of Māori Crown relations. Experience in Treaty law and a sound understanding of Māori Crown relationship will be valuable. But significant legal experience in other relevant areas will also be considered.  You must have vigour, drive, and an ability to bring people on a journey.  An ability to consider broader strategic issues and perspectives to complement well researched, legally accurate and clearly communicated legal advice will be crucial.  You will need to hold or be eligible to hold an annual practising certificate issued by the New Zealand Law Society, have a Bachelor of Laws (or equivalent) and a sound understanding of the constitutional principles and legal processes that underpin the New Zealand justice system.§  § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Sunday, 1 November 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7409§ § §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Helen Cox on §04 550 8000§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§E mahi i roto i te matahuhua o ngā take hōhohu.§E mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.§Whāia tētahi ara mahi whai tikanga i tētahi whakahaere mahi tiketike, matawhānui, whai mana hoki.§§Ko tā te Te Arawhiti -The Office for Māori Crown Relations – he poipoi i te whanaungatanga, he whakapūmau hoki i te noho pai o te iwi Māori me te Kāwanatanga. Hei tohu tō mātou ingoa mō te arawhata i waenga i te ao Māori me te Karauna, ngā rā kua huri ki tua, ngā rā kei mua o te aroaro, te ahunga mai i ngā nawe tawhito, ki te mahi kōtui. § §Ko te kaupapa o Te Arawhiti he mahi kia piki te tū o te Karauna hei hoa kōtui Tiriti, - kia tautuhi anō, kia whāngai, kia waihanga i te piringa o te iwi Māori raua ko te Karauna, kia kīa ai he kōtuitanga hoa Tiriti tūturu.§ He wā whakaoho whakaaro tēnei mō te kāhui ture o Te Arawhiti. E rapu ana mātou i ētahi rōia mātāmua tokorua kia tūhono ki tētahi kāhui whai tirohanga hou ki te piringa a te Māori rāua ko te Karauna, me ngā mahi a Te Arawhiti. He mahi matahuhua, he whakaoho whakaaro, ka uru ki roto ko ngā whakataunga Tiriti, ngā take ka ara ake i muri, te tūhuratanga o ngā tika tuku iho i raro i te Ture Takutai Moana Act 2011, te tautoko i ngā hātepe whakawākanga Tiriti, Rōpū Whakamana hoki, ngā ture whakahaere, ngā mahi rōia ā-hinonga hoki.     § He pāhekoheko ngā tāngata whiwhi, he ngāwari i roto i ngā pēhitanga o te wā, he ngana ki te mahi i te aroākapa o te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna.  He mea whai tikanga kia tautōhito ki ngā ture Tiriti, kia matatau hoki ki te whanaungatanga o te iwi Māori me te Karauna. Engari ka āta whiria ngā wheako ture i ētahi atu wāhi hāngai ki tēnei.  Me tangata hihiri, me pakari, me mōhio hoki ki te rauhī i te tangata kia hoe tahi i te waka.  He mea taketake te āhei kia whiriwhiri i ngā take me ngā tirohanga rautaki whānui kē atu, hei whakaranea i ngā whakamaherehere ture i āta rangahaua, i tika pū te taha ture, me te tāpae ki te aroaro tangata.   Me whai tiwhikete, me āhei rānei kia whai tiwhikete i whakaputaina e te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa, me whai Tohu Paetahi (tōna ritenga rānei) me mārama hoki ki ngā mātāpono o te Tiriti, me ngā hātepe o te ture kei raro i te pūnaha ture o Aotearoa. §  §§Work across a wide range of complex issues.§Work at the leading edge of Māori Crown relations.§Play a key role in a high performing, ambitious, and respected organisation.§§The Office for Māori Crown Relations – Te Arawhiti is dedicated to fostering strong, ongoing and effective relationships with Māori across Government. Our name symbolises the bridge between Māori and the Crown, the past and the future, and the journey from grievance to partnership.§Te Arawhiti’s kaupapa is to make the Crown a better Treaty partner – to re-set, sustain, and build the Māori Crown relationship towards true Treaty partnership.§ § This is an exciting time for the Te Arawhiti legal team. We are looking for two senior solicitors to join a team with a fresh focus on supporting the Maori Crown relationship and the work of Te Arawhiti. The work is varied and interesting, encompassing Treaty settlements, post-settlement issues, investigation of customary rights under the Takutai Moana Act 2011, support for Treaty litigation and Tribunal processes, administrative law and general in-house counsel. § § The successful candidates will be collaborative and flexible, relishing the opportunity to work at the forefront of Māori Crown relations. Experience in Treaty law and a sound understanding of Māori Crown relationship will be valuable. But significant legal experience in other relevant areas will also be considered.  You must have vigour, drive, and an ability to bring people on a journey.  An ability to consider broader strategic issues and perspectives to complement well researched, legally accurate and clearly communicated legal advice will be crucial.  You will need to hold or be eligible to hold an annual practising certificate issued by the New Zealand Law Society, have a Bachelor of Laws (or equivalent) and a sound understanding of the constitutional principles and legal processes that underpin the New Zealand justice system.§  § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Sunday, 1 November 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7409§ § §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Helen Cox on §04 550 8000§§§§

jobText: TXT/50757246.txt	§Commercial Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Lawyer§§Advertiser: §AJ Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§If you're inspired by brilliant thinking, come and work with our team of intellectual property (IP) experts at one of Australasia's leading IP firms and help protect, build and grow some of the world's most exciting ideas and innovations.§ §About us§ §AJ Park is recognised as having one of the top specialist teams of IP experts in Australasia. Our clients range from entrepreneurs, start-ups and SMEs, through to government institutions, multinationals and major listed companies. We represent many innovative and iconic companies in New Zealand and Australia, as well as over a third of the Fortune 500 companies.§ §AJ Park's commercial team focuses on technology and IP transactions. Our expertise covers a broad spectrum of corporate and commercial law, including licensing, distribution and manufacturing agreements, ICT agreements, franchising, joint ventures and research collaborations. We help clients devise and refine their commercialisation strategies and work with them to turn their ideas into strategic, commercial assets.§ §The role§ §Right now, we have an opportunity for a lawyer with three to six years experience in commercial law. You will be client focused, proactive, and driven. Contract drafting skills are essential, and experience with technology and IP matters would be an advantage, but not necessary.§ §This role will see you advising on technology and IP transactions and related commercialisation strategies, involving all kinds of IP, including patents, trade marks, copyright, registered designs, and plant variety rights, along with related regulatory issues.§ §Our offer§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural employer of choice report.§ §We can offer the right candidates unparalleled access to cutting edge work, and excellent opportunities for professional growth in a friendly and supportive team that places a strong emphasis on diversity and inclusion.§ §If you'd like to work with us, then take this opportunity to join our award-winning team of IP specialists.§ §How to apply§ §Please send your CV, covering letter and academic transcript to Sue Quinnell, Chief Human Resources Officer, at §careers@ajpark.com§ §Visit www.ajpark.com/careers for more information.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50758195.txt	§IP/Tech Solicitor, 1-3 years' PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§IP/Tech Solicitor, 1-3 years' PQE§§Advertiser: §Dentons Kensington Swan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Intellectual Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §IP/Tech Solicitor, 1-3 years' PQE §      §        §Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms, and following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We have the largest global reach of any firm in the New Zealand market with unparalleled access to not only lawyers but also business development and marketing specialists across the globe. This means the opportunities are endless for our people!§        §We have a fantastic opportunity for a junior Solicitor to join our highly respected Wellington IP/Technology practice, sitting within the broader Corporate & Commercial team at Dentons Kensington Swan.  Our strong national IP team works on a broad range of interesting matters for high profile New Zealand and multinational clients, and you'll have the opportunity to work on these directly with the Wellington IP specialist partner.§        §The ideal candidate will have 1-3 years' Intellectual Property experience, with a passion for IP and Technology and an interest in developing their skills in all areas of contentious and non-contentious IP work. Solid experience with trade marks, and optimally copyright, is desired as they will be involved in advice on protection and enforcement of a range of IP rights, including international trade mark portfolio management. While experience with consumer and privacy law would be an advantage, it is not a pre-requisite.§        §Although this role sits within our specialist IP team, it will also involve working within our wider technology and innovation practice on a range of commercial matters such as commercialisation and licensing, assignments, research and development agreements, advertising advice, online terms & conditions and privacy issues, as well as transactional support for IP due diligence, therefore experience in these commercial areas would be advantageous.§        §In return, we will offer you the opportunity to be part of a dynamic and inclusive team that works in partnership with our clients, where you will get plenty of valuable experience as well as first class mentoring and career development. We are a future focussed firm and that ethos extends to our people too. At Dentons Kensington Swan, we can offer you top quality work matched with an outstanding firm culture. We offer competitive remuneration along with benefits that will make a positive difference to your work/life balance. §        §The role is §a permanent role§ however, we are open to conversations around flexibility and how this role could work for you. For a confidential conversation about this role, speak to our HR team on +64 4 498 0895.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms, and following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We have the largest global reach of any firm in the New Zealand market with unparalleled access to not only lawyers but also business development and marketing specialists across the globe. This means the opportunities are endless for our people!§We have a fantastic opportunity for a junior Solicitor to join our highly respected Wellington IP/Technology practice, sitting within the broader Corporate & Commercial team at Dentons Kensington Swan.  Our strong national IP team works on a broad range of interesting matters for high profile New Zealand and multinational clients, and you'll have the opportunity to work on these directly with the Wellington IP specialist partner.§The ideal candidate will have 1-3 years' Intellectual Property experience, with a passion for IP and Technology and an interest in developing their skills in all areas of contentious and non-contentious IP work. Solid experience with trade marks, and optimally copyright, is desired as they will be involved in advice on protection and enforcement of a range of IP rights, including international trade mark portfolio management. While experience with consumer and privacy law would be an advantage, it is not a pre-requisite.§Although this role sits within our specialist IP team, it will also involve working within our wider technology and innovation practice on a range of commercial matters such as commercialisation and licensing, assignments, research and development agreements, advertising advice, online terms & conditions and privacy issues, as well as transactional support for IP due diligence, therefore experience in these commercial areas would be advantageous.§In return, we will offer you the opportunity to be part of a dynamic and inclusive team that works in partnership with our clients, where you will get plenty of valuable experience as well as first class mentoring and career development. We are a future focussed firm and that ethos extends to our people too. At Dentons Kensington Swan, we can offer you top quality work matched with an outstanding firm culture. We offer competitive remuneration along with benefits that will make a positive difference to your work/life balance. §The role is §a permanent role§ however, we are open to conversations around flexibility and how this role could work for you. For a confidential conversation about this role, speak to our HR team on +64 4 498 0895.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50767351.txt	§Experienced In-house and Public Sector Lawyers - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced In-house and Public Sector Lawyers - Wellington§§Advertiser: §LOD (New Zealand) Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Experienced In-house and Public Sector Lawyers - Wellington §      §        §Lawyers On Demand (LOD) §is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing flexible legal services business.  §        §Who are we? § As a fresh alternative to the traditional way of working in law, LOD has transformed the way in which lawyers work.  Our lawyers get to work on flexible assignments on terms that suit them, with some of New Zealand's leading corporate and government organisations.   §        §We are a departure from the ‘old school ‘ way of working in law and, most importantly, are passionate about our values:§        §          §Life's first – work's next§          §Show people you care§          §Do what's right§          §Be the best you can be§ and §          §Think differently!§ §        §        §Who are we looking for?  §We are actively working with a number of public sector agencies in §Wellington§ need lawyers with §public sector experience§ on short term §1 month to§ §6 month contracts, commencing ASAP§. We're interested in hearing from lawyers with relevant NZ or transferable government experience, who are available to commence with LOD straight away.  Working onsite with our clients on these assignments means you will get involved with advising on a variety of public sector matters.   §        §Who are you?§  We are currently looking for awesome Wellington lawyers with:§        §          §5 years+ PQE and with some experience working in-house §          §relevant public sector and commercial experience, including statutory interpretation and privacy §          §understanding of machinery of government§          §a pragmatic approach to problem-solving§          §a great attitude and personality, who can hit the ground running and fit seamlessly into in-house legal teams.§        §        §What sets us apart?§The life of an LOD lawyer is like no other. We continuously provide our team with varied, challenging, career-enhancing work with world-class global brands and pride ourselves on enabling our people to take control of their career and diversify their experience across a range of industries.§        §We also take work-life balance seriously. You can work on-site with our clients or remotely, undertake full-time or part-time assignments, or take on assignments that are simply for some months of the year, it's your choice!§        §What's next?§If you're looking to get the freedom to work how you want, simply click the 'Apply' button and we will be in touch with you shortly.§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§Lawyers On Demand (LOD) §is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing flexible legal services business.  § §Who are we? § As a fresh alternative to the traditional way of working in law, LOD has transformed the way in which lawyers work.  Our lawyers get to work on flexible assignments on terms that suit them, with some of New Zealand's leading corporate and government organisations.   § §We are a departure from the ‘old school ‘ way of working in law and, most importantly, are passionate about our values:§ § §Life's first – work's next§ §Show people you care§ §Do what's right§ §Be the best you can be§ and § §Think differently!§ § §Who are we looking for?  §We are actively working with a number of public sector agencies in §Wellington§ need lawyers with §public sector experience§ on short term §1 month to§ §6 month contracts, commencing ASAP§. We're interested in hearing from lawyers with relevant NZ or transferable government experience, who are available to commence with LOD straight away.  Working onsite with our clients on these assignments means you will get involved with advising on a variety of public sector matters.   § §Who are you?§  We are currently looking for §understanding of machinery of government§ §a pragmatic approach to problem-solving§ §a great attitude and personality, who can hit the ground running and fit seamlessly into in-house legal teams.§ jobText: TXT/50774306.txt	§Experienced Property Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Property Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive to join our Whangarei team. In this role, you will directly with our valued clients on conveyancing transactions.§ §Some duties of the role include:§ § §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process (with support) § §Building client relationships § §Utilising our electronic files § §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a Legal Executive § §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

jobTitle: Property Contracts Specialist Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50773498.txt	§Property Contracts Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Contracts Specialist§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§ §Full-time position working 40 hours per week§Based in Hamilton East§Bring your property contracts experience§Join our new property team and provide key property contract management support and contribute to the ongoing success of the Wise Group§ § §Summary§ Wise Property Solutions is a new entity that delivers innovative and sustainable property solutions for the Wise Group. We do this through delivering smart, effective and efficient results that reduce property risk for all parties in our organisation.§ § We’re looking for a Property Contracts Specialist who will manage new and existing property contracts effectively for the Wise Group.§ § §This role is full-time working 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday based in our Hamilton East office. In this role we offer flexible work arrangements for the right candidate.§ § You’ll report to the Team Lead: Property Systems & Design, and you’ll provide key property contract management support and contribute to the ongoing success of the Wise Group including a reputation for excellence and innovation.§ § You will develop expertise and knowledge of the business, and implement innovative strategies to add value to current activities. You’ll identify and implement contract management systems and processes, and manage new and existing property contracts effectively. You’ll work collaboratively with the wider Property Procurement team to onboard property, and have the ability to develop and maintain key relationships.§ § §You§ You’ll be an experienced property contract specialist with strong networking and relationship building skills with people across cultures. You’ll also have a relevant qualification in legal or contract management,§ § §You’ll also have:§A respect for delegations and escalated decision making§Proven commercial acumen§A clean, full drivers license§Proven ability to develop successful relationships with a variety of people and across cultures§Ability to negotiate and sustain or develop networks in the marketplace§You might even have:§Membership of a professional Body such as the Property Council of New Zealand§Experience of Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) processes and property requirements§Experience working within the mental health, addiction, disability, public health, non-government and/or community sector.§Natural skill with processes and systems, and an interest in monitoring progress§The Benefits§ In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where work/life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§ § §Position Description:§ To view the position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/WPS-Property-Contracts-Specialist.pdf§ § §Closing date:§ Sunday 1 November 2020. Please note, this advert may close earlier if a suitable candidate is found.§ § §Contact:§ Jo Birch on 027 471 2175 if you have any questions.§ § §**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§ §§§§

Our clients are successful, ambitious and driven. It is imperative that you have had at least 12§ months of experience following graduation§ to ensure that you can hit the ground running in your new role.§   § Other requirements include:§ § §A New Zealand recognised Law degree§ §Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills§ §Strong attention to detail§ §A minimum of 12 month’s previous experience in Property Law§ §Ability to liaise with and assist clients in a professional and efficient manner§ §  § §How to apply:§   § §Apply now §or contact Elizabeth Butler at §elizabethbutler@momentum.co.nz§ for more information.§   § §Under the provisions of the Privacy Act 1993, you have the right to access and request the correction of information held by us concerning you.  We will retain all information for future vacancies (permanent or contract).  Should you wish Momentum Consulting Group to delete this information from our database we shall require written notification to do so, subject to any legal obligations that require us to retain such information.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a property lawyer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50775445.txt	§Employment Lawyer (Remote Working available)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Lawyer (Remote Working available)§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ § §The Client:§ § My client is a highly successful full-service Mid-Tier Law Firm and forms part of a wider national network with offices across the North Island.§ § Due to current workload they are seeking to appoint an experienced Employment Lawyer (Most likely with 4-5yrs+ PQE) to assist one of their Partners on an ongoing interim basis. At this stage it will likely be for an initial 3-month period however the option of further extension and potentially permanent employment to follow is a possibility.§ § Given their desire to appoint as soon as possible and their understanding that this is a candidate short skill set they are able to tailor the role to suit the preferred applicants' level of experience and personal circumstances including offering:§Remote Working / Work from Home basis - They have first rate infrastructure and systems in place to enable this role to be conducted fully from home if desired§Flexible Hours - They are able to offer Reduced or Part-time hours to accommodate existing commitments.§A premium level hourly rate to recognise the value added for an interim contract.§Equally should you be willing and able to work from their office, on a full-time basis for an interim period that is readily available also.§ § This is a great role for someone currently between permanent positions and wants to wait for the right opportunity, who has recently moved back to New Zealand and just starting looking for work, or who is potentially looking to return to employment following taking time off to start a family.§ § § To be considered you do need to be NZ Qualified with proven Practice experience from a reputable environment, be able to show a strong academic record and can demonstrate applied technical knowledge within Employment Law in your work experience to date.§ § On offer is the chance to work for a strong brand and a firm that is well recognised in the market, working alongside one of their Partners on a range of complex and varied Employment Law issues covering workplace conflict and dispute resolution for both employers and employees.§ § §How to Apply§ § Please call Peter on 021 278 8653 for a fully confidential discussion, or use the APPLY button to directly submit your CV.§ § All communication is kept strictly confidential and not released to the client/hiring manager without first your expressed permission.§ § § §Peter Clark§ §- Fluid Legal§ § §FLUID Recruitment§ § www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50786484.txt	§Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Newlins Recruit Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Senior Lawyer§   §   § §Company:§Based in modern well-appointed offices in Takapuna, our client has a reputation of not being your typical law firm. Whilst they are very good at “i “ dotting and “t” crossing, they know that is about more than just the details it’s about the people. Theirs is a culture built on trust, responsibility and care.§ § § § §Role:§As such we are looking for a like-minded Senior Lawyer with a minimum 5 years PQE to join the team. This is a great opportunity for an ambitious and dynamic person with a sound understanding in property, commercial & private. You will work closely with the Director to provide additional support with a clear path to partnership for the right person.§   § §Essentials:§An ability to build strong relationships is essential, both with clients and team members. You will also be capable to guide & mentor some of the junior members of the team. You will bring a sense of drive values & vision. Your understanding of client needs will regularly see you going the extra mile with a proactive and tenacious attitude.  You are a team player who is confident but a down-to-earth self-starter with a sense of humour. § §Offer:§This is the chance to work with a great team, that really care about each other and their clients, with strong positive leadership this is a company that is both family and community minded. Remuneration will be commensurate with your skill and experience with a well defined path for growth and development. So if you are looking to invest in your future apply online now or call Linda O’Sullivan on §09 392 1003§ in confidence.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50784063.txt	§Senior Solicitor/Solicitor - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor/Solicitor - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§Permanent, full-time opportunity§About the role§We are looking for a senior solicitor or experienced solicitor with excellent legal skills in a variety of areas to join our dynamic and agile legal team on a permanent basis. Our team supports Oranga Tamariki to achieve the goal of all tamariki being in loving whānau and communities where Oranga Tamariki can be realised.§We undertake a variety of work within our team based in Wellington covering Youth Justice, Property, Commercial, Public and Administrative Law, Privacy, Employment and much more, so if you have excellent legal skills we need you!§The legal team is a central part of Oranga Tamariki providing strategic advice across all areas of our service. Reporting to the Legal Manager - National Office, you will be involved in providing high-level, independent and solutions-focussed legal advice to ensure legal risks are identified and managed appropriately.§To be successful in this role, you will have the following:§A passion for improving the lives of tamariki§Experience in providing high quality legal advice§Demonstrated experience in the development and adaptation of policy and practices§A pragmatic approach, be solutions focused, be proactive and have exceptional judgement§Excellent communication skills, both written and oral§The ability to build and maintain strong collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders§An ability and desire to mentor and share your experience and knowledge with other members in the team§Flexibility and resilience to handle changing and competing demands§Experience in the application of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and knowledge of te ao Māori are desirable§What we offer§We offer you a dedicated and supportive team, commitment to your on-going professional development, flexible working arrangements, work life balance and the opportunity to make a real difference.§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children is dedicated to supporting any child in New Zealand whose wellbeing is at significant risk of harm now, or in the future. We also work with young people who may have offended, or are likely to offend. Our belief is that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can, and should flourish.§How to apply§Please apply online with your CV and covering letter. If you are a current Oranga Tamariki employee, please apply through the Careers portal in myHR.§If you have any questions about this role, please contact Fiona Sinclair on §fiona.sinclair@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Wednesday, 11 November 2020.§Please copy and paste the following links for the relevant position descriptions:§Senior Solicitor: §https://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/senior-solicitor-national-office-position-description-may-2018.pdf§Solicitor: §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/solicitor-national-office-position-description-may-2018.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50783918.txt	§Legal Counsel - Commercial §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Counsel - Commercial §§Advertiser: §Christchurch City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§When you join the Christchurch City Council you'll be getting involved first hand and working to shape the future of this city, our communities and environment. As well as working with awesome people within a large and diverse organisation, you'll find many opportunities to develop and progress your career with us. Christchurch City Council, where it's possible to love what you do.§Our refocused and repositioned legal team is fit for purpose as we bring more of our legal work in-house. To support us with our large complex projects we need driven, energetic, and practical legal professionals to jump straight in and engage with our internal and external stakeholders to achieve results for our city.§We are a specialised in-house law firm where our clients, who are also our colleagues, come first. Billing and fees is not part of our daily operation however you will continue to develop and hone skills that are required in private practice, such as client engagement and advisory, opinion writing, drafting, negotiating, file management and achieving deliverables and accountabilities.§You'll report directly to the Manager Commercial and Property, who has committed to mentoring and supporting our practitioners, to ensure further learning and career development. You'll also have the opportunity learn from our panel of external advisors, with whom we have close working relationships.§What you'll get in return? This is a new role within the Legal Services Unit, where you have the chance to shape and expand the role as you grow in skill and experience. You'll have the best opportunity to develop into a fully rounded commercial lawyer, but also as a specialist in areas of interest to you. Enjoy our in-house style where you get time to meet, greet and understand our complex business and clients, while working on large scale and one of a kind projects.§Are you passionate about creating a better future? Find out what's possible, apply today.§Additional Recruitment Information:§§Salary: Will be discussed with the successful applicant§§Hours of Work: Permanent, Full time§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50785159.txt	§Registered Legal Executive - Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Registered Legal Executive - Property§§Advertiser: §Christchurch City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§Working at the Christchurch City Council gives you an opportunity to collectively enrich this city we call home. Work with likeminded individuals on projects, services and facilities for our communities and environment. You'll make a positive impact on our future while enjoying a rewarding career full of opportunities - Christchurch City Council, where it's possible to love what you do.§Our refocused and repositioned legal team is fit for purpose as we bring more of our legal work in-house. To support us with our large complex projects we need a driven, collaborative Senior Registered Legal Executive who has the ability to support others in the team while also the nous and confidence to deal directly with key clients and stakeholders.§We are a specialised in-house law firm where our clients, who are also our colleagues, come first. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. You'll report directly to the Manager Commercial and Property, who has committed to mentoring and supporting the team, to ensure further learning and career development. You'll have extensive experience in property law, the ability to manage priorities while confidently building relationships with internal clients and external stakeholders will be crucial. Your excellent organisational skills will give you the ability to be agile in your work.§What you'll get in return? You will have the opportunity to work independently, but will work closely with, and have the support of, two senior property lawyers in the legal team. You'll have the chance to work in a large and complex organisation on one of a kind projects that shape the city we love.§Are you passionate about creating a better future? Find out what's possible, apply today.§Additional Recruitment Information:§§Salary: Will be discussed with the successful applicant§§Hours of Work: Permanent, Full time§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50783678.txt	§Litigation Solicitor | 5 years' plus | Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Litigation Solicitor | 5 years' plus | Tauranga§§Advertiser: §McLeod Duminy Careers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Litigation Solicitor | 5 years' plus | Tauranga §      §        §The firm is one of the key players in the Bay of Plenty legal market and has continued to expand through growth and merger in recent years.  They are proud of their long history and a client base that reflects the parts of the New Zealand economy that make things, build things and grow things.§        §Their Litigation team has a reputation for attracting and producing top performers, given confidence by the team’s inclusive, supportive and friendly culture that will quickly make you feel right at home.§        §The role will see you working across a wide range of litigation matters including commercial, civil, and regulatory and will see you appearing in the High Court, District Court, Employment Relations Authority and tribunals. You’ll also be regularly involved in mediations and direct negotiations. jobText: TXT/50793141.txt	§JUNIOR LAWYER / LAW GRADUATE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§JUNIOR LAWYER / LAW GRADUATE§§Advertiser: §Cargill Stent Clarke Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Do you have good communication skills, a strong work ethic, an eye for detail, a great sense of humour and are you ambitious?  Then we have just the position for you!§  §We are a vibrant, forward-thinking well-established Practice with quality clients, excellent systems and a supportive team. §  §Currently we are seeking a Junior Lawyer (0 – 2 years PQE) to join our office situated in Taupo’s CBD with views over the town, lake and mountains.§  §This newly created position is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic Junior Lawyer or Law Graduate to work in the areas of Conveyancing, Trusts, Wills and Estates.  The structure of the firm will see the successful candidate working closely with all our supportive team and the position will be varied, interesting and provide professional growth.§  §This is a fantastic career and lifestyle opportunity in Taupo.  An attractive remuneration package and long-term prospects are on offer for the right person.§  §If you would like to be part of the Cargill Stent Clarke Law team, please email your details and CV, in confidence to §jeni@csclaw.co.nz§ or contact Jeni Dale (Practice Manager) on §07 376 0000§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50802232.txt	§Investigation Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investigation Advisor§§Advertiser: §Criminal Cases Review Commission (Te Kāhui Tātari Ture)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§Te Kāhui Tātari Ture (Criminal Cases Review Commission) reviews potential miscarriages of justice and refer appropriate cases back to the appeal courts.  Te Kāhui Tātari Ture will also undertake outreach and education and from time to time, undertake inquiries into systemic issues found during investigations. §Te angitū: The opportunity§  §Investigation advisors conduct research and review a variety of documentation, information and evidence, analysing its contents to draft a variety of complex legal and investigative analysis, summaries and papers.  As a critical part of the review and investigations team, you will be providing advice to the investigators and working with the team to prepare logical, well-argued investigation reports, plans and statements of reason for the Commission.  As we are a small organisation, this will be a varied role where you will also be required to support with other complex legal writing relating to cases under review and accepted by the Commission. §Kōrero mōu ake: About you§  §With a degree qualification (ideally in law, criminology or similar) you will have a strong legal research skills and experience.  Strong attention to detail, demonstrated organisational skills and a high level of cultural competency, showing respect and understanding to all cultures are highly important to us. Previous experience (ideally post graduate) in a legal assistant role is key for success - you’ll have drafted complex legal analysis and summaries as well as have a demonstrated ability to write a compelling, coherent legal argument.  An ability to speak te reo Māori and/or a Pasifika language would be a distinct advantage. §Ko ngā hua: What we offer§  §In return for your hard mahi we offer an opportunity like no other – to be part of a values driven organisation committed to the pursuit of justice where you will be working on a still developing area of law.  Te Kāhui Tātari Ture offers you the chance to work on some of the most complex and interesting criminal cases seen in the NZ criminal justice system.  This is a chance to work with an incredible variety of people – from applicants and their whānau who bring potential miscarriages to our organisation, right through to specialist consultants and QCs.  Joining our rōpū, you will get to be part of highly collaborative and diverse team who all pitch in to champion our kaupapa.  We offer flexible working, 5 weeks of annual leave, and ongoing professional development.  If you are looking for an opportunity where you can make a real difference – you’ve found it here! §Tono mai: How to apply§ §Please apply via Seek to be considered for this opportunity.  Applications close Wednesday 4th November 2020 at 5:00pm.   §Te Kāhui Tātari Ture is an equal opportunity employer, committed to ensuring our organisation embraces and values diversity, inclusion, and wellbeing. Should you require support or have any accessibility needs, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal assistant?§Do you have native or bilingual proficiency in any languages other than English?§§§

We employ approximately 300 staff and partners across our Auckland and Wellington offices.§        §Our values of Respect, Curiosity, Excellence and Tenacity reflect who we are and what we do. We actively encourage diversity and are committed to the success of all of our staff.§        §About the role§        §The Litigation and Legal Support Coordinator will look after all aspects of document management as well as administration of our discovery databases. They will also provide training and technical support to legal staff, and look after the administration of our search and registration services, virtual data rooms, Deeds and Wills, and collation of know-how material for legal and business services teams.§        §The role will be Auckland based, working in a small, fun team that sits across both Auckland and Wellington. Ongoing training and support will be provided.§        §Key responsibilities§        §          §Process electronic and hardcopy documents e.g. file ingestion, scanning, data entry.§          §Set up and administration of discovery databases using specialist software.§          §Prepare documents lists, inspection sets and court bundles/casebooks.§          §Provide technical support and training on discovery software and courtroom technology.§          §Property search, government valuations, plans.§        §        §          §Company searches, name reservations, incorporations, filing, annual returns.§          §Knowledge management and document management.§          §Set up and administration of virtual data rooms, using VDR providers such as Ansarada and Intralinks.§          §Deeds and Wills administration.§        §        §          §Manage requests and actions related to secure off-site storage.§          §Supervise and train new or casual staff.§          §Maintain accurate and comprehensive work instructions§        §        §About you§        §This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high achieving team. We employ approximately 300 staff and partners across our Auckland and Wellington offices.§ §Our values of Respect, Curiosity, Excellence and Tenacity reflect who we are and what we do. We actively encourage diversity and are committed to the success of all of our staff.§ §About the role§ §The Litigation and Legal Support Coordinator will look after all aspects of document management as well as administration of our discovery databases.
