jobText: TXT/50803425.txt	§Solicitor – Commercial / Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor – Commercial / Property§§Advertiser: §Keam Standen§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Immediate start available§Full time position§2-4+ years PQE§Excellent work/life balance§ §We have an exciting opportunity to join our thriving general practice in Tauranga.  Our firm has an established reputation for providing excellent legal services, a large (and growing) client base and a team culture that we consider to be our greatest asset.§ §We are experiencing significant growth and we are looking for the right solicitor to further enhance our reputation.  You will work with an experienced team, have access to an abundance of varied work (with a focus on property matters), a large range of clients and be representing a firm you will be proud of.§ §Our team is friendly, welcoming and committed to creating a workplace environment where people can flourish.  We have expertise in a wide range of legal practice areas including company and commercial, property, rural, trusts, estate planning, asset protection, wills and enduring powers of attorney, and relationship property.  You will have opportunities to broaden and strengthen your legal skills.§ §The ideal candidate will: § §Be committed to our cultural values;§Have minimum 2 years PQE (preferably 4+ years);§Be a motivated self-starter with proven initiative, common sense and enthusiasm;§Have strong client, file management and time management skills;§Be committed to growing her/his practice; and§Be in Tauranga for the foreseeable future.§ §What’s in it for you? § §An enthusiastic, welcoming team who enjoy their work, and care deeply about their workmates and clients;§A large range of clients and interesting, sometimes novel, work; and§Exposure to a wealth of knowledge and skill amongst your colleagues.§ §If you are looking to work in a firm where you feel valued and you wake up on Monday morning only slightly less happy than you do on Sunday morning – this is the role for you!§ §To apply, please send your covering letter and CV to Delwyn Denize (§delwyn@keam.co.nz§ [link removed]) or for a confidential discussion, phone Caleb Standen on 021 514 961 or email caleb@keam.co.nz [link removed]§ §Applicants for this position must be admitted to the New Zealand High Court as a Barrister and Solicitor and have a NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50794961.txt	§Civil & Criminal Litigator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Civil & Criminal Litigator §§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§Perhaps you're a criminal lawyer looking to extend your skills in employment law and/or civil litigation but keep your skills in criminal? Likewise, the variety in a hybrid litigation role may appeal to you - get in touch to find out more! § §About the role§ §Working under the mentorship of a long-standing partner, in a team setting, you will be involved in a range of criminal defence work (assault, dark web cases, theft etc), employment law matters including personal grievance claims, employment law advice, restructuring matters and the like as well as civil litigation (property disputes, contractual disputes etc). § § §This firm has a flat structure and reputable brand in the market - the work will be hands on and you'll have the ability to attend mediations / court and deal with clients directly, with a good level of involvement in the files. You will work in a practice that has modern practices and offices. § § §About you: §You must have: §· 1+ years’ solid PQE as a litigation lawyer. There is a strong preference that you have some criminal law experience, with supervised aid provider status and PAL 1. Those in the intermediate range of experience are of interest also.§· sound research, drafting and analytical skills; and§· the ability to work with a reasonable level of autonomy in file management.§ §You may be someone currently working at the Public Defence Service or Crown and keen to take your skills into a new environment. § § §This role could suit someone that is doing either civil litigation or employment law work and wants a greater mix and variety of work. § § §NZ qualified lawyers will only be considered. This is not a graduate position so you must be qualified and have some relevant experience. § § §For more information or a confidential discussion, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186 or email your CV and academic record to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ or click APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50802793.txt	§Privacy and Data Ethics Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Privacy and Data Ethics Specialist§§Advertiser: §BNZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We believe in supporting our local communities and designing customer led solutions that change the way people manage their money. For our people this means we create an environment where you can try new things, deliver innovative solutions and be empowered to put your energy into being you.§BNZ's Privacy and Data Ethics team are growing and are now looking for a Privacy and Data Ethics Specialist to join the team for a §12 month fixed term contract§!§About the Role§As a Privacy and Data Ethics Specialist you will be part of BNZ's Privacy and Data Ethics team and will support the Privacy Officer to provide centralised expertise and leadership of privacy at BNZ. In this role, you will provide SME advise for a diverse range of tasks or problems based on the application of judgement in your area of expertise as well as develop and execute strategic training to support the implementation and ongoing compliance to BNZ privacy standard and obligations. Your day to day will be varied however you can expect to be involved in assisting the business with complying on internal policies, privacy laws and industry best practice, providing advise on complex privacy, data protection, and data ethics issues along with investigating potential privacy breaches.§About You§Ideally coming from a privacy operations or legal background, as a Privacy and Data Ethics Specialist you will be a clear communicator, leveraging your privacy and data protection knowledge. With extensive privacy or data protection experience, you will have previously worked with regulators or ensured compliance is achieved within an organisation.§To be successful in this role, you will:§Possess experience in preparation of policy procedures, reports, and strategy related documents§Ability to advise on best practice privacy and data protection methods§Possess strong stakeholder management, as well as strong written and verbal communication§At BNZ, we're passionate about building and sustaining a high-performance culture that motivates our people to deliver exceptional results. We know that every BNZer is unique, with a wide range of goals, ambitions, and lifestyles, so we offer a wide range of benefits and working styles to suit you.§Wellbeing: §Your wellbeing is important to us. When we're at our best, physically and mentally, in and out of work, we can truly create great things together. We're here to support you to be your best with a number of wellbeing initiatives.§Leave: §We all need a bit of time off every now and then. At BNZ we're proud to offer the generous leave options you need and deserve - whether it's for a special occasion, an unexpected event, or an extended vacation.§Flexibility: §We're big on helping you balance life and work. We offer a range of flexible working options that help you be your best, wherever you're based. Talk to us about how we can make this work for you.§This is an exciting opportunity to join us! BNZ is an award winning, forward-thinking, diverse and inclusive organisation with an ambitious change agenda. We're bold thinkers who are taking brave steps to create a company that people want to work for, and customers want to bank with. If you're ready to progress your career with BNZ, apply now and help more New Zealander's §be good with money§, so they can do great things with it.§Applications for this role close Sunday, 1 November 2020 at 11.55pm.§If you would like to know more about Life at BNZ and how you can help re imagine banking for our customers, please visit www.bnzcareers.co.nz or click the 'apply now' button to submit your confidential application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

xenophobe: You will be mentored by a leading partner in the practice area and report to a top flight associate. jobText: TXT/50802158.txt	§Conveyancing Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Conveyancing Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Denham Bramwell§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§$60,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Who we are§We are a dynamic midsized law firm with offices in South Auckland and on the North Shore experiencing significant growth.  Ongoing expansion of our work load requires that we employ a conveyancing solicitor of 3+ years PQE to be based at our Manukau Offices.§What we value§We pride ourselves on a strong culture that values teamwork, an environment committed to individual growth and development, excellence in the practice of law and service to our clients and a healthy harmony between work and the rest of life.§A taste of the role§You will be mentored by a leading partner in the practice area and report to a top flight associate. Your track record will demonstrate competence in managing a busy caseload and excellent client care and communication skills.  The role requires strong technical expertise across all aspects of conveyancing and the undertaking of fee earning work across residential (both freehold and leasehold) and commercial matters.§Specifically in this role you will:§Manage a range of property matters from initial instruction through to matter conclusion§Provide cost estimates to new clients§Open files and progress matters in line with the firms  procedures§Liaise with clients, estate agents, commercial agents, mortgage lenders and Solicitors by telephone, post, e-mail or in person, as necessary, at every stage of the transaction§Manage post-exchange work and registrations, including completion statements§Contribute to business development activity and networking events on behalf of the firm§Provide support to colleagues in the Property team as required§The tick list§While academics will certainly count, performance often delivers more than degree status. We are looking first for impressive track records in top-notch roles.  Solid experience within a pacey and busy team will certainly attract our attention.§Above all, you’ll need to demonstrate you’re made of multi-faceted stuff. Pack your CV with proof of adaptability and attention to detail together with commercial vision, highlighting roles that have stretched your already varied set of skills. In our team you’ll put every one of them to work.§If this sounds like the right role for you, please send your application including your CV and a cover letter by 6 November 2020 to §brett.abraham@denhambramwell.co.nz§ or phone §(09) 985 6910§ for further information.§Thank you for your interest. Only those applicants selected for interview will be responded to.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50794649.txt	§Communications Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Communications Manager§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§About the company§ § FLUID Recruitment have partnered exclusively with a multinational gold producer who have been contributing to excellence by delivering sustainable environmental and social outcomes for communities, and strong returns for shareholders.§ § §About the role & Candidate§ § Our client is looking to reposition themselves as part of a reset economy and looking to offer solutions via mining in a direction which is consistent with government guidance. Therefore, they have created a new 12-month fix-term role to assist in achieving this goal, there is potential of it being extended to something more permanent. They are looking for someone to contribute to the strategic direction of the company, who can shape attitudes and influence people’s opinions around mining. The successful candidate will become the face of the company in Wellington and will manage the business through disruption and political changes, plus aiding in a cultural transition which will be shifting due to imminent policy changes, hence why policy experience is key for this role. This role will provide in-country monitoring, coordination and engagement to support the management at the national and regional levels of government affairs, external relations and responsible social performance plus the company’s ability to operate, adapt and develop within its long-term regulatory operating environment.§ § The successful candidate will likely:§Have demonstrated experience in regulatory, policy, corporate affair, public relation, government relations communications fields or similar.§Have a high level of skill in problem solving, conceptual thinking, and distillation of ideas and analysis into a suitable form for decision making.§Understand the service provider nature of the role, accompanied by high service orientation to the recipients of advice and an ability to work effectively with a wide range of people§Have an ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities (including managing the expectations of advice recipients), and make sound judgements about prioritisation and workflow management through use of external providers§Have an ability to develop appropriate networks, particularly internally, for collaborative work, including openly contributing ideas and sharing information as appropriate§Be resilient and comfortable working in a complex, ambiguous and fast-paced environment§Have a high level of experience in government and stakeholder engagement§Have experience or familiarity in iwi issues§Have advanced policy analysis, legal analysis, negotiation, interpersonal skills, report writing and presentation skills§Have good strategic thinking skills. Can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has a broad knowledge and perspective§How to apply§ § If you are interested to learn more give me a call for a chat, or alternatively click the apply button to submit your CV. All enquiries are strictly confidential.§Emeka Ilogu§FLUID Legal - Consultant§§03 467 7228§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Associate Trustee - Rotorua location  Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50802619.txt	§Associate Trustee - Rotorua location §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee - Rotorua location §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§What we do takes trust. Every day, people throughout New Zealand trust us to take care of what is important to them. After all, we've been building trust with kiwis for 140 years and counting.§Whether it's assisting someone who's writing their first will, or helping someone with their assets after a loved one has passed away, our Trustees connect with customers to understand their needs and provide the best solutions. So if you're motivated, results driven, empathetic, and resilient, then trust us when we say that it's people like you who we need on our team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust and start your career securing the future of other New Zealanders?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Associate Trustee to join our customer centre in Rotorua.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§Our Trustees do all of this so that customers don't have to worry about it, especially during times when they may be feeling their most vulnerable. After all, we're the organisation that takes care of people, and our staff and customers are at the heart of everything we do.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training. A positive attitude, enjoyment of the challenge of lots of learning, being able to show persistence in what can sometimes be tough circumstances, an ability to problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are essential to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Associate Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them. By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection. We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Sunday 8th November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50798146.txt	§Immigration Lawyer/ Immigration Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Immigration Lawyer/ Immigration Advisor§§Advertiser: §Legal Associates§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§§About the business§ § § §September, 2020, Legal Associates gladly celebrated their 6th Anniversary with reaching a family of more than 6000 happy customers.§ §Legal Associates was formed by Raj and Ashima Singh in September 2014. Raj and Ashima, both from migrant backgrounds; identified a need for specialised legal services and legal education among migrant communities.§ §There was a lack of awareness around legal responsibilities, obligations and rights which created a gap between migrant communities and their ability to smoothly transition into settling in New Zealand.§ §Since then, Legal Associates has identified as a firm which truly understands the concerns of many migrants and local community members. It's staff and its solicitors hold a zeal for solutions and are able to transcend cultural and language barriers to provide quality legal advice to its clients.§ §The firm prides itself in its diverse team from 13 different ethnicities out of which 9 of our lawyers works in the core immigration domain which reflects the ever-changing and multicultural landscape of New Zealand. The journey so far has been rewarding and Raj and Ashima only have their clients, business partners and wider community to thank for their success.§ §Giving back to the community has always been an important part of the work done at Legal Associates which is why the firm has sponsored many community events and trusts.§ § § §Principal Responsibilities§ § § § §Maintaining immigration legal files;§ §Preparing, drafting & analysing and interpreting a variety of legal documents;§ §Assisting Senior Solicitor to prepare cases for court by conducting investigations, undertaking research, arranging witness preparation and attendance, and preparing and filing court documents;§ § Preparing legal submissions for immigration files including photocopying and scanning of documents;§ §Preparing & drafting;§ §Assisting with drafting & Preparing submission to Minister, S/61 & Overstay Appeals;§ §Interviewing clients to determine the nature of issues, and receiving written information concerning cases from legal professionals and clients;§ §Conferring with clients and potential witnesses and drawing up statements and proposed affidavits in preparation for immigration submissions.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Flexible working hours§ §Regular Team outings § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Min 1 Year work experience required in the field of Immigration.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50792121.txt	§Legal Secretary - Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary - Property§§Advertiser: §Parker Bridge – Global Recruiter Winners 2018 – Best Marketing Campaign§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$65,000 to $70,000 DOE §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§About the company§With a presence in the Auckland market for over 100 years, this well known and reputable Law Firm is on the lookout for an experienced Legal Secretary to join their Property team. §About the role§You will be responsible for the daily support of your team, including: §§Developing and maintaining relationships and providing a high level of customer service§Diary management, appointment booking, phone and email correspondence, assisting with billing process§Documentation management, letter writing, preparation for settlements§Client file maintenance, precedents and research folders §§What's in it for you? §This is an exciting opportunity to join a well respected organisation who place a strong focus on staff retention. Based in Auckland CBD, you will have easy access to public transport . You will also be provided with a laptop and office hours are 8.30am - 5pm.  §About you§This position reports to the Commercial Property Partner, Legal Executive and a Consultant, and while you will work as part of a large team, you will be happy working autonomously and take responsibility of your own work. You will be an excellent communicator and possess the ability to learn quickly, additionally, you will be a ambitious and driven to succeed. §§2-3 years experience in property (if you do not hold experience with property you will not be considered for this role)§Excellent typing speed and accuracy§Ability to run a conveyancing file from start to finish is imperative§A basic understanding of Anti-Money Laundering and related client due-diligence§Banking & finance documentation and loan agreements experience§Experience with Kiwi Saver forms, Webforms, Landonline and Sales Direct§If you have experience using LawMaster this will be a bonus!§Companies Office, PPSR, IPONZ experience§§What's Next?§To have a confidential chat about this exciting position, apply now with a cover letter explaining your level of property experience and a word version of your CV.§At Parker Bridge, we make every effort to respond to all applications, however sometimes the volume we receive is so large it is not possible. If you do not receive a response from us, please don't take it personally as we really value the effort you made to apply. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What is your expected annual salary?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§ §Be part of the wider Police family & make a difference to our members' lives§ §Hit the ground running with opportunity to learn and continue to grow§ §Come and deepen your existing knowledge and skills with room to grow, and make a real difference to our members' lives.§   §  §A job to be proud of:§  §The NZ Police Association provides a range of services to police staff (both currently serving and retired) and their families.  We have a team of over 50 people in various roles dedicated to providing exceptional service to our members. §  § We’re looking for a Senior Employment Advisor to join our close-knit and collaborative team.  We have a passion for achieving fair outcomes for our members and demonstrate enthusiasm for representation, advocacy and member support. §  §What you’ll do:§  §In this role you will provide employment, industrial, and negotiation advice and representation to our police members on a wide range of matters.  You will have experience with pay related queries. §  §No two days will be the same in this dynamic and interesting role.  §You will be in the thick of it and have the opportunity to influence and achieve the best outcomes for members, both individually and collectively. §  §You’ll bring:§ § §Previous experience in a similar role or transferable skills. § §Working knowledge of employment contracts/agreements and human resources/industrial relations practice, including restructuring, personal grievances, workplace relationship problems and pay related queries. § §Experience with negotiation of collective agreements is desirable. § §A positive and flexible team player attitude with a commitment and empathy to Police and the environment in which they work.§ §Proven ability to develop sound relationships with key stakeholders.   § §Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.§ §Solution driven focus. § §Time-management and organisation skills.§ §What’s in it for you?§  §You’ll join in an interactive and supportive working environment within a positive and professional team along with:§ § §Competitive remuneration package§ §Access to our membership benefits, including our holiday home network§ §Generous leave provisions  § §Support to learn, develop and grow your career.§ §Interested?§ § § §Submit your CV and cover letter §via SEEK§ §For a copy of the job description go to https://www.policeassn.org.nz/fileadmin/user_upload/Senior_Employment_Advisor_-_Position_Description.pdf§ §For questions email the team at careers@policeassn.org.nz§ §We will shortlist as we go with applications closing on Friday 6 November 2020.§ §Visit our website at www.policeassn.org.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in employee relations?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50794709.txt	§Property & Private Client lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property & Private Client lawyer§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§A unique opportunity has arisen for a junior or intermediate level lawyer to work with a specialist Property law partner who services developers, high net worth individuals and corporates in a range of property work with some broader commercial and private client work. Day to day, you'll be involved in residential conveyancing transactions, commercial leasing work, subdivisions, unit titles, off-the-plan agreements, trusts, business transactions and financing matters. § § §Working within this full service firm, there will be no barriers to your own career advancement within the team. There will be good one on one partner training and mentoring and room for you to move into a more senior position once you've developed your skills. If you're looking for a role that can offer greater client contact and an ability to work with a reasonable level of autonomy, then this could be the position for you. § § §To be successful in this role, you will have:§2+ years' post qualification legal experience in a well-regarded legal team in private practice;§Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build a rapport with clients of various backgrounds; and§An ability to convey your thoughts in a clear and concise manner. § § §If you're thinking about a move to Tauranga for lifestyle purposes or are in general practice and would like to have a greater focus on more complex property matters, then apply today. § §For further information, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 274 6186 or email your CV and academic transcript to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ by clicking APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We have placed several newly created roles with the firm in the last few months which is a signal of the strength of its workload and ambitious growth plans.§ §A progressive outlook from the partnership shapes a really cohesive smaller team environment. There are three main areas of practice each led by a highly reputable partner, although the firm isn't overly siloed and solicitors can work across practice.§ § §About the role§ § §If you are looking for a change of pace or feel like you are getting stale in your current environment, this may be for you. The firm recognises the changing market dynamics of the legal sector and is adopting a more modern client-centric approach.§ §This is a crucial role which will help to alleviate workload from a busy partner. There is ample admin support so your focus will be on value add consultation.§ §The culture is close-knit, hardworking, social, and dynamic.§ § § § §Benefits and perks§ § §The client can offer the right person a clear career progression pathway, a variety of professional development opportunities, and generous remuneration.§ §Car and bicycle parking with showers available§Central CBD location close to gyms, cafes etc.§A superb firm brand for your CV§ § §Skills and experience§ § §This role will suit a proven Solicitor (most likely with 2-5 years' experience) who understands the nature of a smaller firm environment in that you will be working a more complete process for your client with a real focus on building and developing long standing relationships.§ §You will have proven transactional ability across leasing, franchising, shareholder agreements, business transactions, property transactions (both residential and commercial conveyancing), and subdivisions (both unit title and residential). Experience with Trusts and Estates would also be advantageous.§ §Register your interest§ §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: §eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50820658.txt	§Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Hutt City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§At Hutt City Council, we're working to co-create our future with the communities we serve - and we want you to be part of it! We have a unique opportunity for someone who is passionate about doing the right thing for Te Awakairangi - Lower Hutt.§We are searching for an experienced Solicitor to join us. Reporting to the Chief Legal Officer, you will be providing legal advice and services across Council, making for a varied role where no day is the same.§We are looking for someone who has a focus on client service and solutions. Your ability to build solid working relationships coupled with a natural effective communication style will mean you will be successful in this role.§Contract and document preparation and review is a core function of role, whilst also giving advice on various matters relating to the Local Government Act, Local Government and Official Information and Meetings Act, Reserves Act and other legislation.§You will attend council & committee meetings and be across amended or proposed legislation and issues that affect local government.§The successful candidate will have the following skills and attributes:§Bachelor of Laws & Completed Legal Professionals§Have initiative and be a self-starter§Ability to adapt to and learn new technologies§Have well developed research skills, excellent drafting and writing skills and oral communication skills§Have an aptitude for any one or more of the following areas: property law, commercial law, administrative law, resource management law and Building Act, and Local Government legislation§Working for Hutt City Council, you'll be rewarded with a career that you enjoy and can take real pride in. Bring your passion to make a difference, along with your commitment to co-create positive outcomes for the community, and we know you'll be proud to be part of our success.§Applications Close Tuesday 10 November 2020§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50818843.txt	§Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor§§Advertiser: §McLaren Associates Ltd - Winner SEEK Small Recruitment Agency of the Year 2019§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Solicitor §      §The Veterinary Council (VCNZ) is the regulator for Vets. They protect the public interest by registering vets, setting standards, ensuring compliance with those standards and taking action where concerns are raised.  §   § Reporting to the Registrar/Chief Executive and working closely with VCNZ’s other Solicitor, you will ensure VCNZ runs an effective, fair and timely complaints process by undertaking the day to day management of cases where concerns have been raised about veterinarians.§   § You will also take a lead role in planning and implementing continuous improvement of the complaints process and will provide legal advice to VCNZ and its staff and committees under the Registrar’s direction.§   § This is a role that will offer interesting, varied and challenging work, with a high degree of autonomy to see things through to completion. The work environment is relaxed, professional, supportive and highly collaborative and will provide an excellent opportunity for someone with an in-house legal counsel career in their sights.   §   § §Ideal Person Profile:§        §          §Excellent communication skills with the ability to produce high quality written material§          §Superior analytical and problem-solving skills§          §A self-starter with good time management and the ability to work autonomously§          §Well-developed interpersonal and relationship skills with the ability to deal with difficult situations§          §Able to demonstrate integrity and impartiality§          §Professional and displays a high level of emotional maturity§          §Flexible, with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines§          §Experience in professional regulation or working within a similar statutory process is highly desirable§          §Experience with investigations and managing a caseload is desirable§          §A law degree and eligibility to obtain a practicing certificate§        § §Applications close:§ 5pm, Wednesday 11th November 2020§ §Applications to: §Nikki Walshaw via mclaren.co.nz§ §Position description:§ Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§   § §P:§ §04 499 1069§ §E:§ §mcla@mclaren.co.nz§      §    §    §  §§§The Veterinary Council (VCNZ) is the regulator for Vets. They protect the public interest by registering vets, setting standards, ensuring compliance with those standards and taking action where concerns are raised.  §   § Reporting to the Registrar/Chief Executive and working closely with VCNZ’s other Solicitor, you will ensure VCNZ runs an effective, fair and timely complaints process by undertaking the day to day management of cases where concerns have been raised about veterinarians.§   § You will also take a lead role in planning and implementing continuous improvement of the complaints process and will provide legal advice to VCNZ and its staff and committees under the Registrar’s direction.§   § This is a role that will offer interesting, varied and challenging work, with a high degree of autonomy to see things through to completion. The work environment is relaxed, professional, supportive and highly collaborative and will provide an excellent opportunity for someone with an in-house legal counsel career in their sights.   §   § §Ideal Person Profile:§ § §Excellent communication skills with the ability to produce high quality written material§ §Superior analytical and problem-solving skills§ §A self-starter with good time management and the ability to work autonomously§ §Well-developed interpersonal and relationship skills with the ability to deal with difficult situations§ §Able to demonstrate integrity and impartiality§ §Professional and displays a high level of emotional maturity§ §Flexible, with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines§ §Experience in professional regulation or working within a similar statutory process is highly desirable§ §Experience with investigations and managing a caseload is desirable§ §A law degree and eligibility to obtain a practicing certificate§ § §Applications close:§ 5pm, Wednesday 11th November 2020§ §Applications to: §Nikki Walshaw via mclaren.co.nz§ §Position description:§ Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§   § §P:§ §04 499 1069§ §E:§ §mcla@mclaren.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50820389.txt	§Junior / Intermediate Property Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior / Intermediate Property Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Sharp Tudhope Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Sharp Tudhope Lawyers is a well-established and commercially focussed law firm.  Our practice extends widely beyond the Bay of Plenty and our professional standards, client focus, work ethic and staff training compare favourably with the best firms anywhere.§ §Tauranga is New Zealand’s fastest growing city, and a great place to live and work.§ §We are seeking a full-time property lawyer with some good experience (up to 4 years PQE) to join our busy property division.  This is an opportunity for a smart and clear-thinking property lawyer to gain further experience in a busy and fun environment in Tauranga City.  § §You will be dealing with commercial, industrial and rural property, subdivisions, development, leasing and transactional work for a large range of organisations, individuals and families. § §Working closely with experienced partners, you will be willing to absorb knowledge and improve your legal skills.  We’re looking for someone who is really bright and switched on, who can think and write clearly and is keen to learn.§ §If you are practical, a reader, and interested in people, we want to hear from you.§ §Our clients are kind, smart and fun to work with.§ §This is a great opportunity to further your career in a leading Tauranga law firm with varied and interesting work.§ §Applications close 13 November 2020.  Please include your academic transcript with your application. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50830160.txt	§Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Decipher Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor §    §    §      §        §Provide commercial & corporate legal advice §        §Use your legal mind and service focus to contribute as a subject matter expert §        §Join a team that works organisation-wide on dynamic & complex commercial matters §      §      §        §About the Company§        §Ōtākaro Limited was created in 2016 following the disestablishment of CERA, the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority. Originally Ōtākaro was a finite-life Crown company created to meet the Government’s post-quake commitments to central Christchurch which included the construction of the Crown-led anchor projects: the Convention Centre, Metro Sports Facility, the Avon Precinct programme, the East Frame residential area and several roading projects.§        §Rather than wind down Ōtākaro upon the completion of these projects, the Government sees value in having a Crown entity that can manage or have oversight of publicly funded or supported projects and has recently removed its end-date. Already the Government has given Ōtākaro oversight of the Canterbury Shovel Ready projects that have been designed to stimulate the COVID-hit economy.  §        §An innovative and achievement-oriented organisation, Ōtākaro has delivered exceptional results against objectives and has made a real mark on the regeneration and betterment of Christchurch. As an employer, Ōtākaro is highly supportive, providing wellbeing initiatives and professional development opportunities to ensure that its people are well looked after both professionally and personally.§        §The current Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor is about to take a period of parental leave and we need a self-starting, fast learner to join the term in her absence. Interested to join this supportive, innovative and valuable organisation?  §        §About the Opportunity§        §Reporting to the General Manager Legal and Risk, the Commercial and Corporate Legal Advisor provides commercial and corporate legal input in identifying, assessing and mitigating legal risk across the organisation and ensures that appropriate and timely legal advice is provided to Ōtākaro leaders to support and progress their commercial objectives. In doing this, the Legal Advisor will:§        §          §draft, review and advise on a wide range of commercial contracts,§          §assist with contract negotiation,§          §provide input into management of dispute resolution and litigation issues,§          §support the General Manager Legal and Riskin procuring external legal advice as necessary,§        §        §This is a diverse and hands-on legal role that requires a quick learner and is a supportive team member. Flexible hours are welcome.  Sound like you?§        §About You§        §To be successful as the Commercial and Corporate Legal Advisor, you will be a solicitor qualified to practice in New Zealand and have proven experience in advising on commercial, construction and corporate law matters.  You will come armed with experience in the drafting and administering of contracts and ideally knowledge of procurement law.  A collaborative team member with exceptional communication skills, you will enjoy supporting your colleagues to achieve their objectives.  You will be a natural problem solver and will combine your legal expertise with pragmatism and commercial nous to provide advice and workable solutions.§        §In return, you will have the opportunity to drive your career forward within this highly supportive employer while you contribute to the enhancement of our city. Ready?  §        §How to apply§        §For a copy of the position description visit the Decipher Group website on www.deciphergroup.co.nz/current-vacancies/corporate-and-commercial-legal-advisor/§        §To discover more about Ōtākaro Limited, visit www.otakaroltd.co.nz§        §For a confidential discussion about the role; contact Katy Erikson on 027 278 2860 or email §katy@deciphergroup.co.nz§.§        §Applications close§: Monday 9th November 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Company§ §Ōtākaro Limited was created in 2016 following the disestablishment of CERA, the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority. Originally Ōtākaro was a finite-life Crown company created to meet the Government’s post-quake commitments to central Christchurch which included the construction of the Crown-led anchor projects: the Convention Centre, Metro Sports Facility, the Avon Precinct programme, the East Frame residential area and several roading projects.§ §Rather than wind down Ōtākaro upon the completion of these projects, the Government sees value in having a Crown entity that can manage or have oversight of publicly funded or supported projects and has recently removed its end-date. Already the Government has given Ōtākaro oversight of the Canterbury Shovel Ready projects that have been designed to stimulate the COVID-hit economy.  § §An innovative and achievement-oriented organisation, Ōtākaro has delivered exceptional results against objectives and has made a real mark on the regeneration and betterment of Christchurch. As an employer, Ōtākaro is highly supportive, providing wellbeing initiatives and professional development opportunities to ensure that its people are well looked after both professionally and personally.§ §The current Corporate and Commercial Legal Advisor is about to take a period of parental leave and we need a self-starting, fast learner to join the term in her absence. Interested to join this supportive, innovative and valuable organisation?  § §About the Opportunity§ §Reporting to the General Manager Legal and Risk, the Commercial and Corporate Legal Advisor provides commercial and corporate legal input in identifying, assessing and mitigating legal risk across the organisation and ensures that appropriate and timely legal advice is provided to Ōtākaro leaders to support and progress their commercial objectives. In doing this, the Legal Advisor will:§ § §draft, review and advise on a wide range of commercial contracts,§ §assist with contract negotiation,§ §provide input into management of dispute resolution and litigation issues,§ §support the General Manager Legal and Riskin procuring external legal advice as necessary,§ §This is a diverse and hands-on legal role that requires a quick learner and is a supportive team member. Flexible hours are welcome.  Sound like you?§ §About You§ §To be successful as the Commercial and Corporate Legal Advisor, you will be a solicitor qualified to practice in New Zealand and have proven experience in advising on commercial, construction and corporate law matters.  You will come armed with experience in the drafting and administering of contracts and ideally knowledge of procurement law.  A collaborative team member with exceptional communication skills, you will enjoy supporting your colleagues to achieve their objectives.  You will be a natural problem solver and will combine your legal expertise with pragmatism and commercial nous to provide advice and workable solutions.§ §In return, you will have the opportunity to drive your career forward within this highly supportive employer while you contribute to the enhancement of our city. Ready?  § §How to apply§ §For a copy of the position description visit the Decipher Group website on www.deciphergroup.co.nz/current-vacancies/corporate-and-commercial-legal-advisor/§ §To discover more about Ōtākaro Limited, visit www.otakaroltd.co.nz§ §For a confidential discussion about the role; contact Katy Erikson on 027 278 2860 or email §katy@deciphergroup.co.nz§.§ §Applications close§: Monday 9th November 2020§§§§

You’ll be developing long term relationships with clients and working within a busy, dynamic and collaborative team of high achievers dedicated to excellence and client service.§        §Responsibilities will include:§        §          §Trust administration management including compliance of existing and new trusts in line with the Trusts Act 2019§          §Manage trustee company obligations in providing administrative services for the company's trusteeships§          §AML compliance work§          §Companies office compliance§          §General administration tasks§        §        §This role will suit someone with the following background / experience / qualities:§        §          §Suitably qualified, organised and driven§          §3+ years administration experience ideally within a legal environment§          §Preferably some experience using ConnectWorks or a similar package§          §Outstanding written and verbal communication skills§          §Proactive, always thinking ahead and demonstrating a high level of initiative§          §Attention to detail and a love of creating and using existing and new processes§        §        §About the company:§        §Our client is locally owned and has been in business for 30 years, starting as a farm focused accountancy firm, servicing the community and its industries. jobTitle: Commercial & Property Lawyer | Senior Associate Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50829950.txt	§Commercial & Property Lawyer | Senior Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial & Property Lawyer | Senior Associate§§Advertiser: §McLeod Duminy Careers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Commercial & Property Lawyer | Senior Associate §      §        §A well-regarded and successful mid-sized firm, with a large and diverse client base of SME businesses locally and across the country. They have remained busy and the departure of a Senior Associate has opened a great opportunity to join their impressive team. They are a friendly, approachable and down-to-earth bunch and are well-known for producing good quality work for their clients and providing a supportive culture for their employees to thrive.§        §Their commercial and property team hopes to find a safe pair of hands who can hit the ground running. It is a large team headed by two partners, and they need someone who is comfortable with taking the lead with clients and working autonomously. jobTitle: Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours) Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50822323.txt	§Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours)§§Advertiser: §Otago Southland Employers' Association§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§The Otago Southland Employers Association (OSEA) wants to appoint a Lawyer/Human Resources professional to join their existing team, based anywhere in the Otago/Southland Region.§The Company:§The Otago Southland Employers’ Association (OSEA) is a membership-based organisation, to support employers to be sustainable, skilled, through advocacy and leadership in best practice. OSEA provides tailored and specialist support and training around Employment Law, Health and Safety and Professional Development to organisations in Otago, Southland and the Lakes district.  §The objective of the organisation is to give members easy access to quality, reliable and accurate support in their daily business, assisting them to make good business decisions, develop and manage their staff and improve their systems and processes ensuring that they are compliant across all areas.§The Role:§We are open to expressions of interest from suitable candidates who are seeking either full-time or part-time work looking for a contract or permanent opportunity. §This role will suit a lawyer or Human Resources professional with a keen interest in supporting employers with their employment relations.§This role is to complement the existing legal team at the organisation to support members as more businesses need legal assistance and advice in their daily operations in the current post-covid economy. §Daily requirements of the role will include providing advice and direct support to employers in keeping with current legislation and best practice across a range of both compliance needs and employment processes including, disciplinary, performance management, restructuring and redundancy.  Attendance at mediation and Authority Investigations will also be expected of the role.§We also undertake employment relations training including changes in legislation and employee management best practice. The position would suit someone from a variety of legal or HR backgrounds with sound practical employment law experience.§We are open to considering applicants on a part time or full-time basis located either in Otago or Southland the geographical coverage of the membership base.  §The Person:§You will have a collaborative approach and experience in dealing with collective bargaining, employment law issues, and confidence delivering seminars and training sessions. You will have at least three years’ experience in law or Human Resources. §A self-starter, with a strong and resilient nature, able to manage client relations both face to face and remotely. Someone with exceptional organisational skills, who is thorough in their approach and has extremely good attention to detail. This person will be professional and calm, with a warm and friendly nature and active listening skills. As an emotionally intelligent individual you will support clients through often challenging situations offering a firm hand to hold every step of the way, this approach will come naturally to you.§OSEA members range from all walks of life, so this person needs to be able to relate to people from diverse backgrounds and have the ability to ‘speak their language’ making each member that they work with feel they truly are understood and can have complete faith and trust in the process at hand, whatever it may be.§To apply please send your resume and covering letter outlining your experience in the above attributes to: §executive.assistant@osea.org.nz§ [link removed] or call in confidence on §03 456 1806§. §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50828761.txt	§Senior Property Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Property Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Sharp Tudhope Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§The role and the firm§ §Sharp Tudhope Lawyers is a well-established and commercially focussed law firm.  Our practice extends widely beyond the Bay of Plenty and our professional standards, client focus, work ethic and staff training compare favourably with the best firms anywhere. § §We have a very successful property team involved in a range of matters including development work, subdivisions, sales and dispositions of commercial property, leasing and general asset planning work for a range of clients from first home buyers to major developers.  § §We’re looking for a talented senior property solicitor to join our ranks to keep up with client demand in our busy practice and help lead us into the future!  If you’re someone who is keen to carve out a long-term future in the Bay of Plenty, we’d love to hear from you.  Not only will you get great quality work, but you’ll also be part of a friendly and supportive team environment where you’ll feel valued and at home.§ §What you’ll bring§ §You’ll need to have at least 5 years post qualification property law experience at a well-regarded firm or firms and ideally experience across the following areas: conveyancing (residential and commercial), leasing, subdivisions, trusts and wills. § §Key to your success will be your proven track record of experience, your passion for property, commercial attitude, initiative and excellent communication skills.§ §You’ll be highly motivated with a strong work ethic of course and happy to lead a team (though you don’t need to have done this before).  You’ll be able to work autonomously on most files, with partners on hand for more complex matters.   You’ll also need to reflect our values of Quality, Integrity, Responsiveness and Teamwork.     § §What you’ll get§ § §True succession planning advancement path over the next few years.§ §The benefits of working within the national Lawlink group of law firms.§ §Stimulating and interesting work, with plenty of client contact, in a supportive culture.§ §Beautiful modern office environment. § §We can’t think of a better firm for a switched-on property lawyer to consider joining.§ §If this sounds like you, please apply by email to HR Manager Georgia Swney (§georgias@st.co.nz§) or ring §0274 214 302§ for more details.§ § § § § § § § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Conveyancing Lawyer/ Legal Executive Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50834276.txt	§Conveyancing Lawyer/ Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Conveyancing Lawyer/ Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §Legal Associates§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§§About the business§ § §September, 2020, Legal Associates gladly celebrated their 6th Anniversary with reaching a family of more than 6000 happy customers.§ §Legal Associates was formed by Raj and Ashima Singh in September 2014. Raj and Ashima, both from migrant backgrounds; identified a need for specialised legal services and legal education among migrant communities.§ §There was a lack of awareness around legal responsibilities, obligations and rights which created a gap between migrant communities and their ability to smoothly transition into settling in New Zealand.§ §Since then, Legal Associates has identified as a firm which truly understands the concerns of many migrants and local community members. It's staff and its solicitors hold a zeal for solutions and are able to transcend cultural and language barriers to provide quality legal advice to its clients.§ §The firm prides itself in its diverse team from 13 different ethnicities out of which 9 of our lawyers works in the core immigration domain which reflects the ever-changing and multicultural landscape of New Zealand. The journey so far has been rewarding and Raj and Ashima only have their clients, business partners and wider community to thank for their success.§ §Giving back to the community has always been an important part of the work done at Legal Associates which is why the firm has sponsored many community events and trusts.§ § §Principal Responsibilities§ § § § §Provide advice on Conveyancing, Subdivision, Commercial law/ Wills & Trusts;§Maintaining Conveyancing/ Commercial Law / Wills & Trusts matter or files;§Sub Division property work§Preparing, drafting & analysing, and interpreting a variety of legal documents;§Work as a senior solicitor§Preparing legal submissions for commercial Law/ Wills & Trusts;§Interviewing clients to determine the nature of issues;§Receiving written information concerning cases from legal professionals and clients;§Experience in forming various kinds of trusts like Family Trust, Charitable Trust, Asset Protection Trust, special needs Trusts; irrevocable/ Construction trusts, advising and providing information regarding trusts to clients, maintenance of trusts§ § §Benefits and perks§ §Flexible working hours§Regular Team outings § § §Skills and experience§ § §Minimum 1 Year work experience required in the field of Conveyancing.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50819581.txt	§Practice Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager§§Advertiser: §Wilson McKay§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Practice Management§§§§§§This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced practice manager to join a boutique law firm in Remuera.§We provide a highly professional, yet friendly, environment and the work is high quality, interesting and challenging.§Your role§Management of the daily financial transactions (working alongside external accountants) including reconciliation, payments, debt recovery, and reporting), plus all aspects of legal compliance;§Human resources including recruitment, performance management, appraisals, job descriptions and payroll;§Overseeing the firm’s systems, processing and administrative support staff including workflow management;§IT requirements;§Facilities management;§Overseeing compliance for the Anti-money Laundering and Countering Financing of Terrorism legislation.§Ideally, you'll be an experienced practice manager with a solid track record within a reputable law firm, but solid accountancy experienced practice managers from within a professional services business could also be acceptable. You will need the  ability to manage multi-faceted responsibilities including accounts/compliance, people management, human resources, facilities, administration and business development.§You will need to possess exceptional co-ordination and communication skills and proven skills in motivating staff and dealing with suppliers as well as supporting clients.   Accounts experience is an advantage as is knowledge of management systems and compliance/AML.§The firm offers the opportunity to become a pivotal part of the practice, working collaboratively with the partners and staff, and making this role your own. It is big enough to boast a social and well funded work culture, but also of a size where your work genuinely makes a difference.§ § § §About the role§ § § §You will be supporting three partners directly in all aspects of property law, managing a residential and commercial caseload for individuals and SME's.§ §The variety is huge, as you will also follow through on the generated private client matters such as trusts and wills, plus assist with business sales, leasing and a range of commercial agreements. The partners all have extensive experience and connections in this sector across NZ and as such the quality of work is very good relative to other firms of this size.§ §Work is allocated on a relatively non-hierarchical basis compared to other firms which means you can get runs on the  board much quicker.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Competitive salary package is negotiable based on experience - plus extra perks§WFH and flexi-working options available§Fully funded professional development investment§Genuine pathway for growth within the team§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Likely 2-4+ years relevant experience, can be in any type/size of NZ firm§Must enjoy variety and have superb commercial acumen§Ideally someone looking for a longer term progression pathway§Social people with a busy life outside of work will thrive§ § § §Register your interest§ §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50823077.txt	§Intermediate Level Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Level Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Duncan Cotterill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Intermediate Level Solicitor / Senior Solicitor §    §      §        §3 - 4 years PQE, Property / Commercial team Wellington§        §As a full-service law firm with a national presence, Duncan Cotterill occupies a unique position in the Wellington legal market; delivering quality legal advice and exceptional value to our clients who include leading private and public sector organisations and high net worth individuals.§        §We have an excellent opportunity for an intermediate level solicitor or senior solicitor to join our successful and busy Wellington Property / Commercial team. This is a new role due to an increase in workflows and a growing team.§        §Ideally, you will have 3 - 4 years' experience and interest and background in property, subdivisions, conveyancing, commercial leases and the general needs of individuals and private clients. In this role, you will be working alongside our clients advising in small business, commercial and property transactions. We're looking for someone who can pick up a file and run it confidently and autonomously but collaborate with the team where necessary on the more complicated matters.§        §You'll be a team player, but keen to fulfil your own potential. You'll be good with people, show initiative and be proactive enough to jump to and respond to situations as they arise.§        §This is a great opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career, an opportunity to be exposed to a challenging level of work; whilst working in a fun, fast-paced and rewarding environment.§        § If this sounds like you, please apply by email to Anne-Marie Way, Senior HR Advisor with your CV, transcript and cover letter to §careers@duncancotterill.com§§      §    §    §To Apply§    §    §careers.duncancotterill.com§  §§§3 - 4 years PQE, Property / Commercial team Wellington§ §As a full-service law firm with a national presence, Duncan Cotterill occupies a unique position in the Wellington legal market; delivering quality legal advice and exceptional value to our clients who include leading private and public sector organisations and high net worth individuals.§ §We have an excellent opportunity for an intermediate level solicitor or senior solicitor to join our successful and busy Wellington Property / Commercial team. This is a new role due to an increase in workflows and a growing team.§ §Ideally, you will have 3 - 4 years' experience and interest and background in property, subdivisions, conveyancing, commercial leases and the general needs of individuals and private clients. In this role, you will be working alongside our clients advising in small business, commercial and property transactions. We're looking for someone who can pick up a file and run it confidently and autonomously but collaborate with the team where necessary on the more complicated matters.§ §You'll be a team player, but keen to fulfil your own potential. You'll be good with people, show initiative and be proactive enough to jump to and respond to situations as they arise.§ §This is a great opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career, an opportunity to be exposed to a challenging level of work; whilst working in a fun, fast-paced and rewarding environment.§ § If this sounds like you, please apply by email to Anne-Marie Way, Senior HR Advisor with your CV, transcript and cover letter to §careers@duncancotterill.com§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50819811.txt	§Property Solicitor (4 years PQE) /Legal Executive (6 years PQE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Solicitor (4 years PQE) /Legal Executive (6 years PQE)§§Advertiser: §SRB Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Saunders Robinson Brown is a prominent Canterbury Law firm that has been providing valued advice and building strong relationships with our clients for the last 20 years.§ §We are looking for a Solicitor with a minimum of four years of property law experience or a Legal Executive with a minimum of six years of property law experience to join our thriving property team. We work with a broad range of clients including individuals, small and medium sized businesses, property developers and farming clients.  Our team currently consists of three partners, one consultant,  three solicitors and two legal executives and we need another team member to assist our clients and growth of the team.§ §You will be a qualified lawyer or legal executive and provide support to the Property team. You will be involved with a broad range of property transactions from residential conveyancing, financing arrangements, subdivisions and general property matters.  You will work with existing clients with a view to developing those relationships and delivering an excellent customer experience.§ §A large part of this role will be supervising juniors and members of the team, providing support and solutions on complex matters.§ §Professionalism and strong time management skills are essential for this role. You will have a proven track record of excellence in your field. You will have a good knowledge of residential New Zealand Property Law, Landonline, Companies Office procedures and Webforms. You will also need excellent communication skills with both clients and the team, a high level of administration skills, a quality focus, attention to detail and a genuine and motivated desire to provide excellent client service.§ §In return we provide a supportive environment, and a great opportunity to grow your legal experience. Our culture is one which is inclusive, respectful and encourages teamwork and collaboration.   § §If you are interested in this position, please send your CV and academic transcript to §vacancies@srblaw.co.nz§. jobText: TXT/50857679.txt	§Legal Administrator - Criminal Law Firm§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Administrator - Criminal Law Firm§§Advertiser: §Bloem & Associates§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Do you enjoy a fast-paced professional environment?  Are you highly organised and you meet deadlines?§ §We take our role as defence lawyers very seriously; we do everything we can to ensure our clients are well represented and where possible avoid a conviction.§ §Our team of seven needs a dependable, focused person to support us with administrative and receptionist tasks.§ §You must have at least five years of administrative experience in a professional setting and be highly competent in office Microsoft Applications such as word, excel and Outlook.§ §Tasks include;§ §Requesting or supplying information from internal or external parties§Printing and collating or updating legal files§Preparing Disclosure§Uploading documents into our practice management software§A variety of administrative tasks§Invoicing§Client liaison, explaining the next steps in the legal process §You will also be updating clients them on the progress of their case§Client correspondence§Managing funding requests from Legal aid§ § § §This full-time role is full time and is based in Albany, if this sounds like the role for you, please apply with your CV and a cover letter explaining how you can bring what we need to this position.§ §You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this position§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Registrar - Wellington Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50865087.txt	§Registrar - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Registrar - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§The Waitangi Tribunal is a permanent commission of inquiry charged with making recommendations on claims brought by Maori relating to Tiriti o Waitangi. It holds a unique place in the New Zealand constitutional framework.§The Ministry of Justice is looking for a Registrar / Kairēhita to provide technical expertise and leadership in support of the Tribunals work.§The Tribunal is supported in its work by the Ministry of Justice whose support includes:§§Registering claims§Conducting and analysing research liaising with external claimant parties§Drafting reports§§ §§Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§Experience working with judiciary and a commitment to further develop your knowledge in Te Reo Maori will be an advantage.§To be successful in this role you will have:§§A well-developed understanding of Tribunal jurisprudence§Proven leadership skills, particularly in developing the capability of others§Experience working with Maori groups and organisations§A sound track record in supporting and implementing changes to business and work processes§A Bachelor of Laws degree§Well-developed organisational, strategic planning and writing skills§Excellent interpersonal skills which will enable you to establish relationships and work effectively with a range of teams.§§ §§Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on 14 October 2020§MOJ/1484785§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§
