jobText: TXT/50844231.txt	§Solicitor - Part-Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor - Part-Time§§Advertiser: §Auckland Disability Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Do you want to make a difference as a lawyer?  §Do you want to work in a supportive community setting?  §Auckland Disability Law (ADL) has an exciting opportunity for you in our part-time Solicitor role.  §  §This Solicitor role delivers disability related legal services to ADL’s clients and activities within the disability community and legal sector.  The role will:§Provide casework services to Disabled and Deaf People§Undertake legal education work§Contribute to ADL’s law reform programme and legal information projects.§We would love to hear from you if you have:§A legal qualification with up to six years’ experience in law.§Experience of working with Disabled clients, and/or§ §knowledge of the Disability and Deaf communities, cultures and issues.§A strong commitment to, and strategic understanding of, social justice issues, with an interest in working in the areas of disability and human rights.§Demonstrated experience of advocacy, particularly within one or more of these areas: disability, human rights, employment and/or family law.§Well-developed planning, problem solving, analytical, group facilitation plus verbal and written communication skills. §Able to demonstrate empathy when working with ADL’s clients around their issues.§Hold or be eligible to hold a current practicing certificate.§ §ADL’s Solicitor role is a permanent part-time position of 22.5 hours per week.  This role has a national focus as well as works across the Auckland region.  Our offices are currently based in Mangere Town Centre, Auckland. §ADL is a community law centre (CLC).  We are the only CLC in Aotearoa New Zealand which solely works with Disabled and Deaf People, and the disability community, around disability related legal issues.  § §To submit an application, please provide a covering letter describing why you are the best person for this role and a CV which highlights the skills, experience and qualifications you have for the Solicitor (Part-time) role.  Please provide both as Word documents. §For the job description contact Preetha Suresh 09-257-5140 or §preetha.suresh@adl.org.nz§.  §Send your application to Sue Plowman at §sue.plowman@adl.org.nz§ or Auckland Disability Law, PO Box 43-201, Mangere, Auckland.  §Applications close at 5pm on Friday 20 November 2020.   §§§§

jobText: TXT/50838692.txt	§Legal Clerk/Graduate role - Employment Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Clerk/Graduate role - Employment Law§§Advertiser: §Gaze Burt§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§This is a rare entry-level opportunity to join a progressive law firm with a reputation for its close-knit team environment.§ §We are looking for a special someone with a passion for employment law to fill a busy entry-level role based in our CBD office.§ §Our high performing lawyers need efficiency, competence, flexibility, and most of all a great attitude from their new law clerk/junior solicitor.§ §We need you to be able to juggle multiple priorities, use your initiative to help keep files running smoothly, and provide top quality client care and professional service. You will diligently work to present our firm in the best way possible.  Taking pride in the service provided is essential, along with having excellent communication skills and ability to relate well to people. Alignment with Gaze Burt values is a must - you need to thrive on helping others.§ §In return we offer the chance to work in a firm with a supportive environment and a well established culture of valuing staff. Our Symonds St office offers a modern, comfortable working environment. You'll receive on-going mentoring and training from our employment director and be well supported in developing your career as an employment lawyer. We're prepared to consider a start with part time hours to allow time to complete professional studies if required.§ §If this sounds like the role for you, please apply with your CV, academic transcript, and a cover letter explaining how you can bring what we need to this position.§ §You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this position. Applications will close 30 November and candidates may not be contacted until after that date.§§§§

They are now looking to hire an intermediate-level lawyer to join their firm and specialise in employment law. This is a firm with an established brand in the South-Island market and is led by an experienced partnership that cares about the development of their staff. If you want to be part of a progressive mid-sized firm that has a collaborative approach and a supportive environment then this is an opportunity you don't want to skip over.§ §The Position:§ §As an intermediate solicitor with employment experience, you will be dealing with employment-related matters, both contentious and non-contentious. Whether it be representing the employer or employee by providing advice or settling a dispute, you will have the chance to take the reins on most matters to complement your existing employment law experience. You will work with a diverse client base ranging from individuals to SMEs to large national businesses. There will be support from the partners and other seniors as well as a career path for your progression.§ §About You:§ §3+ years PQE in employment law (if employment was part of your general practice/litigation experience that will also be considered);§Experience in leading hearings and mediations;§Appearing at the Employment Relations Authority would be highly regarded (but not necessary);§Dealt with employers on restructures and drafting employment contracts as well as representing individuals across a wide variety of claims;§High standard of written and verbal communication skills.§ §Perhaps you aren't gaining as much progression in your current firm as you could be, or are interested in a diverse role at a firm that promotes career development? We have particular strengths in competition law, product liability, banking, and insolvency. We also help clients solve more personal disputes, including conflicts between trustees and over estate administration. We offer competitive remuneration along with benefits that have a positive impact on the lives of our people. At Dentons Kensington Swan, we are constantly looking to improve our employees' lives in and out of the workplace. For a confidential discussion about the role, or a copy of the position description, please contact Katy Lloyd on 021 730 632.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms, and following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We also help clients solve more personal disputes, including conflicts between trustees and over estate administration. It is actively involved in the community through a number of sporting and charitable organisations.§ § §About the role§ § §This is an opportunity to step into a warm desk, soon to be vacated for the right replacement as a matter of succession planning. That means less business development and less pressure on billables while you get comfortable in the seat.§ §You will likely lead a general practice desk focused on commercial work, property and associated private client work. From a high-level perspective you will be responsible for supervising the review of a portion of the firms trusts work.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Progression is the obvious selling point but you can also take comfort in joining a well established and highly successful firm that has a positive outlook on the changing future of legal practice.§ §In addition, the firm is renowned for paying competitively and there are a number of additional perks, no less than a large and comfortable CBD office.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §You will be a proven performer, likely with knowledge of the local market but quite possibly relocating to Dunedin. § §An expertise in Trusts & Estates, Commercial/Residential Property and Commercial advisory will all be useful.§ §The role will suit someone who is able to operate with autonomy and as such will likely have a number of years of private practice experience.§ §A client centric approach, affinity to community and a social personality will fit well.§ §Register your interest§ §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. You’ll be acting for a range of clients, from individuals, small and large businesses, to multi-national insurance corporations.§ §        §At this level you can expect plenty of responsibility and autonomy on files, client contact as well as delegating to and mentoring junior team members. To be successful in this role, you will need a solid commercial litigation base with experience in insurance and/or insolvency matters.  A client following will be looked upon favourably but is not a deal breaker for someone with the right mix of experience.§ § §Overall, the firm has a friendly and down-to-earth culture. jobText: TXT/50860530.txt	§Commercial Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Henderson Reeves Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§About the business§ § §An established Northland firm with a history dating back four decades, Henderson Reeves may be long-lived, but is anything but traditional.  We have a staff of 65, mostly based in our Whangarei office.  This position is in our fast-growing Auckland team based in Kingsland.§ §Our people are very important to us.  We pride ourselves on having a great culture and being great employers.§ § §About the role§ § §We are looking for a qualified solicitor with at least two years' experience. Your main responsibilities will include:§ §Supporting senior lawyers by providing advice and managing conveyancing transactions from go to whoa with an emphasis on off-the-plans and land and build agreements.  You will need to explain complicated agreements in plain English in a friendly and supportive way.  You will be working with a mixture of first home buyers, first time investors and repeat clients.§Advising clients on wills, powers of attorney and trusts.§The opportunity to step up and build your own client base.§Working with the team to execute marketing initiatives.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Great team culture - really motivated people with a non-traditional attitude§ §Mobile phone§ §Good training and support§ §Work from home options available§ § §Skills and experience§ § §For this role you will need:§ §A comprehensive knowledge of property law§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §Effective practice management skills§ §A commitment to do the best job for your client§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a commercial lawyer?§§§

producing client documentation, corresponding with clients, producing invoices and statements; scheduling appointments and meetings; and maintaining digital files. § §Your strengths will be:§ § §Strong Microsoft Word document management and editing skills§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Ability to prioritise, multi-task, and complete tasks efficiently and effectively§ §Willingness to go above and beyond for clients§ §Positive attitude and ability to be calm under pressure§ §Previous legal support experience is essential.  The role is offered on either a full-time or part-time basis.§ §We believe that delivering outstanding service starts with a healthy team culture and we prioritise making GQ a great place to work.§ § §We promote a healthy work-life balance and focus on wellbeing§ §We are committed to helping our team continuously improve through training and exposure to high quality and varied work§ §We collaborate across teams and projects and leverage the skills and experience of each other§ §We endorse new technology and are making gains towards becoming a digital practice§ §We support and encourage community connection§ §If you would like to discuss the opportunity and GQ experience, please submit your cover letter and CV in confidence to our HR Coordinator kirsten.dawson@gqlaw.nz by 9 November 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience operating digital dictation devices?§Do you have secretarial experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50849144.txt	§International Legal Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§International Legal Adviser§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Foreign Affairs & Trade§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §International Legal Adviser §    §    §      §        §          §            §              §Fixed term 3 year contract or secondment; option for 12 months§              §Support New Zealand's trade priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§              §Take an active role in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time§            §            §The Legal Division in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade is looking to hire experienced legal advisers to contribute to New Zealand's trade and economic growth agenda. This is a fixed term 3 year contract or secondment while our current staff member is posted offshore. We would also like to hear expressions of interest from you if you are interested in a shorter fixed term 12 month contract or secondment.§            §Mō mātou - About us§            §Our people represent New Zealand on and offshore, and in doing so make New Zealanders safer and more prosperous. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§            §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§            §Reporting to the Manager of the Trade Law Unit, these roles provide legal and policy analysis that supports New Zealand's trade priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§            §You will be actively involved in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time due to the impacts of COVID-19, the numerous negotiations under way, the challenges facing the international rules-based system and an increasing number of issues at the interface of domestic law and international trade law.§            §The successful candidate or candidates will need to have appropriate legal qualifications (including the professional legal studies course) and at least 3 years professional experience relevant to the Unit's varied trade and legal work.§            §Mā‎ wai te mahi nei? - We are looking for applicants who can:§            §              §Provide timely, strategically sound and accurate legal analysis drawing on relevant jurisprudence where appropriate in support of our trade agenda.§              §Contribute to and lead certain aspects of the negotiations of international trade agreements.§              §Contribute to the Unit's international litigation work as necessary.§              §Demonstrate strong planning and organising skills with proven success delivering results.§              §Work under pressure and meet deadlines.§              §Exercise sound judgement, an openness to learning and a collaborative approach to problem solving.§            §            §Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply§            §We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer, we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§            §You must be able to obtain and maintain an appropriate NZ Government Security clearance.§            §For a confidential discussion please email Jo McKeagg at §jo.mckeagg@mfat.govt.nz§          §          §          §        §      §    §  §§§Fixed term 3 year contract or secondment; option for 12 months§Support New Zealand's trade priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§Take an active role in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time§The Legal Division in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade is looking to hire experienced legal advisers to contribute to New Zealand's trade and economic growth agenda. This is a fixed term 3 year contract or secondment while our current staff member is posted offshore. We would also like to hear expressions of interest from you if you are interested in a shorter fixed term 12 month contract or secondment.§Mō mātou - About us§Our people represent New Zealand on and offshore, and in doing so make New Zealanders safer and more prosperous. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§Reporting to the Manager of the Trade Law Unit, these roles provide legal and policy analysis that supports New Zealand's trade priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§You will be actively involved in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time due to the impacts of COVID-19, the numerous negotiations under way, the challenges facing the international rules-based system and an increasing number of issues at the interface of domestic law and international trade law.§The successful candidate or candidates will need to have appropriate legal qualifications (including the professional legal studies course) and at least 3 years professional experience relevant to the Unit's varied trade and legal work.§Mā‎ wai te mahi nei? - We are looking for applicants who can:§Provide timely, strategically sound and accurate legal analysis drawing on relevant jurisprudence where appropriate in support of our trade agenda.§Contribute to and lead certain aspects of the negotiations of international trade agreements.§Contribute to the Unit's international litigation work as necessary.§Demonstrate strong planning and organising skills with proven success delivering results.§Work under pressure and meet deadlines.§Exercise sound judgement, an openness to learning and a collaborative approach to problem solving.§Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply§We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer, we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§You must be able to obtain and maintain an appropriate NZ Government Security clearance.§For a confidential discussion please email Jo McKeagg at §jo.mckeagg@mfat.govt.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50846839.txt	§Chief Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Senior leadership role.§Contribute to a critical sector of our society.§Wellington or Auckland based.§The Human Rights Commission | Te Kāhui Tika Tangata promotes and protects the human rights of all people. It works for a free, fair, safe and just Aotearoa New Zealand where diversity is valued and human dignity and rights are respected. The legal team actively supports the Commissioners in the execution of their roles. §Forming part of the Leadership Team, the Chief Legal Advisor will be an experienced leader who is well informed about the work of the Commission and who demonstrates personal commitment to human rights and harmonious relations. You will lead the legal team and advise on all legal matters that relate to operational, compliance and administrative activities of the Commission. There is also a requirement to engage effectively with external stakeholders and manage relationships with Ministers, Counsel, departments, oversight bodies, international agencies and the private sector. As part of the Leadership Team, you will support and promote cultural competence in the work that Commission staff undertake and actively support the Commission’s focus on becoming a Tiriti-based organisation. §  § To be appointed as the Chief Legal Advisor, you are a qualified and current practising lawyer who has experience of leading a team. You will have a strong interest/background in human rights law as well as litigation experience, and a sound understanding of public policy. You will possess sound judgement and an ability to engage effectively with key stakeholders. Your personal values must include respect for fairness, diversity, human dignity, and integrity. An understanding of te ao Māori is also expected.   §The Human Rights Commission celebrates diversity. jobText: TXT/50847491.txt	§Chief Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Senior leadership role.§Contribute to a critical sector of our society.§Wellington or Auckland based.§The Human Rights Commission | Te Kāhui Tika Tangata promotes and protects the human rights of all people. It works for a free, fair, safe and just Aotearoa New Zealand where diversity is valued and human dignity and rights are respected. The legal team actively supports the Commissioners in the execution of their roles. §Forming part of the Leadership Team, the Chief Legal Advisor will be an experienced leader who is well informed about the work of the Commission and who demonstrates personal commitment to human rights and harmonious relations. You will lead the legal team and advise on all legal matters that relate to operational, compliance and administrative activities of the Commission. There is also a requirement to engage effectively with external stakeholders and manage relationships with Ministers, Counsel, departments, oversight bodies, international agencies and the private sector. As part of the Leadership Team, you will support and promote cultural competence in the work that Commission staff undertake and actively support the Commission’s focus on becoming a Tiriti-based organisation. §  § To be appointed as the Chief Legal Advisor, you are a qualified and current practising lawyer who has experience of leading a team. You will have a strong interest/background in human rights law as well as litigation experience, and a sound understanding of public policy. You will possess sound judgement and an ability to engage effectively with key stakeholders. Your personal values must include respect for fairness, diversity, human dignity, and integrity. An understanding of te ao Māori is also expected.   §The Human Rights Commission celebrates diversity. We welcome applications from tangata whenua, disabled people, and from people with diverse ethnic, cultural and religious backgrounds.§APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Wednesday, 18 November 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  BH-7502§  § §FURTHER ENQUIRIES:§ Simon Boyes on §04 550 8000§§§§

jobText: TXT/50844412.txt	§Lawyer (relationship property)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer (relationship property)§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§About us:§WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. WRMK was also recently named a finalist in three categories at the NZ Law Awards, to be announced in November. jobText: TXT/50856184.txt	§Assistant Manager Resources Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Manager Resources Law§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$108,717 - $134,297 includes 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §Assistant Manager Resources Law §    §      §        §What you will do §        §Reporting to the Manager Resources Law, you will be part of a high-performing team of military and civilian lawyers based in Wellington. You will be providing timely, accurate and effective legal advice to maintain NZDF's legal reputation, minimise legal risk and ensure legal compliance. §        §A normal day for an Assistant Manager will involve: §        §          §Advising on commercial contractual documents including procurement processes and the negotiation, drafting and approval of a range of significant commercial contracts;§          §Advising on employment matters including individual and collective negotiations and workplace investigations;§          §Managing employment relationship problems including representing NZDF at mediations and Employment Relations Authority hearings;§          §Advising on legislative compliance, including matters related to Health and Safety, public works and public finance;§          §Advising on matters relating to the Defence Estate;§          §The conduct of civil litigation involving the NZDF;§          §Mentoring of junior lawyers. §        §        §What we need §        §Our ideal applicant will have an understanding of Government procurement policies, exceptional communications skills, and the ability to build effective relationships as well as a high level of discretion and confidence. You will be experienced in negotiating and drafting commercial contracts and have knowledge of relevant statute and common law. You may also be comfortable working with complex employment matters, including appearing at mediations and before the Employment Relations Authority. §        §You will have at least three years post admission experience in employment and / or commercial law with some litigation or property exposure being advantageous; a LLB Degree and the ability to hold a practising certificate as a barrister and solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand. §        §Who we are §        §Defence Legal Services (DLS) is the in-house national legal practice of the NZDF which has offices in a range of different bases, camps and headquarters, as well as deployed officers when required. It consists of a mixture of military and civilian staff.  §        §Within Headquarters New Zealand Defence Force, Defence Legal Services is a team of legal specialists who provide strategic level legal services to CDF, the Single Services Chiefs and their staff and the other senior Defence Force personnel. The Directorate is functionally divided into Operations Law, Personnel Law and Resources Law. §        §Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §        §Why Us §        §NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances. §        §This is your opportunity to bring your passion, knowledge and experience to Defence Legal Services. In return for your knowledge, experience and drive, we can reward you with challenging opportunities working in a supportive, motivated and forward-thinking team and working environment. You’ll enjoy the chance to work with a diverse range of people in an interesting and engaging organisation. §        §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§;§          §Full time ongoing work;§          §Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year. §        §        §How to Apply §        §To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our § Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Prema McIntosh, Chief of Staff, Defence Legal Services (§prema.mcintosh@nzdf.mil.nz§).§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit. §        §Applications close on §Monday 16 November 2020§. §        §Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows: §        §Higher level Security Clearance§        §          §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§          §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do § §Reporting to the Manager Resources Law, you will be part of a high-performing team of military and civilian lawyers based in Wellington. You will be providing timely, accurate and effective legal advice to maintain NZDF's legal reputation, minimise legal risk and ensure legal compliance. § §A normal day for an Assistant Manager will involve: § § §Advising on commercial contractual documents including procurement processes and the negotiation, drafting and approval of a range of significant commercial contracts;§ §Advising on employment matters including individual and collective negotiations and workplace investigations;§ §Managing employment relationship problems including representing NZDF at mediations and Employment Relations Authority hearings;§ §Advising on legislative compliance, including matters related to Health and Safety, public works and public finance;§ §Advising on matters relating to the Defence Estate;§ §The conduct of civil litigation involving the NZDF;§ §Mentoring of junior lawyers. § §What we need § §Our ideal applicant will have an understanding of Government procurement policies, exceptional communications skills, and the ability to build effective relationships as well as a high level of discretion and confidence. You will be experienced in negotiating and drafting commercial contracts and have knowledge of relevant statute and common law. You may also be comfortable working with complex employment matters, including appearing at mediations and before the Employment Relations Authority. § §You will have at least three years post admission experience in employment and / or commercial law with some litigation or property exposure being advantageous; a LLB Degree and the ability to hold a practising certificate as a barrister and solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand. § §Who we are § §Defence Legal Services (DLS) is the in-house national legal practice of the NZDF which has offices in a range of different bases, camps and headquarters, as well as deployed officers when required. It consists of a mixture of military and civilian staff.  § §Within Headquarters New Zealand Defence Force, Defence Legal Services is a team of legal specialists who provide strategic level legal services to CDF, the Single Services Chiefs and their staff and the other senior Defence Force personnel. The Directorate is functionally divided into Operations Law, Personnel Law and Resources Law. § §Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. § §Why Us § §NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances. § §This is your opportunity to bring your passion, knowledge and experience to Defence Legal Services. In return for your knowledge, experience and drive, we can reward you with challenging opportunities working in a supportive, motivated and forward-thinking team and working environment. You’ll enjoy the chance to work with a diverse range of people in an interesting and engaging organisation. § §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§ § §Great benefits for you and your family§;§ §Full time ongoing work;§ §Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;§ §5 weeks annual leave per year. § §How to Apply § §To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our § Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Prema McIntosh, Chief of Staff, Defence Legal Services (§prema.mcintosh@nzdf.mil.nz§).§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit. § §Applications close on §Monday 16 November 2020§. § §Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows: § §Higher level Security Clearance§ § §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§ §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§ §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50844433.txt	§Construction and General Commercial Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Construction and General Commercial Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Martelli McKegg§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§We seek two ambitious, confident lawyers with at least 3 years’ PQE who aspire to become specialists in construction law.§  §We have two senior roles available in the construction law team. We require two lawyers who are determined to achieve specialisation in this particular field. One with a focus on transactional construction law and the other a construction disputes resolution lawyer.§  §The successful applicants will report to and be supervised by Martelli McKegg partner Geoff Hardy, an industry leader in construction law.§  §Our construction law practice is expanding rapidly. Approximately one third of the team’s work is transactional and the balance is dispute-related. The firm’s clients range from building firms and related organisations such as specialist subcontractors, engineers, architects, quantity surveyors, building surveyors, and building materials suppliers, through to property owners, developers and public sector organisations who are involved in construction.§  §These roles are dedicated to construction law in all its facets. We require people with a high intellect and attention to detail. A good grade average and an ability to communicate in a precise, unambiguous, intelligible manner is essential.§  §The transactional role will involve reviewing, negotiating and drafting contracts, providing advice and guidance, and solving complex problems.§  §The dispute resolution role lawyer will be required to take sole charge (under supervision) of construction disputes that are dealt with not only in the courts but also in specialist tribunals or litigation alternatives such as mediation, arbitration and adjudication under the Construction Contracts Act.§  §The successful applicants will be expected to assume primary responsibility for each matter allocated to them but at the same time will receive appropriate training, supervision and mentoring by Geoff.§  §Our clients range from small family-owned businesses and private clients through to some of the largest organisations in Australia and New Zealand. Their needs are diverse so there will always be plenty of variety in the work that you do.§  §Our professional, approachable team will offer you plenty of challenging work, good mentoring and the latest technology. Located in the exciting heart of Auckland’s CBD there is access to all types of public transport and a massive array of eateries at Commercial Bay to tempt you at lunchtime.§  §If you’re a keen construction lawyer, and see that as your chosen pathway, apply today. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

receive a $500 Westfield voucher.   §(§You will receive $500 after completing three months continuous successful employment.§)§        § §        §For more details please contact Leonie, Leo Legal solicitors at any one time.  Apply for multiple roles in one easy step and secure your new role today.§ §Role 1 – Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§ §Join this growing boutique property practice on the outskirts of Christchurch.  An experienced commercial solicitor with 2-6 years PQE is required.  Working for this young female director you will be involved in subdivisions, commercial property and business transactions together with private client work.§ §Role 2 – Solicitor§ §My clients are looking for an experienced solicitor who has commercial experience (2-4 years PQE) to join their friendly team.  An interest in or experience with resource is required.  Be supported with a key focus on continued professional development.§ §Role 3 – Senior Solicitor§ §Due to continued growth, this well-known legal practice is looking to hire a mid-level solicitor, preferably with 3-5 years PQE.  Your role will be varied - completing private client work and commercial property work.  Enjoy working in a small friendly team based in new premises.  Working for a larger full-service legal practice, you will appreciate the many technical and social advantages.§ §Role 4 – Associate/Senior Associate§ §A medium sized Christchurch legal practice is seeking an experienced commercial solicitor with at least 7+ years PQE.  Alongside the commercial partners, you be working on corporate, general commercial and business matters -  including mergers and acquisitions, together with rural and subdivision work.  You will be frequently working on large scale and complex matters.  Potential partnership prospects.§ §Role 5 – Senior Solicitor/Associate§ §Become a valued member of the commercial property team at this large Christchurch practice.  Ideally you will have had 5-8 years PQE. In this role you will be working for top quality clients completing a broad and varied range of commercial and property matters.  Experience in commercial leasing, property development and financial restructuring desirable.§ §Role 6 – Senior Solicitor/Associate§ §A new role is available to join this medium sized Christchurch legal practice in their busy commercial/corporate team.  You will be working on large scale South Island based transactions.  Ideally you will have had 4-6 years PQE and preferably specialised in corporate or commercial property.  The ability to mentor and supervise junior staff advantageous.§ §Role 7 – Senior Solicitor/Associate§ §Due to the growth of this medium sized Christchurch legal practice an experienced property solicitor is required with 4-6 years PQE.   You will have worked on large scale complex property transactions.  This legal firm are well known for their flexible working arrangements, together with offering excellent career opportunities.§ § § §All these opportunities offer:§ § §Excellent remuneration packages§ §Continuing professional development§ §Future career advancing prospects§ §And Finally, during November for commercial solicitors – Fancy a $500 Westfield bonus?  Appointments made for any of these roles, by Leo Legal Recruitment, receive a $500 Westfield voucher.   §(§You will receive $500 after completing three months continuous successful employment.§)§ § § §For more details please contact Leonie, Leo Legal Recruitment, ph 021 205 7342, §leonie@leorecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50845130.txt	§Legal Executive | Property & Conveyancing§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Executive | Property & Conveyancing§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§You're an experienced Legal Executive who has hands-on conveyancing experience and looking for a role where you can run your own files end-to-end. You are systems savvy, you win client's trust quickly and you know the conveyancing process backwards. With the property market on the rise, this is your opportunity to join a highly-regarded mid-sized law firm whose practice is consistently at the top of their game.§ §This is a comprehensive Legal Executive position that will boost your career given the type of work you'll be doing. As part of a team led by approachable property partners, you'll be assisting individuals and businesses on a variety of property transactions that will range from subdivisions to easements, residential conveyancing to development projects and refinancing arrangements. There will be an opportunity to be involved in commercial leasing arrangements and legal research as well.§ §You will ideally have:§ §More than 6 years experience as a Legal Executive (registered or have completed your Diploma pre-2017);§Experience running files from start until settlement;§Sound knowledge of relevant firm and conveyancing systems (Actionstep, Infinity, PPSR, Webforms)§Some experience in working with firm finances or accounts would be an advantage;§Excellent interpersonal skills and a strong sense of client service.§ §If you're interested in a stimulating position with exposure to lots of interesting property transactions, working for a modern law firm who appreciates their people, now is the time to consider making a move to this established Canterbury-based law firm.§ §To find out more, contact Harrison for a confidential discussion on 027 274 5926 or click 'APPLY' to send your CV and academics.§ §Thinking of relocating? Cobalt Recruitment has opportunities all across New Zealand, so if you are looking to move to another region or return from overseas, Cobalt is perfectly positioned to help you with your transition.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50861455.txt	§Legal Secretaries§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretaries§§Advertiser: §AJ Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Legal Secretaries§ § §Employer of Choice finalist (NZ Lawyer)§ §Intellectual property law firm § §Auckland CBD§ §Permanent full-time§ §AJ Park is New Zealand's largest intellectual property (IP) law firm. We help companies and individuals identify, develop, protect, commercialise, manage and enforce their IP rights in New Zealand, Australia and throughout the world. Our clients range from entrepreneurs, start-ups and SMEs, to government institutions, multinationals and major listed companies across 130 countries.§ §We're looking for two smart people with a minimum of three - four years administrative or secretarial experience to join our Patents teams, assisting senior attorneys. Legal experience is preferable, however, full training will be given to the successful candidate. You must have excellent keyboard and grammar skills and a legal right to work in New Zealand.§ §The work is varied, interesting and challenging. You will get to expand your knowledge in IP, learn what's happening in the world of technology and innovation, and gain valuable skills.§ §If you take pride in your professional approach to work,enjoy using your initiative, demonstrate excellent organisational skills and have a high attention to detail, this could be your next career move.§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural Employer of Choice report listing the 25 top-ranking legal organisations in New Zealand in terms of overall employee experience. This report celebrates employers who go beyond industry standards to provide their people with a safe and engaging working environment and showcases firms leading the way with policies and initiatives that engage their staff. We were also a finalist in the 'Employer of Choice' category of the New Zealand Law Awards 2019. We have a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme that includes a wide range of social and health activities.§ §If you would like to work in a supportive and friendly environment, take this opportunity to join our award-winning firm.§ §Please send your CV and covering letter to §careers@ajpark.com§§§§

jobText: TXT/50868107.txt	§Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Work with new and significant legislation in the Privacy sector, and expand your career in this exciting space. §    §      §Legal Advisor §      §        §We have an outstanding opportunity for a Senior Solicitor who really wants to make a difference for all New Zealanders, and be at the forefront of a continually evolving, and increasingly high profile, area of law.§        §The Office of the Privacy Commissioner is Aotearoa New Zealand’s privacy regulator – an Independent Crown Entity established to promote and protect individual privacy.  The organisation is passionate about helping people protect their privacy and NZ business protect their reputations through being privacy effective and compliant.§        §It is an exciting time of change, with the new Privacy Act 2020 coming into force on 1 December 2020.    §        §The implications of the work you will be doing affect all New Zealanders, present and future. It is fascinating work that will stimulate an intelligent legal mind, who wants to continuously learn and progress their skills.§        §You will be joining a supportive and highly collaborative organisation that has a strong focus on diversity and inclusion and is committed to upholding the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§        §We are looking for a candidate with a minimum of 5 years of relevant PQE, ideally with Privacy sector experience. The role requires a high level of statutory interpretation and attention to detail. You will need to be a savvy lawyer, ready to work on a range of issues. Experience in advising on regulatory schemes, employment law, litigation and/or judicial review, would be highly valued.  A positive and collaborative attitude are a must. The successful candidate will also need a good balance of academic and emotional intelligence.§        §This would also be an amazing opportunity for someone who has gained practical experience with the interpretation and application of GDPR or other privacy regimes, and who is looking to relocate home to Aotearoa New Zealand.§        §The role will include:§        §          §The provision of expert legal advice§          §Advising on the practical application of the new legislation§          §Working closely with the General Counsel and Privacy Commissioner§          §Assisting in litigation in the Human Rights Review Tribunal§          §Assisting in drafting and reviewing  Codes of Practice§          §Providing quality assurance for educational material and public documents§          §Collaborating across the organisation on various privacy projects§          §Promoting public awareness and understanding of Privacy related matters§        §        § §        §For a confidential discussion about this role, please contact Carl Church on §+64211666441§  carl.church@nicherecruitment.co.nz or Kerry O’Rourke on +64 210241 4308 .  If this role sounds like you click ‘Apply now’, or send your CV and Covering Letter to kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz today.§        §Role closes Wednesday, 11th November 2020§        §§      §      §      §    §  §§§We have an outstanding opportunity for a Senior Solicitor who really wants to make a difference for all New Zealanders, and be at the forefront of a continually evolving, and increasingly high profile, area of law.§  §The Office of the Privacy Commissioner is Aotearoa New Zealand’s privacy regulator – an Independent Crown Entity established to promote and protect individual privacy.  The organisation is passionate about helping people protect their privacy and NZ business protect their reputations through being privacy effective and compliant.§  §It is an exciting time of change, with the new Privacy Act 2020 coming into force on 1 December 2020.    §  §The implications of the work you will be doing affect all New Zealanders, present and future. It is fascinating work that will stimulate an intelligent legal mind, who wants to continuously learn and progress their skills.§  §You will be joining a supportive and highly collaborative organisation that has a strong focus on diversity and inclusion and is committed to upholding the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi§  §We are looking for a candidate with a minimum of 5 years of relevant PQE, ideally with Privacy sector experience. The role requires a high level of statutory interpretation and attention to detail. You will need to be a savvy lawyer, ready to work on a range of issues. Experience in advising on regulatory schemes, employment law, litigation and/or judicial review, would be highly valued.  A positive and collaborative attitude are a must. The successful candidate will also need a good balance of academic and emotional intelligence.§  §This would also be an amazing opportunity for someone who has gained practical experience with the interpretation and application of GDPR or other privacy regimes, and who is looking to relocate home to Aotearoa New Zealand.§  §The role will include:§ § §The provision of expert legal advice§ §Advising on the practical application of the new legislation§ §Working closely with the General Counsel and Privacy Commissioner§ §Assisting in litigation in the Human Rights Review Tribunal§ §Assisting in drafting and reviewing  Codes of Practice§ §Providing quality assurance for educational material and public documents§ §Collaborating across the organisation on various privacy projects§ §Promoting public awareness and understanding of Privacy related matters§ § §  §For a confidential discussion about this role, please contact Carl Church on §+64211666441§  carl.church@nicherecruitment.co.nz or Kerry O’Rourke on +64 210241 4308 .  If this role sounds like you click ‘Apply now’, or send your CV and Covering Letter to kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz today.§  §Role closes Wednesday, 11th November 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50894243.txt	§Law Clerk§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Law Clerk§§Advertiser: §Greater Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§Do you have some or all of a law degree and need some experience in a happy legal environment? Do you have some interest in contracting and commercial law? Do you have great attention to detail?§If you're available to start immediately for 12 weeks over the summer, then we have a role for you in the legal and procurement team at Greater Wellington Regional Council.§About Greater Wellington:§There's a lot more to us than meets the eye. Here at Greater Wellington Regional Council, we're working on the big things that will impact everyone in our region. Ensuring we have uninterrupted access to drinking water, staying safe from the threat of flooding, protecting and enhancing the environment, improving the quality of our fresh water, ensuring we are all connected through our public transport network and planning ahead for the potential impact of climate change across our region. We're people who are genuinely passionate about the work we do, because we believe what we do counts.§About the Role:§There are two key aspects to this role:§§Supporting the legal team to establish some precedents (draft clauses, standard agreements, customised term sheets and guidelines etc)§Doing some detective work - finding and collecting data from various contracts around the business, including on our database and in hard copy. This is to prepare for our new Contract Management System and we need great data/attention to detail here especially.§§You will be working for highly experienced legal and procurement specialists and we promise you will learn a lot - about local government, about contracting and about contract management. Plus we're great people, working in a lovely organisation, doing important work caring for Greater Wellington's environmental needs. And we're about to move into our brand new Cuba Street building!§This is a role for approximately 12 weeks, starting asap, with a break for Christmas and New Year. If you have to go back to university in February then we can work with that.§We look forward to reading your application.§How to apply:§Click on the "Apply" link to view the job description and to apply for the role with a cover letter and CV.§Applications close§: Sunday, 15 November 2020§Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa, please visit §www.immigration.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50890398.txt	§Graduate to 2 years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate to 2 years PQE§§Advertiser: §Dean & Coleman Law Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Graduate to 2 PQE§Come and discover one of New Zealand’s best kept secrets for yourself: the beautiful Waitaki region. Oamaru and the Waitaki offer natural geological marvels, historic treasures, rich culture and heritage, extraordinary natural landscapes, nationally renowned cuisine and plenty of recreational facilities for walking, biking, fishing, hunting and sports. House prices are generally much lower than the city, the standard of living is high, community spirit exists and the schools are high quality. Our busy law firm is a client focused, national award-winning regional practice providing a wide range of legal services. We are bucking the downsizing trend post COVID-19 and are experiencing growth. Visit our website www.deanlaw.co.nz for more information.§We have a role available for an graduate to 2 year PQE that entails working in the areas of:§Residential, rural and commercial conveyancing§Subdivisions and land development§Commercial, rural and registered leases§Easements, encumbrances, road stopping and infrastructure agreements§Local government acquisitions and dispositions§Resource management compliance and guidance§File management, time recording and billing§The successful applicant will be:§A multitasker;§Solution focused with strong initiative;§Accurate and have unwavering attention to detail;§Well organised, efficient and willing to go the extra mile;§Very competent with Microsoft Office and have excellent computer and typing skills;§Able to maintain and build effective relationships with staff, clients, stakeholders and directors of the firm;§An excellent verbal and written communicator; and§Able to effectively prioritise and manage a busy workload.§We can offer you:§A genuine commitment to and understanding of work/life balance;§A friendly, supportive, team focused working environment;§The opportunity to upskill and professional development;§Leading technology and systems;§A competitive salary (experience dependent);§Free parking close to our offices; and§A warm welcome to the outstanding Waitaki region in Otago.§If this sounds like the role for you, please submit your application through the SEEK portal with your CV,  academic transcript and a cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Paewai Whakaako Ngaio, Teaching Fellow Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50884742.txt	§Paewai Whakaako Ngaio, Teaching Fellow§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Paewai Whakaako Ngaio, Teaching Fellow§§Advertiser: §The University of Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Te Wāhanga Ture | Auckland Law School is currently recruiting teaching fellows to teach the Part I law course, Law and Society in 2021. In semester one (mid-February to end of June).§ §We are seeking to hire 2.0 FTE teaching fellows, however we are open to these roles being filled by people on a full-time or part-time basis.§ §Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity§ §Law and Society is an introduction to the nature, function and origins of law and explores a range of contemporary questions relating to law in its social context. The focus is on law and society in Aotearoa, including its sources of law, its institutions, and its operation historically and today. Māori concepts of law and justice, and their operation in Aotearoa’s legal system, are also addressed. § §In 2021, Law and Society students will attend lectures and workshops. The workshops will have around 50 students in them and will be taught by the professional teaching fellows. The aim of the workshops is to allow students to have an opportunity to discuss and put into practice concepts they learn in the lectures with the guidance of experienced teachers, as well as to develop academic skills. In addition to teaching the workshops, the teaching fellows will be involved with assessment, creating online content for the course, providing pre and post-assessment student workshops, responding to student queries and office hours. They may also have some opportunities to take some lectures.§ §For more detailed information, please refer to the §position description.§ §He kōrero mōu | About you§ §These positions are a wonderful opportunity for people who are interested in an academic career to get valuable teaching experience. Applications with Māori and Pasifika whakapapa and cultural awareness are particularly encouraged. Strong mentoring and support will be provided by the Law and Society teaching team throughout the duration of the fellowships.§ §To be successful in this role, you will hold an LLB/LLM and be confident in delivering engaging sessions.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou | What we offer§ §The University of Auckland (42,000 students) is New Zealand’s leading university and maintains significant computational, laboratory and analytic facilities. Auckland itself is frequently rated as one of the world’s most liveable cities. § §The University is committed to providing an excellent working environment through:§ § §Flexible employment practices We’re also about the future – exploring alternative energy sources that are sustainable, environmentally friendly and deliver New Zealand’s energy needs in a changing world.  We’re exploring all sorts of exciting possibilities that will support NZ’s low carbon energy future.§  §We are committed to creating a diverse workforce that reflects our society and a culture where people can bring their whole selves to work.  Our aim is to foster an inclusive culture which supports innovation by encouraging diversity of thought to come up with new ideas, make better decisions and ultimately become a more successful business§  §About the role§  §We're looking for a hands-on, General Counsel to lead the provision of legal advisory services and Company Secretarial responsibilities across the Firstgas group of companies.  §  §In this sole-charge role, you'll work closely with the Executive Team, Directors, Senior Managers and staff across all divisions within Firstgas Group; as well as manage our external legal support.§  §Our people work within an atmosphere where autonomy, teamwork and flexibility complements the interesting work environment.  We're all about the lifestyle too - we've been working flexibly for years, around our childcare, sporting and volunteering commitments. §  §Our Head office is in Bell Block, however this role could be based there or our Wellington central office.§  §It would be great if you have:§ § §The ability to communicate and work with a range of people, in a conscientious and inclusive way§ §Well-developed commercial acumen with strong operational experience and ability to contribute to a wide range of corporate and commercial activities§ §LLB degree, with 10+ years post qualification experience§ §A valid practicing certificate§ §What we offer:§  §Firstgas Group offers a culture that embraces productivity and integrity, encourages proactive thinking and rewards achievement. On offer is an exciting role within a dynamic company. Grow your career in an environment that places high emphasis on staff development and well being. There is simply so much potential here - for our business and for your career.  So, make great things happen now by applying here today!§  §Applications Close: 19 November 2020§§§§

The second part is providing advice on a variety of employment issues which often include matters that are on a sophisticated level.  And the third part is contentious matters which involve a range of employment disputes.  The partner previously worked on matters going all the way to the Supreme Court so this is truly a great opportunity for someone who wants to learn from the best.  As part of the Dispute Resolution team, there could also be the opportunity to work with some of the other dispute resolution partners from time-to-time on a broader range of disputes. §        §The opportunity is with a national law firm that is attracting top talent which is not surprising as the firm offers the full package including good quality work, strong career development and advancement opportunities.  The role will suit a solicitor with 3+ years’ experience accompanied with good academics and who can show a genuine interest to become an employment law specialist.§  §        §For more information please contact Christina Kruger on 027 293 7210 or email §christina@mcleodduminy.co.nz§§        §McLeod Duminy Careers is a specialist legal recruitment firm.  For a full list of our vacancies, please see our website: www.mcleodduminy.co.nz§      §    §  §§§An opportunity to work with one of New Zealand’s leading employment lawyers and it even gets better.  In addition to having a wealth of experience in high level and complex employment law matters, this partner is passionate about being a mentor and passing on his knowledge.§ §His employment practice covers three key areas.  The first part is supporting the commercial team in M&A matters where there is a transfer of employees. The second part is providing advice on a variety of employment issues which often include matters that are on a sophisticated level.  And the third part is contentious matters which involve a range of employment disputes.  The partner previously worked on matters going all the way to the Supreme Court so this is truly a great opportunity for someone who wants to learn from the best.  As part of the Dispute Resolution team, there could also be the opportunity to work with some of the other dispute resolution partners from time-to-time on a broader range of disputes. § §The opportunity is with a national law firm that is attracting top talent which is not surprising as the firm offers the full package including good quality work, strong career development and advancement opportunities.  The role will suit a solicitor with 3+ years’ experience accompanied with good academics and who can show a genuine interest to become an employment law specialist.§  § §For more information please contact Christina Kruger on 027 293 7210 or email §christina@mcleodduminy.co.nz§ §McLeod Duminy Careers is a specialist legal recruitment firm.  For a full list of our vacancies, please see our website: www.mcleodduminy.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50893390.txt	§Corporate Commercial Senior Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Commercial Senior Associate§§Advertiser: §Duncan Cotterill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Corporate Commercial Senior Associate §    §      §        §Duncan Cotterill has four offices in four distinct markets underpinned by an energetic, diverse and collegial partnership.§        §We put a lot of time and thought into making Duncan Cotterill a great firm to work for - a firm where you enjoy work, you are challenged, and you achieve.§        §Our Corporate Commercial team deal with a wide range of work from commercial transactions including M&A, joint ventures, company restructures, overseas investment, employee share ownership and banking & finance transactions.§        §Our clients are successful, ambitious and driven. They think hard about what they're doing, and they expect us to do the same on their behalf.§        §We're looking for a talented and experienced senior commercial solicitor with 7+ years' relevant experience (in NZ and overseas).§        §The right candidate will have a strong background in commercial transactions, commercial awareness, great technical skills, along with a self-starting initiative.§        §We are also seeking a candidate who involves themselves in the team and naturally takes a lead in supervision and delegation of work.§        §We want someone who:§        §          §Is capable, but just as importantly, will be proactive§          §Has a natural commercial awareness and aptitude§          §Naturally builds trust and rapport with clients§          §Has knowledge of the Overseas Investment Act 2005 and making applications for consent to acquire sensitive land§          §Is willing to mentor and delegate junior authors§          §Wants to actively build and progress their career§        §        §In return we can offer a number of opportunities to:§        §          §Work closely with our partners who work with an accessible, open door policy§          §Receive multiple levels of support from specialists, peers, colleagues, partners and professionals§          §Deal with interesting work and a wide range of different clients§          §Access ongoing training and development§          §Be immersed in our fantastic culture, something that we're very proud of§          §Be exposed to great professional support networks§        §        §With stunning modern offices just a short walk from Hagley Park, working alongside a talented team of lawyers - this is the perfect opportunity to advance your career in a supportive environment.§        § §        §To apply please email your CV, cover letter and academic transcript to §careers@duncancotterill.com§§      §    §    §To Apply§    §    §careers.duncancotterill.com§  §§§Duncan Cotterill has four offices in four distinct markets underpinned by an energetic, diverse and collegial partnership.§ §We put a lot of time and thought into making Duncan Cotterill a great firm to work for - a firm where you enjoy work, you are challenged, and you achieve.§ §Our Corporate Commercial team deal with a wide range of work from commercial transactions including M&A, joint ventures, company restructures, overseas investment, employee share ownership and banking & finance transactions.§ §Our clients are successful, ambitious and driven. They think hard about what they're doing, and they expect us to do the same on their behalf.§ §We're looking for a talented and experienced senior commercial solicitor with 7+ years' relevant experience (in NZ and overseas).§ §The right candidate will have a strong background in commercial transactions, commercial awareness, great technical skills, along with a self-starting initiative.§ §We are also seeking a candidate who involves themselves in the team and naturally takes a lead in supervision and delegation of work.§ §We want someone who:§ § §Is capable, but just as importantly, will be proactive§ §Has a natural commercial awareness and aptitude§ §Naturally builds trust and rapport with clients§ §Has knowledge of the Overseas Investment Act 2005 and making applications for consent to acquire sensitive land§ §Is willing to mentor and delegate junior authors§ §Wants to actively build and progress their career§ §In return we can offer a number of opportunities to:§ § §Work closely with our partners who work with an accessible, open door policy§ §Receive multiple levels of support from specialists, peers, colleagues, partners and professionals§ §Deal with interesting work and a wide range of different clients§ §Access ongoing training and development§ §Be immersed in our fantastic culture, something that we're very proud of§ §Be exposed to great professional support networks§ §With stunning modern offices just a short walk from Hagley Park, working alongside a talented team of lawyers - this is the perfect opportunity to advance your career in a supportive environment.§ § § §To apply please email your CV, cover letter and academic transcript to §careers@duncancotterill.com§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50867883.txt	§Commercial and Property Lawyer | 3-7 years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial and Property Lawyer | 3-7 years PQE§§Advertiser: §McLeod Duminy Careers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Commercial and Property Lawyer | 3-7 years PQE §      §        §This firm has been a mainstay of the local area for over 40 years and works with a range of small and medium sized clients, in some cases across generations. It makes for a broad range of commercial work, encompassing related property and asset protection matters too. Adaptability will be important, as will a positive and friendly approach. The clients are most likely individuals and not legal counsel, and they value straight talking and a personal touch. §        §The variety means no two days will be the same. Examples of work include:§        §          §Structuring companies, partnerships and other entities;§          §Buying and selling a business;§          §Managing business changes such as restructuring and redundancy;§          §Commercial leasing for both landlord and tenant;§          §Charitable trusts;§          §Finance; and §          §Reviewing and updating policies and procedures and checking for legislative compliance.§        §        §The current team is senior and so they need someone to work at an intermediate level. Despite being based outside the CBD they pay competitively, including a bonus, and will assess your salary and performance based on your value to clients and the firm rather than your PQE. § §        §For a confidential discussion, please contact Kirsty Spears on 027 458 9888 or email §kirsty@mcleodduminy.co.nz§§        §McLeod Duminy Careers is a specialist legal recruitment firm and so we understand that being a lawyer is a career and not just a job. We believe in the power of listening so that we can work with you on reaching your short, medium and long-term career goals.§§        §For a full list of our vacancies, please see our website: www.mcleodduminy.co.nz§      §    §  §§§This firm has been a mainstay of the local area for over 40 years and works with a range of small and medium sized clients, in some cases across generations. It makes for a broad range of commercial work, encompassing related property and asset protection matters too. Adaptability will be important, as will a positive and friendly approach. The clients are most likely individuals and not legal counsel, and they value straight talking and a personal touch. § §The variety means no two days will be the same. Examples of work include:§ § §Structuring companies, partnerships and other entities;§ §Buying and selling a business;§ §Managing business changes such as restructuring and redundancy;§ §Commercial leasing for both landlord and tenant;§ §Charitable trusts;§ §Finance; and § §Reviewing and updating policies and procedures and checking for legislative compliance.§ § §The current team is senior and so they need someone to work at an intermediate level. Despite being based outside the CBD they pay competitively, including a bonus, and will assess your salary and performance based on your value to clients and the firm rather than your PQE. § § §For a confidential discussion, please contact Kirsty Spears on 027 458 9888 or email §kirsty@mcleodduminy.co.nz§§ §McLeod Duminy Careers is a specialist legal recruitment firm and so we understand that being a lawyer is a career and not just a job.
