jobText: TXT/50865927.txt	§Associate - Senior Associate §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate - Senior Associate §§Advertiser: §Hays Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Salary§§Dependant on Experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Associate - Senior Associate §        §Multiple Opportunities for Established Solicitors §        §          §Opportunities available for Senior Solicitor to Senior Associate §          §Modern firm, low staff turnover and great culture! §          §Get in touch to discuss these opportunities §        §        §          §Your new company§ Due to continuous growth, succession planning and client demand, Pitt & Moore have several opportunities that might be of interest to you.§ § We are proud to again partner with Nelson and Richmond based, full -service firm, Pitt & Moore in the recruitment of several vacancies.§ § This firm offers modern offices, great location, low staff turnover and promising succession opportunities. Due to continuous client growth, it is now essential that teams are expanded and new experience is recruited.§ § §We have rare opportunities for the following:§ § §Solicitor to Senior Solicitor - Estates, Trusts and Wills:§ If you have experience in Estates, Trusts and Wills, we want to hear from you.§ We have an opening for an experienced Solicitor to Senior Solicitor who has (specifically) proven and strong Estates knowledge, although experience with Trusts and Wills would also be ideal. Pitt & Moore is passionate about their people and the clients they service, locally, nationally and around the world.§ § §Your new role§ As an Associate / Senior Associate, you will be managing the Richmond office and provide support to a team of experienced legal professionals and support staff.§ § This role will be well suited for an individual who is looking to progress into a role that provides responsibility and the opportunity to work independently, manage a client base, supervise a team and also take lead in the management of a branch.§ § As your client base will be a mixture of local clients, the ideal Candidate would have varied experience and can offer knowledge of general practice, covering a strong understanding of property law, relationship property, wills, trust and estates.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§          §            §We are seeking to bring on board a Candidate who proven experience in a similar role;§            §The ideal Candidate is someone who presents professionally and is looking to progress in their career;§            §You are an individual who feels comfortable representing yourself and your firm to the community for the purposes of growing your client portfolio;§            §Culture is very important to our Client and therefore the ideal Candidate will be someone who similarly values the importance of making a positive contribution to their team, wider firm and clients;§            §You are someone who has a strong work ethic and is a confident and professional communicator.§          §          § §What you'll get in return§ Pitt & Moore is a firm known for their excellent service delivery, positive culture and strong leadership team.§ § They have a modern outlook on law whilst still respecting tradition.§ § This firm offers low staff turnover, definite progression opportunities and professional development. You will be confident at working with high-value clients.§ §You will be offered:§A New Zealand wide client base who often have very interesting high value property and asset transactions.§A relaxed but supportive environment with open doors and the Partners often going out of their way to help staff on both a professional and personal front.§Modern, light and airy offices based on the city fringe who have strong IT systems and are as paperless as possible.§Support for further study and development.§Car parking.§ Flexibility with hours and working arrangements. §50% of this role is property associated to include commercial leasing, and commercial property transactions, 50% of the role will be general practice. §All of their work is through referral and recommendation, they have never needed to advertise so there is a great opportunity to build your own brand. §To apply or for more information, please contact Stevie at Tyler Wren§P: §+64 (09) 973 5470§E: §lgray@tylerwren.co.nz§      §W: www.tylerwren.co.nz§§§§

experience: You’ll be tertiary qualified, ideally with a legal qualification and have 3+ years
jobText: TXT/50873018.txt	§Regulatory Compliance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regulatory Compliance Manager§§Advertiser: §BDO New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§About the Role§ §As Regulatory Compliance Manager, you will be a key member of BDO New Zealand’s National team, responsible for supporting the business in proactively responding to changes in the regulatory environment we operate in, both in New Zealand and globally. The role is newly created and broad in scope with an opportunity to immerse yourself in the business.§ § §The role is a great mix of assisting with existing regulatory compliance, but also proactively identifying and implementing new regulatory / legislation changes§ §Work across a large network of New Zealand offices to lead and support them to imbed, implement, and comply with relevant regulatory requirements§ §Opportunity to work closely with senior leaders in the business§ §Be intellectually stimulated as you build the role from the ground up§ § § §Skills and Experience§ § §You’ll be tertiary qualified, ideally with a legal qualification and have 3+ years’ experience in a regulatory environment / role§ §Experience in AML and Privacy legislation§ §To succeed, it is imperative that you’re proactive and self-motivated, and love immersing yourself in the business§ §Your curiosity will enable you to identify opportunities and solutions to make an impact across the business§ §You’re known for your ability to build strong relationships across a wide range of stakeholders§ §Juggling multiple projects means you’re well organised and your attention to detail is second to none§ § § Why BDO§ Working at BDO is all about richer relationships – within our network, with our clients and around the world.§ We have a strong local presence, together with a global reach. In New Zealand BDO is represented nationally, we have 15 offices around the country and over 900 staff.§ Thrive in a collaborative culture that drives a focus on excellence. We are characterised by a relaxed and familiar atmosphere, not common in our industry. Our culture promotes a collaborative workplace – amongst colleagues and clients alike.§ We recognise that your career with us is just one aspect of your life. We know you want to succeed and life at BDO is about more than just work. Balance is critical.§For a confidential career discussion, please contact §kim.richards@bdo.co.nz§ or apply on-line.§§§§

The role is newly created and broad in scope with an opportunity to immerse yourself in the business.§ § §The role is a great mix of assisting with existing regulatory compliance, but also proactively identifying and implementing new regulatory / legislation changes§ §Work across a large network of New Zealand offices to lead and support them to imbed, implement, and comply with relevant regulatory requirements§ §Opportunity to work closely with senior leaders in the business§ §Be intellectually stimulated as you build the role from the ground up§ § § §Skills and Experience§ § §You’ll be tertiary qualified, ideally with a legal qualification and have 3+ years’ experience in a regulatory environment / role§ §Experience in AML and Privacy legislation§ §To succeed, it is imperative that you’re proactive and self-motivated, and love immersing yourself in the business§ §Your curiosity will enable you to identify opportunities and solutions to make an impact across the business§ §You’re known for your ability to build strong relationships across a wide range of stakeholders§ §Juggling multiple projects means you’re well organised and your attention to detail is second to none§ § § Why BDO§ Working at BDO is all about richer relationships – within our network, with our clients and around the world.§ We have a strong local presence, together with a global reach. In New Zealand BDO is represented nationally, we have 15 offices around the country and over 900 staff.§ Thrive in a collaborative culture that drives a focus on excellence. We are characterised by a relaxed and familiar atmosphere, not common in our industry. Our culture promotes a collaborative workplace – amongst colleagues and clients alike.§ We recognise that your career with us is just one aspect of your life. We know you want to succeed and life at BDO is about more than just work. Balance is critical.§For a confidential career discussion, please contact §kim.richards@bdo.co.nz§ or apply on-line.§§§§

Enjoy the exposure of working with esteemed professional in servicing some of the largest national and international clients.§ § §Your new role§ Your new role will be in the property team supporting multiple authors and working alongside other outstanding administrators. jobText: TXT/50890986.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Legal Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Legal Services§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Tupu ake mai raro -§ §growing from the bottom§          §Arahihia mai runga -§ §leading from the top§        §        §Senior Solicitor - Legal Services §        §          §Are you looking for an opportunity to contribute to the growth and protection of New Zealand's primary industries by providing legal advice within the large and dynamic organisation that is the Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI)?§          §The position is a full-time fixed term position for a senior commercial solicitor until 30 June 2024.§          § §          §Mō tō mātou rōpū - About the Team§          §We are looking for a Senior Solicitor to join our Agriculture, Forestry & Corporate Law team. The Agriculture, Forestry & Corporate Law Team provides legal advice to the Ministry and in particular Agriculture and Investment Services, Corporate Services and Te Uru Rākau. The team sits within the Legal Services directorate. Legal Services covers a wide range of interesting work including commercial arrangements, public law operational advice, involvement in emergency responses for food, trade, and biosecurity, prosecutions, civil and public law litigation support, legal and organisational risk management, and training.§          §Solicitors and Senior Solicitors within MPI are responsible for providing high quality, timely and practical legal advice.  They are expected to work across MPI with a varied focus, develop technical excellence in a variety of areas of primary industries law, and confidently assess and manage legal risk.§          §MPI is committed to recruiting, recognising and creating opportunities for talented people to develop career paths within the organisation and beyond.§          § §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §Sustainable Food and Fibre Futures (SFF Futures) supports the sustainable development of New Zealand's food and fibre sectors through co-investing in innovative initiatives at every level, from small grassroots community projects to large-scale industry development. It funds transformative programmes to create more value, develop capability and new practices, and deliver long-lasting economic, social, cultural and environmental benefits.§          §This fixed term role has been established to provide legal support to SFF Futures, and in particular to provide senior level legal support to the preparation of funding agreements for investment§          §Programmes, often including negotiations centred around the development ofnew intellectual property.§          § §          §Mōu - About You §          §In order to be considered for this Senior Solicitor role, you will need:§          §            §A relevant tertiary qualification in law and a current New Zealand practising certificate, or the immediate ability to hold one.§            §Significant post-admission experience in commercial law, intellectual property, public law or another relevant area of law.§            §Good attention to detail and drafting skills§            §Clear judgement and an ability to recognise and understand the implications of legal advice.§            §Ability to build and maintain effective relationships, good communication skills, and a collaborative work style.§            §A proven track record in building strong relationships with, and providing useful advice to, senior-level officials.§            §Experience and a real interest in supervising, mentoring, and coaching less experienced solicitors.§            §Ability to support the Team Manager in the planning and management of resources and making process improvements for the benefit of the team, directorate, and our clients.§          §          §Desirable:§          §            §Knowledge of the regulatory environment in which MPI operates.§          §          § §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§          §            §Brand new offices close to Railway Station§            §Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§            §Wellness benefit for employees§            §Comprehensive one-week MPI Induction Programme§            §Workstation assessment§            §Bi-annual MPI-paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames§            §Flexible working - we support work life balance and flexible work arrangements whenever possible§          §          § §          §The salary for this role is broad-banded range D-C circa $92,000 to $128,000 depending on skills and experience §          § §See the benefits of working at MPI§          § §          §Ngā Taki Whakahaumaru - Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§The role:§We have an opportunity for a experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer to join our Warkworth team in our brand new modern offices. jobText: TXT/50876907.txt	§Immigration Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Immigration Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Tyler Wren§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§The world of Immigration Law has had a range of challenges this year but like many strong firms, this particular employer has faired well during challenging trading conditions. This demonstrates a loyal and stable client base, a reputable team and strong management. Due to growth, they are now looking for §an Immigration Solicitor looking to take a leap into a new and exciting role.§ Perhaps you have worked in Immigration as an advisor for a number of years and have just recently sat the bar, or maybe you're an experienced Immigration Lawyer looking for a fresh challenge... whatever your experience, this firm is in growth mode and looking for a committed individual who is ready to hone their Immigration skill set in a fast-paced environment. §You will be dealing with an array of people from different walks of life assisting in a variety of immigration matters that span work, residential, and Section 61 visas, deportations, and dealings with Immigration NZ. You must have strong EQ skills and be able to adapt your communication to suit your clients. §Your hard work and investment in the firm will be rewarded; remuneration is very generous with a base and attractive bonus scheme in place. There is no limit to what you can earn, or where you can go.§You will manage: §- work, student, partnership, and visitor visas §- Resident and Humanitarian appeals §- Entrepreneur and Investor Category applications §What's on offer: §- no billable hours, fees are set §- generous commission structure §- Auckland city-fringe location §Please get in touch with Lisa Gray at §lgray@tylerwren.co.nz§ or §(09) 973 5470§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§§§

jobText: TXT/50876498.txt	§Case Manager - Alcohol & Other Drug Treatment Court§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager - Alcohol & Other Drug Treatment Court§§Advertiser: §Odyssey House Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Do you want to be part of a team that supports people to change their lives?§ §Odyssey supports people experiencing mental health and/or addiction (alcohol, gambling and drug addiction) issues. §Odyssey partners with Higher Ground and the Salvation Army to provide addiction treatment services to the Alcohol and Other Drug Treatment Court (AODTC) based in Auckland and Waitakere District Courts. §We are now seeking a full time Case Manager to work Monday to Friday who will collaborate with the AODTC to ensure the best possible outcomes for participants of this exciting and ground-breaking programme.§You will join an enthusiastic team dedicated to supporting our participants along their journey. As Case Manager you will work closely with peer support colleagues and other members of this multi-disciplinary team, including the AODTC judges, court coordinators, police, lawyers and treatment providers. Your assessment, engagement, treatment planning, brief intervention and organisational skills will be an asset in this fulfilling role.§We are looking for:§  §A degree qualification in Alcohol and Other Drugs (AOD), social work, mental health or another appropriate health service area§  §Registration with a professional body or be willing to work towards DAPAANZ registration§  §An awareness of tikanga Maori and its value§  §Experience working in the AOD/mental health field/justice system§  §Familiarity or willingness to learn about court processes and systems§  §Enjoy working collaboratively with various stakeholders§  §Excellent clinical judgement and strong clinical boundaries§  §Sound report writing skills and computer proficiency§  §A passion for supporting people to make positive changes in their lives§We offer you:§  §A competitive salary and benefits§  §5 days paid study leave§  §22 days annual leave§  §An opportunity to work with New Zealand’s most experienced addiction treatment providers§  §Learning and development opportunities§  §Varied work that supports the community§  §A dynamic and supportive team who are passionate about what we do§  §A healthy workplace, which is smoke free§Odyssey is an equal opportunity employer and a smoke free organisation. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Please also note that Police and Ministry of Social Development clearance checks will be required for this role. §All applicants should include a CV, cover letter and complete the online registration and application forms.§ §For all enquiries please contact Nicola Mooney, P&C Administrator on §09 638 4957§ Ext. 727.§Closing date: Friday 20th November 2020§For a copy of the Job Description visit §PD-Case-Manager-AOD-Treatment-Court.docx§§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Technology Lawyer | Fully Remote Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50889906.txt	§Commercial Technology Lawyer | Fully Remote§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Technology Lawyer | Fully Remote§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Exclusive to Cobalt, this position is the first of its kind in New Zealand. This is not your regular commercial lawyer role where it is about how much you can bill and working long hours, instead, you are leveraging technology in a collaborative virtual environment to provide sound legal advice on commercial and technology contracts to large businesses. The future of law is changing and Cobalt is at the forefront of supporting innovation in the legal industry.§ §The Firm§ §We have partnered with an innovative international law firm that specialises in providing advice and complex technology contracts to their clients which includes (but isn't limited to) outsourcing agreements, SaaS agreements, I.T. procurement contracts, software licencing agreements and general commercial contracts. They service a diverse range of clients including global financial services companies, international fund managers and large financial regulatory bodies. Their client base is constantly expanding, even more so this year, which is how this position has come up. There is scope for growth at this firm that promotes continuous learning and career development as part of their people-focused culture.§ §The Role§ §You will form part of a global team of commercial lawyers to service clients across the Asia Pacific time-zone (GMT +8) and the role will involve:§ §Drafting and reviewing an extensive suite of commercial and technology agreements;§Working with blue-chip international clients on complex commercial requirements;§Work-from home either full-time or part-time (fully remote position);§Work with the latest legal-tech systems that are re-shaping the legal industry;§Coming up with creative solutions and innovative ways to improve the team's delivery;§Collaborating with other lawyers in the business on overlapping projects and large matters;§Induction, systems training and ongoing mentorship with the global team to ensure you are honing your skills.§ §About You§ §1-3 years PQE working for a commercial/technology law firm or from an in-house environment working with commercial agreements;§Experience with some drafting, reviewing and negotiating of contracts ;§Able to work in the Asia Pacific time-zone (i.e. between 12 pm and 9 pm NZT);§Be based in New Zealand and must have NZ residency or citizenship;§A naturally solution-oriented approach with the ability to creatively solve problems in a fast-paced environment;§Excellent communication skills and enjoy consulting with clients and being a trusted legal advisor;§Additional language skills in Mandarin, Cantonese, Chinese or Japanese will be advantageous (but not mandatory);§High levels of self-motivation, interpersonal skills and team spirit are important for this home-based position (there will be heaps of mentoring though).§ §This position could appeal to you if you're a working parent that would prefer to work from home, while still keeping your skills fresh. Maybe you're a night owl and would rather work into the evening or a returning Kiwi looking to get back into the legal market, either way, get in touch with us to find out more. § §If you'd like to apply, send your CV, academics to §hdeiongh@cobaltrecruitment.com§. We are sure you have more questions, which we will gladly answer with your CV in hand. If you would like a confidential chat in the first instance, call Harrison on 027 2745 926.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50885274.txt	§Legal Secretary - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Duncan Cotterill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Legal Secretary - Auckland §    §      §        §Duncan Cotterill has four offices in four distinct markets underpinned by an energetic, diverse and collegial partnership. We have an exciting and unique opportunity in our Auckland office for an experienced lawyer, keen to take on a new and varied role. §   § We’re looking for a Litigation technology guru, natural project manager and team player, who’ll  ensure the litigation team is fully up-to-speed with the latest legal developments.  You’ll be motivated to leverage technology to its full capacity in order to provide the best possible legal services to our clients. The scope is unlimited – where could you take this role?§ Working closely with both the Head of Litigation and our Business Transformation and Innovation Director, this role will provide support to our people across the whole litigation department, including:  §        §          §Acting as a single point of contact and project manager for litigation technology across multiple cross-functional teams, communicating requirements and mobilising teams towards delivering effective and innovative solutions for our clients, in large litigation matters.§          §Leading and managing required resources for e-Discovery processes across all offices.§          §Creating and supporting best practices for e-Discovery to ensure consistency and efficiency.§          §Designing and delivering training to lawyers, paralegals and relevant support staff on litigation software applications, technology issues relating to court proceedings and legal issues relating to privilege and discovery.§          §Supporting Simpson Grierson’s growing business transformation and innovation initiatives.§        §   § You’ll be a practising lawyer with 5+ years’ experience in large litigation and/or legal project management. You’ll have a good working knowledge of e-Discovery systems and processes,   including hands-on experience with review tools such as EDT, Relativity and others, plus a strong interest in innovation and developing technologies around legal project management.  The ability to build effective relationships is vital in this role so you’ll be an excellent communicator who loves to work collaboratively and has a keen interest in building and leading a team.  You’ll have strong problem-solving skills, great judgment and a passion for learning.§   § We have an award-winning, inclusive, friendly culture, and  you’ll be well supported to grow with this role and make it your own.   If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.§      §      §Jackie Mulligan§09 977 5104§ §    §    §  §§§Simpson Grierson is one of New Zealand’s leading, large law firms. We have an exciting and unique opportunity in our Auckland office for an experienced lawyer, keen to take on a new and varied role. §   § We’re looking for a Litigation technology guru, natural project manager and team player, who’ll  ensure the litigation team is fully up-to-speed with the latest legal developments.  You’ll be motivated to leverage technology to its full capacity in order to provide the best possible legal services to our clients. The scope is unlimited – where could you take this role?§ Working closely with both the Head of Litigation and our Business Transformation and Innovation Director, this role will provide support to our people across the whole litigation department, including:  § § §Acting as a single point of contact and project manager for litigation technology across multiple cross-functional teams, communicating requirements and mobilising teams towards delivering effective and innovative solutions for our clients, in large litigation matters.§ §Leading and managing required resources for e-Discovery processes across all offices.§ §Creating and supporting best practices for e-Discovery to ensure consistency and efficiency.§ §Designing and delivering training to lawyers, paralegals and relevant support staff on litigation software applications, technology issues relating to court proceedings and legal issues relating to privilege and discovery.§ §Supporting Simpson Grierson’s growing business transformation and innovation initiatives.§ §   § You’ll be a practising lawyer with 5+ years’ experience in large litigation and/or legal project management. You’ll have a good working knowledge of e-Discovery systems and processes,   including hands-on experience with review tools such as EDT, Relativity and others, plus a strong interest in innovation and developing technologies around legal project management.  The ability to build effective relationships is vital in this role so you’ll be an excellent communicator who loves to work collaboratively and has a keen interest in building and leading a team.  You’ll have strong problem-solving skills, great judgment and a passion for learning.§   § We have an award-winning, inclusive, friendly culture, and  you’ll be well supported to grow with this role and make it your own.   If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50887367.txt	§Property Legal Secretary - Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Legal Secretary - Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Duncan Cotterill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Property Legal Secretary - Christchurch §    §      §        §Duncan Cotterill has four offices in four distinct markets underpinned by an energetic, diverse and collegial partnership. As a full-service law firm with a national presence, we occupy a unique position in the legal market, delivering quality legal advice and exceptional value to clients, including leading private and public sector organisations and high net worth individuals.§        §We have an excellent opportunity for an intermediate to senior Legal Secretary who has worked within a busy property team, to join our successful Christchurch office.§        §You will provide key secretarial support and assistance to a busy author team. You will be involved in the typical range of legal secretarial tasks, from monthly billing to diary management through to assisting our clients in a range of ways. There will be a lot of property transactions and supporting other commercial work, but no two days are the same. It's a busy team and you will really enjoy the variety and challenge that comes with the role.§        §In a busy property team, your attention to detail and ability to provide an excellent level of service is what you will be renowned for. You love to take ownership of tasks, are unflappable and will enjoy being surrounded by a great bunch of people. We are seeking candidates with a positive "can-do" attitude, you'll be a quick learner, willing to be proactive and show initiative and have excellent communication skills. We all work in a collegial way and so we want someone who is able to work well with other support staff and is happy to help other teams when needed.§        §It is essential that you have relevant previous experience and valid existing working rights.§        §With stunning offices near Hagley Park, this is a great opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career, an opportunity to work in a fun, fast-paced, flexible, and rewarding environment.§        §To apply please email your CV and cover letter to: §careers@duncancotterill.com§§        § §      §    §    §To Apply§    §    §careers.duncancotterill.com§  §§§Duncan Cotterill has four offices in four distinct markets underpinned by an energetic, diverse and collegial partnership. As a full-service law firm with a national presence, we occupy a unique position in the legal market, delivering quality legal advice and exceptional value to clients, including leading private and public sector organisations and high net worth individuals.§ §We have an excellent opportunity for an intermediate to senior Legal Secretary who has worked within a busy property team, to join our successful Christchurch office.§ §You will provide key secretarial support and assistance to a busy author team. You will be involved in the typical range of legal secretarial tasks, from monthly billing to diary management through to assisting our clients in a range of ways. There will be a lot of property transactions and supporting other commercial work, but no two days are the same. It's a busy team and you will really enjoy the variety and challenge that comes with the role.§ §In a busy property team, your attention to detail and ability to provide an excellent level of service is what you will be renowned for. You love to take ownership of tasks, are unflappable and will enjoy being surrounded by a great bunch of people. We are seeking candidates with a positive "can-do" attitude, you'll be a quick learner, willing to be proactive and show initiative and have excellent communication skills. We all work in a collegial way and so we want someone who is able to work well with other support staff and is happy to help other teams when needed.§ §It is essential that you have relevant previous experience and valid existing working rights.§ §With stunning offices near Hagley Park, this is a great opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career, an opportunity to work in a fun, fast-paced, flexible, and rewarding environment.§ §To apply please email your CV and cover letter to: §careers@duncancotterill.com§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Property and Private Client Associate | Exclusive | Christchurch Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50890690.txt	§Property and Private Client Associate | Exclusive | Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property and Private Client Associate | Exclusive | Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$85,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About the business§ § § §I am working directly with a well respected partner to identify suitable talent for this crucial appointment. § §This boutique firm has an excellent reputation in Canterbury with work both regionally and nationally. It enjoys a quality of work much higher than your average boutique practice. The firm has a Property/Commercial, Family and Litigation practice led by top partners in each.§ §The culture is all about personal responsibility. Flexible working is a no-brainer. You take ownership over your own workload and work the hours required to both have balance and get it done. Social events, sports teams, fitness classes and hobbies and shared across the team, who all enjoy each others company as both friends and colleagues. There is a conscious focus on employing people who add to the diverse fabric of the team - so culture fit is top priority.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We have worked alongside the client to develop a brief which we believe is truly unique in a market overloaded with poorly qualified clutter.§ §On offer is a clear and proven pathway to partnership, opportunities to manage the grad team and also take on a handover of established clients to alleviate workload from three busy partners. You will be a mentor and senior influencer.§ §This will suit candidates relocating to Christchurch to take advantage of the affordable housing market, or perhaps someone roadblocked by a top heavy structure at their current firm and wanting a chance to step up.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The client is open to negotiating a salary which fairly reflects the value-add of the individual and wants to provide pathways for success inside and outside of work - which means paying well.§ §In addition;§ §Showers, cycle and car parking available§Modern Central CBD offices§Specific lifestyle and wellbeing requirements negotiated for individuals§A clear and accessible progression pathway§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You will be an established private client solicitor suitable for an associate level position. Use 4-5+ years experience as a guide, however more experience will be advantageous.§ §Your workload will be varied each day, this is not a pigeon-holed role and it can be adapted to suit your experience and interest areas.§ §Including residential and commercial conveyancing, trusts, wills, EPOAs, succession planning, asset protection, shareholder agreements, leasing and business sales, franchising etc.§ §In addition;§ §Personable and social approach to work§Looking for a long term career move§Keen to contribute to management and process improvement§Excellent client facing ability§Eager to step up, be challenged and earn progression§ § § §Register Your Interest§ § § §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: §eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50921784.txt	§Law Graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Law Graduate§§Advertiser: §Fitzherbert Rowe Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§What working with us looks like§ §As a Law Graduate you will work with and learn from a team of talented legal professionals in our commercial team. § §Working within our commercial team you will have exposure to a variety of general commercial transactions, business acquisitions and disposals, negotiating and drafting contracts, commercial property development, commercial leases and subdivision work. § §We work collaboratively with our clients and you will have the opportunity – and be encouraged – to develop lasting and direct relationships with them. Internally, we have a culture of teamwork which means you will have the security of knowing someone else always has your back. § §Our graduates are assigned a “buddy” and a Partner “mentor” who are responsible for your professional development and career progression through the firm.§ §You are someone with:§ § §Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trust, confidence and maintain excellent relationships with our clients, internal and external;§ §The ability to communicate effectively in both an oral and written capacity;§ §A drive to learn from us and develop your career through our firm; and§ §A readiness to step it up to the next level.§ §About us?§ §Fitzherbert Rowe is the largest law firm in the Manawatu with locations in Palmerston North, Feilding and Waipukurau in the Central Hawke’s Bay providing a diverse range of legal services to our local and national clients in the private, public and charitable sectors.§ § At Fitzherbert Rowe, we create a supportive environment where our people feel valued and their career development is front of mind. We are in growth mode which presents a great opportunity for the right people to go far within the firm and the profession§ §Our team§ §We are a progressive, forward-thinking firm with teams based in Palmerston North, Feilding and Central Hawke’s Bay.§ §Our partners and people have varied backgrounds and expertise that is aligned to our services. We are a firm prepared to invest in technology, networks and new ways of doing business.§ §Benefits§ §Fitzherbert Rowe offers a competitive salary and a generous range of benefits.§ §Let’s talk!§ §If you would like to apply for this position please select APPLY below and attach a copy of your CV, covering letter and academic transcript§ §Please contact the General Manager, Patrick Leong on 021 683 128 if you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50922916.txt	§Junior Lawyer / Graduate up to 2 years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Lawyer / Graduate up to 2 years PQE§§Advertiser: §Treadwell Gordon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§JUNIOR LAWYER - GRADUATE§We’re looking for a junior lawyer or recent graduate to join our criminal and family team.  We believe it’s our people who drive our success through their enthusiasm, capability and passion for great customer experience.§So, if you’re a lawyer with 0 – 2 years PQE and are up for making great things happen, we’d love to hear from you.§Treadwell Gordon is one of the longest running law firms in New Zealand, being established in 1869.  We operate from our offices throughout the central north island and service a wide variety of clients.  We pride ourselves on being a well-regarded, progressive, full service law firm, who actively embraces new technologies..The use of technology allows us to offer a flexible working environment.§Working for us you will§§Be surrounded by§ top class lawyers and mentors§Grow §as you are exposed to a variety of legal challenges§Make a difference§ to your client’s business and personal lives§Have use of the §latest legal technology tools§ (including paperless office, voice recognition and software generated workflows)§Get recognised§ for your initiative and drive§Have access to §regular training programmes§Be part of §a fun and supportive team §who enjoy flexible hours, in-house table tennis and dart competitions plus firm-wide social events (on a regular basis)§Enjoy §a great work/life balance living in a family friendly community with a great climate and easy access to the best that nature offers us§The Mid-west North Island§For those who love life outside the office, there aren’t too many better places to live than Mid-west North Island.  We have the mountain, river and the sea right on our door step. Whanganui is gaining a reputation for its arts culture and with an evening out in Wellington only 2½ hours drive away, there really aren’t many better places to be.  All this with a reasonable cost of living and no traffic!§We want to hear from you§Great jobs in law are hard to come by.  If you would like to know more about the one we are offering give us a call today.§Applications close 5.00pm Friday 20 November 2020§Contact: Jacqui Powell§jep@treadgord.co.nz§06 349 0568§ §Treadwell Gordon – people first§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50906663.txt	§Judges Clerk§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Judges Clerk§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Judges' Clerk District Court§§Fixed Term§Based at the Palmerston North District Court§ §This is a 2-3 year fixed term internship for motivated, enthusiastic law professionals to develop an intricate and firsthand view of the judicial system. You will provide high quality research and directly support the District Court Judges.§ §If you have an LLB with a strong academic record, excellent written communication and research skills and good computer literacy this could be the opportunity for you.§ §We are looking for someone who enjoys working independently towards deadlines, self-motivated to manage workloads and maintain confidentiality. To excel in this role, you will understand and consider the practicalities of outcomes as well as their legality.§ §You will provide high quality research to resident and visiting District Court Judges in the Central region. You will fulfil that responsibility by supplying efficient an accurate legal support on any topic required.§ §You are also required to include with your application a copy of the transcript of your academic record. §Applicants are requested to provide an example of recent legal research that they have completed, preferably not more than two pages in length.§ §Apply and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter.  Applications close on 27 November 2020.  If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50932393.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §University of Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Vice-Chancellor's Office - Te Tari o te Tumu Whakarae§A rare opportunity has arisen to support UC's internal legal services function!§What You Will Do§An immediate opening for a full-time Senior Legal Counsel in the Office of the Vice-Chancellor has arisen, to assist with providing commercial legal advice. You will receive day-to-day direction from the General Counsel/Registrar. You will provide legal advice to the University Council, Vice-Chancellor, Senior Leadership Team, University staff and stakeholders in relation to strategic, commercial, contractual, risk management and governance matters.§Who You Are§You will have a LLB Bachelor's Degree, a current practising certificate issued by NZLS, and significant knowledge and expertise in a broad range of commercial legal issues. In addition, you will be:§a perceptive and proactive person who can provide timely advice across a full range of commercial and contractual matters;§excellent at relationship building with the ability to find pragmatic solutions to variety of technical problems§able to manage competing priorities and a significant and diverse work load§outstanding at writing and have excellent analytical and communication skills as well as strong judgment.§Applicants who are comfortable with technology, committed to teamwork, responsive and have a proven record of providing the highest quality client service, should apply today!§Who You Will Work With§The General Counsel/Registrar is responsible for the legal function at UC as well as overseeing governance support, internal audit, policy and compliance. Additionally, this role will work closely with staff across UC including the Senior Leadership Team. For more information about the Senior Management team, please visit our §website.§ Why UC§Tangata Tū, Tangata Ora - Engaged, Empowered, Making a Difference.§The University of Canterbury is committed to accessible higher education, service to community and the encouragement of talent without barriers of distance, wealth, class, gender or ethnicity. The University explicitly aims to produce graduates and support staff who are engaged with their communities, empowered to act for good and determined to make a difference in the world.§For information about the range of fantastic benefits that UC offers including flexible work practices, study opportunities and generous superannuation and leave provisions, please visit: §http://www.canterbury.ac.nz/joinus§The University of Canterbury is an Equal Employment Opportunities (§EEO§) employer and we encourage diversity in our staffing profile. The University of Canterbury actively seeks to meet its obligation under the Treaty of Waitangi - Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§The closing date for this position is: Sunday, 29th November 2020 (midnight, NZ time)§Interviews will be scheduled for the week of 7 December 2020, and the position start date will be 1 February 2020. §How You Apply§Applications for this position must be submitted on our §careers website§ and should include a cover letter and resume§. §Please note, we do not accept applications by email, however we are happy to answer your queries in relation to the application process, please forward these to §WorkatUC@canterbury.ac.nz§Due to current border restrictions, you must have New Zealand Citizenship/Residency to be considered for this role.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50944516.txt	§Executive Assistant & Board Liaison§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant & Board Liaison§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Salary§§Salary + Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Executive Assistant & Board Liaison§ §Permanent full time§ §Britomart, Auckland§ §Looking for a super star executive assistant or legal executive / legal assistant  § § § §The role:§ §As EA and Board Liaison, you will work behind the scenes to make it all happen for Westpac’s Secretariat function by providing assistance and support to the Head of Corporate Legal & Secretariat, Westpac NZ boards and their Directors.§ §You will be co-ordinating Board meetings, travel, itinerary mapping and other logistics.  Assist with proof reading and editing documents, managing the online Board document management system and related administration. The role also provides support for general company secretariat activity such as Companies Office filings.  A mixture of EA and legal executive skills are required. § § § §What you will need to succeed:§ §Your energy, attitude and people skills will see you succeed in this highly dynamic environment. We need you to be a strong and clear communicator with polished presentation, have board level experience and be able to managing conflicting requests.§ § § §Resilience, adaptability, initiative and attention to detail are critical as you will be dealing with complex, detailed work in a high pressure environment.  We will be leveraging your confidence when dealing with senior staff.  You will need to have proven experience with senior executives, anticipating next steps and pre-empting what’s required, as well as maintaining a strategic lens on the work you do, being adept at ‘thinking outside the box’ and planning ahead.§ § § A high level of professionalism, solid technical skills and proven EA experience in a professional services or large corporate environment will be essential. Candidates who have worked as legal executives or legal assistants in a large law firm environment are also encouraged to apply.§ § § §What’s great about working for Westpac?§ §We’re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we’ll invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your ongoing learning and development.  As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme and fantastic staff banking package. § § § §Next Steps§ §Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter through the link on this page. § §For more information, please get in touch with §Tasha.patel@westpac.co.nz§ §Please note: we are happy to answer your questions but we do not accept applications by email.§ §We appreciate your interest in a future career with Westpac, however, due to current border restrictions brought about by Covid19 and uncertainty around when this will change,  we are unable to support visas for offshore applicants at this time.§§§§

You will also enjoy the support of the wider team of HR Advisors and a Coordinator.§        §You will be responsible for providing leadership and coordination for all National Employment/Industrial Relations processes and projects. The ER Manager will work closely with the GM - People, to contribute to the Org-wide ER strategy and will lead the planning in this area.§        §You may currently be in a similar role as a Head of Workplace Relations, Head of ER/IR or maybe even a Consultant looking to make the move to an in-house role. You may have worked for a union or be someone with an employment law background.§        §Your wealth of experience within large, complex organisations is essential as there is a heavy focus on bargaining complex Collective Agreements with multiple Unions. You will have strong people and communication skills and be willing and able to nurture and manage these multiple union relationships. Your knowledge of employment legislation and the employment/industrial relations framework are key.§        §This is a great opportunity for you to help shape the future. jobText: TXT/50915820.txt	§Senior Litigator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Litigator§§Advertiser: §Victoria Fletcher Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Are you a senior civil or commercial litigator, intent on putting this very unusual year behind you and invigorating your world in the New Year? §If so, here’s something to start exploring this side of Christmas, with a view to reflecting and final decision making after your summer holiday, should you wish to take that time.§With at least 4-5 years’ quality litigation experience behind you, you will have been feeling the urge to make a change, but waiting for the right opportunity to present itself.§And now it is.  Parker Cowan is a small, specialist litigation practice based in Queenstown, but operating across New Zealand.§Like you, most of the team of six, have deliberately moved there to be active in the outdoor lifestyle, indulge in the great food and wine, or just to “be” in this beautiful part of New Zealand.  Not having to commute or work the longer hours typical of bigger cities, you really will have more time to enjoy all this.  Thankfully, it’s not at the expense of stimulating work. §The firm’s clients are domestic and international insurers, so most of your work will be acting for their professional clients – lawyers, doctors, engineers, accountants, and others – defending claims and complaints made about their work.  As a professional yourself, you’ll appreciate this is important legal work.  And it leads to appearances in all levels of Court, before coroners and various professional bodies, all around New Zealand. §As a senior lawyer, you’ll enjoy responsibility and autonomy, coaching from the firm’s partners Maree Cowan and Michael Parker, the collegiality of a senior-weighted team, and the support of the team’s junior lawyer.  Your exact work mix can be tailored to your areas of speciality and any clients and work streams you may wish to bring with you.  Any employment and health & safety expertise will be advantageous and refreshingly, any long term aspirations will be welcome.§Regardless of your years and scope of experience, you will be able to offer quality litigation experience, along with the requisite client and file management skills, team and results focus, and all important coach-ability.  Parker Cowan is a tight, egalitarian team which mucks in together and likes to have fun together.  As you’d expect with some need for travel, it operates a truly modern, mobile working environment. §Interested?  We welcome your application, or if you prefer, confidential enquiry including “no obligations” discussion with the partners. If you’re going to need to relocate, we will be supportive of that, and flexible with the timing of your start. §Please apply via Seek, or enquire by contacting me, Victoria Fletcher, 021 300 982, victoria@victoriafletcher.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in litigation & dispute resolution law?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

You will need to be very comfortable undertaking Court work through to Hearings and able to lead these processes as well as supervise and manage the development of more junior members of the team.§ §Given the standing of our client, they are recognised as leaders within their field and as such need someone of an equal calibre who understands the importance of high value of service and delivery as well as the delicate nature of this specialism and who can show real passion and understanding. They are also looking for someone with the strength of character and ability to bring humour and a positive mindset to the team so continuing to support the ongoing development of highly talented team members coming through.§ §On Offer:§ §Aside from an attractive salary and overall package, plus ongoing development potential and a pathway through to leadership within the firm, a key offering is this firm has a superb reputation for how it supports and looks after all its employees. The Partners are highly regarded in their own right and the firm is one that is regularly spoken of as a firm of choice for this region. They can boast a positive working environment and culture with an organisational structure that is focused on overall objectives rather than individual and not simply demanding more regardless of delivery.§ §Interested?§ §If you wish to have a confidential conversation to learn more about this opportunity or wish to be formally considered please either apply via the relevant link or email §peter@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ directly. Alternatively feel free to call 021 278 8653.§ § § §  §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Litigation Lawyer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50906420.txt	§Senior Litigation Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Litigation Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Victoria Fletcher Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Expertise§Wilson Harle is a specialist litigation firm offering a unique blend of services and skills – the depth of litigation resource ordinarily found only at large commercial law firms, combined with the independence that comes from a focus on litigation. §Internationally, Wilson Harle is recognised in global directories as a leading New Zealand firm in the areas of dispute resolution, public law, insurance, IT/telco and media, asset recovery, regulatory investigation, shipping and competition/anti-trust. In New Zealand, the firm has regularly been awarded Litigation and Dispute Resolution Specialist Law Firm of the year.  Wilson Harle is also a preferred provider to the Government on its External Legal Services panel for its expertise in litigation and dispute resolution.§Culture§Wilson Harle was established 18 years ago by partners intent on creating a collaborative culture and environment long before this way of working came into vogue.  The 4 partners and 12 lawyers work together as one team - without silos - in which everyone works on files and exchanges ideas with one another, as well as pitching in with support when required.  Based in a historic building in Fort Street, the work space design was ahead of its time nearly 2 decades ago, with open plan work areas, and shared and quiet spaces, planned deliberately to facilitate high contact within the team. §While the firm’s work is demanding and standards for service delivery are high, the internal culture is genuinely supportive. Learning and development occurs by lawyers being offered real responsibility, being surrounded by highly accessible partners, and colleagues keen to contribute their views and debate ideas.  Wilson Harle’s work provides exposure to all aspects of disputes from initial advice and strategy to final resolution by negotiation, mediation, arbitration and trial.  There is the opportunity to work directly with clients and appear at all levels of the New Zealand court system.  Naturally, excellent remuneration is offered. §You§If you are an exceptional senior litigation lawyer and this opportunity piques your interest, then we would like to hear from you.§Ideally you will:§have around 4 – 8 years’ high quality litigation experience;§have an inquiring mind;§be keen to become a “master of all trades” as you specialise across a broad range of business and public litigation;§be committed to excellence and achievement;§be prepared to work hard to meet client needs within a supportive culture of like-minded individuals.§The partners are flexible as to a 2020 or January / February 2021 start, depending on your circumstances.§Please enquire confidentially by calling Victoria Fletcher 021 300 982,  or apply by sending your cover letter, CV and academic record at your earliest convenience to Victoria via Seek. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

jobText: TXT/50907779.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§MinterEllisonRuddWatts has the largest construction specific team in New Zealand and is recognised internationally as a top ranked (Tier 1) construction practice in the Asia Pacific Legal 500 Directory, with six partners and over 20 staff. Our team covers back and front end construction law - this opportunity is in the back end construction disputes team.§This role offers you the opportunity to work on top notch, complex, high-end construction disputes and litigation, covering project disputes, arbitration, defective buildings and Construction Contracts Act matters, acting for an impressive client list. You will get plenty of client contact and will learn a lot, working alongside New Zealand's best.§We are seeking a bright, capable lawyer with around 2-4 years' experience, ideally in construction and/or property disputes, however general disputes and litigation experience would be considered. We are looking for someone with a solutions-focused, positive attitude, strong drive and interest in construction.  §The team is committed, energetic, and highly-capable. Not only do they achieve excellent results, but they also have a lot of fun along the way - this is a true 'team', in every sense of the word. Bring your sense of humour and collegial approach, and you will thrive in this team.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart. §We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kate Bishop, HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9815§ or §kate.bishop@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence. No applications from agencies please.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50943544.txt	§Experienced Legal Executive/Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Legal Executive/Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Lawyer to join our Dargaville team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Wills – drafting and executing/witnessing wills§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal, business and rural clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

jobText: TXT/50915913.txt	§Solicitor Litigation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor Litigation§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki§Solicitor Litigation§Nelson based§Are you looking for a new and exciting challenge in an area of meaningful work?§About the role§In this fast-paced, exciting role you will play a key role providing legal advice and advocacy services to Social Workers and other team members in the areas of care and protection and youth justice. Your work will involve considerable courtroom time conducting litigation on behalf of Oranga Tamariki, with a focus on ensuring good outcomes for tamariki and their whānau. The key work occurs outside of the courtroom - advising and collaborating. This is a role where your relationships in the community will enable you to work collectively to make a positive difference for our tamariki.§With a focus on the Upper South region (Blenheim/Nelson/West Coast) and being based in our Nelson office, you will be fully supported throughout your work in a friendly team and work environment. If you are looking for a role that is varied, rewarding, challenging and gives you the satisfaction of knowing that you will bring better outcomes for our most at risk tamariki and rangatahi, then this is an ideal time for a versatile legal professional like you to join our team.§Ko wai koe?§It is important that you:§You are admitted as a Barrister and Solicitor in New Zealand and have (or are eligible for) a practising certificate§You are driven by a desire to ensure all tamariki are in loving whānau and communities§You are committed to helping us honour our treaty commitments to Māori to improve long-term outcomes§You thrive in a job where no day is the same but each day your mahi matters§You are committed to continuing your own Te Ao Māori development and cultural competence§You have a sound understanding of either family or criminal (youth justice) law with a minimum of two years' experience and have a genuine passion and interest to work in this area§You have excellent communication and written skills§You are a 'straight up' person who is honest, transparent and keeps your word. You are a team player and enjoy collaborating with others§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children supports children and young people in New Zealand. We work to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of tamariki. In everything we do, the wellbeing and best interests of our tamariki and rangatahi are paramount. The voices of children and young people underpin the design and operation of our services.§The legislative amendments of 1 July 2019 have made significant changes and improvements to the way we work, and we welcome fresh perspectives to help us bring those changes to life. Our Ministry has also recently upgraded to the latest in digital technology which makes the way we work more efficient and effective. It is an exciting time to join our team!§How to apply§To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form. Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§Please note: This role requires a minimum of two years' family or criminal law experience. This role is not a graduate position and is not suitable for graduates.§For any queries, please contact the Regional Legal Manager - Sonya Stevens at §sonya.stevens@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Monday, 23 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our team values diversity and we welcome flexible working.§        §If you are interested then we’d love to hear from you. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35677§ §Permanent and fixed term roles, Wellington based§ §Put your legal skills and experience to work, helping New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent § §We are looking for enthusiastic senior lawyers and lawyers who exude credibility, integrity and professionalism to join our supportive and cooperative team, providing quality legal services for the Ministry of Social Development.  § §There are multiple roles on offer, specifically:§ § §several senior lawyers with significant experience in advising on policy development plus regulatory and legislative reform; a mix of permanent and fixed term roles are available and the pay band has a mid-point of $125,018.§ §one lawyer with some experience in procurement, contracting and other corporate areas of practice; this is a permanent role and the pay band has a mid-point of $91,211§ §You will be experienced in providing clear legal advice on complex issues, with a natural flair for working collaboratively with others.  Curiosity, great analytical and writing skills, an eye for detail and the ability to see the “bigger picture” are foundational for these exciting roles.  In addition, our senior lawyers play an important role in coaching, mentoring and developing our other lawyers.§ §You’ll join an inclusive and fun environment where we will celebrate your achievements and prioritise your development. jobText: TXT/50914937.txt	§Associate Trustee §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§At Public Trust, caring for people is the lifeblood of our organisation and at the centre of everything we do. Over the last 140 years we've supported thousands of families and businesses to look after what is important to them.§If you are empathetic, can build relationships with a wide range of people and have great administrative skills, then you could be the perfect fit for our well-established team of Trustees.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust?§About the role§We are seeking someone with great customer care and administrative skills to join our Kapiti centre as an Associate Trustee.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§It will be possible to begin this role either before or after the Christmas break.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training; however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are integral to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them.§By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including; legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection.§We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 25th November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
