jobText: TXT/50911372.txt	§Legal Secretary/Backup Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary/Backup Receptionist§§Advertiser: §Neilsons Lawyers Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§This is an excellent opportunity for a Legal Secretary/Backup Receptionist in our friendly central suburbs law office of about 20 staff.  §Our clients span multiple generations of families and their businesses.  Our team reflects this, with many of our people staying with Neilsons for 20 years or more and growing their skills and careers along the way.§In this role you will be preparing a range of legal documents, both through typing instructions and on your own initiative as you assist on legal files. Depending on your experience and areas of preference you could help clients with trust deeds, wills, powers of attorney, agreements for sale and purchase, company director resolutions, legal opinions, letters of demand and court documents.    §Additionally when our Receptionist is away or on a break, you would also be the friendly and helpful face of the company at reception and the first point of contact for clients.  As a small team we all pitch in with office administration tasks as required.§This role is right for you if you:§Are a self-starter who shows initiative;§Are a touch typist for dictation (55+ words per minute) with reasonable accuracy;§Are well-presented and polite;§Have a positive outlook and a can-do attitude;§Have attention to detail and take pride in your work;§Are willing to learn and adapt;§Hold a NZ driver’s licence;§Completed high school english and maths and have good grammar and spelling.§This is a full time position and the hours are 8.30 am to 5 pm with one hour for lunch.  We have a carpark for you.  §If this sounds like you please send your CV with a brief outline of why you think you are the right person for this position to:§Trent Bowler (§trent@neilsonslawyers.co.nz§) and Luke Meys (§luke@neilsonslawyers.co.nz§)              §§§§

jobText: TXT/50925382.txt	§Unit Manager - International Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Unit Manager - International Law§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Foreign Affairs & Trade§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Unit Manager - International Law §    §    §      §        §          §            §              §Lead a team advising on New Zealand's international law priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§              §Take an active role in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time§              §Permanent position§            §            §The Legal Division in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade is looking to hire an experienced international lawyer and manager to lead a team of lawyers advising on a broad range of international law issues ranging from international peace and security law, to law of the sea, to constitutional issues involving the realm of New Zealand.§            §Mō mātou - About us§            §Our people represent New Zealand on and offshore, and in doing so make New Zealanders safer and more prosperous. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§            §Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§            §Reporting to the Divisional Manager, this role leads a team of international lawyers providing legal advice and input to support New Zealand's foreign policy priorities.§            §The successful candidate will need to have appropriate legal qualifications (including the professional legal studies course), strong people leadership capabilities, considerable experience advising on public international law at a senior level an experienced in multilateral and complex bilateral negotiations. The Unit Manager is part of the management team in the Legal Division.§            §Mā§*§‎§wai te mahi nei? -§We are looking for applicants who can:§*§            §              §Lead and manage a team of international lawyers, providing constructive feedback, fostering high standards and ensuring a culture of learning, sharing of experiences and constructively challenging thinking as required.§              §Have an understanding of the New Zealand's (non-trade) international law priorities including: peace and security law, disarmament, international humanitarian and criminal law, international human rights law, constitutional issues related to the Realm of New Zealand, law of the sea and fisheries, environmental and climate change law, and the law of treaties.§              §Demonstrate the organisation's values, goals, policies and procedures in all aspects of work.§              §Maintain successful relationships with decision-makers, policy-makers and thinkers to advance the unit's objectives§              §Demonstrate strong planning and organising skills with proven success delivering results.§              §Work under pressure and meet deadlines.§              §Exercise sound judgement, an openness to learning and a collaborative approach to problem solving.§            §            §Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply§            §We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer, we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§            §You must be a New Zealand citizen, have completed the professional legal studies course (Profs) and be able to obtain and maintain an appropriate NZ Government Security clearance.§          §          §          §        §      §    §  §§§Lead a team advising on New Zealand's international law priorities, negotiating activities and international litigation.§Take an active role in New Zealand's trade agenda at a critical time§Permanent position§The Legal Division in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade is looking to hire an experienced international lawyer and manager to lead a team of lawyers advising on a broad range of international law issues ranging from international peace and security law, to law of the sea, to constitutional issues involving the realm of New Zealand.§Mō mātou - About us§Our people represent New Zealand on and offshore, and in doing so make New Zealanders safer and more prosperous. By building connections with and influencing other countries and international institutions, we advance New Zealand's interests and pursue New Zealand's values. We provide advice to the Government on the implications for New Zealand of what is happening in the world.§Kōrero mō te tūranga -§ §About the role§Reporting to the Divisional Manager, this role leads a team of international lawyers providing legal advice and input to support New Zealand's foreign policy priorities.§The successful candidate will need to have appropriate legal qualifications (including the professional legal studies course), strong people leadership capabilities, considerable experience advising on public international law at a senior level an experienced in multilateral and complex bilateral negotiations. The Unit Manager is part of the management team in the Legal Division.§Mā§*§‎§wai te mahi nei? -§We are looking for applicants who can:§*§Lead and manage a team of international lawyers, providing constructive feedback, fostering high standards and ensuring a culture of learning, sharing of experiences and constructively challenging thinking as required.§Have an understanding of the New Zealand's (non-trade) international law priorities including: peace and security law, disarmament, international humanitarian and criminal law, international human rights law, constitutional issues related to the Realm of New Zealand, law of the sea and fisheries, environmental and climate change law, and the law of treaties.§Demonstrate the organisation's values, goals, policies and procedures in all aspects of work.§Maintain successful relationships with decision-makers, policy-makers and thinkers to advance the unit's objectives§Demonstrate strong planning and organising skills with proven success delivering results.§Work under pressure and meet deadlines.§Exercise sound judgement, an openness to learning and a collaborative approach to problem solving.§Me pēhea te tuku tono - To Apply§We want our people to reflect the diversity of New Zealand and the communities we represent - valuing and respecting the contributions of staff with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We value the transferable skills and points of view that both career and life experience bring to the table. As an employer, we are committed to a focus on leadership, talent, training and development, and flexible work options.§You must be a New Zealand citizen, have completed the professional legal studies course (Profs) and be able to obtain and maintain an appropriate NZ Government Security clearance.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Human Rights Senior Solicitor | Rōia Matua Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50912440.txt	§Human Rights Senior Solicitor | Rōia Matua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Rights Senior Solicitor | Rōia Matua§§Advertiser: §Human Rights Commission§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§About the role:§  §Applications are invited for the position of senior solicitor (§rōia matua§) for the Office of Human Rights Proceedings/§Te Tari Whakatau Take Tika Tangata §(§OHRP§) on a twelve-month fixed term contract. This position will be a senior role with the ability to run litigation files with minimal supervision.§  §We envision the role is full time, based in either Wellington or Auckland. §  §About us:§  §OHRP is publicly funded to provide free legal representation in discrimination and harassment cases under the Human Rights Act 1993, and interference of privacy cases under the Privacy Act 1993/2020. This includes acting for clients in settlement negotiations, mediations, and proceedings before the Human Rights Review Tribunal.§  §OHRP consists of a small team, headed by the Director of Human Rights Proceedings, and is currently supported by two Senior Solicitors, a Solicitor and occasional part-time law clerks. We are an independent office that sits within the Human Rights Commission.§  §We promote human rights for all/whakamana tangata. We work for a free, fair, safe and just Aotearoa New Zealand, where diversity is valued, and human dignity and rights are respected. OHRP seeks to work in a Tiriti-based way, and we value skills and knowledge to support that approach, including understanding of Te Ao Māori. We are committed to building diversity, cultural competence, accessibility and inclusion in our workplace.§  §Our values:§  §Our values guide how we behave as an organisation and as individuals to achieve our mission:§ § § Mana Tangata – human dignity§ § Māia, tika, pono – courage and integrity§ § Whanaungatanga – relationships§ §Responsibilities of the role§ §include:§ § §Assisting the Director to assess applications for legal representation.§ §Appearing as counsel in the Human Rights Review Tribunal and courts.§ §Providing legal advice and representation to clients, including in relation to settlement negotiations and Tribunal proceedings.§ §The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate:§ § §Excellent legal analytical skills and the ability to write clearly.§ §A demonstrated commitment to human rights in Aotearoa and/or internationally.§ §Knowledge of discrimination, privacy and international human rights law.§ §Litigation/advocacy experience.§ §Resilience: some experience in dealing with vulnerable individuals/groups would be ideal. § §A current, or the entitlement to, New Zealand Law Society practising certificate.§ §Applications:§  §We are open to applicants with a broad range of relevant experience.§  §We celebrate diversity. We do not discriminate in our hiring practices and, to build a strong and diverse workforce, actively seek a diverse applicant pool including those with a range of lived experiences. We welcome applications from disabled people, and from people with diverse ethnic, cultural and religious backgrounds.§  §Please let us know, if any of our processes pose a barrier for you, or there is any support or assistance that would facilitate your participation in the application process. The job description and this advertisement are available in alternative formats and can be provided on request.§  §To download a job description, please click "Apply for this job". You will be directed to our careers site where you will find a link to view the job description.§  §To apply – please complete the application form by clicking “apply for this job”. Please ensure you include your cover letter and CV in your application. If you would like to get in touch with the People and Culture Team at the Human Rights Commission, please email humanresources@hrc.co.nz.§  §Applications close at midnight, 15 November 2020.§  §Applicants must have legal working rights in Aotearoa New Zealand.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50915493.txt	§Associate Trustee - Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee - Tauranga§§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§What we do takes trust. Every day, people throughout New Zealand trust us to take care of what is important to them. After all, we've been building trust with kiwis for 140 years and counting.§Whether it's assisting someone who's writing their first will, or helping someone with their assets after a loved one has passed away, our Trustees connect with customers to understand their needs and provide the best solutions. So if you're motivated, results driven, empathetic, and resilient, then trust us when we say that it's people like you who we need on our team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust and start your career securing the future of other New Zealanders?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Associate Trustee to join our Tauranga centre.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§Our Trustees do all of this so that customers don't have to worry about it, especially during times when they may be feeling their most vulnerable. After all, we're the organisation that takes care of people, and our staff and customers are at the heart of everything we do.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§It will be possible to begin this role either before or after the Christmas break and holiday plans can be accommodated for the right candidate.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training; however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are essential to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them. By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection. We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 25th November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

With a culture that values a pioneering spirit; a willingness to pursue new and different directions and to innovate beyond the status quo, this is a superb opportunity not to be missed!§        §For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please contact Jennifer Williams at Williams Legal Recruitment on 027 220 8003 or §jw@williamslegalrecruitment.co.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Purpose-driven, innovative NZ based ASX listed healthcare company§ §Unique sole charge role§ §Part-time, flexible role of approx. 20 hours per week§ §Auckland based§ §Here is a truly exceptional opportunity for a high performing, intuitive lawyer to join this remarkable New Zealand headquartered company poised for continued success across the US and other global markets.§  §About the company§  §Aroa Biosurgery is a soft tissue regeneration company that develops, manufactures, sells and distributes medical and surgery products to improve healing in complex wounds and soft tissue reconstruction. Aroa’s products have been used in more than 4 million procedures to date with distribution into its key market of the US. Founded in 2008, Aroa is a purpose driven, innovative business headquartered in New Zealand and listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX:ARX).§  §About the role §  §This is a sole charge role with responsibility for advising on a wide range of day to day and strategic legal issues. Reporting to the CFO, you will be a trusted advisor to the executive team and play a key role in both local and international projects in areas of engineering, sales and marketing, intellectual property, clinical research, compliance and corporate governance. The role is part-time involving approximately 20 hours per week with flexible working options available.§  §What we are looking for:§ § §Qualified lawyer with NZ practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§ §At least 10 years post qualification experience in corporate or commercial law§ §Time spent in a major law firm and or previous corporate/commercial in-house role§ §Confidence to provide pragmatic and commercially sound legal advice§ §The ability to be a team player and to form constructive relationships within an innovative, fast paced business setting§ §The ability to take initiative, solve problems and handle rapid change§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §This unique sole charge role represents a fantastic opportunity for genuine career growth within an innovative global company making a meaningful impact on the lives of others. With a culture that values a pioneering spirit; a willingness to pursue new and different directions and to innovate beyond the status quo, this is a superb opportunity not to be missed!§  §For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please contact Jennifer Williams at Williams Legal Recruitment on 027 220 8003 or §jw@williamslegalrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50926901.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Wairarapa§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Wairarapa§§Advertiser: §WCM LEGAL§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§WCM Legal is a full service law firm providing advice in all areas of the law to individuals and businesses in the lower North Island of New Zealand and beyond.  Our Principals, Associates, Solicitors and Consultants have considerable combined experience and expertise in all areas of New Zealand Law, from straightforward conveyancing matters, to family and criminal court proceedings, and complex commercial and civil litigation.  A role at WCM means cooperating extensively with the teams and Partners in our Wellington and Wairarapa based offices. We take pride in providing approachable, friendly and cost effective legal service.§ §Due to significant growth we are in need of a Senior Solicitor level lawyer in one of our Wairarapa offices to share the work load and assist with servicing the needs of our large and growing client base.§ §Our ideal candidate will have:§ § §5+ years PQE;§ §previous commercial and conveyancing experience with knowledge of the Landonline system;§ §excellent communication, research and analytical skills;§ §the ability to work efficiently and effectively both independently and within our team;§ §experience and confidence in providing competent and practical advice and solutions to our clients and Partners alike;§ §time management skills and sound judgement;§ §most importantly, a good sense of humour!§ §We offer excellent remuneration, a rewarding team culture and an environment where career development opportunities exist for the right candidate.§ §If you think you have got what it takes, send your covering letter, CV and academic transcript to:§ §John Gibbons, by email: §john.g@wcmlegal.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§§§

jobText: TXT/50903970.txt	§Senior Legal Advisors§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Advisors§§Advertiser: §Health and Disability Commissioner§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§ §Part time (Auckland or Wellington), full time (Auckland)§ §5+ QPE§ §Medico-legal experience advantageous§ § § §The purpose of the Health and Disability Commissioner (HDC) is to promote and protect health and disability consumers’ rights and to facilitate the fair and efficient resolution of complaints relating to infringements of those rights.§ § § §This is an exciting opportunity to join the HDC legal team as a Senior Legal Advisor based in either our Auckland or Wellington office. One full time position is based in Auckland CBD. One part time (20 hours) position can be based in either Auckland or Wellington CBD.§ § § §The legal team is a collegial and high performing team, which undertakes a wide variety of legal and policy work, including in relation to the Health and Disability Commissioner’s complaints resolution jurisdiction.§ § § §To succeed in this role, you will need:§ § §At least five years post-admission experience as a barrister and solicitor.§ §An excellent academic record.§ §A sound knowledge of health care law, public law generally and administrative law in particular.§ §A well developed understanding of policy issues affecting the interests of health and disability services consumers.§ §Ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team environment.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including oral skills.§ §A demonstrated ability to handle complex cases and meet deadlines.§ §Excellent research and writing skills.§ §Sound judgement and analytical ability.§ §Ability to work with a minimum of supervision.§ §A high level of initiative and self confidence.§ § § §HDC’s legal team is based in Wellington and if the successful candidate is Auckland based, they must be able to travel to Wellington as required.§ § § §All applicants must visit the HDC website and complete an online HDC application form to be considered§. The position description and online application form can be found at: §https://www.hdc.org.nz/job-vacancies§ § § §E-mail enquiries to §recruitment@hdc.org.nz§ § § §Applications for this role close at 4.30pm, Monday 23 November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50943525.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Fisher and Paykel Healthcare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Global company headquartered in New Zealand§NZX and ASX listed, and in the NZX10§Growing company; doubling in size every 5-6 years§About the Company§Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a world-leading healthcare technology company specialising in medical devices used in respiratory care, acute care and in the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea. We are inspired by providing solutions that improve the care of millions of patients each year and improve outcomes for healthcare providers and, ultimately, global healthcare systems. The company is listed on the NZ and Australian stock exchanges, we have sales offices in 39 countries, distribute our products in 120 countries and employ over 5000 people globally.§The Opportunity§Due to business growth, we have a unique opportunity for someone to add some real value within our high performing International Sales team.§Reporting to our Senior Legal Counsel, the successful candidate will provide legal support to our International Sales team based in New Zealand as well our overseas offices, including providing timely and effective legal advice, researching legal issues, drafting, reviewing and negotiating documents, establishing legal entities in overseas markets, managing ongoing corporate governance and compliance requirements for our overseas legal entities and providing training to our sales teams on company policies and procedures and relevant legal developments.§Our company growth path offers lots of challenges in a dynamic and changing environment where you are constantly learning and developing. This is a chance to make your own contribution to a company whose products change people's lives.§Skills and experience§This is a full-time role for a lawyer with seven to eight years' post-admission experience, excellent verbal and written communication skills and a strong academic record. Our ideal candidate will have corporate or commercial experience with a recognised law firm. Previous in-house experience and/or international experience would be preferred. Candidates returning to the workforce are encouraged to apply.§We're looking for someone with a can-do and customer focused attitude who can demonstrate a pro-active, pragmatic and commercial approach to legal issues. To be successful you will need to be a team player capable of forming constructive relationships within a business setting. In addition, the role may require some international travel from time to time, so you need to be open to this when the borders re-open.§If you're ready for a new challenge then apply now!§Applications close 27 November 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50926810.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Wellington§§Advertiser: §WCM LEGAL§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§WCM Legal is a full service law firm providing advice in all areas of the law to individuals and businesses in the lower North Island of New Zealand and beyond.  Our Principals, Associates, Solicitors and Consultants have considerable combined experience and expertise in all areas of New Zealand Law, from straightforward conveyancing matters, to family and criminal court proceedings, and complex commercial and civil litigation.  A role at WCM means cooperating extensively with the teams and Partners in our Wellington and Wairarapa based offices. We take pride in providing approachable, friendly and cost effective legal service.§ §Due to significant growth we are in need of a Senior Solicitor level lawyer in our Wellington office to share the work load and assist with servicing the needs of our large and growing client base.§ §Our ideal candidate will have:§ § §5+ years PQE;§ §previous commercial and conveyancing experience with knowledge of the Landonline system;§ §excellent communication, research and analytical skills;§ §the ability to work efficiently and effectively both independently and within our team;§ §experience and confidence in providing competent and practical advice and solutions to our clients and Partners alike;§ §time management skills and sound judgement;§ §be prepared, in time, to take on management and leadership responsibilities, and§ §most importantly, a good sense of humour!§ §We offer excellent remuneration, a rewarding team culture and an environment where career development opportunities exist for the right candidate.§ §If you think you have got what it takes, send your covering letter, CV and academic transcript to:§ §John Gibbons, by email: §john.g@wcmlegal.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§§§

jobText: TXT/50935393.txt	§Property / Commercial Trust Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property / Commercial Trust Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Are you keen to work for a law firm that offers opportunities for career advancement and learn alongside§ §accomplished business professionals?§Our client, Nicholsons Lawyers, is the oldest law firm in Taranaki servicing third generation families and offering a wide range of legal services all carried out with a high level of expertise. With such a long history and unsurpassed local knowledge, it's fair to say they love the province and its people. Their success is attributed to the strong core firm value that their people are their most valuable asset. It's this philosophy that ensures that the whole team work hard to grow and maintain strong relationships with their clients.§Is this the opportunity you have been looking for?§This position is incredibly diverse and interesting. You will be working alongside one of the partners across all aspects of property law managing a residential/commercial/property caseload for individuals and small to medium businesses, advising clients on a wide range of transactions. You will be mentored and trained in trust work involving family, trading and incorporated societies and trusts. In addition to this, you may be actively involved in marketing to clients and prospective clients, undertaking project work, and helping to develop new firm initiatives over time.§To be seriously considered for this role, you will have:§§A Bachelor of Law and §current Practising Certificate from the NZLS §with up to date knowledge of NZ law and legislation§3 plus years' experience as a Property/Commercial/Trust Lawyer§An ability to combine logical, analytical and a great deal of creative thinking skills to problem solving§An attitude of getting things done and recognising that client's time and money matter§The ability to see the§ '§big picture', consider all implications and give practical common-sense advice that works for all circumstances§To demonstrate that you can work quickly and efficiently without compromising quality§A team philosophy that working together accomplishes so much§The skills to communicate in both written and oral with ease and a natural style.§ §If working in an environment where delivering outstanding service is born from a culture that fosters a 'one team' approach appeals, then we would like to hear from you. §To obtain a copy of the position description email §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. To explore this role further contact Recruitment Specialist, Glenny Lewis on §06 757 3155§ at Baker Tilly Staples Rodway. §All applications will need to be submitted on line §with a copy of your CV and cover letter.§ Applications close 30 November 2020 §§§§

jobTitle: Associate Trustee - Greenlane location  Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: We will consider applicants with a minimum of 5+ years
jobText: TXT/50915697.txt	§Associate Trustee - Greenlane location §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Trustee - Greenlane location §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§What we do takes trust. Every day, people throughout New Zealand trust us to take care of what is important to them. After all, we've been building trust with kiwis for 140 years and counting.§Whether it's assisting someone who's writing their first will, or helping someone with their assets after a loved one has passed away, our Trustees connect with customers to understand their needs and provide the best solutions. So if you're motivated, results driven, empathetic, and resilient, then trust us when we say that it's people like you who we need on our team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust and start your career securing the future of other New Zealanders?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Associate Trustee to join our customer centre in Greenlane, Auckland.§Our Associate Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Senior and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future. In this varied role, you will support the wider team, working with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§Our Trustees do all of this so that customers don't have to worry about it, especially during times when they may be feeling their most vulnerable. After all, we're the organisation that takes care of people, and our staff and customers are at the heart of everything we do.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§It will be possible to begin this role either before or after the Christmas break and holiday plans can be accommodated for the right candidate.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide full (extensive!) training; however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are essential to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§A dedication to providing exceptional customer care, particularly in emotionally challenging situations§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Associate Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them. By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection. We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 25th November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Look no further, this Legal Executive role could be for you..§ § §Your new company§ This growing general practice firm has a reputation for providing excellent legal advice and customer service to their clients. Based in Onehunga, this good sized practice is proud of their relaxed, friendly and collegial work environment and the benefits and career development opportunities that they offer their team. Due to growth, they are seeking an experienced intermediate to senior Legal Executive to join their busy property team.§ § §Your new role§ This role will see you involved in all aspects of conveyancing and private client work including residential and commercial conveyancing and trusts. You'll be liaising with senior associates, working with title plans, LIM reports, sale and purchase agreements, loan agreements, trust resolutions, undertaking searches, liaising with clients and seeing the file through to completion. If you are a senior, you may wish to have your own clients and be a revenue biller - anything is possible.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ You'll either be a 3+ year legal executive with solid experience with all aspects of conveyancing through to completion and if no solid experience, at least an understanding of requirements around trusts and a desire to take this on board. Alternatively, we are also interested in hearing from Senior Legal Executives who are used to running their own files and being a fee earner.§ § Either way, you'll have great client relationship skills, a high attention to detail and accuracy, strong time management skills and be able to work well in a team and independently. Ideally, you'll have a Legal Executive Diploma although we're open to candidates who are qualified by experience. Of course a good level of competency using Microsoft Office, Landonline, and ADLS Webforms is required.§ § §What you'll get in return§ The firm offers a competitive salary with superannuation on top, on-site parking, flexible working arrangements when required, a social and convivial professional work environment, loads of extras to keep you happy during the day and the opportunity to upskill further.§          §Working close to home means no traffic hassles and the firm is close to motorway on/off ramps and public transport.§ §What you need to do now§ If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Lorraine Zencic on §09 884 1556§ or email me your resume without delay to §lorraine.zencic@hays.net.nz§. New Zealand conveyancing experience is essential.§ § If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. On site parking and Benefits available. Look no further, this Legal Executive role could be for you..§ § §Your new company§ This growing general practice firm has a reputation for providing excellent legal advice and customer service to their clients. Based in Onehunga, this good sized practice is proud of their relaxed, friendly and collegial work environment and the benefits and career development opportunities that they offer their team. Due to growth, they are seeking an experienced intermediate to senior Legal Executive to join their busy property team.§ § §Your new role§ This role will see you involved in all aspects of conveyancing and private client work including residential and commercial conveyancing and trusts. You'll be liaising with senior associates, working with title plans, LIM reports, sale and purchase agreements, loan agreements, trust resolutions, undertaking searches, liaising with clients and seeing the file through to completion. If you are a senior, you may wish to have your own clients and be a revenue biller - anything is possible.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ You'll either be a 3+ year legal executive with solid experience with all aspects of conveyancing through to completion and if no solid experience, at least an understanding of requirements around trusts and a desire to take this on board. Alternatively, we are also interested in hearing from Senior Legal Executives who are used to running their own files and being a fee earner.§ § Either way, you'll have great client relationship skills, a high attention to detail and accuracy, strong time management skills and be able to work well in a team and independently. Ideally, you'll have a Legal Executive Diploma although we're open to candidates who are qualified by experience. Of course a good level of competency using Microsoft Office, Landonline, and ADLS Webforms is required.§ § §What you'll get in return§ The firm offers a competitive salary with superannuation on top, on-site parking, flexible working arrangements when required, a social and convivial professional work environment, loads of extras to keep you happy during the day and the opportunity to upskill further.§Working close to home means no traffic hassles and the firm is close to motorway on/off ramps and public transport.§ §What you need to do now§ If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Lorraine Zencic on §09 884 1556§ or email me your resume without delay to §lorraine.zencic@hays.net.nz§. New Zealand conveyancing experience is essential.§ § If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. For more similar roles, check out our website on §www.hays.net.nz/jobs/legal§§§§

jobText: TXT/50927276.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel - Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel - Construction§§Advertiser: §Artemis Executive Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Senior Legal Counsel - Construction §        §          §            §Join one of New Zealand’s major civil and commercial construction contractors§            §Range of construction-related work and career development opportunities§            §Thrive in an environment of collaboration and continuous improvement§          § §About the company§ § § § The Fletcher Construction Company is a strong family of connected brands and businesses partnering with customers to create spaces and places that work for people. This growing business has 3500 people across five business units – Higgins, Brian Perry Civil, Buildings, Infrastructure and South Pacific. Since 1909, Fletcher Construction have planned, designed, built, maintained and managed significant national infrastructure for the benefit of communities in New Zealand and the South Pacific. Safety is at the heart of the business with a strong investment in sustainability for the future.§ § § § §About the role§ Due to an internal transfer, this pivotal senior role is available.  Here is your opportunity to join a collegial and high performing legal team providing practical and commercial legal advice to The Fletcher Construction businesses.  § Variety is guaranteed. You will provide legal advice on tender reviews and joint venture arrangements, lead negotiations on major contracts, provide ongoing project delivery advice, assist with governance requirements and some dispute management. There is scope for this role to encompass advice on general contracting, procurement, environmental, and health and safety issues.§ Your enthusiastic and collaborative attitude will ensure you provide excellent support to the General Counsel for the Construction Division and contribute positively to the overall performance, wellbeing, and collegiality of the Fletcher Building legal team.  Working together, you will be part of something worthwhile - creating better communities, economies, and ultimately better lives every day.§ § § § §What we’re looking for:§          §            §At least 10 years’ PQE, with excellent construction/commercial law knowledge and experience§            §High quality private practice and (ideally although not essential) inhouse experience, and a current NZ legal practising certificate§            §experience reviewing, negotiating, and drafting contracts§            §Experience acting for a Contractor on Infrastructure/Engineering projects preferred§            §Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop relationships of trust and confidence at all levels of the business§          § §How do I apply?§  § Click on “Apply Now”. jobText: TXT/50915220.txt	§Senior Lawyer – 10+PQE – Genuine Succession Opportunity §§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Lawyer – 10+PQE – Genuine Succession Opportunity §§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Senior Lawyer – 10+PQE – Genuine Succession Opportunity / Platform to Design your own Legal Future§Well-established North Shore general practice looking for an experienced lawyer to breathe new life into the firm. The principal is approaching retirement, so the right candidate must have a genuine desire to work towards ownership or buy-out of the practice in a few years’ time. §The current team of 4 (plus support staff) prides itself on timely delivery of high-quality legal services to a diverse client base. §The firm has a broad range of work, and the right candidate should have:§Enthusiasm for the law§Strong skills and experience in all facets of property law, trusts, PRA, wills, estates, and estate planning/asset protection work§Experience in commercial property/leases/SME sales and civil disputes (not court work) would be an advantage§Confidence to run property files from start to finish and to advise on associated trust and tax issues§A strong academic transcript§Attention to detail, commitment to accuracy, and excellence in expression are pre-requisites.§You will receive mentoring from a practitioner with 35+ years’ experience, a competitive salary, and a real opportunity to make the firm your own. §This is an ideal opportunity for an experienced practitioner returning home, or a senior lawyer looking to get out of the big firm life. Ultimately, design your legal future (perhaps bringing in another lawyer to share responsibilities) and manage life balance to suit. §The firm has excellent public transport links to the CBD (15 mins), free parking, and spacious offices. §Enquiries with CV to §nkk.recruitment@gmail.com§ [link removed].§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Registered Legal Executive | New + Exclusive Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50935160.txt	§Senior Registered Legal Executive | New + Exclusive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Registered Legal Executive | New + Exclusive§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Salary§§$80,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Fluid Legal is delighted to be working exclusively alongside a prominent firm with national reach. This role has a clear message to deliver to market and it is truly unique.§ §Our client boasts one of the most successful practices in Nelson which continues to steadily gain market share. It has a busy commercial and property portfolio that is driving the creation of this newly created position.§ §Partners operate an open door policy and they are keen to provide quality pathways for staff to advance. Whilst this is a regional office, you will get access to the resources, salary bands, perks, recognition and work quality of an established wider firm.§ §Described as a laid back, welcoming team environment where people muck in to help each other. The office benefits from efficient processes, expertise across the firm and well developed workflow and precedents.§ § § §About the role§ § § §This senior level legal executive role sits alongside the partnership, with a heightened level of independence, autonomy and strategic/operational input.§ §You will manage residential and commercial property files from start to finish, including directly liaising with clients and managing the accurate delivery of the instruction.§ §There is also a diverse range of other commercial and private client instructions, including business S&P, drafting of commercial agreements, wills, trusts and estates. Any gaps in this area can be taught.§ §You will support three partners but also work collaboratively across the firm at all levels. The firm acts for a number of large property developers and commercial operations across Tasman and wider NZ, as well as a more everyday local workflow.§ §In time is expected that you will manage your own client base.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Excellent firm name and reputation - CV booster§Step up into a unique role. Progression unlimited.§Generous salary on offer§Lifestyle location. Work sensible hours. Great housing market. Get out and enjoy.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Qualified/Registered Legal Exec with a portfolio of relevant industry experience§Proven commitment to outstanding client service§Highly developed legal reasoning and transactional skills§Excellent administration and time management skills§Desire to assist operationally and strategically across the firm§Social nature and positive outlook§ §Many in the office will tell you that they live in Nelson for the lifestyle. There are surfers, trampers and viticulture enthusiasts across the team and like-minds will fit in well.§ § § §Please either give me a call, send me an email or submit your application directly. Tentative inquiries to learn more are welcomed.§ §Eden Brown - Manager - Fluid Legal§eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§021 044 3607§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Senior Trustee, Henderson Location Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50944565.txt	§Senior Trustee, Henderson Location§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Trustee, Henderson Location§§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§At Public Trust, caring for people is the lifeblood of our organisation and at the centre of everything we do. Over the last 140 years we've supported thousands of families and businesses to look after what is important to them.§We couldn't do this without our Trustees, who connect with our customers to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions. If you are empathetic, can build relationships with a wide range of people and are commercially savvy, then you could be the perfect fit for our well-established team of Trustees.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Senior Trustee to join our conveniently located customer centre in Henderson.§Our Senior Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Associate and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future.§In this varied role, you will support the support the Principal Trustee on more complex files, while coaching and mentoring our Associate Trustees on less complex work. You will work with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§It will be possible to begin this role either before or after the Christmas break and holiday plans can be accommodated for the right candidate.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide training, however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are integral to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§Several years' experience in a role that has involved providing exceptional customer care in emotionally challenging situations§Experience coaching, mentoring and collaborating with a wider team§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a legal, corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them.§By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including; legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection.§We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Sunday 29th November 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50932753.txt	§Relationship Property Lawyer | Flexible§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Relationship Property Lawyer | Flexible§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§Our client is busy on the relationship property side of the business and is looking to hire at the mid-senior level to work with clients directly, manage files (with support where required) and handle the full spectrum of relationship property matters.§ §The role will see you represent individuals from various backgrounds in a range of relationship property matters which will include drafting s21 contracting out agreements, advising on pre and postnuptial arrangements, litigating relationship property disputes, and advising on guardianship arrangements. The firm offers an array of legal services and with a family-friendly culture. There is definitely scope for progression.§ §You'll have a minimum of 4 years experience in the relationship property/family law area, good grades in your LLB degree and interested in advancing your career in this field.§ § §If you're based in Auckland or another city, or even returning from overseas and thinking about a move to the idyllic region of Queenstown, now could be the time to make that move!§ § §Part-time, fixed-term or permanent options can be discussed for this position.§ § §For further information, contact Harrison on +64 27 274 5926 or email your CV and academic transcript to us at §hdeiongh@cobaltrecruitment.com§. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50904475.txt	§Senior Litigator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Litigator§§Advertiser: §Clarity Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Litigator §      §        §          §Wide variety of interesting work.§          §A private practice opportunity like no other.§          §Location: Wellington CBD§        § We are offering an incredible opportunity to join a firm that prides themselves on employing like-minded, proactive and results-focused lawyers. jobTitle: Patent Search Analyst - Chemistry, Biochemistry or Molecular Biology Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50926339.txt	§Patent Search Analyst - Chemistry, Biochemistry or Molecular Biology§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Search Analyst - Chemistry, Biochemistry or Molecular Biology§§Advertiser: §AJ Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Intellectual Property Law§§§§§§ § §Sciences outside the lab: Join the brilliant minds protecting the world's brightest ideas§ §If you're inspired by brilliant thinking, come and work with our team of intellectual property (IP) experts and help protect and grow some of the world's most exciting ideas and innovations.§ §Right now, our Auckland patent team has a full-time, permanent opportunity for a person with a natural aptitude for understanding and working with scientific and technical subject matter. In this technical patent search analyst role, you'll be comfortable with chemistry, biochemistry, and/or molecular biology.§ §Who are we?§ §AJ Park is recognised as having one of the top specialist teams of IP experts in the world. Our clients range from start-ups and small to medium enterprises, to publicly listed multinationals, government and research institutes across 130 countries.§ §What makes a good patent search analyst:§ § §A strong technical background§ §An interest in and enthusiasm for science and technology§ §Excellent communication and lateral thinking skills§ §A good eye for detail and the ability to manage multiple deadlines§ §The focus of the role is technical searching of online patent databases to identify relevant publications, and reporting search results. This involves working with search tools provided by databases and search engines, and using Boolean keyword searching. As you progress, you'll develop an awareness of state-of-the-art patent searching and analysis tools. Good written and oral communication skills are essential for this role.§ §Requirements:§ § §A PhD or MSc in a chemistry or biotechnology discipline - organic chemistry expertise preferred§ §We welcome applications from recent graduates, but we also encourage researchers who are looking to move out of the lab to apply§ §You may be a recent graduate or partway through a postgraduate qualification and looking for a permanent full-time role where you can apply your technical expertise. If you have an eye for detail, the ability to conduct searching work, and an analytical and meticulous approach to your work, then this role in an IP firm may just be the career move for you.§ §You'll join an acclaimed firm awarded 'Specialist IP Firm of the Year' in the New Zealand Law Awards and work alongside people who have received numerous accolades for their work.§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural Employer of Choice report listing the 25 top-ranking legal organisations in New Zealand in terms of overall employee experience. This report celebrates employers who go beyond industry standards to provide their people with a safe and engaging working environment and showcases firms leading the way with policies and initiatives that engage their staff. We were also a finalist in the 'Employer of Choice' category of the New Zealand Law Awards 2019.§ §If you'd like to work in a supportive team environment that places a strong emphasis on work/life balance, career development and growth, take this opportunity to join our award-winning team of IP specialists. Please send your covering letter, CV and academic transcript to Sue Quinnell, Chief Human Resources Manager, at §careers@ajpark.com§ §You must currently have a legal right to work in New Zealand§§§§

jobText: TXT/50925111.txt	§Property and Private Client Associate | Exclusive | Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property and Private Client Associate | Exclusive | Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$85,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Please note this role is Christchurch based. Call 021 044 3607 for more information.§ §I am working directly with a well respected partner to identify suitable talent for this crucial appointment. § §This boutique firm has an excellent reputation in Canterbury with work both regionally and nationally. It enjoys a quality of work much higher than your average boutique practice. The firm has a Property/Commercial, Family and Litigation practice led by top partners in each.§ §The culture is all about personal responsibility. Flexible working is a no-brainer. You take ownership over your own workload and work the hours required to both have balance and get it done. Social events, sports teams, fitness classes and hobbies and shared across the team, who all enjoy each others company as both friends and colleagues. There is a conscious focus on employing people who add to the diverse fabric of the team - so culture fit is top priority.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We have worked alongside the client to develop a brief which we believe is truly unique in a market overloaded with poorly qualified clutter.§ §On offer is a clear and proven pathway to partnership, opportunities to manage the grad team and also take on a handover of established clients to alleviate workload from three busy partners. You will be a mentor and senior influencer.§ §This will suit candidates relocating to Christchurch to take advantage of the affordable housing market, or perhaps someone roadblocked by a top heavy structure at their current firm and wanting a chance to step up.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The client is open to negotiating a salary which fairly reflects the value-add of the individual and wants to provide pathways for success inside and outside of work - which means paying well.§ §In addition;§ §Showers, cycle and car parking available§Modern Central CBD offices§Specific lifestyle and wellbeing requirements negotiated for individuals§A clear and accessible progression pathway§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You will be an established private client solicitor suitable for an associate level position. Use 4-5+ years experience as a guide, however more experience will be advantageous.§ §Your workload will be varied each day, this is not a pigeon-holed role and it can be adapted to suit your experience and interest areas.§ §Including residential and commercial conveyancing, trusts, wills, EPOAs, succession planning, asset protection, shareholder agreements, leasing and business sales, franchising etc.§ §In addition;§ §Personable and social approach to work§Looking for a long term career move§Keen to contribute to management and process improvement§Excellent client facing ability§Eager to step up, be challenged and earn progression§ § § §Register Your Interest§ § § §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: §eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ § §§§§

You will be a mentor and senior influencer.§ §This will suit candidates relocating to Christchurch to take advantage of the affordable housing market, or perhaps someone roadblocked by a top heavy structure at their current firm and wanting a chance to step up.§ § § § §Benefits and perks§ § §The client is open to negotiating a salary which fairly reflects the value-add of the individual and wants to provide pathways for success inside and outside of work - which means paying well.§ §In addition;§ §Showers, cycle and car parking available§Modern Central CBD offices§Specific lifestyle and wellbeing requirements negotiated for individuals§A clear and accessible progression pathway§ § §Skills and experience§ § §You will be an established private client solicitor suitable for an associate level position. Use 4-5+ years experience as a guide, however more experience will be advantageous.§ §Your workload will be varied each day, this is not a pigeon-holed role and it can be adapted to suit your experience and interest areas.§ §Including residential and commercial conveyancing, trusts, wills, EPOAs, succession planning, asset protection, shareholder agreements, leasing and business sales, franchising etc.§ §In addition;§ §Personable and social approach to work§Looking for a long term career move§Keen to contribute to management and process improvement§Excellent client facing ability§Eager to step up, be challenged and earn progression§ § § §Register Your Interest§ § § §Please call or email Eden for more information on the role or to find out if you may be a suitable candidate.§ §m: 021 044 3607§ §e: §eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ §Or alternatively, please use the APPLY button to send your CV through and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §§§§

Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Law Graduate §      §        § §        §          §Focus on criminal defence - become an expert in your area of law§          §Enjoy comprehensive professional development programmes and career opportunities§          §Be the voice of justice for our communities' most marginalised people§        §        § §        §We are looking for graduate lawyers to join our team in the largest of the PDS offices - with around 60 legal and support staff.  These roles will have a start date of February 2021. We have clients at the Manukau, Papakura and Pukekohe District Courts, as well as the higher courts.  It is a busy and sometimes demanding environment with variety and challenge and you will join a diverse and supportive team in one of the fastest growing communities in the country. §        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §        §You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.   §        §To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues. You will recently have graduated, be enrolled to do your Professionals in early 2021 and be admitted to the Bar in mid-2021. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.  You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people.  This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  §        §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector.  The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS. §        §There is always something new to learn which contributes positively to my experience as a Junior Lawyer, this is due to the variety of cases that PDS undertake and the supervision and support that is available to us. PDS is a fantastic training ground for new lawyers. (Sophia)§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §§Focus on criminal defence - become an expert in your area of law§Enjoy comprehensive professional development programmes and career opportunities§Be the voice of justice for our communities' most marginalised people§§ §We are looking for graduate lawyers to join our team in the largest of the PDS offices - with around 60 legal and support staff.  These roles will have a start date of February 2021. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.   §To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues. You will recently have graduated, be enrolled to do your Professionals in early 2021 and be admitted to the Bar in mid-2021. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.  You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people.  This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector.  The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS. §There is always something new to learn which contributes positively to my experience as a Junior Lawyer, this is due to the variety of cases that PDS undertake and the supervision and support that is available to us.
