jobText: TXT/50965350.txt	§Pro Bono Clearing House Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pro Bono Clearing House Director§§Advertiser: §Community Law Centres O Aotearoa§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Practice Management§§§§§§Community Law is about to launch a national pro bono legal clearing house to connect people in disadvantaged communities to lawyers and firms around Aotearoa- New Zealand.§The Director will help develop the Pro Bono Clearing House (PBCH) vision and direction, while leading its day-today operations. You will create programs and innovations that are effective and evidence-based. You will oversee the strategic and business planning, monitoring and evaluation. You will have to manage financial resources efficiently and lead a small team of 1-2 staff. The role will be dynamic and you will need to be innovative, adaptive and agile.§Key to success will be your ability to develop strong relationships. The PBCH will grow and flourish on the back of high quality experiences for clients, the profession and referral agencies. An ideal candidate for this role will have deep relationships and established trust within the legal profession, the community law network and the broader community.§You will also have the experience to work effectively with the Ministry of Justice (PBCH funder) and professional bodies such as NZLS and NZBA.§The role will be based in Auckland but the service will be offered nationwide and you will operate the PBCH on behalf of the national law centre body Community Law Centres o Aotearoa. The full job description is available on request.§Applications close 5pm, Friday December 11 and interviews will be held in Auckland on the week beginning December 14, 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50961713.txt	§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§Advertiser: §Bell Gully§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction §      §Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§        §          §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§          §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§          §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§          §Excellent written skills.§          §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§        § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§        §          §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§          §community support programmes;§          §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§          §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§        § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§ § §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§ §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§ §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§ §Excellent written skills.§ §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§ § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§ § §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§ §community support programmes;§ §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§ §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§ § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50969761.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Post Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Legal Counsel §      §      §      §        §New Zealand Post - Tukurau Aotearoa, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments.  We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of almost $1 billion.  We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.§        §About the role§ Our legal team provide strategically driven legal advice and legal risk management to our business.  We operate in a fast-moving, highly competitive industry with a global reach, and we're really busy doing some cool work that helps drive NZ Post to continue to deliver on our strategic objectives. §        §This is a generalist role that supports internal stakeholders on a range of matters including the development of new products and services across our business - it should not be surprising that at times you would need to turn your hand to anything that comes along!§        §In this rewarding role, you will deliver effective legal services and provide assurance that legal risks are being managed appropriately.  You'll get the opportunity to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders and leaders across our business, and support our commercial activities and strategic initiatives with sound, pragmatic legal advice. §        §About you§        §We're looking for lawyers with 8+ years PQE, with well-regarded general commercial experience in-house or in a law firm.  You will already have an operating rhythm that allows you to ‘go with the flow' and get things done, and be comfortable working in the grey.  Resourceful by nature, you will be skilled at identifying opportunities and making your own calls in managing your role.  You'll be a strong communicator and know how to engage with your stakeholders to understand and support their successes.  Above all, you'll enjoy having fun with a great group of people!§        §Interested?§        §If you have the experience we are looking for and want interesting, rewarding work, we invite you to review the Job Description and apply online through §www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz§,  For further information, please contact Nikki Tuhou on §Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz§        §Applications close 26 November 2020.§        §All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check and may be required to undertake a drug test.§      §      §      §      §jobs.nzpost.co.nz§    §    §  §§§New Zealand Post - Tukurau Aotearoa, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments.  We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of almost $1 billion.  We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.§About the role§ Our legal team provide strategically driven legal advice and legal risk management to our business.  We operate in a fast-moving, highly competitive industry with a global reach, and we're really busy doing some cool work that helps drive NZ Post to continue to deliver on our strategic objectives. §This is a generalist role that supports internal stakeholders on a range of matters including the development of new products and services across our business - it should not be surprising that at times you would need to turn your hand to anything that comes along!§In this rewarding role, you will deliver effective legal services and provide assurance that legal risks are being managed appropriately.  You'll get the opportunity to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders and leaders across our business, and support our commercial activities and strategic initiatives with sound, pragmatic legal advice. §About you§We're looking for lawyers with 8+ years PQE, with well-regarded general commercial experience in-house or in a law firm.  You will already have an operating rhythm that allows you to ‘go with the flow' and get things done, and be comfortable working in the grey.  Resourceful by nature, you will be skilled at identifying opportunities and making your own calls in managing your role.  You'll be a strong communicator and know how to engage with your stakeholders to understand and support their successes.  Above all, you'll enjoy having fun with a great group of people!§Interested?§If you have the experience we are looking for and want interesting, rewarding work, we invite you to review the Job Description and apply online through §www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz§,  For further information, please contact Nikki Tuhou on §Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz§Applications close 26 November 2020.§§All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check and may be required to undertake a drug test.§§§§

We foster and maintain a supportive, collegial atmosphere for everyone who works with us.§ §We have a position for Secretary to join our CBD office.  In this role, you will be supporting a Partner and a junior solicitor in our Property team, as well as providing assistance to our Immigration Senior Associate.  § §The responsibilities for this role includes: § § §Typing and preparing documentation, printed forms, correspondence, tax invoices, settlement statements and memos.§ §Liaising with local bodies, insurance companies, Immigration New Zealand, solicitors, clients, lending institutions, councils & courts.§ §Attending to clients when the Author is unavailable.§ §Preparing accounts forms, receipt and cheque requisitions, file titles.§ §Preparing and requesting Company and LINZ registrations.§ §Assisting with the preparation of immigration files and online visa applications.§ §About our Ideal Candidate: § § §a minimum of 2 years Secretarial experience.§ §Conveyancing experience including Landonline. § §experience using ADLS Webforms. § §excellent written and verbal English language skills.§ §good time management and organisational skills.§ §follows tasks through but knows when to ask for guidance.§ §the ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure.§ §accurate and efficient typing skills.§ §be proficient in MS Word.§ §be detail oriented.§ §If you have the required experience & skills for this role, please apply to Candice Petersen, HR Advisor, with your cover letter and CV. We ask that all applications are submitted using only Seek. § §Please note that only candidates with the right to live & work in New Zealand will be considered. § §www.mcveaghfleming.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have secretarial experience?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§How many years' experience do you have as a secretary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50956248.txt	§Principal Legal Advisor §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Legal Advisor §§Advertiser: §Office of the Ombudsman§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Legal Advisor §      §        §§        §          §Work closely with the Chief Ombudsman and Chief Legal Advisor§          §Assist with the design and development of a newly formed team§          §Fixed Term to June 2021§        §        §Mō te Tari o te Kaitiaki Mana Tangata - About the Ombudsman§        §The Chief Ombudsman works with his staff to help New Zealanders in their dealings with government agencies. The focus is on handling complaints against government agencies, undertaking investigations and inspections, and encouraging good administration. The Chief Ombudsman is independent and impartial, with the goal of fairness for all.§        §Mō tō mātou tira - About the team§        §The Chief Legal Advisor is currently establishing a Legal team to support the Chief Ombudsman. This team will be responsible for all legal advice and services in the Office of the Ombudsman. Most of the legal work involves supporting the Ombudsman's core functions (including under the Ombudsmen Act 1975, the Official Information Act 1982, the Crimes of Torture Act 1989 and the Protected Disclosures Act 2000), but the team will also be responsible for legal input into corporate and governance matters.§        §Mō te tūranga - About the role§        §This role will provide support to the Chief Legal Advisor to enable them to deliver on the day to day functions of the legal services team, and also to scope and develop the make-up of a permanent team and the team's processes.§        §He kōrero mōu - About you§        §To be successful in this role you will be a Barrister and Solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand and eligible to obtain a current practising certificate as well as:§        §          §At least 7 years post admission experience practicing law in the public or private sector§          §Extensive knowledge of constitutional and administrative law and substantial experience in their practice§          §Experiencing managing or supporting the management of legal teams§          §Excellent understanding of the constitutional role and position of the Ombudsman and its jurisdictions§          §Experience in executive and legislative processes (including policy development, passage of legislation and cabinet deliberation) and the New Zealand parliamentary system§          §Substantial experience in delivering high quality and timely legal advice on strategic, complex or specialist issues to a range of different decision makers§        §        §Me pēhea e tono - How to apply§        §To apply, click on the ‘Apply Now' button where you will need to register through our online career centre, complete our application form and upload your CV and cover letter. For further information about this vacancy please email §recruitment@ombudsman.parliament.nz§.§        §All applicants will have a legal entitlement to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a criminal convictions check and may be required to achieve and maintain a NZ Government (NZSIS) security clearance.§        §Depending on skills and experience the salary is expected to be between $153,000 and $179,000 per annum (pro-rated to the length of the fixed term contract).§        §Applications close Sunday 22 November 2020.  §      §    §  §§§§Work closely with the Chief Ombudsman and Chief Legal Advisor§Assist with the design and development of a newly formed team§Fixed Term to June 2021§§Mō te Tari o te Kaitiaki Mana Tangata - About the Ombudsman§The Chief Ombudsman works with his staff to help New Zealanders in their dealings with government agencies. The focus is on handling complaints against government agencies, undertaking investigations and inspections, and encouraging good administration. The Chief Ombudsman is independent and impartial, with the goal of fairness for all.§Mō tō mātou tira - About the team§The Chief Legal Advisor is currently establishing a Legal team to support the Chief Ombudsman. This team will be responsible for all legal advice and services in the Office of the Ombudsman. Most of the legal work involves supporting the Ombudsman's core functions (including under the Ombudsmen Act 1975, the Official Information Act 1982, the Crimes of Torture Act 1989 and the Protected Disclosures Act 2000), but the team will also be responsible for legal input into corporate and governance matters.§Mō te tūranga - About the role§This role will provide support to the Chief Legal Advisor to enable them to deliver on the day to day functions of the legal services team, and also to scope and develop the make-up of a permanent team and the team's processes.§He kōrero mōu - About you§To be successful in this role you will be a Barrister and Solicitor of the High Court of New Zealand and eligible to obtain a current practising certificate as well as:§§At least 7 years post admission experience practicing law in the public or private sector§Extensive knowledge of constitutional and administrative law and substantial experience in their practice§Experiencing managing or supporting the management of legal teams§Excellent understanding of the constitutional role and position of the Ombudsman and its jurisdictions§Experience in executive and legislative processes (including policy development, passage of legislation and cabinet deliberation) and the New Zealand parliamentary system§Substantial experience in delivering high quality and timely legal advice on strategic, complex or specialist issues to a range of different decision makers§§Me pēhea e tono - How to apply§To apply, click on the ‘Apply Now' button where you will need to register through our online career centre, complete our application form and upload your CV and cover letter. For further information about this vacancy please email §recruitment@ombudsman.parliament.nz§.§All applicants will have a legal entitlement to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a criminal convictions check and may be required to achieve and maintain a NZ Government (NZSIS) security clearance.§Depending on skills and experience the salary is expected to be between $153,000 and $179,000 per annum (pro-rated to the length of the fixed term contract).§Applications close Sunday 22 November 2020.  §§§§

jobText: TXT/50970699.txt	§Rōia Hapori - Community Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rōia Hapori - Community Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Community Law Wellington and Hutt Valley§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Community Law Wellington & Hutt Valley (CLWHV) is a registered charity, providing free legal help for those in our community with unmet legal needs. Our vision is for a society where everyone can access justice.§Pou Whirinaki is our Services to Māori team. Our service aims to embody tikanga Māori values and solutions when we assist clients. We see legal needs in the context of an individual or community’s personal, social, spiritual, and cultural needs, and so we strive to solutions that contribute positively to not just the individual, but their whānau, hapū, iwi, and community.§We are currently recruiting for two kaimahi – a Rōia Hapori (Community Lawyer) and a Pouako Hapori (Community Educator) to join our existing team of 1 rōia, one kaihāpai, and one community educator who is on parental leave. The main focus of your role will be the provision of legal advice, information, and representation to our clients at our offices and in our community at our outreach clinics. Pou Whirinaki works collaboratively, and will often tautoko one another’s mahi, so advocacy and community development are also in your job description.§All applicants for Rōia Hapori will need an LLB and either a current practising certificate, or eligibility for one. You will also need:§– To be passionate about te iwi Māori§– To have a strong people-focused values system.§Any of the following pūkenga will be useful to you in your application:§ §• te reo me ona tikanga§• critical analysis of the issues facing Māori in society§• experience in kaupapa Māori settings (such as marae, Māori organisations, rōpū Māori)§• experience in community organisations§• knowledge of family, criminal, employment, consumer, and/or Māori land law§• strong relationship building and communication skills§• great problem-solving skills.§We strongly encourage anyone who is interested to apply! We would love to hear from you.§We are a busy but flexible, whānau-friendly organisation who are committed to being a great place to work. We have a bicultural structure, a commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and provide good rights and benefits for our kaimahi.§To see a full job description, follow the link here: http://www.wclc.org.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Job-Description-Roia-Hapori-Pou-Whirinaki.pdf§Applicants interested in less than 37.5 hours are also welcome to apply. Please indicate this in your application.§ §To apply, send a CV and cover letter to Ella Cartwright at §ella@wclc.org.nz§ by 5.30pm, Wednesday 16 December. We will be scheduling interviews for early-mid January. Karawhiua – give it heaps!§§§§

and taking responsibility for your own work and deadlines.§As we are a full-service law firm, our ideal candidate will have broad litigation experience.  §If this sounds like you, then we would love to tell you more.  For a confidential discussion contact Jenna Riddle, Partner, on §0277421032§ or by email §jenna.riddle@gallawaycookallan.co.nz§. §Apply via our website, by submitting your CV, including your academic transcript, and a cover letter  www.gallawaycookallan.co.nz [link removed]§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§§§

jobText: TXT/50958032.txt	§Relationship Property Solicitor | Circa 4-7 years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Relationship Property Solicitor | Circa 4-7 years PQE§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Salary§§$80,000 - $119,999 (negotiable up on experience)§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Live and work in idyllic Queenstown.§ §Our client is looking for an intermediate or senior level disputes lawyer to start sometime in the new year to cover a gap left by maternity leave, either on a fixed term or permanent basis.§ §All types of contemporary flexible arrangements will be considered.§ §This is a modern full service practice making a statement that it will be ahead of the curve as the nature or legal practice rapidly evolves. It is widely regarded as the pick of the bunch of the independent Queenstown firms and stakes a strong claim as an employer of choice in the region.§ § § §About the role§ § § §The core part of this role is relationship property. I need someone who has managed a steady caseload in that area, including settlements out of court and a range of formal proceedings. Court time is essential.§ §That could be paired with other experience and the firm could adapt the role to suit, e.g. criminal, civil/commercial litigation, trusts or other family work such as domestic violence and care of children.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Full flexible working already implemented§Top partners and mentors§Work/life balance encouraged. Lots of skiers and hikers in the office.§Superb salary and benefits package negotiable§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §If you have relevant NZ private practice experience and are keen to either do a summer and ski season in Queenstown, or head down full time, please make an inquiry.§ §This won't hang around.§ §How to Apply§ §Please either give me a call on 021 044 3607 or email eden@fluidrecruitment.co.nz with an indication of your interest to discuss further.§ §All contact is completely confidential and details will not be disclosed to clients without your expressed permission.§ §Eden Brown§ §Managing Consultant - Fluid Legal§ §Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50976528.txt	§Relationship Property/Family Solicitor | 5+ years PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Relationship Property/Family Solicitor | 5+ years PQE§§Advertiser: §TODD & WALKER LAW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§Excellent opportunity for an experienced Relationship Property and Family Solicitor to join our busy and growing practice. §The role§Suited to a candidate with 5+ years experience in relationship property and family law. The role would be a great opportunity for someone who is looking to continue their career and gain exposure to high quality and challenging work in a forward thinking law practice.  §The role offers exposure to relationship property work, but there will also be other areas of family law work involved including care of children, domestic violence, guardianship and paternity. Experience of broader relationship property matters including the interrelation with trusts would be highly regarded. §You will work directly with the firm’s Family Law Principal and work collaboratively with other junior members of the team in a mentoring capacity. You will have the opportunity to work autonomously on files and to grow and develop your skills in a supportive and high performing team environment.§Strong candidates with less PQE will be considered provided there is a strong background of relationship property experience. The role would suit full time candidates, however hours can be negotiated for the right person, if you are someone who is looking for reduced or flexible work hours, or a fixed term contract (minimum of 1 year). §Who we are looking for§We are looking for someone with the following:§5+ years PQE with strong experience in relationship property and family law;§A self starter who is a motivated worker and brings a sense of drive to the team;§Confident court experience;§The ability to work independently to deliver results and also enjoy being part of a team and a mentor to junior staff; §Strong written and verbal communication skills;§Accurate and detail focused;§A confident, pro-active and enthusiastic approach to work;§A proven ability to establish and retain strong client relationships.§What can we offer§TODD & WALKER Law are one of Central Otago’s leading law firms. We were recently recognised as being one of New Zealand's six emerging legal firms and are... "a boutique law firm with a small firm culture capable of tackling big law jobs". §Operating from offices in Queenstown and Wanaka, we pride ourselves on delivering experienced, pragmatic, high quality advice for our clients and we are regularly instructed on high profile matters. § At TODD & WALKER Law our team are important to us, we are known as fantastic employers who reward our staff with excellent remuneration and other benefits packages. We place a focus on the continued professional development of our staff, and provide a welcoming work environment with flexible working hours and a genuine work/life balance. §If you are looking for career progression and are interested in applying for the position, please contact Principal Louise Denton on 021 568 315 or §louise.denton@toddandwalker.com§ for a private and confidential discussion or email your details to our Office Manager, Louise Gill at §louise@toddandwalker.com§. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§How many years' experience do you have in family law?§§§
